title: Doesn't do much for me
review: It would be good if it connected to somewhere useful The majority of people just prefer to grab a taxi because that's much easier  I think things will change when they connect it to Don Muang airport

title: Lifeline
review: Using the BTS in Bangkok was such a convenience for us  We used it extensivly for all access to Grand Palace Siam area and Chatuchak

title: May not be worth the hassle
review: The Express Link is a quick and economical way to get into town from the airport It travels express from the airport to Makkasan station  However my personal experience is that the Express Link is often out of service which forces one to rely on the City Link    The City Link stops at a couple of stations where locals get on and off  During peak hours the train carriage is so full of people that I found it difficult to get my luggage onoff the train    At Makkasan station one has to walk 100200m to reach the subway system (MRT) which involves stairs some escalators and security checks  If one has to change to the BTS skytrain system at BTS Asoke more stairs and escalators will be involved   In my opinion if you can afford it go with a taxi  It will be around 400 baht (less than AUD20) to get from the airport to the city centre  It's not much considering all the hassles you will avoid (carrying heavy luggage in hot weather buying tickets security checkpoints following maps stairs cramped train carriages etc)

title: Fun, insane markets to check out!
review: Railway and Floating markets were great fun  It’s complete insanity in a good way  Our tour guide and driver were wonderful  We had a small medical  emergency while in the van that required quick visit to the bathroom and it was very well handled which everyone appreciated  I highly recommend

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: This is a very convenient way of getting around Bangkok and very cheap  It is usually very busy but very efficient  There are maps of the the system at every station and easy to follow

title: BTS Bangkok
review: The best option to travel within the city of Bangkok Take a daily pass for about 130 Bh and travel the whole day One such day we travelled to Chatuchak market in the morning(quite a distance) and in the evening to the Chao Phraya river cruise at the other end of the city  all very well connected by the BTS Skytrain

title: Fast and efficient
review: We used these several times to get around Bangkok to see the sights They are cheap fast and efficient

title: Easy and regular services
review: Easy to buy a Rabbit card and use on the BTS trains The trains are convenient but packed however frequent services means you can catch the next one However the trains don’t go to the tourist spots mainly in the shopping districts It will help to ease congestion on roads Also you have to queue to top up which could be easier if vending machines are available

title: Great Value. Easy to use.
review: We are cheap travelers so instead of paying a taxi to get to the city center (approx 700B) we took the ARL (approx 90B for two of us)  The ARL connects easily with the BTS and MRT along the line so you can basically get anywhere from it  We took it from airport and back Saved us about 1400B approx i think It gets a little crowded during peak hours but we were able to do it with all of our luggage with little problem

title: Excellent
review: The best way around BKK Try to avoid the rush hour though   Wish they had a tourist card or unlimited card longer than one day   Btw BTS is the sky train and MRT is the underground

title: Easy access to prayha Thai station one stop from the hotel
review: Express train now cancelled but the all stops train is still great  only 45 baht one way  Get off at prayha Thai station and take one stop to ratchewhi station and hotel is only 30 m from step of station

title: The most convenient and safe way to travel in bkk
review: A must use Rabbit card should be used although you must bring a passport to get one and sometimes to top it up

title: great access around the city
review: catch the bts from paya thai to get straight to the airport 35 bht for 35 minutes or express is 90 bht for 15 minutes

title: Awesome.
review: Police and staff very helpful for passengers travelling to destinations from the airport   Very clean and timely

title: getting around
review: Cheap clean fast Best way to get around Bangkok

title: Easy to use and cheaper than taxi.
review: We used the airport link to get back to the airport after having used both taxis and hotel transfer services before but this was easy and simple to use Clean and comfortable

title: Great service with air con
review: What else can I say about this service Its clean convenient and fast From memory it runs every 15 min It leads right up to the door of Siam Paragon too

title: Best transportation in bangkok
review: Bangkok is famous in its traffic jamming lol especially in rush hour it might take hour for you to travel among bangkok city center BTS skytrain is the best and cheapest way for you to travel around It is fast clean and perfect for a tourist to explode bangkok

title: BTS Bangkok not for the disabled!!!
review: We travelled with our son who used crutches and wheelchair Some stations had no lift access some stations had escalators going up but none going down and some stations had wheelchair paths that lead to stairs

title: Went from airport the Phaya Thai - not bad trip.
review: At the airport the ticketing system was difficult You have to know how the machine works The journey is quick It beats anything on the ground Arriving at Phaya Thai required a little local knowledge I wanted to get to the BTS station and the signage is not always clear

title: Super convenient and clean
review: Took the BTS with 2 seniors and an 8year old Easy to use once you’re familiar with their map Workers are available at every station if you need directions or help with fares Trains are clean and comfortable with strong AC As with all metro in everywhere be mindful of rush hour because trains do get packed Like Taiwan and Japan there is an organized way getting onoff the train waiting lines are neatly designated and formed on the outside doors allowing passengers off first It would be a miracle if New York City could be this efficient and civilized

title: Fantastic system
review: So I gave this a five star rating It isn’t a must visit tourist attraction but it is a fantastic transport system  Cost wise it’s very cheap Extremely clean & modern And it’s a nice way to get some great views of the city  I really wish the ukScottish system was up to this standard

title: Easy
review: Easy Even with kids Safer than tuktuk and quicker than taxi Great that you can walk under the train as well away from the traffic

title: Nice journey
review: Very reasonable and best service Train comes after every 23 minutes We caught skytrain from Nana Road to MBK mall and came back to hotel by skytrain

title: City tripp in Bangkok
review: you can use to escape from the permanent traffic jam in the Sukhumvit and Silom area and it's with 40 Baht for the longest way really cheapp and quick

title: Traveling round Bangkok
review: This is the best way to travel round Bangkok it removes all the stress from traveling in traffic and cheap to travel around

title: Fastest mode to reach airport
review: I would say this is one of the fastest way to reach Bangkok International Airport Costs about 90 Bahts (at least when I was there last October) per trip Starting from Phaya Thai this nonstop rail link reaches airport in about 1520 mins However frequency is not so great running one every 30 mins Still a great hassle free mode to reach airport

title: Very clean and fast.
review: Train tickets come in the form of coins and can be purchased from ticketing counter Trains are clean and fast

title: An experience not to be missed - or repeated!!!
review: Our tour group travelled on the overnight sleeper from Bangkok to Chiang Mai a couple of weeks ago I think we had an Economy carriage Hope so as if this was First Class I dread to think what Economy is like  Having said that it wasn't terrible The one good thing was that it was different My first sleeper train We had prepaid for everything as part of a group so not sure what you get if you book as an individual Food was a bit grim Not sure what was for starter  as I didn't have one Main course was choice of 4 dishes I think I ordered something with fish chicken and rice which sounded good as I fancied a nice warm Thai dish with a couple of drinks before settling down for the evening  but when it turned up it was in cling film with salad and was cold The rice was served separately and was luke warm And there were black things in the dish which I assume were mushrooms It wasn't horrible but it wasn't great And there were no alcoholic drinks I needed a stiff one when I got that meal so it was all a bit of a struggle I'm still not sure if there was any alcohol on the train so if anyone does know put the information on Tripadvisor The loos were grim  I managed to stand on the pedal on the floor that works as a tap for the sink while relieving myself and soaked the back of my trousers before realising  as the sink overflowed in about half a minute Flooded the floor too but no one cared  You are advised to keep your luggage under your seat in case something gets stolen I assume   there are areas that you can shove them into below the seats  but we had a relatively  big suitcase which wouldn't go That got carted off to the end of the carriage and chained up next to the guard So it was safe but inaccessible to us for the rest of the night  The upstairs bunks are scary Very narrow and a couple of straps to stop you falling 6 feet to the floor if you fall out Lower bunks are twice the width so get one of those   Staff were great No problems with them at all  I managed to get some sleep but woke up or was woken up about 10 times during the night  though some of out tour slept throughout the trip  So it was an adventure but I wouldn't like to do it again

title: Very good
review: Easy way to run around and enjoy Bangkok   Fast efficient and cheap  Better than taxi and traffic  always quick to arrive and very clean

title: What a relief
review: Used this a lot to get around Bangkok saved loads of time easy to use a relief to get out the heat as air conditioned and quick compared to sitting in the crazy traffic a all day travel card works out a lot cheaper It is worth going on a tuk tuk as well just for the experience and fun

title: Lots of steps
review: Efficient They will give you change at the information desks You need your ticket to leave the station Very crowded but good humoured Make sure you know your station Signs in both English and Thai

title: Too simple not to take advantage of
review: On a stopover heading to Phuket I headed down to the trains for a quick trip into the city You can take this through to Phaya Thai where you can easily transfer to the BTS line and get about anywhere you want to go Hint get accom near an MRT or BTS station and ignore the roads altogether  One of the best things at the airport rail platform is the money chargers on this train level Ignore the money changers just outside the customs gates its a MUCH better rate from 4 or 5 outlets near where you buy your train tickets just keep walking past down the centre and you will easily spot these money changers all working off about 1% less than the rate you can find on xecom (thats my experience for $AUD)  Very competative

title: A beautiful, scenic trip!
review: The scenery is beautiful and from Kanchanaburi to Nam Tok the trip takes around two hours plus But it's worth it   Take the first train in the morning from Kanchanaburi and watch as the sun rises over the passing landscape Absolutely stunning I liked it so much I did the trip twice

title: Excellent
review: Always on time The best way to know and discover Bangkok They are two linesand in Siam is interchange Not expensive way of travelling in this well airconditioned trains Notes should be exchanged for coins before purchasing tickets from machines  Choose your destination from the map and number written on it is your bath amount For example you choose E1 this will cost you 15 THB if you choose E2 will cost you 22 The etcHappy travels

title: thumbs up but gets super crowded at rush hours
review: affordable and efficient but crowded jam packed at rush hours so avoid rush hours or be prepared to be sardined summer time can be hot and humid esp walking to nana n den using the train

title: A better mode through Bangkok Traffic
review: Very easy to travel and best way to get around Bangkok and avoid the usual heavy traffic throughout Bangkok Hop on to reach places around Bangkok town

title: BTS day pass
review: We used the BTS day pass for 140 baht per person The pass is good till midnight of the day you buy it And it allows unlimited hop on and hop offs And no need to have coins or stand in lines to enter each time

title: Often packed, restrictive routes but better than a taxi
review: Often packed restrictive routes but better than a taxi the skytrain will take you from the riverside to the shopping areas at a reasonable price and in airconditioning Do get a route map or use google earth to find your way around Payment is by coins only in a machine but you can change notes at the booth Avoid rush hour travel

title: A simple system makes BTS a great system
review: I use mass transit systems all over the world all the time Somehow I still enjoy using BTS the most Reason It's a very simple system with only two lines No six floors to go down or climb No complicated interchanges Of course the short lines with limited stops doesn't give it a good coverage of the massive Bangkok

title: Best travel type to avoid stuck in traffic!
review: The MRT as as the BTS is the way to move in the city As theer is no integrated ticket system yet  will be launched soon you are required to buy your ticket at the machines which can be a kind of hassle special during rush hours as there are very very long queues to the machines So if you do not mind about some bucks and use the service frequently during your stay get a MRT card  topup amount touch and go Avoid services during rush hours

title: Cheapest & Convenient transportation from airport to town
review: Just located at ground floor of Suvarnabumi airport within 30 mins to reach interchange station Phayathai by 45baht only suitable for budget traveler & SOLO traveler

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: We took the Skytrain to the weekend Chatuchak market Trains are crowded but air conditioned and clean No problem buying tickets Avoid the machines and go to the ticket booth Attendants are very helpful even if they don't speak English Stations are not numbered so you will need to listen for the names of the upcoming stops The station route is posted over the doors but the text is a bit small I found myself craning to read what stop was next  Take pics of the name of your station and you will always be able to ask directions Everyone we met were willing to help with directions even if they didn't speak English

title: Impressed by the efficiency and connectivity
review: A great way to travel in between the international airport and the city centre Helps you to avoid the bad traffic and still cheaper than getting a taxi You'll usually have a place to seat and this is definitely a time saver No brainer to use this option unless you are really lazy and have both time and money to burn

title: Worth an experience taking the train
review: Our family travelled by sleeper overnight from Bangkok to Chiang Mai We like travelling by train and found this trip to be a good experience and similar to other such trains in Asia The train travels slowly but does leave and arrive on time We went second class and most of the people in our carriage were tourists The online booking worked well the carriage was efficient and worked out the service was good and entertaining food was cheap and good the beds were firm but comfortable Once everyone around bedded down it was very quiet and most slept through the night without trouble (the bottom bunks seem more comfortable Squat toilets were ok In the morning it was nice sitting up in the dining carriage having coffee and watching the scenery roll by until into Chiang Mai (I have checked bathroom as it is probably American prudishness for toilet)

title: Easy Travelling
review: When we are in Bangkok we use the skytrain daily The trains are clean  cheap and every 5 minutes there is a train coming

title: Super easy and no evil taxi drivers
review: I recommend the airport rail It is so easy and you don't have to deal with sketchy taxi drivers Taxi drivers love to rip off tourist and the airport rail will get you to most tourist areas of town at a fixed rate You might need to get a taxi from your rail exit but you avoid the taxi drivers for most of the journey Metered taxis are cheaper than nonmetered and much cheaper than the tuk tuk drivers Explore the rail in general It will make your visit better in BKK

title: Best skytrain service
review: The BTS Skytrain is a Bon for the tourists They are very comfortable and commute to every corner of the city in Bangkok at a very nominal charges The best advice I can give is to click a picture of the base station and while coming back you can show the picture at the ticket counter and heshe will give you the ticket and guide you to the track the train would come

title: Easiest transport to city without hassle
review: If you landed at Suvarnabhum Airport this is the easiest transport that you can take to the city The train will stop at Phaya Thai station which is connected to the BTS and you can go anywhere from there The price from the airport to the last station is 45 baht

title: Great Way to Beat the Traffic and Very Cheap
review: I used it for going from Patpong back to Nana at night when none of the taxis would use meters and were overcharging i think it was 31 batth compared to the two hundred the taxis were asking for It was easy to figure out and there are people to help you there as well

title: QUick and Smooth
review: Excellent ridea bit crowdedthoughthe worst part is that not all stations have a lift or escalatorsthis makes it hard to travel when you have a baby and a stroller

title: Cheap. Clean. Efficient.
review: The BTS In Bangkok is a life saver They are quick clean efficient cheap and the lines are easy to understand They have many ticket options so you can choose the right one for you It passes through many important and necessary places and most of the times you don't even have to go back down to the road to enter places Many malls have direct sky bridges attached to the top of the stations which is neat The way to travel in Bangkok For places not connected by the BTS get to the closest BTS station and take a taxi from there Makes things very cheap I hope when I get back to Bangkok even more places are connected

title: better optoin to reach the city
review: cheap and best to travel via airport rail link to the city Need to change the platform to catch another train

title: Easy
review: Cheap and easy to use  faster and easier than a tuktuk Used it to just go a few stops to get between a couple of different malls  so much nicer than London tube

title: Don’t recommend the floating market
review: Very crowded Railway market was okay bus not as spectacular as expected After a view minutes the train past and that was it  Floating marked was awful Loud and the engine of the boats smell terrible Within the small canals you stuck in traffic on your boat The market shops do sell all the same and are way overpriced  Would not recommend this trip

title: Easy, fast and cheap
review: Not too much to say really it was easy enough to find where we needed to go and we'd never been before and was cheap and efficient

title: Must see.
review: A must see I couldn’t have imagined I’d see what I did and experience the things we did A life changing outing Our guide Kwan was a treat

title: OK
review: crowded but convenient to access the central Bangkok but slow moving and can be very crowded best during Bangkok traffic

title: fast transport - no trafic hasle
review: the easy way to travel true Bangkok Any time the traffic is a big hassle here The BTS is a perfect way to move around They should have more lines and stations that would be best improvement for Bangkok trafic

title: Forget taxi
review: Most of the time taxi is a total waste of time in Bangkok (if not money) Take the Skytrain or the metro to as close to your destination that you can get and take a taxi or tuk tuk from there Frequent quick very cheap air conditioned but crowded at all times

title: Great way to travel
review: The sky train wasn’t here the last time I visited Bangkok many years ago and I have to say that it has transformed the city for me You can now get around the city without being stuck in all the traffic and it can take you straight to the ferry pier which is one of the best ways to get to some of the attractions  The sky train is quick clean and easy to use with plenty of helpful staff to help you get to your destination

title: Easy way to travel
review: Easy an fast way to get around in Bangkok but if you are a family it is not cheaper than driving in a taxi

title: when in Bangkok please be always in a hotel close to Skytrain because the street traffic is horrible
review: Skytrain is perfect working simple and fast to go from place to place the only traffic in BKK I use

title: Very convenient when travelling light
review: A very convenient inexpencive and fast option to get to Sky Train in the center of Bangkok But then you might still need to take a taxi to get to your final destination unless you are familiar with the bus routes

title: The cheapest way to come around
review: It´s really easy to use and it´s the cheapest way to come around Unfortunately you can´t get everywhere with it

title: BTS in Bangkok
review: Useful to move quickly around the crowded city of Bangkok the skytrain allows to avoid the terrible congested and polluted traffic  Take a light scarf though the air con inside has a very low temperature it is very easy to get sick

title: Clean, fast, cheap and airconditioned.
review: Once you come to terms with and accept the fact that this is not like the hotels at home you will smile at the differences No the wait staff speaks little Enlish so how is your Thai

title: sometime a taxi is just a lot easier !
review: A great service no doubt and we used it with the intention of saving some cash and possibly time However after a huge flight we arrived in Bangkok feeling terrible and just wanted to get to our hotel and lie down   Keep in mind that if you take the rail link you have to worry    about buying tickets which can be confusing at the vending machines and with a language barrier via the attendants   having the right change to buy the tickets  getting off a the right train station (worrying about where you are)  finding a seat on the train (you may well have to stand up during the journey as the train is always busy)  then you at your train stop you still have to get a taxi or tuk tuk to your actual hotel which means a chance of potential rip off for newbies to Bangkok in addition to explaining where your hotel is to a local cab driver  In hindsight it would have been better just to hop into a taxi and the airport sit down relax and let the driver take us direct to the hotel doorstep (we did use a taxi the next time) Airport taxis are controlled at a departure point and are all metered so you will not get ripped off  Unless you are on a really tight budget or are feeling fresh and ready to go I would recommend taking a taxi if you are a situation like we were For the sake of a few bucks more the convenience and lack of hassle is worth it Nothing beats the ease of 'door to door' transport when you arrive in a strange city and are feeling destroyed after a long flight  ps as far as time goes I dont think we saved any time using the rail link compared to the taxi which took the express motorway anyway But sure in times of bad traffic congestion you would indeed save time on the rail link

title: so quick
review: it is definitely the best way to get to the airport very fast reliable and cheap air conditioned and clean

title: Quick Transport
review: If you want to get around the city by all means take the Skytrain Trust me I've sat in taxis and on buses which would take me over an hour to go just a few km  The Skytrain is airconditioned and quickly gets you around to the main areas of the city for about 50 baht or less ($150 or so USD)  The only downside is that it quickly gets packed as you reach the more popular terminals  My family used the BTS numerous times to travel around the city It's easy to use just pay attention to the signs and where you want to go

title: The best
review: The best way to get around Bangkok without traffic From the Bangkok airport will connect to BTS and MRT very good and cheap and fast way to travel can be very busy and a lot a people on the train in the morning and after work too  people are very nice on the train and very safe

title: Cheap and convenient
review: Took the train from the Suvarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai where our hotel is and it was around 70 baht Pretty cheap and clean not to mention its fast (around 40 minutes to reach the city area)   The whole line has only 8 stops I think so it brings you to your destination pretty fast as well

title: Easy cheap and clean
review: Good way to get around town easy cheap clean and aircondition Just try to avoid major stations around the hours when workers are coming or going to work Can get very crowded at those times

title: airport link.
review: Easy  straight forward safe cheap Our hotel was just out side station The Sukosol  This station Phayathai you is a good crossover station to other lines to go around city

title: Clean, efficient & quick way to get around the MRT line's stations
review: Took the MRT to Chatuchak weekend market instead of the BTS Tokens can be purchased via machines which you can select English if you can't understand Thai Touchscreen machines – easy to use Train is modern clean not much waiting very stable can be a TINY little bit crowded on Saturday but nothing like the sardinekind of crowds you get during Singapore's peak hours on trains Most importantly you skip the constantly choked road traffic in Bangkok There are announcements in Thai and English before reaching each stop Very efficient way to get around if you're situated along this MRT line

title: East use, helpful staff
review: BTS is an easy and cost effective way to get around the city The lines only go in two directions so you can't really get lost If you get off at the wrong stop you can just hop back on until you get it right Staff are approachable and the ticket system is simple so you can purchase a ticket each time you use the train no problem It's air conditioned too

title: USE, USE, USE
review: Efficeient Good price Save stacks of time to avoid traffic that you can see below especially at peak time

title: A good way to get around
review: It is easy the only thing is that you have to go up of all those steps after a while we found out to go into the shopping malls and take the escalator as almost all shopping malls are connected to a sky train station It is also a good way to cross the street

title: Sobering tour of a very important rail line in WWII
review: Maha was our guide and he was excellent It’s a long day 12 hours so be prepared for that We found it well worth it If you’ve watched Bridge on River Kwai it’s disgusting how Hollywood portrayed POW’s as in control of and enjoying their captivity and forced manual labor Nothing is further from the truth Over 100000 men died firing the 17 months the rail line was built that’s over 200 per day It was a tragic episode of the war We visited the bridge took a train to a death camp and of course Hellfires Pass where the Australians were forced to break through bedrock by hand to create the rail line Fascinating bit of WWII history

title: Maeklong railway market & damnoen saduak floating market
review: I decided to use alternative method to enjoy Railway Market & damnoen saduak I booked into a hotel near the floating market spend 1 week there Next day the hotel help me to get public van to Maeklong railway and I spent a day there watched the train go thru the maeklong railway market it was very interesting Next few days we watched the activity in the floating market and bought food & drinks It was enjoyable I would like to do this again

title: Brilliant transport system
review: This has to be one of the bestthings to happen to Bangkok in many years So quick & easy to use Only drawback is the queue fir tickets  Byt uts quick clean cheap & efficient

title: Great Value - Quick - Avoid Traffic
review: Depending on when you arrive into Bangkok consider the Rail Link  It's a great way to avoid ungodly traffice it's cheap and it gets you close to where you can then take a taxi or tuktuk to where you need to go  I always use it when leaving BKK

title: Very Easy
review: The most interesting and fun way to travel for sure ) Very very quick and you can reach 5 stations within just 10 minutes

title: Convenience at your fingertip.....
review: In the bustling city of Bangkok BTS really offer a fantastic alternative to the taxis Grabs or Tuttut for the matter Of course there are only so many places it can go depending on the lines reaches The connectivity to the major areas of Bangkok is just excellent Malls hotels and landmarks are all well within reach Pricing is also good in regards to the traffic free travel time

title: Wonderful tour
review: Tom (the guide) and Mr Three (the driver) made the experiences both memorable and very enjoyable  A must do tour and a big thank you to Tom and Mr Three  The market train and the floating markets are something not to be missed  Highly recommended

title: good product but terminal points are not so accessible to city centre. Price is similar to a metered taxi from Asok BTS
review: If you are two or more travelling get a metered taxi Cost of travel to Asoke area is halved per person

title: Efficient transport from the airport
review: Hands down the best way to get to the center of Bangkok from the Airport Don't get stuck in the city's legendary traffic Use the trains

title: Excellent Mass transport System
review: Everything about the BTS is great Buying tickets are convenient  the stations are so so clean schedule of the trains are on the dot  What a good way to go around bangkok

title: "편리한 BTS"
review: In Bangkok Thailand bts was really necessary and convenient to use Other means of transportation were time consuming

title: Better than nothing
review: Living in Bangkok I use regularly the BTS at all different times of the day Overall the service gets worse with daily delays frustrated people waiting or getting stuck on the platform and ongoing interruptions thru breakdowns Don't forget to bring something warm as you will get frozen inside Entering and leaving the wagons gets more and more difficult as the platform are not build to service such a big number of people especially after several extension For a city with the aim to compete with neighboring Hong Kong or Singapore it's an affront having this kind of public transportation People traveling with luggage children trolley or wheel chairs should think twice as there's very limited service provided to make the ride convenient But as mentioned a worse system might be still better than no system

title: Experiance
review: Yes what and experience worth doing but I wouldn't want to do this every day very hot and a bit of a free for all

title: Sky train
review: The best way to around bkk  clean tidy cheap and no traffic jams motor bike taxi is good not for faint hearted

title: "Crowded, messy, and full of ads"
review: I don't understand why we cannot have the silence moment when we're on BTS Ads are everywhere the pillar the wall even in BTS' tvs I'm sick and tired Also the price is quite high

title: FAST BUT CROWDED
review: Bangkok's traffic is notoriously slow so this is a good option for getting around the centre of Bangkok but at times it is also extremely busy Unfortunately the Sky Train does not extensively cover Bangkok The other quick way to get around the centre is the Licenced motorbikes but is dangerous weaving in and out of traffic with no helmet

title: BTS SKY TRAIN
review: Excellent transportation around Bangkok quick frequent and airconditioned  Easy to follow routes can buy day tickets for a cheaper rate just need to work out the best value on where you want to go

title: Good for connect to downtown Bangkok
review: BTS system is very fast and good value for money Just on only office time so have many people use skytrain But better than Taxi and Motorbike taxi and can connect to Airport Rail Link and Bangkok MRT

title: Easy way to get around the city
review: Try to buy the ticket from a live agent  Trying to use the maps on the wall to determine the fare is a bit of a challenge

title: Great Transport Getting About Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is excellent for getting around Bangkok  Air conditioned clean and cheap Used a combination of the BTS Skytrain and the fast river boat to visit Bangkok's China Town A great adventure

title: Amazing scenery, historical trip and one of the best things to do in Thailand!
review: The train journey can start anywhere along the line I took the train from Thonburi station in Bkk Don’t leave getting to this station to the last minute as traffic in that area is hell even on a good day I took the train to kanchanaburi about 25 hours and lots of countryside to watch rice fields fruit and lots of cheap snacks on board You can walk to most hotels from the centrally located station in Kanchanaburi I took the train to the River Kwai bridge the next station and then walked to my hotel from there as it was closer than from the main station The next day I took the train to the end of the line at Nam Tok Amazing scenery wooden trestles panoramic views of the river Kwai and a history lesson about how the railway was built All this for $100 baht each way Lots of places to visit nearby Namtok too but don’t miss the last train back

title: Spend your BKK time doing something else
review: Railway market is interesting but the floating market and the overall trip do not make much sense Most of the time you spend in transportation Floating market is deifnitely not genuine seems like it is a way to spoof tourists snd make them buy magnets and other souvenirs That being said the trip was nice I can't say a bad word about organization and our guide

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: With heavy rains bts is the best way to travel in Bangkok Lucky for us it was 5 min away from our hotel Be careful it can be freezing in thete so bring a scarf

title: Easy way to get around, day ticket good value
review: A very nice clean fast way to get around Bangkok Purchase a day ticket if you plan several trips Day ticket also saves you the waiting Wish it would run a bit later

title: Easy, not expensive and fast
review: The BTS is very easy to use Needs coins to pay First you check where you want to go and the map show you the price You go to the pay"machine" and chouse the amount you have to pay pay and you get your ticket (one way) If you need change go to the desk

title: Its crazy but you have to see it.
review: The Railway market is over crowed and you can find the same articles elsewhere but its cool to see The floating market is amazing is good to travel around the canal and see everything they have there i liked it

title: Easy to connect
review: Easy and cheap way to get from BTS and then to train link to airport Clean trains with people helping made me really like this service Only thing was it closed at midnight forcing us to take a cab one time when flight arrived at 1130

title: Well run.
review: Have to say the management of BTS has done a very good job in making it easier for us to buy tickets get inride the trains and easy to exit The same cannot be said of the MRTTook us 20 mins at Asok Station to line up to buy our tickets using the machines another 10mins to line up to get into the stationAnd the trip is less than 10minsThey should have more machines and lines to get in and out

title: Disappointing organisation and sites
review: My husband and I were very disappointed in today’s tour The time was actually 75 hours (not 6 as advertised) and almost all of it was spent in travel On the way to the railway market we spent 45 minutes in a van and then an hour on the train The train did offer an opportunity to see the countryside which was pleasant We arrived at the railway market were told to wait with our guide for the 1520 minutes to see the train depart again and then left right away to get back on the van We then drove to the floating market waited 25 minutes to get on a boat took a 30 minute ride in a boat surrounded by other boats and the smell of motorboat gas and then had 20 minutes to eat lunch andor shop… Then back in the van for 25 hours to get to the drop off point  Our guide was not engaging and could not be heard in the van (which is where he spoke a bit in the first 45 minute ride about Thai history and economy) as the microphone or speakers were not working Both markets for the little time spent were disappointing Better to spend the day touring on your own in Bangkok

title: Ease of use and connections
review: This was a great mass transit service  We took it to several tourist destinations and the airport enjoy the cool and the ride

title: Amazing service by the SRT with lost property
review: We accidentally left an IPad in the seat pouch on a second class Rapid Service carriage from Bangkok to Hua Hin Some hour later after leaving the trainwe realised its loss The receptionist at our motel phoned the number on the back of our ticket The SRT would check the train for it  Oh wellwe expected that no further information would arise Amazinglywe were told to go to the station next morning with our passports The Hua Hin station staff had the missing iPad They would not even accept our small gift A fantastic and unexpected result The SRT rail system is amazing  fabulous non air conditioned rolling stock and fabulous service to nonThai speaking tourists Thumbs up SRT

title: Underground Experience
review: Bangkok City is well planned and has excellent facility to travel by train to avoid the traffic congestion The BTS and MRT are linked in such a manner that you dont have to take any pain in interchanging the same as per your need

title: Fast and efficient
review: Train comes every 2mins Fares are easy to purchase using vending machine Very easy to navigate around Convenient access and link to airport line other lines subway and bus

title: Excellent, Avoid the traffic, get the train
review: I normally take taxis when abroad for the ease and convenience However decided to take the train as recommended by a friend Advantages Easy to use and figure out how to by a ticket Easy to navigate  well sign posted Cheap No ques Avoid grid locked roads  Cons None

title: Always reliable, quick, comfy, though overcrowded at times
review: Always take the Rail as it is timely though overcrowded at times but better then taxis waiting in traffic jam

title: Reliable, Cheap and Convenient
review: The aircon really feels good after walking in the sun  On time clean and a great way to get around Bangkok  Just look at the route maps carefully and make sure you know which direction you are going

title: Mr
review: Excellent way around Bangkok convenient way to use well priced air conditionedeasy to use mapping system to pick destinations

title: Super Good
review: Best mode of transport to get to Bangkok Airport from Sukhumvit Line I have always preferred this mode during the days as traffic in Bangkok can get very bad sometimes

title: Easy to use
review: Cold ac clean safe Bought a Rabbit Card for a week long visit Can also use Rabbit Card in Mall food courtslike street food in air conditioned surroundings

title: Best way to get around the city
review: After agonizing forever about where to stay in Bangkok we decided to stay in Silom to have immediate access to the Skytrain and it was well worth it They system is clean reliable affordable and more comfortable than the river express boats (though those are cheaper) The announcements on the train are in English so you don't need to worry about missing your stop and riders are courteous about getting on and off  you don't find that in every city

title: great way to get around
review: a bit difficult to get a ticket not easy to understand how the ticket machines work  apart from that it is a very good and inexpensive way to get around the city

title: Train Market fascinating. This is different to the Cha Am Wednesday night market!!
review: People are talking about two different markets here The train market is half way between Bangkok and Cha Am and is held every day with the train coming through the middle of the market 5 or 6 times during the day All the stall holders wheel back their stalls and remove stall canopies so the train can come through Some food items stay on the ground and the train goes over the top of them As soon as the train has passed the stalls are reinstated and the market goes on as if nothing happened Cha Am Wednesday night market is a fantastic maket for locals and tourists  large with lots of stalls selling clothes kitchenware handbags electronics watches etc as well as an amazing array of food Be game and try some of the different food items

title: On Time
review: Great rail service  Clean With air conditioning and cheap  Taxis are fine you'll get there faster this way

title: Very efficient and fast
review: I would recommend using the Skytrain to any one visiting Bangkok   It is great value fast clean very easy to use and a wonderful air conditioned escape from there the hot sticky Thai climate Ypou will feel refreshed after a short journey  The silly bit about it is the buying of the tickets In many stations you will queue at a window to buy the ticket only to be given a pile of coin as change to you notes You will then have to queue again at a push button ticket machine to purchase your ticket using the coins A weird waste of time and manpower Some stations will issue you the ticket from the kiosk where the cashier resides

title: Good way to get around, but the coin ticket machines are irritating
review: In most stations there are still only coinoperated ticket machines You can get change at the stations but sometimes you need to queue Otherwise a quick and convenient way to travel in a trafficchoked city

title: Punctual and fast
review: The airport rail link is something everybody should be aware of it takes you to the town center in less than 30 minutes and allows you to save more than 300 Baht for the taxi If you hotel is located far from the stop I suggest you take a taxi from the stop to the hotel you will still be able to save a lot

title: Nice & convenient way of airport transfer
review: Nice convenient reasonably priced One should use this if not many luggage are there because Bangkok taxis are unreliable and can ask for any fare for airport transfer Besides Bangkok traffic is infamous  it can let you down any moment RailLink is the way to go

title: The best transportation in Bangkok
review: This is the fastest way to go almost everywhere in Bangkok It is cheap an convenient Can be overcrowded during rush hour

title: Reliable quick transport service.
review: Links up with BTS skytrain Good way to get to other areas of city as taxis take ages depending on traffic jams and time of day Not so good if you have lots of luggage though

title: Convenient and cheap way to get around
review: BTS is the cheapest and the most convenient way to get around in Bangkok I took BTS skytrain almost everywhere except the old city (Wat Pho Palace and Khao San road) and Don Mueng airport since these are not connected to the BTS   To get to Wat Pho Palace or Khao San Road the most enjoyable and cheapest way is to take the BTS train to Saphan Taksin station and then take the ferry from there (2 min walk to ferry Terminal) for just 40 bahts (less than $2) The ferry ride is enjoyable has a tour guide and you can get off at any of the several places on the way (restaurants malls and historical sites) I would recommend getting off at the terminal by Wat Pho and visit Wat Pho and area and then take a tuk tuk from there to Khao San Road To get to Don Mueng airport a taxi is usually the most convenient way   The trains are frequent but can be busy during rush hour and also run a little bit slow compared to other major subway systems around the world Some lines are not connected so require a bit of a walk and repurchasing of tickets Credit cards are not accepted most stations only let you purchase tickets using coins but the office can give you change in coins if you only have bills

title: Clean, efficient but very crowded
review: The BTS Skytrain offers travel discounts if you purchase the monthly Rabbit Card It is clean efficient with police at all platforms but extremely crowded At times people are packed in like sardines in a can On the other hand when it is less crowded you can get excellent photos of the city´s skyline buildings and monuments

title: Quick affordable transport to airport
review: Very well priced transport if your hotel is close to a BTS sky train station Wish they brought back the express trains though stopping at each station just does't make sense for travellers

title: Super service in city haunted by TRAFFIC JAMS
review: Super service in city haunted by TRAFFIC JAMS But very crowded during rush hours But very safe & convenient Little expensive though Good information everywhere in english language also Very helpful staff also

title: Pretty standard but nice public transit
review: I can't really understand why so many people are rating this like it's some sort of ride It's public transit and is nice but also it's just public transit I would recommend using it though To get around town

title: Great way to get around!
review: If you've been to Thailand you know traffic is insane and you could be stuck in a taxi or tuck tuck for hours  We took the skytrain and it's by far the best way to get around They are cheap they come every 10minutes so you're never waiting long and they get you to your destination within minutes

title: Fast, Cheap and Clean
review: Our hotel was in Sukhumvit soi 2 area and we were reaching on Saturday afternoon hence we decided to explore with airport Rail Link instead of Taxi as we read many things about Thai airport Taxi scam Rail link is just one level down the arrival hall where they have a Seven eleven shop a small food court and few money exchange counters (who offers much better rates than the counter at arrival hall) The ticketing and boarding the train was no issue The train is smooth  fast and very comfortable We reached in Makasan station within 20 minutes and then took a Taxi for a 15 minutes ride upto the hotel  The train fare is 35 Bhat and Taxi 80 Baht Extremely convenient

title: Crowded
review: ‘Be Prepared’  standing room only for most of our travel A 24 hour pass is only 120baht so very reasonably priced

title: Helps you skip traffic. But, it's the worst for value in Asia.
review: Bangkok traffic is terrible So the only options you have to save time to get around within the city is the BTS or MRT However BTS is very pricey once you start moving around the city several times a day From Asok to Siam I paid 28 baht From Siam to Phra Khanong I paid 28 baht How does that make sense One is one stop away while the other is 6 stops away On average I spent between the two of us close to 250 bahts just to move around 12 city blocks Also not all stations have automated ticket machines that accept notes You must exchange for coins at a separate window which are often staffed by people who don't always understand basic English This compounds the frustration when there is a huge tourist crowd who are all lining up to ask questions The stations are not air conditioned as well adding to the bad experience I took uber each time we had to go some place nice so that we don't sweat I'd say this is perhaps the worst subway in major Asian cities

title: Easy and Fast!!
review: We used the BTS to get from the airport to our hotel with no problems at all Then the following day we bought the one dayall day ticket to use to go sightseeing We were able to easily and quickly get to the sights and back The other days we bought as needed

title: Love It!!
review: The BTS Skytrain is always so clean and quite organized especially during the peak season they were very alert and helpful And it gets you wherever you're going quite fast

title: Best way to travel in downtown Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is the best and fastest way to travel along the main directions in Bangkok It is clean not expensive save I would like to have it operating 247

title: Efficient mode of travel
review: What a great way to get to and from the Bangkok Airport It is efficient and inexpensive to take the airport rail link to connect to the Sky TrainIt is a smooth 2530 minute ride No need to take a taxi from the airport

title: Easy and simple
review: BTS is a favorite vehicle in Bangkok to avoid traffic jam Its very convenient especially in happy hours Its very easy and simple to buy the ticket The sky route also easy to read and signs were everywhere  its more expensive than MRT ticket Connect to many places and very strategies There is roof along the corridor way to get down or up or other places Some station has lift or elevator The passengers also very kind  to elder or woman with kid

title: very fast and reasonable
review: very easy to go to shopping centers all around the city  as taxis get stuck in the traffic so advisable to use train instead  very convenient

title: Fast ride through bangkok
review: The easy way to travel through Bangkok especially in combination with the metro The skytrain has airco unfortunately it is warm when waiting for the skytrain but you're in the shade )

title: The way to get around Bangkok
review: Very convenient The only best way to get around town If you plan well stay at a hotel close to the sky train and visit attractions close to the sky train you will really enjoy Bangkok much more

title: Worst train
review: This damn train needs to change their time management I know that Rapid train is always late but this time was unbearable We traveled from Korat later than my expected time which was 1233 The train arrived almost 1pm and the most infuriating one was when we’re almost to our destination which is in Ayutthaya it stopped to Nong Saeng for almost an hour MF they could have bother to inform us foreign people that our train has a problem but instead we had to wait

title: Reasonable peice and punctual
review: Very reliable to travel within the metro city The ticket price is affordable and the trains are on time

title: Almost a great public transport system.
review: The BTS is very much like most mass rail systems in Asia it's clean modern efficient and overcrowded at peak times Being overground you can get great views when the train is less crowded   The trains can get very crowded but this seems an easy problem to fix as the stations have the capacity to accommodate longer trains But for some reason they don't Alternatively the frequency of trains could be increased It didn't seem like there was a peakoffpeak frequency for the number of trains   Despite the occasional overcrowding it was a great way to travel around Bangkok

title: Avoid traffic jams
review: On time quick and clean Bangkok can be a real pain for traffic jams even though taxis are cheap you could still be stuck in them for a good hour which is not the best I'd opt for the skytrain in future

title: Cheap and fast
review: Easy and cheap way of transport in Bangkok Ticket machines are working good also in English connections are OK

title: EXCELLENT WAY TO GET AROUND BANGKOK
review: I highly recommend the MRT  Its cheap always runs on time there are trains every few minutes & you have zero traffic delays

title: The best way to get to airport faster and economic
review: Highly recommended to reach all places of attraction shopping areas and street food in Bangkok This is the most economic way and faster too as the taxis and tuk tuks are a rip off if you are not good at bargaining

title: Best way to get to the city center Bangkok
review: I always use the ARL when I fly into Suvarnabhumi Airport  Go all the way to the bottom floor of the airport and buy a token for 35 baht  All trains head in the same direction towards the city and Phaya Thai station  You have two options of connecting to the BTS sky train from the ARL  You can take it all the way down to Phaya Thai then walk about 5 mins up to the BTS Skytrain station or you can get off the ARL at Makassan station walk a few minutes to the Petchaburi MRT station and from there go to the Sukumvit Station by MRT  Once you get off at Sukumvit station you can walk up to the BTS skytrain station  Keep in mind you will have to walk up some short flights of stairs so if you have a lot of luggage or kids you might want to just get a taxi from the airport for about 350400 baht to the city center  Using the ARL MRT and BTS will cost around 6080 baht to and from the airport depending on where you are headed in the city  It can also be much faster then taxi too since traffic is horrible once you get into the city

title: Very Efficient way to get to city even with luggage
review: During our previous trips we used taxi from airport This time we tried Airport rail link to  and fro Makkasan station and were pleasantly surprised by its efficiency Very convenient even with luggage and small children Fast clean easy to get tickets and very cheap  Must use when in Bangkok

title: No more nail biting rushes
review: Getting to the airport in Bangkok in the old days was a nailbiting experience The traffic was so bad  you might not even make your plane Thank goodness for the Airport Rail Link now you can be certain of getting to the airport on time It's well worth the fare which is quite affordable

title: Dec 21 arrival
review: Clean and straightforward with easy to follow signs We were able to navigate with our luggage easily beating the rush hour traffic

title: Best Mode of transport
review: We could not expect any better mode of transport Very convenient clean and safe Even though the fair for kids and adults was the same which was surprising Every one in our group loved traveling in the Rail Link and the metro

title: Great experience
review: Good service Affordable and accessible Clean  Connecting to airport rail line  Gives you easy travel You can purchase a rabbit card and use unlimited only in the BTS line until midnight  Taking skytrain is recommended than taking taxi You can explore better in the place by BTS and save more money

title: Easy to use
review: I thought it best to buy a day pass(140 bahtpp)  A very inexpensive way to get around Bangkok  Very reliable and comfortable mode of transportation

title: Great transportation system
review: I wish they would extend the skytrain so it'll be available in more locations in bangkok   It's a very smooth and reasonable way to get around   The stations are clean and well staffed they speak English and very helpful   Inside train it's airconditioned  clean and comfortable   The price can be anywhere between 50 to 25 Baht very reasonable and much faster than taking a taxi

title: Very Clean and fast - easy to use
review: Only used this once during a short stay in Bangkok however great way to get around very quick and easy to use

title: Express broken
review: 100 baht if express 20 mins from airport to prath  thai Or 45 baht if you take regular  bts 7 stops about 40mins

title: Great way to travel
review: We used the MRT on one of our private tours and found it to be very well utilised  It is a most efficient way to travel in Bangkok

title: Bangkok skytrain
review: This is the way to travel in BKK Quick airconditioned and cheap why mess with taxis and tuk tuks

title: Crowded but very convenient and reasonable.
review: BTSSkytrain cuts across the city along Sukhamvit Rd Much fasterthan a taxi during rush hour BTS has separate fare than the MRT which is paid with a separate fare All fares are distance based

title: Good train experience
review: Brilliant good timings and very cheap And the trains were clean and easy to understand how to get to where you wanted to go

title: Easy to Use
review: The sky train is easy to use however the self service machines do not take credit card or bills  Self service machine takes coins only so if you do not have the correct change you will need to stand in line  Also the train stops service at midnight

title: Quickest way to get around
review: Quick on time easy to use Only gripe it gets busy kind of expensive and doesn't reach enough of the city

title: Fast, efficient and clean and cool
review: Cleanest public transport ever  and it helps that eating and drinking is not permitted Very comfortable and never too crowded aircon up to freezing point so bring a cardigan or shawl

title: It beat the traffics
review: If you are going to travel a lot might as well get the 140tbh oneday BTS tourist pass from the counter You might not save a lot of TBH but you will definitely save a lot of TIME queuing for the ticket machine

title: convenient and economical
review: These trains are pretty much frequent and very economical The only problem is they do not have late night or early morning trains

title: Quick, clean , convenient.
review: Normally not a fan of public transport in Bangkok this was  a delightmuch much better than the rude taxi drivers who deliberately take you on long winding routes to hike up the fare The BTS is prompt clean and very convenient  literally taking you to the door of most malls Very highly recommend it

title: Very easy and economical way to travel in Bangkok
review: The BTS is a great way to dodge traffic  many times it is a faster way to travel if your destination is along the BTS route since traffic in Bangkok can be heavily congested It is very cheap and has two lines that connect at Siam station Most stops have things to do and things to see either connected to the station or right outside the station Much cheaper than taking a taxi and very easy to use just make sure to keep some spare change for the ticket machines as not all locations accept bills and the queue for change can be a little long at times

title: Easy access to downtown without BKK traffic!!!
review: I am a frequent visitor to Bangkok but this was the first time I took the Airlink into downtown If you dont have alot of luggage I recommend this 45 Baht and forget grid lock traffic Clean and fairly fast

title: Father an son family trip
review: Sky train is very easy and fast way to move in city area We used that several times during our vacation

title: Efficient city train system!!
review: I mostly used BST or Metro train system while I'm bangkok and found it impressive Very tourist friendly  You have signs available in English everywhere which is helpful for non Thai speakers and logistically it's possible for a first time traveller t cover important city landmarks in a day  Only drawback is that it's not 24 hours operational and closes by mid night

title: Convenient and economic
review: Used this several times when I was in Bangkok  But sometimes  it takes longer time than road because you have to buy a separate tokenticket for every route unlike other places (as New Delhi metro etc )  Which is a waste of time   I also observed that this service is just good only for money point of view If you want to save time then better to use local taxi service   Suvarnabhumi Airport to SIAM (by Skytrain)  15 hours   Suvarnabhumi Airport to SIAM ( by Taxi)  35 mins   Now choice is yours )

title: THE way to get into Bangkok from BKK Airport
review: Save your money take the Rail Link from the basement of BKK airport A great way to immerse yourself in the city off the bat Affordable and efficient great view along the way on the elevated rail   Staff at the entrance can assist you with determining fares the link only runs 23 times an hour but we were directed onto a local train that seemed just as fast and were on our way easily enough   Note for early flights the BTS doesn't start running until 5 or 6 am so you'll need to cab to BKK if you have an early departure from Bangkok

title: I good way to travel quickly in the city
review: The Skytrain is a very good way to get around in Bangkok  The train is clean and the ticket agents are very helpful if asked how to get to a certain location  First time use can be a little confusing but once you gain just a little experience travel between locations is very fast compared to taxis or tuk tuks  As with many metro systems the train can be very crowded during rush times

title: The war railway
review: A very moving experience and shocking to see what was achieved in unimaginable conditions  The train journey was very popular and a bit of a bun fight for seats  be sure to listen to your guide re where to stand

title: 2nd class sleeper, train #9--awesome!
review: Took 2nd class sleeper train #9 from Bangkok to Chiang Mai practically brand new carriages very clean with a dining car which has the only wifi on board I slept through the night waking 1 hour before arriving Train has power outlets I wish they dimmed the carriage lights at nightbut I brought a night mask so should you

title: Sky Train Bangkok-Easy and Earnest
review: Skytrains at Bangkok are very convenient to commute within the city They are quick and easy to use Everything is so well organized that a tourist will not feel lost at all Ticket Machines Maps Signs and Announcements make it real easy to opt for these A must use commute option in the city well connected to all major places (malls etc) and stations

title: Holiday 2016
review: Worth doing the first four stops to the bridge after doing Hellfire Pass to complete the experience  The market at the fourth stop was unusual in the goods being sold and possibly the best market we saw in Kanchanaburi

title: Great, quick and cheap way to the city
review: Great quick and cheap way from the city to the airport It's always in time with the taxi you can never exactly estimate the time required due to traffic Clean and well air conditioned They used to have one that operates straight to phaya thai but not sure why it stopped Very efficient

title: Take MRT to avoid traffic
review: We usually take the MRT when we were in Bangkok to avoid traffic congestions during peak hours It could be a headache to be stuck on the road

title: Very well organized and on time
review: We booked this tour through Getyourguidecom and truly enjoyed the trip Specifically concerning the tour organization they arrived on time to our hotel their guide spoke good english and was very friendly and everything went smoothly and on time They even found a solution for a family that was late for the pickup Although both the train market and the floating market are a little touristywe found them both to be still good fun especially the train market If you decide to go this company is a good option

title: Sure beats taxis
review: I am tired of the Swampy taxis usually refusing to use the meter until I ask in Thai for the third time The train link is fast not crowded and affordable The down side is it's hard to find the elevator if you have suitcases and you may have to transfer 2 or 3 times to get to your hotel

title: Doesn't cover a wide enough area
review: As I said it's quite a journey from the backpacker area just to get to a skytrain station It's also not the cheapest and gets very very busy during rush hour But thats to be expected

title: Great, quick & safe way to get srounf
review: The BTS sky train is a brilliant way to get around Bangkok I travelled it as a single western lady and felt very safe Either buy a ticket for each trip or get a day pass for unlimited travel all day for 140 baht

title: Best way to reach Airport
review: I was initially reluctant to opt for Airport link to go to Airport as I was carrying 2 bags and children But the staff at the station helped me out and guided me very well We got on the Airport link on the departure and reach Suvarnabhumi very comfortably

title: very quick and reasonable
review: Good value especially if you want to get to the airport from down town Bangkok

title: Holiday
review: Probably the best way to travel from Bangkok to the airport The service was fast and an experience in itself travelling above the traffic The cost was modest and operated on a token purchase system Its advisable to have some smaller value notes for payment when using the ticket machines as change is given in coins I would advise watching one of the many online videos first showing how to use the system first before travelling

title: marvellous
review: Brilliant method of travel guarranteed to be on time no fuss no harrassment from crooked taxi drivers juat relax and get out at the airport brilliant so easy

title: great way to commute
review: the BTS is very high quality from the ticketing platforms and the train For places that are close to a BTS station its a no brainer to opt for this but at times travelers might be too tired of roaming the malls that they would prefer the cab from the mall gates rather than even walk 510 mins to BTS

title: Easy to use even for an idiot
review: Easy to follow machines for purchase of tickets or helpful staff for assistance Personally where I am from we don’t have a rail system and I found this one easy to use  Obviously cramped at busy times but not really an issue

title: Very Efficient
review: Good to use BTS in Bangkok much better than using taxi if you are ok with a little bit of walking  Their route is fairly good able to reach most of the popular locations in town

title: very efficient
review: cheap way to get into Bangkok from the airport Roughly £100 all the way a bit packed but also intersects the monorail

title: Convenient transfer
review: You can use this transportation to go anywhere of Bangkok This is a good choice if u don't want to use taxi or bus in the city

title: Good way to get around Bangkok
review: Clean and cheap Serves mainly the Central Business District  which can get very bad during peak hours

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: We visited Bangkok for 3 days and used Skytrain every day  With all the road traffic it is the best way to get around and will get you close to many areas such as night market boat launches to grand palace and other spots weekend market even the airport although we didn't use for that BWAYWK   Inexpensive well marked with English signs directing you air conditioned runs frequently  Some trains were crowded no problem the next one will come within minutes  Runs fast passengers very polite no problem using  Our hotel was close by not sure if all hotels are close but is easy to walk to

title: Easy way to and from airport
review: This is a fast and efficient mode of transport to the airport  gives good views of the city as travelling past and is cheap (35baht a ticket)   Would recommend over a taxi  it's easy cheaper and much quicker than sitting in the endless traffic of Bangkok

title: cheap, fast, very cold from AC
review: its very cheap and you can just Forget the traffic jam make sure you dont sweat before going there or bring something along they cool it down like Northpole

title: Very clean and easy to use
review: Simple and easy to network helpful staff on hand should you need them very clean and great value for money Trains run very frequently and on time

title: Easy mode of transport
review: Easy to navigate fairly cheap and gets you to places Gets very crowded at peak hours but definitely better than being caught in Bangkok's notorious traffic jams

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Get a Rabbit card (purchase at ticket booth) to ease travel then you don't have to figure out the fares and buy a ticket each time Cars are airconditioned which is nice in Bangkok in the summer

title: fast to town
review: 1st time took the rail link never expect that is so fast and convenient able to avoid terrible jam and get to town easily

title: Fast and efficient
review: Sometimes very crowded But there is never long to wait for the next one I little trouble lugging luggage up and down steps when no escalator

title: great way to move around the city
review: the Skytrain in Bangkok has to be one of the best transit systems in SEA The maps are easy to read ticket machines are fairly painless and as long as you're not claustrophobic it's good fun and a great way to see the city

title: Efficient and easily accessible
review: Better than the jam any time of the day It's highly affordable and beats bargaining with the taxis and tutus Directions are clear as well

title: easy to get around
review: we enjoy taking local transport and the bts was very easy to maneuver    it very near hotel area and then goes through the main bangkok downtown  we went from the river to a couple shopping destinations  was very easy to maneuver  signs were easily marked and in english   there are people at the station to direct and give you change

title: Sky train modern convenient comfortable
review: When in Bangkok use the sky train it’s easy fun safe convenient inexpensive and very comfortable The maps show the price to get to each stop next to ticket machine as an American with no knowledge of the Thai language the process of buying the correct ticket was easier than at anyplace I’ve visited the trains are very modern and very well air conditioned Bangkok is very fortunate to have such a beautiful modern convenient transportation system

title: The best and fastest way to get around Bangkok
review: We use the Skytrain when we're in Bangkok as we find it the quickest and certainly the cheapest way to get around It has two lines that intersect I would advise you get a map of the skytrain routes before you travel to get your head around the where you are staying and where you want to travel httpwwwbangkokmapscombtshtm  It can get crowded at peak times but if you try to avoid those times it is a very efficient way to get around  Bangkok is often so choked with traffic it moves at a glacial pace while the Skytrain zooms along on it's elevated track  While staying at Sukhumvit we would catch the Skytrain into Siam to shop at MBK & Siam Paragon the train station is right there are Siam and you can walk from your train straight into the shopping centre without even having to go down the stairs and outside  We also took the Skytrain out to Chatuchak weekend market this really is the only way to go to Market it took us 30 mins and cost about $3 it would have taken probably 15  2 hours to get there by taxi through the traffic  To buy the tickets grab a map and work out where you want to go prices are charged on how many stops you pass  If you ask the ticket sellers they will hep you and give you the correct change to put into the ticket machine  You get a token which you must hang on to as it opens the gate at your destination  Once you try the Skytrain you will use it everytime as it really is so efficient

title: Beats the Traffic
review: From the airport take the BTS to Phaya Thai  Change to the green line to your destination  45 baht fto Phaya Thai and another 1520 baht to whatever station you need

title: Easy!
review: Took this to hotel on Sukhimvit line ) fast and air con What more could you want It was also cheaper than a taxi and the roads were at gridlock so this was the best option

title: Airport Rail Link
review: The Link is an excellent public transportation traveling to and from BKK avoiding the usual traffic jams of Bangkok The fare is very reasonable 45 Baht one way and would be fantastic if the fare can be combined with BTS in a prepaid card system like in many other cities

title: Friends
review: I took train once went I came to Bangkok to the hotel and it was convenient chip and accessible In the central Bangkok I used with tok tok and taxi

title: Best A/C in Bangkok
review: Be prepared for the crowds especially during rush hour but I'd ride the train just for the AC after walking around Bangkok on a steamy day The train was clean fast and on time

title: Fantastic service
review: Such frequent service no graffiti very clean VERY cheap way better than anywhere in Australia  Easy to top up your travel card and all the stations are clean and many close to shopping malls  Far quicker than the taxis

title: Perfect way to travel
review: Used the rail system to travel everyday avoiding the long delays in taxis We could move around to all locations that we needed too Very easy to use with helpful staff to assist Buy a travel card and load money as needed saving time and money against single trip costs

title: By pass the traffic!
review: Love the BTS Much better mode of transportation in traffic prone Bangkok  It would be nice if they have more ticket machines at each station Often time we had to get in line to exchange bills for 10 bath coins and then get into another line for the ticket machine

title: Airport Rail link in Bangkok
review: I usually just call a taxi but the traffic was worse than normal and we were in a bit of a hurry so we took the airport link for the first time and it was cheap fast clean and easy  Excellent service

title: Very practical
review: Best way to go to chatuchak WE market and most of the big malls in BKK without braking a sweat User friendly

title: Convenience
review: Best way to get around the city and saves time easy access to all the malls and clean Usually a nice experince

title: Very Much Like Sgp MRT
review: Good & clean Clear & easy to navigate Nothing negative   Convenient to many places esp Siam areas + Chachujak + Erwan 4 face Buddha + all the main shopping centers

title: Fun ride
review: Ride was good  avoid traffic time if with kids Good connection all through the city Kids had fun to have view of the city

title: Intersting
review: You arrive at this station if you catch the train further up the line The station itself is small and surrounded by market stalls which I feel is a little disrespectful

title: Crowded ride
review: Often very crowded We tried the Mrt riding from the Phetchaburi station We had Rabbit cards for the Bts but sadly you can't use the on the Mrt A combined system would be good

title: very simple transfer...very cheap...far better than a taxi battling the bagkok traffic
review: this is definitely the way to get to and from the airportno traffic to sit in and extremely cheapand air conditioned

title: Best and fastest
review: I would recommend this as this is the best and the fastest way to get to the city We travelled as a couple and it was so easy and cheap

title: Good way to travel around Bangkok
review: Apart from the BTS the MRT is another good way to travel around Bangkok city Can be crowded sometimes but I found that the crowd at BTS was even worse I prefer MRT more than BTS as it is somehow more comfortable For the tickets you can pay either by coins or bank notes (for BTS some stations only accept coins) and you can buy the MRT tickets either at the ticket counters or through the machine

title: quick and efficient
review: This is the cheapest way to town centre It is quick and efficient but very busy with local people too I don't think it is the best way to your hotel when a taxi in Thailand is cheap comparing to UK If you take a taxi from the desk at Suvanabhum airport They log the details of the taxi and the driver for you so it is safe enough In general you would pay about 250 bahts to town centre plus toll fee about 80 bahts for using flyover and it is door to door so why lug your luggages about from train to trainand then walk some more to your hotel There is a 50 bahts fee to the taxi from the airport desk which added to your bill

title: Riding the BTS
review: The BTS is a cheap alternative to cabs It’s easy to use and takes you to most of the desired tourist destinations The only drawback is it can be crowded at peak times I rode it mid morning and mid afternoon without the crowds

title: Very convenient way to beat the traffic
review: Get yourself a rabbit card and you are good to go Very convenient way to see the city esp if you are staying in downtown

title: On time, comfortable
review: The train was clean on time and very comfortable Always clean Came in very handy we often made use of it

title: Not bad
review: Cheap fare  Its quite impresive though  Efficient and not so bad  Though its crowded sometimes yet i still like it

title: Good but avoid peak time
review: Convenience for main shopping area and many points of interest  But try to avoid our peak time in morning and evening weekdays

title: The only way for true lovers to go to Chiang Mai
review: If you are in Thailand with your lover and you wish to experience something that will bond you in an even more special way for life take one of the world's last truly successful passenger trains from Hua Lamophong Station (see my review for that) up to the end of the line in Chiang Mai  Splurge the $70 for a first class cabin (with great airconditioningcouches sink etc) and enjoy the view from ample glass windows or shut the blackout curtains for wonderful sleeping  Take the night train up and the night train back at the end of your stay in Chiang Mai and your train fare will be what you would have spent on a room anyway  The night train up gives you dawn views of the last two stops in the morning the return trip give s you dawn over Ayutthaya  Get a ticket that lets you exit at Ayutthaya for breakfast and a few hours of rambling those ruins then back on for a midday arrival back in Bangkok  Even the dining car is respectable food  This is a nofail guaranteed romantic hit of a lifetime  Take her wrap your arms around her in your cabin and watch this magic land go by under moonlight  Wake up in the morning and you are in the mystical North  Trains can still be magic when they traverse a magical land

title: Cool transport in the heat of Bangkok
review: Fast reliable and totally cool in the heat and humidity of Bangkok Absolutely worth the money of the ticket

title: Great Inexpensive Transit to/from the Airport. but not Tourist Friendly
review: The Airport Rail Link is an inexpensive way to get tofrom the Airport The system does lack clear signage at the airport and lacks transit infrastructures at the stations (ie taxi stands maps signage Etc)  AllInAll not very Tourist Friendly especially for First Time Visitors

title: Efficient and cheap
review: Once you have the systemof getting your ticketit is tbe best way to get around  Although taxis are cheapthis is so much faster

title: Good experience.
review: Great experience taking the train into the market then watching it run the other direction The floating market was less boisterous than during pre Covid times but is still fun Gotta try the mango sticky rice

title: Awesome
