review: Way better than catching a cab This sky train is easy cheap and fast to catch  It links up with MRT stations for transfers but we caught to all the way to its last stop before catching a cab from there to our final destination At 45 baht per person for the full trip it was significantly cheaper and quicker as a couple than sitting in traffic

title: best way of transport in Bangkok
review: BTS has one of the best connectivity and the best mode of transport in Bangkok Has internal connectivity with many malls so one can directly enter various malls from BTS station itself Day passes are also available

title: Best way to get around Bangkok!
review: Bangkok was a little intimidating at first but became much more accessible once I learned how to ride the BTS It is everything you can ask for in public transportation  clean safe punctual and AIR CONDITIONED It gets quite packed at rush hour but that's half the fun

title: Good and bad things about the skytrain
review: The skytrain is nice because it is coming fast The only thing you might not like is that it is really busy Otherwise When you go by cab you have to wait for hours before you get at your destination sometime

title: Excellent connectivity
review: I always take airport rail link fromto suvarnabhumi airport I always stay at Pratunam So my nearest metro station to my hotel is ratchaparop It starts from 6 am After that frequency and connectivity is very good Coaches are kept very clean

title: I love it and that was ever since my first visit to Bangkok 15 years ago!
review: So convenient if you choose hotels nearby the BTS  Now that Bangkok has MTR you can connect it with BTS to many popular spots with very reasonable cost and time

title: MUST TRAVEL IN THIS TRAIN
review: One must travel in these trains to various places in BANGKOK there are connecting boat services where you can see and visit to lot of nice locations via boats as well

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: I love the BTS It makes getting around so easy If you're going to be here for a while consider getting a Rabbit Card 530Baht gives you the card an 15 trips to be used in a month  Air conditioned very clean and excellent signage makes it easy for all  Sadly like a lot of Thailand it's not wheelchair friendly

title: Transport  in City
review: Excellent way to travel around the City  high above all the traffic pollution and links all the major tourist areas including a station by the river taxi

title: Best way to travel into the city!
review: If you just arrived at Bangkok Thailand(BKK) or plan to go to use the Airport Rail Link It is the BEST method of transportation to go to the city The Airport Rail Link stations are very close to other train lines so you can mount and dismount easily and keep on moving through the city It's way cheaper than taxis and way faster Remember that traffic is insane in Bangkok

title: Good transportation in Bangkok
review: I travel to work by BTS every weekdays It helps us save the time a lot but there are crowded would be nice to have more trains Sky train is expanding the lines right now but it will take a few years until its finished

title: So practical!
review: If the French métro could be as clean Cheap and easy to travel all around Bangkok Just may be not so cold inside Ahah

title: Flawless
review: BTS very quiet at moment due to COVID19 pandemic No lack of trains though Plenty of hand gel in evidence at entrances

title: Fast and comfortable
review: When we first arrived in Bangkok we were met at the airport by a taxi but when we came back after our side trip to Cambodia we came back into the city on the rails It was fast and not crowded took us directly to the sky train which dropped us at the river so we could take the tourist boat to our hotel It was serene  although it would not have been so easy if we had been lugging along a lot of luggage

title: Eeasy transportation over the city
review: Best transportation to move side to side in Bangkok city during the traffic jam all over day and night

title: Nice Experience
review: I used the train to go the weekend market It was packed full but the train was efficient The service agents at the station were helpful The ticket kiosk should accept other money denomination for tickets because queuing to change money to coins to pay for a ticket could be slow and painful

title: A Very Unique Experience
review: A very unique experience and I would highly recommend to do this with a tour as the guides know the exact times and places you need to be in order to get the best experience of viewing the train going through the market We arrived to the railway market via the train itself so you get the experience of both arriving on the train via the market but also after seeing the train depart through the market I would have like to have spent a little more time at the market but as soon as we were done with the viewing the train depart we went straight to the floating market Floating market was an amazing experience lots of fruits food and items for sale along the river Had chance to have lunch at the floating market before returning back to our hotel

title: Very convinient
review: Cheap and convinient way to travel across the very busy traffic in Bangkok Watch for the right exit from some stations

title: Great public transportation
review: Clean efficient cheap My only reservation was not being able to speak Thai but signage is in English

title: Overcrowded
review: Suggest people to take the Airport Rail Link in the morning otherwise don't bother The train will be overcrowded I feel the train seriously need maintainence work done and they need to extend a few more cabins

title: The only way to go (okay, there's the subway, too)
review: Bangkok traffic makes "miserable" sound like an advertisement for paradise The BTS Skytrain has plenty of signage in English English announcements in the cars and is generally pretty easy to navigate as long as you don't let yourself get flustered by the rushing crowds An actual seat can be hard to get near the center of the city but the trains don't get jampacked like Tokyo subways and—this is the payoff—you can figure out when you're going to get to your destination Allow about 25 minutes per station and you won't be far wrong Stations and trains are clean and fares are low—B42 or about $125 US for the longest rides You can buy a onetrip ticket from the vending machines outside the turnstiles or if you're going to be in town for several days get a multiuse ticket Those come in two flavors 15 or 30 trips of any length you like good for one month or a fixed amount of money good for years The former are a bargain if you're making long trips

title: Great way to Travel the city!!
review: We were in Bangkok for 3 nights and purchased the 3 day pass  (230 baht) for unlimited rides  What a value and great way to navigate the city  The MRT route connects with the BTS and the Airport Link so you can get to every location  The only drawback is that the card can only be used on the MRT  That being said the BTS and Airport link are so incredibly cheap it doesn't really matter The staff in the MRT are  friendly and helpful if you have any questions as most people in Bangkok are  So ride the MRT and see the city

title: Totally worthwhile. Good price.
review: Loved this trip It was well paced and got us around everything we went to see without rushing  Our guide was great and gave us lots of info as we travelled

title: So Fast
review: Got on the train and in 20 Mins in the centre of Bangkok no sitting in traffic for more than an hour

title: Bangkok at its Best
review: With the BTS you AVOID the jam the hot sun the rain the uneven ground footpaths the headache in hailing a cab and you can control your time  I also like it that they have bridges to all the main shopping centres and hotels  So convenient and affordable

title: Better option than taxi, if the timing works
review: Easy inexpensive and convenient way to get to the city Used it to connect to the BTS The only drawback was having to haul luggage across levels to switch trainsbut better than dealing with the Bangkok traffic

title: fast and convenient
review: This is the cheapest fastest and most convenient way to get to the city from the airport It's way cheaper than taking the taxi Sometimes the taxi drivers charge extra (most expect a tip) I was able to get to Bangkok in less than 40 mins

title: Complete chaos that works
review: I did not know whether to laugh or cry you are walking a  long a railway track hidden by solid rows on both sides by market stalls selling the most amazing array of foods The choice quite stunning then all of sudden there is a  train whistle and the stalls slide their wares away from the track in a polished manner and recover the awningsThe train chugs through the crowds some of whom seem desperate with their selfie sticks to get run over Once the Train passes stalls slide out canopies folded and trading continues Quite a showHealth and safety in the UK would have a heart attack

title: Suggested
review: Traffic in BKK is some of the worst I half seen in the world  Seemed to take an house to get ANYWHERE  I suggest using public transport whenever possbile

title: easy to find
review: Just followthe signs inside BTS and you'll find it Drops you off at the airport and other stops too but not too hard to figure out

title: Very convenient to get around bkk
review: a quick and convenient way to get around bangkok without the traffic in bkk it could get croweded during peak times

title: Yes Yes Yes
review: Once I used it I did not stop  Getting anywhere around Bangkok this is the best was to travel once you arrive at the Airport  If you have too many bags don't do it as its better to take a taxi  As I normally just have a backpack I get on the airport link to either Phil Thai as it links with the skytrain or get off at Markasaan which links to the underground

title: So easy to use and great value
review: We opted to take the Airport rail link and then sky train into Bangkok centre from the airport rather than a taxi It is so easy to use all automated machines which have English they accept coins and notes We just checked before arriving at the station which lines we needed etc to take some of the stress out The train is quick clean and air conditioned so cooler than a cab and quicker Four of us got from the sky train at Asok to Bangkok airport using the Airport rail link for a total of £10 (that is for all us not per person)

title: Nice cup of coffee
review: Reasonably priced coffee with tasty blend  No problem  accessing WiFi which was useful before our train trip

title: Fast, efficient and easy to manoeuvre
review: Routes are clearly layout stops clear and announcement in both Thai and English Ticket dispensing machines are easy to use As they extend their lines it makes it easier to travel especially for tourists Trains do get very packed at peak times Travellers with luggages have to walk up and down stairs and the airport line station does not connect in one hall with BTS Regardless very convenient for tourists to sightsee

title: Best way to travel from airport
review: Just walk out of Airport and take this ARL connects to the city and also connects to other mode of transport  BRTS & MRT

title: A fun way to experience 2 unique local markets
review: Great half day trip for families giving a glimpse of 2 very different and unique local markets around Bangkok Well organised and well suited to travel with younger kids   Having a few different modes of transport makes it more fun than a busonly tour and is something that is otherwise a bit tricky to organise so this is good value for a busy parent

title: Quick and easy
review: This line really makes getting to the airport on timevery easy  It's quick and efficient easy to access and there's no traffic congestion

title: Great!
review: Spend some time on the train The air conditioning is perfect and the view is very very interesting A nice way to know some beautiful parts of the city

title: Best transport for reaching Middle of Bangkok
review: Landed in Bangkok Collected the luggage and went to basement where the metro station is 👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 Small chlid Is free of charge  We took the ride from airport to Ratchaprarop station  Fare was 40 baht per person kids loved the ride🚇🇹🇭

title: Easy to use
review: Another mass transit option if you are visiting Bangkok  Also very simple to use  Runs to different areas of Bangkok than the BTS Skytrain

title: Just public transport
review: Crazy busy and not great views but fine for a quick commute if it works out for where you want to go

title: Convenient, cheap, fast and traffic-free!
review: Convenient cheap fast and trafficfree Although it can a little inconvenient for people who bought too many goods but they have elevators

title: No
review: Just splurge a little and take a taxi It's old and crowded The only good thing about it is the views you see along the way

title: Pretty good
review: Comfortable rideGood price and easy way of getting to the stations and coming out

title: BTS best form of travel in Bangkok
review: The BTS skytrain in Bangkok is really easy to use and you can avoid sitting in traffic You need change to buy a ticket however there is a counter just had them a note they give you change only you cannot purchase a ticket directly with them go to the ticket machine its all very straight forward But gets busy during peak hours so expect to maybe wait a few minutes for the next service

title: Best way to travel Bangkok!
review: So easy make sure to get a day pass if you will be traveling a lot

title: An easy and fast way of travelling in Bangkok
review: If possible find a hotel near a Skytrain station It makes your trip so much easier Away from congestion on the streets makes you feel  more relaxed

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: Loved the skytrain  Similar to the one we have in Vancouver BC (also same name)  It was easy to use cheap reliable safe & clean  It doesn't cover the city but it works really well for the areas that it serves  We used it often  Also loved the Chao Phraya (River) Boat service

title: Efficient, a little slow
review: This efficient train service is well worth the money a bit slow and it was fairly full as well We had to stand which was surprising as in most other countries I think younger people would have offered seats to an older couple with luggage  But they were all intent on their devices The train brings you right into the airport It's clean efficient and a reliable service

title: The way to get to and from the airport
review: We were going to take a taxi back to the airport till friend recommended the airport link Took the airport lonk at 11pm at night and it was busy but clean and quick and only 40 Baht each

title: Good but slow and not well integrated
review: The line is somehow very convenient at the airport but it is not well integrated to the other lines I had to change in Makasan and it looked a bit far from there to the metro station so if you have too much luggage it can be quite hard to get around The lines are not integrated so if you have to take other lines you will have to buy different ticket every single time

title: Pretty good
review: The MRT was pretty good  Ran regularly and wasn't overly crowded  There are not many stops and they are quite hard to find when you are above ground

title: Easy to use and convenient
review: Taking the Rail Link is much better than a taxi stuck in the jam if you dont have heavy and bulky luggage to lug

title: So easy to get into in town
review: A ride to the last (farthest) stop is only 45 baht right into town center You can't beat it Easy to get connecting subways and taxis or tuktuks to complete your travel within the city

title: The architect of the building at interchange level is absorbing too much heat
review: Well the link provides more convenience between airport and town If you are with luggages it could pose troublesome for link stations The path are difficult to get about and the distance can be quite a fair bit If you don't mind the trouble of getting the way it does save alot for alone or couple travellers

title: Easy
review: Easy to use cheeper even taxi meter are not expensive but definitely faster in s so crowdy city like Bangkok

title: Was very comfortable and starts early morning.
review: Took the airport link for our hotel at 6am Paid around 40 bhat for one person most economical than taking expensive taxi from airport to hotel

title: A great way to commute outside of Bangkok
review: Flight was cancelled between Bangkok and Chumphon so I gave the train option a go and I’m impressed by its standards Took the first class sleeper train  (booked the whole room to myself) and I slept my way through Despite the train delay I felt that the service and comfort level are better than my expectation Did the same for a trip to Hua Hin from Chumphon via its second class AC and the ride was also comfortable

title: The aorta of Bangkok
review: The BTS is one of the main things that make Bangkok great Combined with the MRT and Airport Link it takes you to pretty much all the places you might want to visit except Khaosan Road and Don Muang airport Always stay near a BTS station when visiting Bangkok

title: Great Way to Get Around
review: The BTS system is a great way to avoid traffic and get around to many places in Central Bangkok It is easy to use as there are 2 main lines that intersect at a few points with also the Metro Tickets are reasonable and trains are clean and timely

title: Clean and very convenient
review: With Bangkok traffic as it is unless you are willing to venture riding on the back of a motorcyclescooter taxi your only options at certain times are the train or walking  Walking means sweatinga lot so the train is a great option It also connects to the river taxis so that gives you more nonwalking and noncar options  Some tips  You have to have change but there's a booth to get change and the machines return change The ticket machines are nicely simple though maybe not intuitive when you first use it 1) Look up your station to get fare 2) press button with that fare amount 3) Insert coined until fully paid 4) take card  You have to insert the card at the beginning and the end so hold onto it If you paid exact fare the card will not be returned to you upon exist (gate opens but no card comes back out as it did when you entered)

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Used the local transit system which was clean frequent and efficient Not a lot to add purchasing a day ticket for 140 bht was easy since everything is Bi lingual Thai and English

title: Food market
review: During my visit to this market we got thai food  Busy market mostly local peoples  Open night time  Much visit

title: Can be useful
review: Yes a great quick way to get around if you can master it would use during peek travel times as roads gridlocked when a usually 10 min taxi ride can take 90 min otherwise jump in a taxi or tuktuk they are sooo cheap

title: How To Beat the Bangkok notorious traffic jams
review: As travelers we have limited time and would not like to be caught in traffic jams and waste precious time on the roads A good way to move around Bangkok especially to the popular shopping malls and places of interests is to travel by BTS Skytrain These sky trains practically brings you to all the popular shopping malls in Bangkok These trains may be packed especially during peak hours but it definitely moves you much faster and quicker to your destinations than be caught in the crawling traffic To enjoy the facility of using these Skytrains try to book your hotels that are along or located near the BTS lines These will save you considerably time getting to the BTS lines Some hotels are located some short distance from the BTS but some of them provide shuttle service to the train stations If you think you will travel a lot on the BTS try to get a day or few day passes and the cost will be so much cheaper than purchasing single tickets

title: Cheap and efficient. But needs better ticketing processes.
review: The BTS is the best way to get around Bangkok avoiding the terrible traffic But it is let down by a system with ticketing machines that only take coins So you have to queue for a service counter where they will change notes to coins (they won't actually sell you a ticket) and then queue again for a ticketing machine Very inefficient You can buy a prepaid card but that is only worth it for longer stays

title: Saving cost of transportation?
review: I traveled from the Phrom Phong to Survarnabhumi Airport via the Airport Link and transfering at Praya Thai station I paid about 90 Baht per person total  This is great with 1 or 2 persons The trip took about 55 minutes with the walking involved  Consider a taxi if taveling with more or luggage which may run about 350 Baht

title: Easiest way to move
review: Cheap clean airconditioned way to move in Bangkok everyone can this We have used BTS several times during our enjoyable vacation

title: A great way to go
review: After making the initial connection from BTS it was a painless and efficient way for my party to zip to the airport The price more than fair

title: Good experience with BTS bangkok
review: Most time I take taxi from airport to hotel and other places  but long queuing  and miscommunication with taxi driver  and often over charge by the taxi  traffic jam   so one day I try ask one western foreigner teach me how to use local bts from airport to hotel  and supprisingly is not difficult at all  and not crowded like in Hong Kong Mrt too  here bts is very clean  have air Con  English sign and map too  safe and clean  and very cheap too  almost cover all impotent location in bangkok  am not sure they operate 24 hours or not  but I did use one time at night around 11  they still operate  well it is really good transportation for foeringer to use  especially for female traveler is more safe  when you do not understand about the road and can not speak thai language  cause I had many times been drive around by taxi driver  and he keep drive refuse to stop and do not respond my English at all  and that was very scary feeling when you were alone sit inside car and no ideal where you were  so be careful before you take taxi  make sure the driver understand English and local 911 number keep with in your mobile phone  but over rall  bangkok is exciting city to discover  just try learn to be more smart and wise to spent your money on  best experience

title: Easily flying through traffic...
review: BTS features a great service to move around BKK especially on the Sukhumvit line which is usually traffic heavy They should however improve the machines to stop this crazy coins game perhaps introducing a rabbit card for tourists

title: wrong pictures for the wrong market! Wednesday Cha-Am Nightmarket
review: This reviews here are a totally mix up ChaAm have many markets now but the one is worth a visit is the Wednesday nightmarket And this market is only Wednesday at the train station  Police station You will find here lots of food thai food western food isan food and even insects But not just food What ever you need you can find here Clothes Shoes Copies  watches  Dogs  fish  rabbit  cosmetics  CD's  the newest IPhone Copies and and and the hotels from all around bring their guest down here in the highseasonso it is real full here from 1800 till 2000 so don't forget to bring your camera

title: Very convenient
review: Keeping in view the rates of taxis at the airport airport link is the best option Just takes 45 thb from airport till the last stop from where you can get bts on wards to siam square or anywhere Taxis charge 700thb for this 45 thb trip

title: Very convenient
review: The fare is cheap and very convenient It links to many BTS stations But you are carrying heavy big luggages please take taxi There is no lift or escalator in most of BTS stations in Bangkok You have to carry you heavy luggage down or up using staircase

title: Stay Cool
review: Traveling around the city on a Skytrain helps you escape the heat and humidity even for a short while

title: Make daily life in bkk easier, Tourist-Unfriendly, terrible ticket system
review: BTS skytrain has 2 main lines Sukhumvit line and Silom line It helps Bangkokian and tourists to commute easier in Bangkok I found the ticket system is pretty terrible You need to change into coins at counter then bring those coins to add in machine for ticket Only a few big stations you can use banknotes at the machine Siam station (interchange station) is over crowded during peak hour Saladaeng station is too much packed on the platform during peak hour Silom line is often delayed or stopped running without any notice You can connect to subway at Asoke station Saladaeng station Mochit station with some walking distance Subway and BTS skytrain do not share the same ticket so you need to buy a new ticket

title: Needs better airconditioning
review: Good way to get to city center BUT poor airconditioning It's faster way to go but can also be very crowded Hongkong is for me the gold standard for an airport link

title: Great well organized trip !
review: The night before they advised us what time pick up will be exactly and they were there waiting for us in the morning at that time The tour guide Pat was very professional and excellent English we understood everything and she was very detailed as what to expect First you drive to the train station take the train into the market and after leave with the van to the floating market where you take a boat into the market In the market you can take another boat for few extra bath to go around the river or just walk around on land and see mostly the same things up to you if you prefer the beat or walking around After the floating market its time to head back Very well organized activity and i would recommend to anyone thinking about doing it

title: Quick and clean
review: We booked 2 nights at Baiyoke Tower Hotel and we traveled by metro from the airport to the hotel It was really clean and it was quick 90% of the time it was outground and you can admire the city see the areas You can take the metro from the underground level of the airport So in this city metro is a good choice no matter where you want to go

title: Convenient
review: Once you work out where you are going this is by far the best way to get around The counter sells tickets and can give advice   I heard that some lines don't cross so you can't interchange from green lines to the red one We didn't try so I can't verify it

title: Super easy to use
review: Very convenient airport link and super cheap as well If you dont want to go through the traffic definitely use this

title: Fastest way to cross the city
review: Cleanefficient and inexpensive   Don't sit in traffic get where you need to be quickly and enjoy the view of the city along the way

title: The only way to travel in Bangkok
review: Bangkok has one of the worst traffic gridlock in the world  The best way to get around is taking the BTS Skytrain  Its very clean reliable and cheap  I fell very safe the routes stops are very easy to navigate  Very cheap fares

title: A fun experience.
review: We had top bunks opposite each other which made it feel like Some Like it Hot  people chatting and passing snacks I was planning on getting first class tickets but they were sold out and I'm glad as the second class beds were great and the whole experience was more fun We had a little bed picnic and got a good night's sleep Definitely take eye shades as the lighting is bright The top bunks don't have windows but when you get on the train it's dark anyway In the morning you can move down to seats by the window (if you're going all the way to Chiang Mai) as people will have got off at previous stations

title: Excellent way to get to the city

title: Overnight from Chiang mai to bsngkok

title: Decent overnight sleeper train
review: As part of an organised tour we experienced travelling in classic Thai style as we used an overnight sleeper train Our train departed from Bangkok at around 5pm and we arrived in Surat Thani at around 4am the following morning so we had a very early start   When boarding the train we went to our assigned bunks which initially comprise of two wide seats facing one another There was a buffet service of hot food available on the train but we bought snacks at the station and ate these on board instead   Because we travelled with a tour group we were surrounded by people who we knew which made the experience easier There were two bathrooms available at the end of the carriage one squat toilet and one Westernstyle toilet as well as a couple of sinks outside of the toilet cubicle which meant that large queues were avoided   At around 8pm train staff come to convert your seats into bunks If you're not ready you can ask them to come and do this as late as 9pm Once converted the two seats become part of the bottom bunk and the top bunk is lowered from the ceiling of the train The bottom bunk is wider and shuts out the light more Both bunks have curtains that you can draw across which is great for privacy and helps to shut out the light as the train carriage lights remain on throughout the night  The beds are pretty comfortable though I personally didn't sleep well due to the motion of the train and our incredibly early start   Overall this is of course not a luxury way of travelling but it's authentic and a great experience for just one night It also prevents losing time on your trip due to long travel days

title: Family adventure
review: My family (husband and child ) took the train in Mid July  We booked through Thailand Train ticketing info@thailandtrainticketcom  They had the tickets delivered to our hotel on our arrival in Bangkok   We could not get the first class carriage as it was fully booked so we ended up with the 2nd class sleeper  It was a great experience for our family  The train departs 6pm from the central train station   You are allocated your seat and your sleeping berth  We all had the upper berths ( 2 across from each other and one next to )  I was very surprised at how many families were doing the same journey   You get a meal on board which is basic thai food plus they have crisps and drinks available to buy  Diinner is fine but if I was to do this again I would take my own snacks for breakfast   The beds come down at about 9pm and by 10 everyone seems to be settled in for the night  The beds are made up and the sheets and pillow cases clean and i found the bed surprisingly comfortable   I did have earplugs for the journey and probably needed if you are a light sleeper  The only downside of this train ride is that you are going through the country side at night so you do not get to see the changes in scenery until early morning  At 600am we woke and breakfast was served (basic egg sandwich ) Stand by the exits and look out the window as you really get to see the country just as the sun is rising  They come around and put the beds up so everyone then is sitting in the carriages  We arrived at around 730 into Chiangmai and lucky for us our hotel room was free I recommend this as a family adventure  My son loved it

title: Bring a jumper and warm trousers

title: Fantastic experience. Everything we hoped for
review: On the Chiangmai express #13 leaving at 1935 2nd class sleeper  Had read that the Air con was too cold so took tops and blankets Not needed Air con was great temp on this occasion   Met people who travelled after us who said it was too cold though   AnywayI can not recommend this journey highly enough  2nd class seats and beds are great  Made very comfortable by the staff blankets pillows etc All screened off with your own light Perfect  We got up at 530 when the restaurant car is supposed to open it's also where the staff sleep so we waited a little longer  The view of sunrise did not disappoint There is something so magical about watching a sunrise from a train with the sound of the tracks and the scenery rushing past  Spent almost all of the 3 hours you get in the morning to watch the scenery in the restaurant car I'd recommend getting up early  Ticket booking system is good enough friendly staff building not too hard to find   You can't beat this experience for the money  But if you are not interested in the sunrise experience get a plane instead

review: This and the MRT are the best public transportation systems in the city  It has made a big difference to visitors as well as citizens of Bangkok  The advantages of the system are that it all runs on time the service is frequent and is not affected by changes in the weather  It is airconditioned and is not sensitive to traffic jams  I would like to see it expanded throughout the city  The line to the airport needs a lot of improvement  It is not very userfriendly  The carriages and stations are well maintained and clean  I use the system whenever I can

review: Bangkok is well served by effective public transport Being in a hotel nearby a Skytrain station we decided to use this method to visit a Cabaret show Good idea as it is quick and easy to get to the train  bad idea as it was also rush hour with city workers returning home for the evening A tight squeeze to say the least but all passengers were respectful of space and not pushy as in other countries

title: Safe and pleasant and inexpensive.
review: Easy to embark clean and inexpensive and safe travel Saved us stuck in traffic jams The line connects some of the key tourist sites

title: Nice and comfy but expensive
review: Nice and comfy but expensive A short ride can cost up to more than THB40 which I think is very expensive We tried to take the boat instead

title: Easy, quick, and clean
review: Easy quick and cheap (about 35 baht one way) option to access common areas from the airport It is easy to understand as long as you know what stop you need to get off of

title: Fantastic
review: What easy way to travel around the city clear instructions everywhere Cheap transport on the train service clean trains Best way way to move around as traffic is awful First time users will find it simple to use as well Great service

title: Overnight Train Chiang Mai to Bangkok
review: We booked second class sleeper in the ladies only carriage I was initially impressed by the new clean seats that turned into beds and the availability of a power socket The fact that WiFi was only available to first class was also fine But what was absolutely awful was that they keep the bright fluorescent lights on all night Even with a thick eye mask and a curtain it was still way too bright as it shone straight onto my face on the top bunk  both my travelling partner and I barely slept as it felt like an interrogation room I cannot fathom why they can’t even dim these central lights as they do on airplanes sleeper buses and every other sleeper train I have got in the past Absolutely appalling

title: Superb
review: I am able to went all places I want to visits in Bangkok On time and organise Clean Safe to travel

title: Save you cash - get the train
review: It's too easy to just get a taxi into town Then sit in the traffic pay road tolls etc Getting the train is cheap 45 baht to the terminus then change onto the Sky Train eastern Line MTR However  it's not luggage friendly as some walking is involved For those who travel light  train is fine More that one case  get a cab and enjoy Bangkok's traffic jams

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok
review: Skytrain connects the major city centre of Bangkok Sukhumvit and Siam A great and cheap way of travelling around Bangkok

title: GOOD AND CONVENIENT
review: The sky train is easy and convenient to use for around certain areas of Bangkok and at a reasonable price beats been caught in the traffic around the city if you are in a taxi when I am in Bangkok I use it often and will keep doing so

title: Stations Everywhere
review: This is a great  means of quick transport around the CBD of Bangkok you have access to all the main shopping centres hotels and restaurants and then can travel right down to the river night markets and night life  and club areas

title: Easy to use and efficient
review: An easy and cost efficient way of getting around town

title: Best way for transportation in Bangkok
review: #NAME?

title: Beat the traffic - take the Skytrain
review: Bangkok traffic congestion can spoil your plans for shopping and sightseeing Skytrain is a viable alternative for getting around quickly Its inexpensive quiet efficient and safe (As on any transport system in the world  watch your belongings) Plan your day and locations carefully to be at stations which are close to your eventual destination Its easy My friends and I love it Taxis and motobike rides are at almost every station exit too

title: Fast and Convenient
review: This by far the best value for money mode of transportation from and to Suvarnabhumi Airport it is hassle and free and most importantly you won't stuck in a very bad traffic congestion which is a norm in Bangkok street But study your route before taking the Link Cheers

title: I love it! On the train right now using there wifi! First class private cabin. GREAT!
review: Very glad we booked in advance Last cabin and booked it 3 weeks in advance off season Very nice cabin bathroom outside of the room but very efficient space Little sink and good space under the seats I love trains So we are very excited by the prospect Its a night train so not expecting much of a view but saw many beautiful mirror temples in the night light Things to know Heard dinner ia until 10 in the dinning car but there is also room service We crashed so didn't get to experience  Some things to know The cabins are very cold and they do not bring a blanket until time to prepare the beds So bring some coverings or clothing like leggings socks light sweater or jacket will come in handy Better to have great ac than no ac right The beds are hardfirm for those people who like that kind of thing They give you nice pillow and a comfortable blanket as the night proceeds We stop many times during the night but our cabin was super quiet The bathrooms were very stainless steel and clean The stewart brings you water The train is run very professionally with a military air all the crew was lined up when we arrived receiving instruction and details from a person with ribbons pins and captainpilot like khaki hat Cool They also let a small little girl have her photo with them and left the line immediately to help us as we arrived We got to the train almost an hour early and we directed to our car At first a little confusing since we were in 24 and the car did not seem long enough but we were at the end Not bad because the bathroom area was nextdoor and very convenient I would recommend our location Sorry I didn't try the food but didn't hear any rave reviews We brought some snacks with us I am told there is no alcohol on the train Not sure if it is allowed or not but we bought a nice bottle of wine with us to enjoy in the privacy of our cabin There is a TV panel with maps arrival time what town you are passing If you have ear phones you can see videos about the king and an enjoyable travel channel in englis The cabin cost us about $80 USD for two  We booked online from the official website When you get to the historical train station you might be a little confused where to go The Official gov railroad office is on the opposite was of the entrance A brown background sign with woodwork if I recall properly They sent us to track 4 to board early There was a well stocked knowledgeable pharmacy with snacks in the waiting area Apparently there is a railroad station museum but we didn't know until after boarding the train The ticket collector will come by right before the train leaves the station

title: Efficient, Clean and Safe
review: Although British I am now a Bangkok resident To save time and money buy a one month card called a Rabbit Card for THB 625 plus THB 100 for the card you can take 25 individual trips to MOST of the system  As most trips more than 5 stations cost around THB 42 you can see that it doesn't take long to obtain financial equilibrium and you never need to queue again

title: Fast, convenient, cheap
review: Use this to get to the city centre and vice versa Change at mamaksan mrt in order to get to sukhumvit or lumpini I found this rail which was operated by the State Railway of Thailand to be the best way to get to the airport It was so convenient and the stations are all sheltered as well It costs less than 100 baht if u choose this instead of the airport express

title: Quite a decent Airport Rail Link
review: Facts (from my tired brain at 2 in the morning)   Cost 45 baht from Airport to the very end of the line It's slightly less if you stop at one the in between stops  Duration About 30 minutes (I think) from Airport to the very end of the line  The Good   1) Cheap and hassle free   This train is a direct train from the Bangkok Airport to the middle of Bangkok city I've used it twice Prior to that I used to take the taxi from the airport which used to mean running the gauntlet of taxi tauts and paying about 400600 baht depending on who you settled with and how much energy you were willing to spend bargaining  I hate the taxi tauts  2) Fast  Approximately half an hour by train or up to an hour longer if you take a taxi and get caught during peak hour traffic  3) Convenient Actually goes where it's supposed to  Unlike some airportcity links this one actually goes the to the city  and actually links to stations of the existing train lineok at the very end you have to walk about 50100 metres from the Airport platform to the BTS one but I mean thats not too bad for 45 baht  Think of it as exercise and part of the holiday experience  )  Compare this to the Shanghai high speed express does end near the existing train line but very far from city centre  and the Hong Kong Aiport Express where at some stops you need mini buses or taxis afterwards  4) Connects to the existing train line Just check the map to see which station to alight and if necessary transfer  5) You'll see locals  Most of the passengers appear to be Thai so you'll be getting the full Thai experience the moment you step from the airport  The Bad   1) No luggage racks in trains The trains seem to be regular passenger carriages so you just keep them next to you Not a biggie  2) There's no escalator or lift at the platforms  All above ground stations in Bangkok seem to only have stairs between the ticketing level and the train level (there are 3 levels street ticketing train)   This makes it inconvenient to lug around suitcases especially while the crowd is surging around you at the stairs  Still everyone seems to survive Again part of the experience  3)  Taxis  This next point isn't directly related to the Airport link since you'll have probably transferred to the regular train line BTS etc but it still is since it's a consequence of taking the Airport Link  You still have to get to you hotel right  If it's nearby to a station  you just walk to it  If it's still a bit of a distance or it's the middle of the day and it's Bl****y hot and even 100 metres seems too far then you're going to have to queue at the road and flag down a taxi or tuk tuk  Depending on the time of day or night this may take some time   This is the one advantage of taking a taxi driver goes directly to the hotel (assuming they know the hotel so many new ones have been built in the last few years I've found it common for them not to know it   Still I consider it to be part of the experience )  Gosh I didn't think I'd write so much for a train line Thanks for reading

title: Clean safe and efficent

review: Road traffic in Bangkok is insane  Float above it with the Skytrain  Prices and destinations are clearly marked  carriages are air conditioned and clean  Stations are conveniently placed around town for major sightseeing and shopping destinations Take a heap of change in your pocket  or change is readily available  The ease of travel of the skytrain casts travel in this city in a whole new light

title: Horrific.
review: We went to a travel agent who charged us for second class seats and told us our tickets wouldn't be ready until the next day We only received our tickets a few hrs prior to leaving (which was conveniently after the agent was closed) to find out we were in 3rd class About 40$ over charged and nothing we could do about it  The conditions are horrific Dirty smelly hard seats Two benches that face each other and one of our benches was broken Luckily it wasn't full and we were able to use adjoining seats for some space but still impossible to sleep sitting straight up for 15 hrs The toilet is a nasty filthy squatty potty and reeked of stale urine  Bottom line don't trust anyone in Bangkok and unless your desperate to save money book a flight in advance

title: very convenient
review: we took the sky train from the airport to ratchaparop station travel time was more or less 23 minutes  fare is 40 baht per person  at the airport directions to the skytrain are clear and easy to follow int the train stops are announced in thai and english  operating hours are 6 am to 12 midnight

review: I rode the Skytrain pretty much every day and it's amazing  So easy and inexpensive to get around with connections to all transportation  Avoid it during rush hours if possible as it gets pretty crowded

title: the only way to travel airport to city
review: We caught the express to makassan from the terminal  45 baht I think  $150  by my watch about 18 mins non stop  I saw someone else review this service as slow but I think they may have caught the city line by mistake which also runs to airport stopping at every station whereas the express in nonstop   (see our return details below) Then taxi 30 mins for 2km to our hotel returning to the airport at the end of our stay our concierge briefed the taxi driver to take us to makassan  it was rush hour  40 mins later he dropped us at a station and drove off  it was not Makassan but ratchaprarop and it was a 45 minute trip to the airport so be sure you go to makassan

review: Beenusing BTS surface train for years on frequent trips to Bangkok  BTS offers cheap reliable and Air conditioned comfort zapping around Bangkok and the outer city townships  It isa good way to traffic and in so doing you are helping to reduce traffic congestion had you travelled by taxi

title: Modern, fast, easy. But won't get you to the Old City.
review: Close but so far You'll save money taking this easy and quick route to near central Bangkok but if you're like most you'll have to then get off at the last stop and grab a taxi We did and asked for a metered one Even though we knew about where we were the old man then zoomed onto an expressway and took us across the river When I told him to stop and turn around (too late of course) he did and stopped to ask a cop for directions to Democracy Square that was photocopied and written in Thai just for him (meter running of course) He stretched a $225 ride to $280 that way Funny thing is he ended up with $055 for his joyride and missed a tip that would've been at least $1 per bag plus 15% for the ride Until you've had at least a few days to adjust to them don't set yourself up to take a taxi in Bangkok Don't use a metered cab in Bangkok at all if you can avoid it Have your hotel set you up with a cab at a price that the hotel thinks is fair Same at the airport

title: Provides quiet a connectivity
review: Fast comfortable & dependable means to commute across bangkok Managed fairly efficiently and professionally

title: Its an experience ....
review: Well its an experience what hasn't already been said    book a "special express" they are slightly faster and their beds better   second class sleeper with air con is the way to go   book a lower berth   trains are normally waiting so get on and store your luggage you should get able to get it under the beds depending on its size i had standard suitcase   try not to get at the end of a carriage if you can that's normally where the toilets are the wash station the cleaners point so all in all a lot if traffic and people seem to think they can congregate here for chats smokes plus the cleaners  crisp sellers have no concept of a quiet voice for people sleeping   ensure you have a jumper in case you get cold   take toilet roll   no alcohol allowed anymore   take own snacks for supper  breakfast  water   take cards book   lights will be on all night so if you are bothered by this when sleeping take a sleep mask   if you are on a upper berthonce the beds are made up you are expected to sit in your berth hence why lower ones are better (and bigger)   prepare to be tired and disheveled at the other end )   Its definitely something to try people tell me that flying is as cheap but I would suggest you try it at least once in your life   Used 12 goasia  to book fast and efficient and easy to find

title: Best way around BKK
review: Very easy to use airconditioned train service Most routes (depending on the distance) cost from 50 euro to 150 euro (from 26 to 60 BAHT)  A much better alternative to other forms of transportation around Bangkok given the unbelievable traffic The two BTS lines cross at SIAM station (major station) and trains can be really packed especially at peak hours and weekends Many ticket machines at each station displaying the various stops and cost of ticket Some of them accept only coins so make sure you stand on the right one Also if you know you are going to use the BTS again make sure you either get the daily card or get your return ticket ahead of time – it will save you time

title: A remembrance tour well worth the visit
review: First of all Pete our guide was excellent and punctual at our hotel pick up Off we went through the bustling streets of Bangkok to our first destination being the War Cemetary at Kanchanaburi A must for all Brits to visit to pay your respects to all of our fellow countrymen who died at the hands of the Japanese in this far off land A quick visit to the museum opposite then 2nd destination was the Bridge on the River Kwai Steel construction unlike the original wooden bridge built by the POWs and asian prisoners because as we all know it was blown up in the movie by Alec Guiness lol Anyway a great chance to see the exact location the bridge was built on and a chance to walk along it gave great views across both sides of the river 3rd destination was a train ride on the Death Railway itself A short car ride to a station further up the tracks where we hopped on the train for a 20 min ride Great sceneries and a chance to reflect on the lives lost building this railway before stopping at one of the stations for lunch Lunch was a small buffet of lovely Thai dishes the coconut soup being one of the best I have ever tasted We complimented the chef and staff before heading out to Hellfire Pass This was still covered by jungle during my 1st visit to the area in 1996 and has been 'refound' and developed as a must location Founded by the Austrailian Gov I first saw Hellfire Pass in the excellent movie 'The Railwayman' staring Colin Firth and made a point to visit one day Many British Austrailian Dutch asian prisoners and soldiers from other countries died digging out this pass and walking through the pass gives you an idea of the hell these poor souls must have gone through Original tracks at the start of the pass led to the memorial at the end We laid a couple of poppies on the wall of the pass to pay our respects and headed off into the museum at the entrance as it was full when we arrived Final destination was a beautiful waterfall on our way back to Bangkok My wife and I thank this company for an excellent tour especially Pete our guide and our driver thank you

title: Great experience

title: awesome

title: Train
review: Train is a great way to travel from airport to central Bangkok Often over crowded but a cheap way to travel Fast and clean

title: Fast, safe and efficient travel in Bangkok
review: Getting around Bangkok can be a difficult in Taxis The drivers often avoid using the meter and want to negotiate prices that cost the tourists more And then you can end up in a grid lock One trip just under 6kms took us 1hour 15 mins The same trip done on the Skytrain the next day took just 15 mins The Skytrain is the only way to get around Bangkok and finding a hotel within easy walking distance to a station is the way to go The all day hop onhop off ticket is also the best option for a tourist visiting several locations

title: Easiest & fastet way from / to the airport BKK
review: Just walk down from the arriving hall it's that simple Pay 45 Baht for the slower or 90 Baht for the faster train with less stops Usually the train first leaving will arrive first If you go to the center of Bangkok just take this train to the last station & take a taxi from there It will be much faster & cheaper Insist that the taxi uses the meter Never take a taxi driver who is hunting tourists

title: All about public transportation in Bangkok
review: Take the train whenever you get a chance in Bangkok  This was  so much more affordable than a cab  It is very clean well lit airconditioned and always ran on time

title: Efficient
review: Bangkoks BTS is clean safe very efficient and user friendly It is a joy to use to get around Bangkok The fares are also very reasonable I especially like their interchanges as it provides cover towards the office buildings shopping complexes and so on Thought has been put into the planning

title: Train market
review: A good time I was motion sick in the van but still managed the boat ride The salt farm and the ride on the train were definitely highlights

title: Skytrain - quick and clean
review: Cheap travel from airport but lots of steps at many stations  awkward with luggage  Clear information in train  good map showing stops and clear announcements

title: Fastest way to move around Bangkok
review: BTS Skytrain is the fastest way to go from point A to point B in Bangkok During rush hours BTS is also full not just the highway Summer time people sweating a lot and smell can be like heaven to some BTS is expanding to many direction in next few years It's easy to use and fast Just try it instead of Taxi or Tuk Tuk

title: MRT is an Excellent way to travel in Bangkok.
review: I only have positive things to say about MRT system When I used it on occasion it was clean fast cool and effective way to travel It has only one line (blue) and it is a good way to get to the railway station HuaLamphong  I was bit surprised they do not use all the space they have for commerce  but it is a positive for me as it keeps the walkways clean I used the purple line (BST) and blue line and found it a good way to travel The purple line which is operated by BST was very underused n  the blue line MRT was busier  but never crowded They use security gates to enter the station but it is bit too relaxed to be really effective If you need to transfer to purple line sky train there is free shuttle bus at Bang Sue as the connection is not finished yet (As of March 2017)

title: Good connectivity
review: Takes you directly inside the Suvarnabhumi airport A very good and cheap and speedy alternative to Taxis

title: good way to get around in bkk
review: I like taking the sky train but try to avoid end of work times cause then its really overcrowded I Think prices are not to much and the trains go to the main shopping areas

title: Very convenient
review: This train is a comfortable way to reach Bangkok from the airport You just buy the ticket from the automatic vendors It is air conditioned fast and runs on time

title: Easy to get almost anywhere
review: Fairly simple to use also it is air conditioned So that is the best You pay based on how many stops you travel

title: Good service but no integrated transport system
review: BTS Skytrain is clean comfortable and convenient Buy a rabbit card for 100 Thb and it takes off money as you use it More expensive than buses and boats but has amazingly strong air conditioned Shame it’s not an integrated transport system in Bangkok

title: Easy airport connection to the MRT of BTS
review: There are 3 different unique train lines that leave from the airport make sure you are getting on the right one  1) Makkasan Express  Nonstop that connects to the MRT 2) Phaya Thai City Line  Stops at multiple places on the way to the Phaya Thai BTS 3) Phaya Thai Express  Nonstop that connects to the BTS  I took the Phaya Thai City Line at 45 Bhat from the Airport to the Phaya Thai BTS it was relatively comfortable but felt like a normal innercity train (plastic seats no place for luggage etc)  I then took the Phaya Thai Express to the Airport at 90 Bhat (150 Bhat for a Roundtrip Ticket) this train had luggage storage was nonstop very smooth very fast and had comfortable seats  This felt like a longdistance train  I highly recommend using the airport link as it is fast and will likely save you money  However the airport link is not a good idea under the following circumstances a) if you are a group bigger than 2 a taxi is likely better value b) If your hotel is not near to the BTS and you have luggage Bangkok is hot c) you have large luggage there are a lot of stairs small gates for the BTS walking  If you just have a carryonbag your hotel is right next to a BTS stop and you are 2 people or less the Phaya Thai Express (nonstop) is a great way to get tofrom the airport and the city  Also remember that the Express runs every 30 minutes (on the half hour and hour when leaving Phaya Thai)

title: Avoid traffic congestion
review: BTS easy to use if your hotel is nearby Saves traffic hassles Try to avoid in peak times though as very packed

title: Good service
review: Had a ride from Chong Nonsi to National Stadium and back It was a nice experience with a seamless ticketing and entry experience The ride was also comfortable People were disciplined while alighting and inside the train

title: Cheap transportation to reach City
review: if you are travelling alone then better take a Airport Rail link to reach city centre Its cheap fast very economical Catch a train towards Phyao thai to reach city

title: Needs joining up
review: great service from BKK to town but sadly doesn't integrate with other metro lines meaning you won't get a through ticket if you have to change lines which is a bit of a faff really

title: Floating Market
review: This tour is a must if you come and visit Bangkok Just learning the history and seeing how the local people make a living whether its on the Railway tracks or on the floating market

title: The skytrain cuts travel time a lot
review: If you stay near the skytrain its a perfect way to travel  the traffic in Bangkok is very congested most of the day

title: Faaaaaaast
review: It's just a easy way to travel if you need to go to the airport Just buy a ticket (coin) don't loose it you need it later for going off  It's way faster then a bus or taxi or scooter and for sure cheaper And the aircon make comfortable

title: Cheap transfer to City center
review: We took our ride from Suvarnabhumi Airport at 6 AM and it was crowded We dropped off at Phayathai Station (City center) and internally changed to BTS to reach our hotel Overall the train was clean and conditioned and cheap way to reach the city center if you're traveling on a budget

title: Okay mode of transport
review: Price of the transportation is reasonable Trains often tend to be crowded Just be careful of your personal belongings

title: Cheap and fast
review: In my opinion it's the best way to get to the airport The price is about 1545bth (while the taxi is 500bth car 3 people at least) So consider to find a place closed to the ARL station to stay

title: Crowded
review: Lots of steps not many escalators at some of the stations Very crowded and busy trains but convenient too

title: The cleanest and safest way to travel in Bangkok
review: This is the underground subway that you together with Skytrain can travel cheap quick and very safe around bangkok

title: Easy to use train
review: This system was easy to use and got us around as needed within the city It is clean and efficient Announcements made in Thai and English

title: Train to MBK mall
review: Not much to say other than cheap ran on time clean and good way to get around as roads always busy so often traffic jams  The only slight off putting thing for me and that was due to how busy city was it was seriously crowded If you have been on London Underground think that but twice as busy So as long as crowds don’t freak you out go for it and it does seem like it’s all part of the city experience

title: Good exposure for first visit to Bangkok
review: First visit to Bangkok this is a must visit as its the trademarks Basically railway market and floating market both are the same as other day or night markets

title: Is everything for Bangkok
review: without BTS is quite difficult to move around in Bangkok because of the traffic Especially when you need to move around from one buidling to another in the main business district without this my life definitely goes more difficult

title: Easy and quick
review: So great for quick transport around bangkok Easy to use and you pay for the distance you travel Always have some coins ready espacially in rush hours That way you can skip line for ticket office and use the machines

title: Easy, competative if good connection with your destination address
review: In airport Suvarnakabumi easy ticket machine available next to platform More economic and faster than taxi provided one of the train stations is well connected to your destination

title: Great way to move around Bangkok
review: The Sky train has improved so much in the last few years  and there is now an Airport link too and as they hook up with the MRT (under ground) it is a very efficient and great way to avoid the times when the traffic in Bangkok is unbearable

title: Close to sky train
review: Proximity to shopping area hate having a coffin shop closeby 5 mins away from bits station walking distance 100 bahts by taxi to the nearby shopping Siam square

title: Slow
review: I've been on this Airport Link several times and have been happy with the service However recently they have been experience lots of problems and the service has gotten much slower  I read in the news that the management will fix their problems by the end of this month  Let's see

title: Quick ride, but costly.
review: Sky train is one of the best way to travel during peak hours to avoid traffic If you are travelling in groups then travelling via Taxi is cheaper (per person) Keep change (2510) if you wanna avoid standing in queue to get TokenPass

title: Very convenient.
review: Great way to move around many interesting areas of Bangkok reliable low cost and clean Don't hesitate to use the service

title: wonderful way to travel
review: Why would you take a bus or taxi through the busy streets when you could just use this wonderful service Love the way the staff march stand to attention and salute when each train leaves

title: Comfortable carriage but bad stations
review: The trains are comfortable good airconditioned clean and spacious It is frequent and friendly user Its fare is very reasonable 120 Bahts for a daily pass It is thronged with crowds almost all the time It is indeed an indispensable service as traffic in Bangkok is really heavy However the stations are not fully equipped with escalators It can be a long walk up consisting fifty or more steps up

title: fast cheap and very good way to get around Bangkok
review: the only way to travel in Bangkok but gets very busy late afternoon so choose your time and enjoyif your not sure just ask the friendly thai peopl

title: the worst organisation
review: we wanted a quick way into town so the train was so confusing and frantic It said it took 15 minutes but took 30 as stopped and so slow Its cheaper to take a taxi

title: Fast and cool
review: A great way to get around this crowded city as long as you're near a station It'a modern and the airconditioning is a great relief People are all polite  and queue Only problems are long queue's to buy tickets for which you need the correct change and nearly 100 stairs to get to the platforms

title: Forget the Taxi's
review: Don't get a taxi and don't let a travel agent talk you into buying an overpriced transfer  The Airport Rail Link is the fastest way to get into Bangkok and back to the airport  We used the link in June & July for 45 Baht each way per person  The trip took about 30 minutes  The trains are air conditioned and it was easy to get a seat  From the airport you can go straight to Phaya Thai station and connect with the BTS

title: packed!
review: i wonder why there is no direct trains to the city being a commuter train & airport train at the same time is just an inconvenience a big city like bangkok needs both services however it is cheap & fast

title: Handy transport if your destination is on its routes
review: Excellent services and easy to use best for tourists are to purchase a Rapid Pass as you do not have to find small changes to get a ticket

title: Brilliant experience
review: We traveled from Bangkok to Chiang Mai in two connecting first class cabins They were perfectly clean with a little sink and they provided clean towels and sheets and even came and made our beds ready for us to go to bed The staff came round with drinks and snacks and took our order for our breakfast We had electrical sockets to be able to recharge our phones etc and the air con keep us exceptionally cool  make sure you bring plenty of layers as it gets very cold Great way to travel long distance

title: Reliable, efficient and cool!
review: BTS Skytrain is an ideal mode of transport to get around Bangkok The trains are clean and very modern Also air conditioned so appreciate the time you are on there

title: Clean and efficient
review: We took the bts on severaal occasions and found it to be efficient and clean It is easy to navigate and very economical Unfortunately it does not cover all areas

title: Preferred Transport for Foreign Visitors
review: Easily accessible and most importantly map information provided is easy to understand and follow Safe to travel and especially one can avoid the heavy traffic of Bangkok in peak hours The staff is very helpful to foreigners Well maintained in terms of cleanliness  Recommended transport as it is also cheaper than TUK TUK at times )

title: Skytrain in Bangkok - Quick and excellent way to travel
review: With our time constraints we found the Skytrain easy to use and economical We took it to Saphan Taskin where we took water  taxis to Wat Arun and the Grand Palace area Travelling this way allowed us more time to visit rather than sit in the heavy traffic

title: Easy to use but prepare to have coins
review: BTS is easy to use but sometimes taking a taxi can beat its price if you are traveling with 2 3 people But note traveling by road is really not a good idea at rush hours the PM one starts around 4pm on wards  Only the more advanced stations have ticket vending machines that take notes most stations only take coins so its an hassle to go to the ticketing counter to change notes into coins then going to the ticket machine to buy a ticket  Navigation is quite easy but it is hard to see which station you're at pay attention to the monitor in the train is easier than looking out to the station for a name  Another good thing about their stations are that they normally have drinks and snack stores outside and money exchange stores Stations are also great ways to cross the roads on its cross bridges if you are not going into the station

title: Convenient & Cheap
review: Very convenient and easy to take from BKK airport Good introduction and views of the city   Cash only

title: Fast and cheap
review: If you do not want to get stuck in a traffic jam then take this train A  ticket cost about $150  The train will take you to downtown Bangkok You can transit on both BTSlines at the endstation Phaya Thai If you continue with the BTS you have to buy a ticket first

title: Very convenient just need to expand the service
review: Since the taxi service has deteriorated (taxi operators attempting to charge a fixed rate) we make use of the BTS whenever our destination is near a BTS station Trains run frequently are clean and only a little crowded during peak hour but this is a minor inconvenience All the stations are clearly marked and all stations have a ticket booth that serves as an information centre

title: See Bangkok even for less
review: Such an easy and cheap way to travel and see the city At first might me a little intimidating and challenging but after you tried once you will always travel around Bangk9k this way  If you need any help the local people are always there for you and that is such a lovely way to interact with local community  even with some language limitations but always ready to help  smile and you will be rewarded with beautiful smile back  Enjouy

title: quick easy to use skytrain
review: It was easy to follow and getting on board was quick and easy Very clean helpful people to guide you along  Was cool on a hot day

title: good way to get into the city
review: It is an easy way into Bangkok Buy a token then hand it in when you arrive at your destinationIt is only a short walk to the other rail transit centre

title: Clean, fast and cheap
review: Clean fast and cheap way to get around in Bangkok Only not that the trains run only until midnight

title: Puts the London Underground to shame
review: Easy to use made up of two lines AIRCONDITIONED carriages which are Clean and great for sightseeing   Don't be frightened to use this the sky train to get around the city   Inside the carriages the stops are in English and in Thai and light up at each stop and are announced 42 Baht for our journey to the Jatujak market each ( less than 50pence)   We were so impressed with the sky train  bring aircon carriages to the London Underground

title: Does the job
review: If your hotel is close to the link use it to get to the airport The process of ticket buying and getting onto the train was a little confusing so give yourself a little more time just in case

title: A smooth journey
review: Comfortable and clean and secured but waiting time can be improved Secured as there are security guards  police patrolling in and outside the train platform

title: Cheap n fast
review: Cheap and fast public transportation Not difficult to use even I using for the first time Just very busy during the peak hour

title: Best way to get around
review: For anyone used to traveling on the London Underground or Paris Metro the BTS and other related city metro lines still have a lot of catching up to do But there is a lot of development happening and new stations and lines are being added all the time  The BST (sky train) is on elevated lines above ground and the MRT is underground The lines tend to be owned by different companies so on a single journey you can’t buy a through ticket if you are using two different ones However you can buy a prepaid top up cards which speeds up the process Announcements concerning the next station are in both Thai and English which is very helpful  Having said this the BTS and MRT are by far the quickest and easiest way to travel around the City Trains are fairly frequent but still get crowded at times There are less seats and more standing  The system is already being expanded so expect it to improve over the next few years

title: Quick, fast, convenient
review: We took the Airport Rail Link from Suvarnbhumi airport which is at the B1 level Ticket vending machine is easy to operate since you can choose English language n it accepts notes Frequency of the train is good n the stations are clearly announced while in the trainNot crowded so easy to commute even with your luggage  n you pay a fraction of what you will end up paying if going by a taxi the maximum fare being 45 bahts which is to the last station of Phayathai

title: convenient clean cool
review: convenient clean and cool  fastest way and no one will scam you )

title: Efficient and easy!
review: The BTS Skytrain is fast efficient safe inexpensive and very easy to navigate (once you do it once)  The people in the little ticket kiosks speak English and can easily get you to where you need to go

title: Excellent Service
review: This is the best way to avoid massive traffic inside the city center There are so many connection station other than the Payathai and so comfortable service

title: the only way to move fast in Bangkok
review: Traffic jams everywhere not only in rush hours skytrain is best when close to where you are and wish to go jk

title: The best traffic
review: Knowingthe Bangkok rush hour this is the only alternative  do it even if you need to stand close to other people

title: Extremely FAST CHEAP Always try to use Rail link to save tons of money
review: This service is one of the best if you dont want to pay hefty money on taxi or bus you pay aprrox 80 THB whereas taxi might charge you above 1200THB min so this service is quick and helps you to save money which you can spend on buying delicious food

title: Good tour but not in line with what we booked
review: Very engaged guide who explained us a lot of interesting facts about life in those villages and the markets Yet we booked the tour which included a ride with the train to the market The guide did not know that and recommended not to do it due to time constraints So we got more time in the market but yet not what we booked and having experienced the trip it was also difficult to understand why we would have time constraints if we had done the trip as booked

title: Slow and unreliable
review: Unless you have a plenty of time just take a taxi The service is ok and at a reasonable price if you travel solo Waiting time might be up to 30 minutes and the station is not air conditioned   The airport link connects to the convenient BTS line which is the only reason why you might want to use it

title: Fast way to airport
review: I found it the cheapest and fastest way to get to the airport I just took a taxi from my hotel in Silom  to Makkasan station From Makkasan in less than 20 minutes I was in the airport The cost 30 Bath

title: Love Sky Train
review: Love the Sky Train it has air it's clean cheap fast and reliable  Most of all I love the beautiful women on their cell phones ) university girls business ladies house wives lol  yes A good place to meet ladies and guys  Take it everyday Look forwards to hearing the announcer on the speaker say next stop Siam Parigon )

title: Convenient, fast and easy to go around in the heart of Bangkok
review: BTS or skytrain very convenient for the people who have to use it in Bangkok some route is close or direct to The Mall and some attractive of Bangkok And now they expand the route but it's not complete yet For the fare is higher than before and higher than other country(that's have train or skytrain)

title: So good but not cheap!
review: So convenient so good so clean so we'll done and so great when it is raining or too hot Only black spot on the frame becomes more and more pricey maybe the price to pay for a tip top transportation service Thai people can be proud of it

title: The Only Way To Travel in Bangkok
review: The best way to get around Bangkok The trains are lovely and cold so just like stepping into a fridge when outside is screaming hot Also very cheap and easy to buy tickets

title: Very easy but know you way first before you go
review: There are no directions just major stops  You can link to the metro train or sky train but need to know where you are going (maps are not readily provided)  You can do this online before your trip  To get to the skytrain  go to the end of the line  then connect with the skytrain to your destination  Workers typically do not speak english so good to map out your trip ahead of time I have an international dat plan on my phone and it worked great

title: Really Good,, Try It,,, Safe and Secure,,,
review: Try to avoid rush hour morning and evening only because crowded but still not awful by any means Read the signs…

title: Start early and you can do this by yourself!!
review: Planned it by ourselves and booked Taxi on Grab App and Mr Songkram was fantastic He advised us to choose private boat instead of Group and it paid off Even though it was pricey at 2000TBH for 1 hour for both of us the experience of skimming almost flying over canal water is priceless The floating market gets crowded by noon so it’s better to get there by 8am and after an almost Bondlike boat ride our new cabbie friend dropped us next to Maeklong Railway station He waited patiently for us while we spent an hour in the market gaping at the many canopied stalls and their swift folding as the train passed Best time would be 11 to catch 2 trains pass within 30 mins You can also find some good bargains at this astonishing market

title: Around 30 minutes from airport to final stop in the city of Bangkok
review: Perfect and cheap way to arrive in the city centre From there  you can then take the Sky Train even if I would not recommend it if you have heavy luggages with you as most of the stop don't have elevator or escalator Better the taxi

title: An efficient and fast way to move around!
review: For us tourists we visit mainly the touristy spots like Central Chidlom Siam Paragon Emporium Thonglor Chatuchak Silom etc  What better way to travel than to take the skytrain Taxis are no doubt more private and bring you from point to point but with the congested roads of Bangkok you'd be better off taking the train )

title: Great train
review: Loved this train It cost 140 baht per person and was air conditioned They came frequently and was a pleasure to travel on

title: On time
review: It's a train It's clean and on time Peak hour is 800 to 930 and 500pm to 800pm Easy to use grab a rabbit card to make life easy when in Bangkok for a few days  much easier than getting coins each time

title: A Ride into the Past
review: This trip will take you over the River Kwai across the actual steel bridge assembled by Allied POWs mainly Dutch that was used during WWII The train travels over tracks trestles and viaducts constructed by Allied POWs The journey takes about 25 hours and stops at Nam Tok station where you can have lunch and then board the bus for the return trip back to Bangkok which takes about 2 hrs If you're into history this is a MUST see

title: Easy and efficient
review: The skytrain was cheap and easy to use covering a good area of Bangkok The stations all showed maps showing which line you were on and where to change

title: Forget about traffic
review: Today bts or sky train it's the most popular transport in Bangkok No need to spend your time to traffic  You can buy thicket with maximum price 52 thb and begin your way with air con to any side of city

title: Effective transportation
review: Advantage of it being close by the Anajak Hotel where I was staying Fully air conditioned and easy to get around

title: Great day put!
review: Great day out lovely guide and great driver Well worth the price Could not recommend more Hotel pick up available

title: Highly recommended if you can handle the crowds!
