review: A great experience From the pickup at the hotel to the whole trip everything went wonderfully and was very well organized Despite the crowds it was definitely worth seeing

title: BTS and Excellent Choice for Transportation
review: The BTS is the only way to get around in a timely  manner in the Central Bangkok area  The traffic on the roads can be a bit crazy  The Skytrain is Clean Efficient Safe Fast and Inexpensive  I definitely recommend using it if your destination is near one of the stops  Plus there are great views from the elevated skywalk section near MBK Mall

title: Sleeper train from Bangkok to Koh Samui, much better than flying.
review: We as a family of 4 took the sleeper train south #85 from Bangkok to Surat Thani and it was an excellent choice We had 4 adjoining berths in a second class ac sleeper car and it was fab The kids really enjoyed it  It was the 1930 departure from Bangkok Central station which punctually departed at bang on 2045 but still arrived exactly on schedule at 7am the next morning  The berths were comfy the food service was great the toilets were erm typically Thai but it was great   We booked our tickets through 12goasia and they were excellent highly recommended they even changed our tickets for a day earlier after we'd booked them without any hassle and really cheaply

title: Fast Easy Cheap
review: This is the best mode of transport to get around here The service is excellent cheap and easy to use

title: Convinient and no jam transportation
review: I go to BKK many time but first time use it You do not fear of trafic jam Save quite a lot if you drop at a station near the hotel Ask station staff if you are not sure about the way to get there My experience  from the station to the hotel  20 mimutes by taxi from the hotel to station  5 minutes by walking

title: Very convenient.
review: Always use when in Bangkok quicker than taxi  In rush hour the traffic can be terrible in the middle of Bangkok  As the Skytrain is on a raised level there are never any delays although it can get quite busy  Very good value

title: Great service
review: We found the sky train very easy to understand and great value for money You can get around the city really cheaply and quickly

title: I had a great days in Thailand
review: Actually was not my first time here in Thailand for holiday I love Thailand people here are so polite wherever  you go they will greet you with passion you feel being connected to their traditionnot only that they are nice people humble people and for buying things you can negotiate try to go MBK a famous for souvenirs

title: Very comfortable and easy
review: We stayed at Marriott and always take BTS at Chong Nonsi station It was quite comfortable and easy for us

title: Convenient, but slow
review: The ARL is a great way for travellers to enter the city from the airport which we benefitted from due to our hotel being walking distance away from one of the lines on the ARL Unfortunately I find that it pales in comparison to the airport lines of say Beijing Taiwan Hong Kong and Seoul  We happened to take the ARL during the early hours of the evening and were unable to get on the first train  simply because it was too packed Our station was 6 stations away from Suvarnabhumi Airport Not to mention the train doors were closed upon manual command  they would close only when the station marshals blow the whistle The second train arrived and while we managed to get onto the train the train took 25 minutes to arrive at the airport The train moved slowly throughout the journey and delayed our checkin as a result   Not that impressed

title: Clean, efficient and inexpensive
review: Liked everything and very easy to use If you encounter any problem there are many locals who will jump in and Patiently help you learn the system

title: The only good thing is the journey time
review: The only good thing is the journey time in the sense that you can calculate around 35 minutes from end to end  The express line has ceased operations and only the city line is running meaning stops at all stations (which is ok) but still quite fast  The problem with the city line is that the platforms and trains have not been designed to bring people to the airport There is no way to get your suitcase from the street or bts level to the train and vice versa The Airport link has a lot to learn from Hong Kong in terms of accessibility  Furthermore the getting a taxi from the end station (Phaya Thai) is not so easy The taxis waiting at the taxi stand and Airport link lady which assigns you a taxi are corrupt and refuse to use the meter Its not a 1 time case because it has happened to me 3 times already Its best to drag your suitcase to the street and hail a passing taxi  Hopefully Bangkok will improve all the trains BTS MRT and airport link to be more airport passenger friendly

title: Clean,quick & cheap
review: Clean and gives you a great view of the city Cheaper than a taxi too Easy to get to and from the airport I'd recommend this way to get into the city as traffic is a nightmare there

title: Cheap and efficient
review: The airport train seems to be a very cheap and efficient way to get to and from BKK airport Can get a bit crowded but it's definitely faster than a taxi at peak times A bit troublesome when you switch to the BTS line as you need to buy another ticket but still a good way to get into the city

title: Just 25 minutes from the airport to the city
review: This train runs every few minutes and is a cheap and easy way to get from the airport to the city and back Even with a substantial amount of luggage it's easy

title: Fast and easiet mode to reach heart of city..
review: ARL run from Suvarnbhumi airport basement in every 1015 mins it is connecting to BTS (skytrain) from phaya thai Station you can interchange from phaya thai fare is 45 THB per person you can carry your luggage from airport in this you need to show your passport on interchange very fast and will take 30 mins only

title: So easy and yet difficult
review: Airport rail link is fast and economical for budget travellers Most importantly you can avoid all the  traffic jam in which you can save alot of travelling time However in my recent visit the express airport rail link was not functioning and end up taking the city link train My advice to those rushing for time do check the airport rail link's website to see whether there are any broke down so that you could take a taxi from the airport

title: Great skytrain
review: This skytrain is connected to the airport suvernabhumi It is not expensive and a good way to travel when the traffic is stuck

title: Very good option
review: Much cheaper than airport taxi  service to the airport 25 minute trip with approx 6 brief local stops in between Arrives directly inside the airport terminal During peek traffic periods travel to airport is slow and the airport link train is the best was to go

title: Comfortable
review: At first we afraid of traffic jam as many of friends have said however its got bts so it's so comfortable for us no matter where we go and what time it is Thanks to bts

title: East transportation
review: Very easy to use clean and fast Air conditioned trains Good signage when you depart the train on which exit to use

title: Fantastic. Wish we had this at home!
review: The BTS skytrain is one of the best transport systems I've seen It's cheap clean quick and you feel safe From buying a ticket to getting where you need to be the entire experience is satisfactory easy and very reliable Wish we had something this organised back home

title: Great but oh so cold!
review: Very fonctional and on time But keep a scarf of something at hand because the schock in temperature inside and outside is just madness (32C outside and 17C inside) It s very useful easy and absolutely convenient when you want to move around Bangkok The traffic is swamped most of the time but the BTS will take you were you need in no time however it is packed during peak hours (make sure you have a bit of time ahead as sometimes you need to wait a few trains before you can get in) Shame it isn t explained in English (for bying top up cards to the different options you could buy for example)

title: Don't be scared to use it: easy, cheap & air conditioned!
review: We used taxi & tuk tuk for our first 3 days in BKK bit decided on a whim to use BTS on our 4th day to get to Siam We are do glad we did It was only 20 TBH one way & very easy to use   BTS staff are helpful & give directions Get coins from manned window for ticket machine BTS trains come often & inside its a nice relief from heat of the day Feel very safe using it even at night as the stations are well lit & security are around too

title: Cheapest way to get into central Bangkok from the airport
review: If you're not in a hurry and don't mind lugging your bags up and down stairs this is a very cheap way to get into central Bangkok  The journey is about an hour compared to a 30 minute taxi ride  But the cost is only a few dollars whereas a taxi is going to be closer to $15   The train cars are very nice with air conditioning  It can get a little crowded the closer you get to the city but you'll not have a problem getting a seat when coming from the airport

title: Skytrain
review: Clean cheap punctual We travelled all over Bangkok via the sky train We found the ticket machines easy to navigate although always have change with you as they don't take notes A typical 15 minute fare is about 35 baht Finding a seat is easy although around Siam station (shopping Malls) it does get very busy Best way to the the city

title: Probably the best way to commute in downtown BKK
review: Believe me there's no other cheaper and more convenient way to commute in down town Bangkok You do not want to get stuck in a taxi in the middle of Asok intersection for 45 minutes while the meter keeps going up

title: VERY CONVENIENT
review: Sky Train was very helpful for us as the roads were packed with cars and bikes travelling with Sky Train would hardly takes minutes  to travel to nearby mall or any place from our hotelSo any of you guys travelling for shopping and visiting any place i would strongly recommend taking a Sky Train instead of a cab It would be economical and would also save a lot of time

title: Best way to get around in Bangkok
review: Faster easier cleaner safer and cheaper than tuktuks and taxis  Surprisingly easy to get around this way And its great fun to se the traffic jams below the sky train whilst passing them in 90 kmt )  Another plus No one will try to scam you like the tuktuk and taxi drivers

title: A fast and reliable way from /to Suvarnabhumi airport
review: Very easy to find from Suvarnabhumi airport terminal  You need some bahts to buy ticket  Red Express train no longer run only regular Blue train making 8 stops along the way   To go to old town go all the way to the end of the line at Phraya Thai then hail of grab a taxi to old town only about 100 bahts but it may avoid an hour stuck in traffic in peak hours  Early in the morning 6 AM went back to Phraya Thai to go out to the airport  The train was about 10 minutes late but got to the airport in half hour avoiding the morning traffic jams through downtown  Thsi is reliabale fast cheap transport from downtown to the airport highly recommended

title: Worth the trip
review: It’s took about 15 hrs ride from Bangkok to the railway but is worth it Experience the local market shopping and how the prepare when the train comes However you need to know the time of the railway train arrive and leave

title: Efficient and fast way to the city
review: Boarded the Airport Rail Link from BKK airport and got into the city within an hour Easy and jamfree way to get to the city

title: aware traffic during peak rush hour
review: early morning and after 500pm  700pm are not suitable to get in unless your destination was from airport directly to Phayathai station Lots of local are get into downtown as well as you are Big luggage may not fit to get in the train

title: Railway market and floating market
review: I loved this tour I regret didn’t do it sooner as it gave us a good comprehension of the city highlights The guide Tee explained about everything during the tour he was nicest guide we had so far He even help me to find durian fruit that I was dying to try The train trip to the market was the most exciting experience Liked the floating market but while on the water is very commercial and everyone tries to grab the boat and selling you something the floating market it is indeed a nice place to have good food and buy some souvenirs We also had time to visit a temple and a salt farm during the trip

title: Once in a lifetime!
review: Lucky was our group tour guide and she did a great job keep everyone excited despite the early start To start we took the bus to a salt farm which was unexpected but really great to see Lucky explained a lot about how the salt is farmed and also explained other thai exports while we waited for the train The experience on the train driving through the market is so surreal and I think it is great that with this tour you see the market from both perspectives on and off the train We had some time then to walk around the market and of course have some mango sticky rice before getting back on the bus to go to the floating market For me personally the floating market was the highlight to this excursion being on a small boat and having other small boats approach you in the water with a person who is both rowing and cooking at the same time really is something you cant experience anywhere else I would highly recommend this tour for a relaxing yet exciting break from the city

title: Best way to get around BKK
review: If you're in Bangkok just try to use the BTS as much as possible It's really the best way to get around in this huge city try avoiding the main traffic hours (mornings and afternoons) Otherwise AC'd trains perfectly clean and organised  Huge plus for the city of BKK

title: Best transportation
review: Bangkok was a very busy city so you really hard to travel by taxi sometime BTS was the best choice for you to avoid from the traffic jam It also the better option in term of time and money It offer the excellent traveling experience in Bangkok

title: Nice ride
review: This was a nice ride through a farming area and then into the hills that provided opportunities for photos of farms and farmsteads In the hills you got a sense of how difficult the terrain was for a project of this size  It was interesting to see a resort on the site of what had been a POW camp

title: Only Way To Get Into The City
review: If you take any other way into the city you are either spending too much money on your trip here for business or need to live a little by little I mean a lot When you leave BKK airport walk down stairs and the airport link is in the "basement" There is a money exchange down there Get $2 usd exchanged and buy a cointoken at the machine 1545THB depending how far you go (most people go to the end)  Than for this part you swipe the coin over the sensor its a magnetic strip in order to get to the trainlink go down stairs again and for about $1usd you are in city central in less than 15 minutes

title: Fast to Bangkok
review: if you do not have a lot of baggage I recommend the fast way to Suvanbhum Airport or Bangkok Escape from the traffic jam

title: Convenient transportion in busy Bangkok
review: Using the BTS is very easy you just need to know where you want to go off   Buy the ticket from the ticket machine if you do not have coins you can change them from the counter

title: brilliant
review: Brilliant way to move around Bangkok  a lot more quicker and cheaper than a taxi and the air con its very strong inside

title: Very convenient
review: Take your bag from the belt and head down to airport link station In 25 minutes you will be at an MRTBTS station and from there you can go wherever you wantOfcourse you need to know where you are going and that can be a challenge sometimes This is a good option IF you know exactly where you are going (or if you have a card of the place in Thai so you can use to get a taxi from a different location then the airport) and you need to skip traffic or save some baht There is also option of checking in and luggage drop from the main station (if you are going to the airport) I think but never tried it

title: City travel cheap and easy
review: To get around bangkok traffic using the MRT and skytrain is the cheap and easy way to get around quickly and now with the expansion of the blue line the MRT gets you within 12 mile from the grand palace wat pho China town India markets wat arun golden mount Additional blue stations have opened across the river which was great for us since we went from wat po to wat arun and did not have to battle the tourist crowds on the ferry or the heat There is additional stations opening but new years and the planned completion of another line to make a complete circle route on both sides of the river Cheap travel we rode from isatrap station by wat arun to our Airbnb in sathorn for 28bht per person After a hot day of sightseeing it was nice to ride in air conditioning and our stop was 200mtrs from our bnb

title: Gets you there fast!
review: Airconditioned and efficient this is often the best way to get around in Bangkok because it bypasses the constant busy traffic

title: Fast but crowded
review: A very affordable way for moving around but don't recommend this when with bulky items or luggages as It can get very crowded and squeezy The train will arrive in about 23mins and the timing between each stop is less than 2 mins

title: Obtain a Day Pass
review: A day pass for 120 baht will save you time each time you enter the station The skytrain will take you to much of Bangkok but not all It will certainly beat the traffic congestion All skytrain directions and communications are in English It is easy to use

title: SUMMER HOLIDAY
review: A very fast clean  fast & quick way to commute to avoid traffic hazards to reach central BANGKOK A most economic way to travel too Be informed that it is ideal if you are trvelling light & not with heavy suit case or baggage Easy to get on  get off You may have to change a station

title: Convenient and quick
review: Sometimes roads in Bangkok can be clogged to an extent that you might miss your flight it is always better to take this link for predictability

title: Convenient and clean
review: My hotel is near the bts line so it's quite convenient Clean and frequent Signs are easy to read and understand The day is 140b per day The 30 days 15 trip card is just around 500b

title: Clean, efficient and great value
review: Would recommend for all easy to navigate friendly staff and great value Travelled from BKK to the city and then over the following days across the city

title: It’s a train innit
review: It’s gets you round Bangkok pretty easily Good to use easy to follow Air conditioning nice Should probably put some stops in nearer the grand palace

title: Very Punctual.
review: The most cost effective manner to get into Bangkok  No Jam and fast  And also for the trip back to the airport

title: Great experience
review: Sara is awesome It was so nice trip The tour guide was very friendly Both the train and boat was a good experience

title: easy
review: Great way to travel pollution free no conning taxi drivers to deal with So easy to travel like this with connections from the airport and bkk rail station Super fast  no traffic to contend with be certain to get to your destination safe fast and trouble free

title: Cheap & Good
review: Very convenient and cheap to travel downtown if you do not have a lot of luggage to drag Saves a lot compared to a taxi Ask for help if unsure on how to buy tokentickets on the ticketing machine Locals are more than happy to help

title: An easy and convenience public transport
review: Can less the travel time due to Bangkok is also a big city might traffic jam heavily MUST BUY RABBIT card to save the money The only inconvenient is the stations are too limit cant go everywhere of Bangkok

title: very good and comfortable
review: the MRT is so convenient and quite reasonable a very fast mode of transportation ticketing system and finding the platform is very easy too overall very good and efficient

title: So easy!
review: great inexpensive way to get around especially if your are going to MBK Central world or that area

title: So easy to use once you get the hang of it.
review: Used the train while in Bangkok to get everywhere  We ended up getting on the wrong train once but everyone is so helpful that they pointed us in the right direction   Very easy to use  Would recommend getting the day pass 140bht if you are making a few stops

title: Super connectivity
review: Just get on this  Very few stops (i think only 34) and this takes you from Suvarnabhumi to the heart of the city Helps avoid queue at the taxi and city traffic Cheap fares make sure to get some change as soon as you can from the airport

title: Fastest way to travel from Airport to Downtown
review: Follow the sign in the airport to go downstairs and see the service counter and a variety of fast food shops  It is easy to buy ticket from the machine because change are provided  Walking with luggage is not difficult because there are lifts in the station  This is certainly the best way to avoid traffic jam and unreasonable charge by the taxi drivers

title: Fast and convenient
review: The easiest and the cheapest way to travel to Central Bangkok is taking the Airport Rail from Suvarnabhoomi Airport It is definitely the fastest way to get to the city especially if you travelling in the peak hours of morning or evening when the traffic jams can go for miles

title: Best way to avoid traffic
review: Good 20 min frequency relatively cheap brings you downtownairport in less than half hour Once you get in is  guaranteed to arrive in time It can be crowded sometime 15 min interval could resolve it

title: Great value
review: Clean available at all times with little waiting cheap Also beats the gridlocks with road traffic t peak times

title: Easy, and stress free
review: This is hands down the best way to get into central Bangkok It's reasonably quick cheap and connects with the BTS skytrain

title: Convenient
review: No harm in experiencing the sky train and works good on your pocket and saves your time Best thing about it is you can avoid the heat of the city

title: Great way to move around the city
review: The BTS is a quick cheap and efficient way to navigate the city of Bangkok It is very safe and beats waiting in traffic It is used by both locals and tourists

title: Great way to see the city
review: 120 baht ride all day ticket is the way to go4 usdyou can not get into a smelly yellow cab in New York for less And it goes to all the major areas of the cityclean and cool

title: excellent service!
review: it is so easy to go airport to city by airport rail link and the fare is not too much must travel

title: Earthquake!!!!
review: Kinda like an earthquake a lot of fun And met some great people we spent a good week with in Chang Mai Also a very good  cheap way to get to Chang Mai

title: Not as excited as we expect it to be.
review: I prefer to watch the train coming in to the market itself than me being watching down from the train I didn't get to see the stallholders rushing to close their parasols and canvas which is the highlight that we are more interested in

title: Best method of getting there
review: The Airport Link train is fast comfortable and cheap No matter how much baggage you are carrying it cannot be beaten I will be using this service every time

title: Great tour
review: Tong was a fabulous guide He spoke perfect English and was very well informed We were always at the front of the action

title: Great form of transportation
review: The BTS is an excellent way to get to the major points of Bangkok  It is always clean and timely  Everyone does their best to be polite and give you personal space even when it is busy and crowded

title: Cheap
review: The best way into Bangkok unless you have lots of luggage easy transfer to the other train lines so cheap runs every few minutes

title: another layer in bkk efficient mass transport system.
review: the bts like the mrt has 2 main flaws it is crowded many times and it doesnt get to the old town area (yet new stations are planned) other than that its a great quick and economic way to travel through this traffic chocked metropolis

title: Perfect trip
review: Had a very nice day at the railway and floating market our guide Sara was very nice and gave us a lot of interesting informations

title: Fast convenient link
review: A little confusing at first but quite easy & inexpensive Not so good if you have lots of luggage Traffic busting

title: Cool experience
review: We found ourselves in the middle of Bangkok and decided to take the train just out of curiosity It's quite easy to get around it's good if you have a pocket full of change as it saves you some time  but no worries if you don't you can exchange big bucks there too The train gets very crowded at the middle stations (around shopping centers) but is worth a ride

title: FAST, CONVENIENT AND INEXPENSIVE
review: Our first time using the BTS in Bangkok it was a bit daunting at first yes I'm old and sometimes a bit wary of Public Transport In Bangkok the roads are always gridlocked so dont be frightened travel above the roads It is easy to use and very very fast  There is always one escalator at each station and sometime a lift but you may encounter some stairs

title: Fast & easy way to airport
review: Best choice  to get to airport on time Don't have to worry about traffic jam any time of the day Airport Rail Link is user friendly and affordable Fast & convenient Plenty of time to do last minute shopping at the airport

title: Beat the traffic jam
review: If you are in a hurry this is a fastest transport to get from point A to B Taking a taxi could be cheaper for a family of 34 pax but could take triple+ the time to get to your destination during the peak hour traffic Should consider buying a adult BTS card for 450 baht for 15 trips else buying a single trip ticket may not be cheap for frequent trips

title: Quick and cool
review: One of my favorite means of transportation in Krung Thep only beaten by the water express boats  Cool and quick at least when you spend the currently Baht 200 on a day ticket at the counter else you loose a lot of time looking for change and queuing in front of the ticket vending machines

title: easy and quick
review: its the way to get around  bangkok far better than the traffic jams and taxidriver ripoffs

title: Convenient
review: I was surprised to see that everyone inncluding the BTS staff at the stations in Bangkok speaks English  The staff are helpful and friendly the stations in between Siam and Asok are clean the train cars are also clean and quite cold The significant temprature difference between the train cars and the outside is probably my only slight complaint about the BTS skytrain I absolutely loved it

title: expensive
review: If you are alone it's worth it If you travel with two or more a meter taxi is cheaper  It's very good to avoid traffic though

title: Very convenient
review: Very convenient on time no hassle All places are accessible easily with BTS Signboards are well placed and the instruction are clear for foreigners like me It is advisable for you to have BTS train map for easier plan

title: Fast, Cheap, but not for Lots of Luggage
review: The Airport Rail Link runs about every 10 to 15 minutes and is downtown in less than 15 minutes   During rush hours this is a big plus versus a taxi which can take up to 75 minutes  It is cheap for Hong Kong or western standards and naturally clean and comfortable  The only real problem is when you get off and want to get you hotel  You then have to switch to the metro or BTR port both  You may still have to tale a taxi  The logistics of changing from one system to the other is a lot of walking  You also have to pay again  Frankly with luggage either have a taxi take you tofrom the Airport Rail or skip it  If you are traveling light no issue  It is not up to Hong Kong

title: Fantastic experience!
review: This was a very exotic experience for me At the railway market it's amazing how tightly coupled the market is to the train The sellers have to pull away their products and rents every time the train passes by it's very cool to experience The floating market was also alot of fun Its impressive how creative the locals have become at assembling shops on the docks and even on their tiny boats I paid about $54 dollars for this trip and it was worth EVERY penny

title: Good for travelling in the city
review: Very good and economy travel in the city Much faster than getting stuck in traffic for a long time Get change from the counters and then use them in the ticket machine

title: Skytrain
review: Once you get a handle of the system the cheapest and easy way to get around plus we felt  safe on it as well

title: 2 things you must know..
review: 1 If you have luggages i don't recommend you to use rail link unless you can go up and down the stairs with your stuffs Taxi is better  2 The seats are quite limited You probably need to stand with your luggages   3 It's quite cheap so if you are going to airport to greet someone good to try

title: easy, efficient, convenient
review: The train was easy to use pretty efficient and fairly cheap It was also air conditioned so it made the ride a bit more comfortable

title: Cheap and only cost 45Bahts one way
review: I use the link for my layover in Bangkok to tour around the city It's cheap and safe for solo traveler like me

title: Great intro to Kanchanaburi
review: Well presented and documented museum about the history of the death railway The exhibits are well done and kids enjoyed discovering the models and objects shown Not too long so no time to get bored and the small cafeteria at the end of the visit is a good incentive for children

title: Best way to get around
review: Using BTS is great Clean efficient gets you almost anywhere in Bangkok The best way to get around

title: Great way to travel
review: Quick cool and clean way to get around Bangkok We used it often with 4 adults and 3 children ages 6 9 and 10

title: Perfect way to get around Bangkok
review: One of the easiest and affordable means of transport around the city  Also on elf the cheapest  Signs and directions to navigate are easy to understand  Connects to downtown Bangkok and the other parts of the city  Makkassan metro is the connecting station for the airport city link rail line

title: Use toilets in terminal 21 there great
review: Asok great station for shopping eating places massage venues location getting about easy access clean station as all gts stations our

title: Easy transfer
review: For once we where traveling light so decided to try the airport link Very easy and cheap if your having a hotel close to BTS or MRT Might be a hassle in the rush our with your luggage etc

title: Simple to use and you wait no longer than 5 minutes
review: Would definitely advise using this service where possible prices are low approximately 40 Baht (80p) will get you most places

title: Great way to see Bangkok
review: train system easy to useyou must have change to buy your tickets from the vending machines Money can be changed at the ticket boothTrains are clean and run frequently

title: Clean and Efficient
review: There was a station very near our hotel Marriot Executive Sukhumvit so this was convenient for us to get to many areas of Bangkok where we wished to go

title: Wasn't on our list to see but glad we did
review: This tour was included in our 1 night2 day package at Elephant Haven We also saw the Buddha cave  Beautiful location and views from both ends  A slow moving train does still travel the tracks  Watch where you are walking as it is easy to trip over bolts and the track is not solid nor is there a side railing A little market is set up as well to purchase items  Bring water it is hot and in direct sunlight

title: The best thing to ever happen to Bangkok
review: This is undoubtedly the best way to get around Bangkok It's reliable clean and fast The ticketing is very logical and inexpensive

title: Very good
review: Train was comfortable with fans for air conditioning an amazing train ride to Hell Fire Pass with fantastic views along the way

title: Excellent value
review: After many times in Bangkok we used this link for the first time having watched it being built over the years Its a perfect way to get into the city and saves the angst of the traffic queues into the city Highly recommended unless you have vast amounts of baggage when it would probably be better to use another form of transport

title: Very convenient, but allow more time during rush hours.
review: Airport Rail Link is one of the most convenient ways to get into Bangkok Even if you do not take it to the end you could save a lot of time by avoiding some of the traffic At the end you can connect with BTS or connect to the subway 2 stations from the end which could save you a lot of time during the rush hours or if there is rain Because there are no  other rail lines that serve communities in that direction the Airport Rail Link tend to be overcrowded during rush hours with commuters Sometimes the commuters have to wait for several trains before being able to get on Some even resort to going to the airport rather than closest station to be able to get on an empty train Therefore allow more time during rush hours

title: as always
review: everytime I go to bangkok sky train is my first choice for traveling in bangkokSiam is my most often station then anusawaree

title: Quite a challenge
review: I love the rail in Bangkok The carriages are nice and cool and kept very clean and there are always plenty of trains running to get you to where you want to go The only thing that bothers me is the crowds and at certain train stops such as Siam it's a fight to get off and on I feel that the trains are getting more and more crowded every year but it beats the heck out of being ripped off by the Tuk Tuk Drivers

title: good choice
review: easy get around with sky train and fast if you want to avoid the traffic this is the best way to get around the town

title: Efficient
review: The skytrain was quick and covered the areas we wanted to get to  It was easy to use and close by our hotel

title: a great way to travel in Bangkok
review: One thing good in hot and tropical Bangkok you can expect their BTS has strong aircon which is a blessing in the hot weather Its also kept very tidy Compare to Singapore's mrt when the aircon is always turn on the low we should learn from them

title: About time!
review: This link should have been operational when the new airport was opened Never the less it is now and finally we have some transport that can get us into the city in less then an hour

title: Needs improvements
review: It's a cheap way to get into the city but I felt it could be better As the ARL I was expecting purpose built cars to accommodate passengers from the airport getting into the city maybe some places for luggage but the train cars are just ordinary cars like on the BTS It fills up quickly with people having to find space to stack their bags on the floor and regular passengers from the other stops adding to the overall numbers

title: Airport Train
review: Great cheap way to get near the city center and other bus terminals A little hard to find on out first visit to Bangkok Go all the way to the lowest floor in the airport

title: GREAT TRANSPORT SYSTEM
review: Travelled several times on the skytrain and it runs very efficiently Very well organised system for boarding and disembarking at stations so there is no pushing and shoving Even though it was crowded it was comfortable airconditioned and PA announcing next station Ticketing system is very good any easy to use

title: Beats the traffic
review: The BTS Skytrain is easy to use a lot quicker and cooler then other forms of transport in Bangkok As long as you know where your going then the system is straight forward You buy tickets at the ticket machine which is in Thai and English just touch the screen to the station you want to go to and the price comes up The one down side is the ticket machines only take coins and not notes Otherwise go to the ticket counter and buy your ticket from the cashier who speaks Thai and English When on the skytrain all announcements and maps are in Thai and English The skytrain works well and is easy to follow

title: Very convenient
review: Very convenient for travelers just don't go during rush hour so go after 9am The station and the trains are clean

title: A good start..
review: I used this service just a few months after its official launching there're two types local and express I took the express one it's clean and brand new also with extra compartment for big luggage It costed 150 bath (if I am not mistaken) and only took 15 minutes from the airport to the last station where to change to the subway   The only disadvantage that time was the station was not integrated with neither the subway nor the skyline I had to get out from the station pull my luggage (luckily only one) a few hundred meters and get into the subway station can't imagine if traveling with small kids and a lot of luggage Hope they have solved this problem   certainly it's incomparable to the system in Japan or Europe but at least it's a good start for Thailand and Bangkok to provide a better transport

title: Sky Train around Bangkok
review: Best way to move around Bangkok quickly Our hotel was close to Ashok Station which also provides access to the new subway From Ashok we were able to get wo China Town and all the main shopping areas and the weekend Market quickly and very cheaply The walkways below also provide a way to move around efficiently and above all the chaos and traffic below

title: Easy
review: best cheapest and easiest way to get around Bangkok with its terrible traffic snarls all day Do not be afraid familiarise yourself with the service and away you go

title: Where did the time go?
review: Victor  the guide was very pleasant The driver was safe The whole experience was efficient and delightful

title: Fun tour
review: This was a fun tour although the journey was rather long  We visited salt mines and then got on a train to the train market  What an experience to see the market as you pull into the station  Our guide (Miss One) was really sweet and looked like she was enjoying the experience as much as us  The floating market was great too and it was very enjoyable to go through the markets on the boats  Although people say this tour is a waste of time if you are first timers in Thailand as we were then this is a tour that should not be missed

title: Slow!
review: I was had experience last month about Thailand Airport Link it's very nice train but look like a little old style

title: A little glimpse of Asia
review: This was an amazing trip for both places  The floating markets were brilliant busy and bargains to be had  The railway market was different but I do like a train ride

title: Avoid the crazy heavy traffic jams in Bangkok by Airport Link Train
review: I live in Bangkok and frequent go to the airport and back by Airport Link Train Suvarnabhumi Airport is approximate 10s km from the center but the unpredictable traffic jams in Bangkok sometime it takes about  1  15  2  or 3 hours esp before long holiday or rainy season  The train station situated at Suvarnabhumi Airport (underground level) and it takes about 40 mins to Praya Thai BTS then you can change to BTS or take a taxi to your hotel However there's not many trains  so there are lots of passengers and each train takes about 1015 mins for waiting By the way it's cheaper and faster than take a taxi directly from the airport save money save your time

title: SUPER EASY way to get around Bangkok
review: Didn't hurt that our Hotel (see my Anantara Siam review) was 1 block away from one of the station stops Travel all around Bangkok for about 3060 baht My new wife and I found it very easy and user friendly Very well laidout with every station stop being a spot that is central to an area of town that you want to be in Also cheap considering the cost of cab or tuk tuk Don't travel in a tuk tuk not safe very hot and you'll smell like gasoline when you're done

title: A lot to see during the 10+ hours on the train
review: We took this day train from Chiang Mai to Bangkok and the scenery was really good The area close to Chiang Mai has a lot of hills and after that the rice fields and closer to Bangkok more houses and industry arise We also had several meals that were included in the price We bought our tickets a few days in advance at the ticket office at the train station That was easy

title: Depending on where you are going...
review: Really comes down to if you are staying close to anywhere on the city links If you are it is fast cheap and clean If you have to take this and then get a taxi for where you are going might not be worth the troubleIf you are up to see a great view of the city and have a backpack go for it

title: Convenient and cheap.
review: Convenient and cheap Best way to travel within the city as the road traffic can be quite bad at times

title: Good transport option in BKK
review: Easy and conformtable to use if you do not have to reach remote spots in the city  Prices are very cheap the system is easy to understand  Using BTS is in many cases the faster way to get from A to B instead of using a taxi or tuk tuk   We use BTS most of the times to room around the city

title: Excellent
review: Travelers should take experience in bts its 15 bhaṭ only minimum charges that's just same in mumbai metro

title: Feeling stupid and mixed up.
review: We used it many times as it  is the only convenient  and safe way to move around the city traffic jams 247 are horrific in this city Some lines are more easy to understand and guide yourself to the proper platform Others are really terrible Before entering any train ask the security guard if you are on the right platform direction etc Unfortunately there are no signs in some stations Sometimes the only sign is an arrow "to all stations" so you are trying to guess where you have to go ending going up and down in the heat feeling a bit stupid Other con is that not all the trains have a loud speaking voice announcing the stations Check the monitor TV displaying several adverts At the bottom is written which is the next station

title: A Nice Feature to Bangkok's Infrastructure
review: If you know where you're going how to get there and doesn't mind to mingle with the locals here's your champion I like the BTS Skytrain it was a nice way to commute Wellconnected to main attractions cool with aircon in the heat of Bangkok and clean  Note that the BTS Skytrain can be so crowded at certain times so try to avoid using it in peak hours By the way the have 'One Day Pass' for tourists to ride anywhere in the system as much as they like that valid for 24 hours from 12 AM (remember not from the time you first use it) It is a nice feature to Bangkok's infrastructure

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: The air condition was great and it was a peaceful ride My friend and I took it and I saved money by not having to get a grab or taxi I was really impressed with the cleanliness and would always take the BTS when possible

title: Useful transport but not integrated
review: Although sky train was convenient for our hotel the main issue for me was that it isn't integrated with the metro This meant that the 'rabbit' electronic card did not work on the metro or on the boats Not sure about the buses but I assume not You have to pay a non refundable 80 baht for the card and 450 baht for 15 journeys so think carefully before buying Also think carefully before buying a one day card as that is exclusive to sky train too Trains were clean and air conditioned and it's easy to find your way round but the service is not particularly frequent so longish waits for trains

title: Fast and and quite cheap rail link
review: Very cheap and fast way to get to the Bangkok airport only 80100 baht per person it will take you from central Bangkok to the airport in no time Very spacious trains very clean and westernised you will arrive in the airport ground floor inside the airport not outside Extremely convenient and fast

title: Not bad
review: Compared to other South East Asian countries the MRT is not as good Still gets you to where you need to go but not as efficient

title: Skyttain
review: Ideal cheap and quick  The traffic in Bangkok is bedlam and scary We used the sky train to get from our hotel to get to the hop on hop off bus for a tour of the palace rather than using taxi or tuktuk It’s a crazy busy place

title: A very convenient way to get sround
review: I have used the service many times It is fast reliable and easy to use You can hop on and off at so many locations use it to swap to the MRT or a train A little crowded at times but still a great way to get around

title: super easy
review: runs frequently is fast and super easy to use  i believe it only cost 45baht a person too (a little over $3)

title: Convenient and Cheap
review: Very easy to get around bangkok using BTS Cheap as well You can buy a card or using coins Usually it takes 30 baht to get to everywhere Runs frequently as well A bit busy and crowded during the rush hour Try to avoid it

title: Convenient, Fast, Frequent
review: This is the way to beat the traffic jams There's access to all the popular places touristy & business areas

title: take BTS easy~
review: Pretty convenient to go to famous site like shopping bike tour or massageetc So strongly suggest to take a trip by BTS

title: Very easy to get around
review: This is one of the easiest ways to get around Bangkok and it isn't expensive either An all day pass for the Skytrain is only 130 Baht per day  This gives you as many trips on the network as you like up until midnight  There are only two lines so getting to where you want to go is quite simple most interchanges take place at Siam station  Eating and drinking on the skytrain is not allowed and there are markings on the platform to show you where to queue up allowing the passengers on the carriage clear exit room  The carriages are wonderfully cool and a bit of a haven after you have been walking around in the heat My hotel was attached to the Asok station and when I had finished travelling each evening I found someone to give my ticket to to save them a few bucks rather than throw it in the binone night some Americans thought I was trying to scam them rather than just being nice

title: A cheap & traffic free way to travel
review: Used the train to go from hotel to Main shopping district though was crowded but very clean & efficient with on time arrival & departures The best part is you avoid all Bangkok traffic jams ticket prices vary by destination & start at around TB 18 & above

title: Very easy to get around
review: The Airtrain is great very easy to get around just make sure you always carry small change on you though as the machines don't take notes and if it's peak hour you have to line up to get change

title: Very good service
review: The skytrain runs until 11 pm and goes to the most turistics places Make sure you have enough change to buy the tickets

title: Easy to Navigate
review: The Sky train is easy to navigate efficient and fast

title: Well worth it
review: Great trip Time at train market was a little rushed but we loved our time on the boats at the floating market It would have been good to have more time to look around both the markets

title: east to use
review: Initially it is a bit overwhelming but the staff are helpful  We travelled everywhere on the Sky train   It is cheap and efficient

title: Best transport mode in Bangkok
review: You can save time and money while get around BangkokIts very fast and  you can avoid busy traffic in and around Bangkok

title: Best location
review: 100m from sky train and MBK Close to all shopping centers Close to Tesco and McDonald’s very good location

title: Quick & Efficient
review: Before the BTS started to operate in 1999 travelling in Bangkok was a nightmare indeed during the 1990s I stopped going to the city because of this With two lines and now 34 stations travelling across Bangkok now takes a fraction of the time that it used to Yes it gets busy in particular in the rush hours but what major rail transit system in the world does not Trains are airconditioned and run every few minutes at peak times but you never have to wait long out of peak hours

title: Effective way to get around
review: The skytrain is a very good way to get around in Bangkok easy cheap and fast with kids the best way to get around

title: fast way to moove around
review: but of course it depend where you are heading as it have limited   only 2 route  from Paya thai station you can get to airport railway  it also connect with MRT or river boat   eastern bus terminal(Pattaya) at Ekamai station

title: very strong A/C
review: The AC is always strong  It cools you off as soon as you step into the cabin The cabins are always clean

title: Very convenient
review: It is so easy to know how to use it Their is English writing so you will not be lost The staff will help you if you need change for the machine just ask at the counter Your bafs will be searched before you get on board and I love the idea

title: Good for solo and when traffic jam
review: Bts is the fast and convenience ways to commute from one point to another point at the Bts line  For tourist  you can stop at Taksin station and there is a hop on hop off boat or shuttle boat to commute from center of Bangkok to grand palace or see Choapraya river at competitive price

title: Recommended only if you have extra time
review: We wanted to take the train to see some thai scenery The experience itself wasn't that bad the train and the cabin were relatively clean the toilets  was exactly what we expected from a toilet on a train we came with low expectations and were not surprised ) We took the 1st class cabin on a "night" train #1 which is a small cabin with 2 berths  one lower and one upper berth We also received blankets and clean sheets The ride itself was pretty bumpy which sometime woke us from sleeping There is an option to order dinner and they serve juice (not free) that tasted more like sugar with juice (too sweet)  Unfortunately we didn't see much of the "Thai scenery" the train left Bangkok at 1800 when it already started getting dark and arrived at Chiang mai at 7AM right after the sunrise We booked the tickets online from thailandtrainticket got a reply from them after a few days The tickets were waiting for us in the train station in Bangkok Overall it wasn't that bad experience but next time we'll take a flight

title: Nice way to travel.
review: Alsoif you are into urban photography you can get some great shots of the urban scenery from the BTS platforms  My one criticism of the skytrain is that the fares for short distances are excessive

title: Convenient but not cheap
review: Just trying out the skytrain in bangkok Good view from top But the price is too pricey and very crowded with people Just experiencing in people country But im happy

title: Cheap and fast
review: It is a cheap convenient clean and fast mode of travel around Bangkok

title: Best Way To travel
review: We happily took the BTS around Bangkok versus other modes of transportation Cheap easy fastand no traffic Easy to use as long as you can use a map

title: “Fast and Comfortable”
review: Basically the best way to get around Bangkok Tried to get to the Airport once with my luggage which was less convenient Easy way to get to the shopping centres

title: For rush hour!!
review: Good for rush hour but not good becoz a lot of people Easy and faster for travelling fromto Suvarnabhumi airport

title: the immigration was going fast and smooth
review: very good the access to the trian to the city easy to travel and it is congested at times many people using it

title: Convenient Way to get around Bangkok
review: easy to use clean regular and reaches all the key shopping & business areas of the city

title: Bangkok by railway is the best way !
review: MRT is the perfect complement of BTS you can Rich the center of Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi Airport first by MRT until Playa Thai in which you can interchange with BTS just 7 stations away from the start at the airportin 20 minutes you can be in the center of Bangkok no taxi can bring you so fast from the airport  And for the price you will paid almost 6065 bth  Welcome to Bangkok Rail Link

title: Easiest ride i have ever taken
review: Save yourself the stress of dealing with taxi drivers or limousine and just take the airport link It cost me 50 baht to get from the airport to the city finishing at phaya thai station Phaya thai is just a short 2min walk to the bts skytrain If you have google maps you cam navigate this pretty easy Make sure you use the touch screen ticket machines unless you read thai

title: Fun Day
review: Sara was brilliant Made the experience for us really happy and informative a ray of sunshine on our trip would deffo recommend

title: Best transport to get around Bangkok
review: Best transport to get around Bangkok Recommend to get the Rabbit card to avoid the long queue on coins exchange and ticket purchasing

title: Great
review: Very surprised at how efficient easy and clean the skytrain was I suggest using this as the primary method of getting around as Bangkok traffic can be brutal at times

title: Escape the traffic
review: BTS skytrain services are a blessing specially in peak hours when traffic in Bangkok is a killer and even the shorter distances can take a long time We used this mode extensively during our recent trip The day pass costs THB 140 but is beneficial only when you want to do several trips or longer trips

title: To busy
review: Not recommended had to stand for a long time not enough seating a taxi is so much cheaper and more comfortable

title: Always on time
review: Used the sky train regularly on numerous visits to Bangkok Nothing but brilliant Easy fast and reliable and so cheap

title: The best way to travel solo ...
review: If you are not in the mood to sit in hours of traffic to get to your hotel then I recommend the rail link as your transportation to the hotel

title: Amazing day out
review: Not to be missed when in Bangkok This tour was absolutely amazing From the start to finish Vicki was our tour guide who met us at our hotel She was brilliant very friendly knowledgable and helpful We stopped at the stadium and had a mini tour of the salt fields Next was the train ride to the train market which in itself was great Get a window seat Going into the train market was such an experience and love everyone waving at you We had 20 minutes at the market and watched the train leave through the market which was unreal Next onto the floating markets soooo cool Definitely worth paying a little extra to go into the market itself on the boats Highly recommend this tour and massive thank you to Vicki making our day perfect

title: Good
review: Me and my boyfriend just wanted to try the BTS  We really like the circular handrail inside the train  It was convenient and accessible even though it was crowded   the reason for not giving 5 star is for the ticketing service  It’s not so user friendly they dun accepts notes only coins    Over all it is nice convenient and clean

title: Functional, fast and easy to use.
review: Mass transit almost essential to use in Bangkok Buy a Rabbit card for unlimited travel 180Bt and top up 100Bt when needed  Can not be used on MRT

title: Organize, educated.
review: The first time I used the BTS i was a bit confused there are some machines and a map beside with numbers you have to know which station you are going to then look at the map for it and it will have a number thats the price you will have to pay go to the window and change the amount you need the  go to the machine and use the coins to get the ticket if you are staying for a linger time I recommend to get a Rabbit Card that you can recharge and will avoid you lines during rush hours People is really polite and respect the lines the BTS is clean and has AC which helps after a long walk in a really hot weather

title: Easy way to go
review: Very easy to get the hang of the system So so cheap and very helpful staff at most stations On time and a far better service and trains than you will find anywhere in Australia

title: Easy to access
review: Easy to access and change to other transportations such as fast boat and subway The train is very clean too

title: smooth and affordable
review: access is pretty nice it is affordable and just worth the benefit not having to deal with a cab trying to hustle you It does not have late night service which is a super bummer It can get crowded easy Nice new Siemens trains About 45 min from the bigger international airport to central bangkok

title: Fair service
review: As there are not many routes you must be lucky that your destination is on the route Nevertheless connects some major shopping and business hubs and has links to the MRT However during peak hours very packed and stations are outside in the heat As MRT very inexpensive

title: Fast and english announcements

review: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of service and the clean bedding provided and made by the railway staff The sleep was comfortable between the crisp clean bedsheets

title: Beat the traffic

title: Easy to Use and Convenient
review: I have used the MRT many times  It is very easy to use buying a ticket is simple and there are many stops within Bangkok for travelers to help get them to their ultimate destination

title: suvabhumi airport connection
review: it is very convenient for those arrive or depart at suvabhumi airport The airport link link the place to various places in bangkok city the price is reasonable as well

title: Over crowded
review: BTS Skytrain is a good mode of transport in Bangkok But over crowded Not convenient for senior citizen

title: Simple and effective
review: Not luxury by any means Ran smoothly and got us to our destination Air conditioned and clean Would ride again

title: Floating market and train market
review: Perfect trip well organized Sarah was a perfect guide Me and my family really enjoyed ist Can highly recommend it Take it

title: Definitely worth the money and time
review: For less than 30 US dollars you will get the transfer to the railway market get the ride on an old train plus ride on a boat The guide will also provide some useful information and assist you bargain with local trades

title: Fastest way to get around Bangkok
review: For shopping or sightseeing without the headache of the traffic in this mega city the Skytrain is the easiest cheapest and most convenient way to travel The only negative are the access problems Stairs are everywhere and if you are elderly or not very fit this takes its toll on the knees Walking is one thing but the stairs are steep and there are many Going from Phloen Chit to the river is fast but the number of stairs is offputting Some stations have escalators but most do not Lifts are few and far between which is award when traveling with young children

title: Can be crowded but good way to move around
review: I have used the skytrain a lot at times it can get very crowded with people pushed against the doors but having said that i have never had an issue with getting where i wanted and its certainly vheaper than taxi or tuktuk

title: Easy to use and cheap!
review: Lovely experience so far People are very friendly and helpful The trains are clean and run very often  Links you to main areas of bangkok for tourists

title: very convenient
review: Loved the skytrain very regular and really clean We used it to visit various sites in Bangkok Really economical too

title: Cool transportation
review: I wonder how the train be sky in big city as Bangkok It is unique one transportation in the world All of you should take it even you haven't visited to Thailand yet

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Clean easy to use very VERY organized even during extreme peak hours stations are placed in all the major points in the city and of course you get to beat trafficI didn't take the taxi at all while I was there because my hotel was a 2 second walk from the station and the train took me where I needed to go Of course once you go shopping and need to take the train back to the hotel with a gazillion bags it can be interesting hahaha but I managed

title: Best
review: Very convenience to get into the downtown of the Bangkok City It is a good way to choose if you are travel to Bangkok not more than 3 persons

title: clean, efficient & air conditioned.

title: Great tour, brilliant guide - would highly recommend to anyone visiting Bangkok.

title: Yes, air con on trains!
review: finally even London is behind when it comes to having proper air con on trains Spacious reliable great way to get around Bangkok (river boat taxi even better) Enjoy

title: Easy, clean and affordable
review: When arriving to Bangkok we decided to take the train vs taxi to our hotel Not because of money but it looked like the fastest way to get to our hotel We were very happy with our choice as it was very easy clean comfortable and fast If your hotel is next to a bts station I highly recommend to take the airport train and then connect to the bts rail

title: Very efficient and fast way to move around
review: We have used the skytrain during our stay in Bangkok and we found it very good and moderately priced

title: BTS Skytrain is very nice
review: BTS Skytrain is a very nice way to get around town  We used it on sunday to get to the Chatuchak weekend market )

title: Good connection but very full
review: we used the skytrain to visit some places faster than taxi or other  easy to reach points  many people are using the skytrain must be lucky to catch a seat

title: Crowed but efficient
review: This is a quick way in and out of Bangkok  Much more efficient than a cab  Our fare was 52Baht per person

title: Clean and cold. Good if traveling with just one or two people
review: We always take the skytrain in Bangkok but now that my kids are having to pay to ride it is becoming cheaper to take a taxi or tuk tuk

title: Really is the best way to get about BKK...
review: At times it can be crowded and hard work but comparative to the delayed sits in Bangkok taxis that is an all too regular occurrence its the best way to get about the main areas Clean efficient safe and stops at all the right placesits easy going at the most part The steps can sometimes be a grind and for three to four people it is more expensive than a taxi but still cheap comparatively

title: very cheap and convienent
review: very easy cheap convienent around bangkok  dont stuck in trafic always use bts best option in bangkok

title: Clean, efficient, and air conditioned
review: Anyone who has spent time in Bangkok knows that traffic is the worst thing about an otherwise fantastic city If you're lucky enough to live work or be visiting in the area of a BTS station it's your best option to move around town quickly and comfortably  If you'll be in town for more than a couple of days and anticipate using the system frequently you can purchase a socalled "Rabbit" card and storeadd value as needed  You'll save the hassle of figuring out how much each trip will cost and then standing in line to purchase individual tickets The downside is that the initial cost of the card is 80 baht but then you'll have it forever and can keep topping up the value at the cashier window whenever you're getting low It's made of hard plastic not paper so no worries there (just keep it away from any powerful magnets) Bonus Most BTS stations have plenty of food and drink outlets (though you're not allowed to consume food and beverages while on a train) and some stations even have other types of stores (nail salons clothing stores banks mobile phone shops and more)

title: Billiant!
review: I use a Rabbit card from the BTS and load it up with 1000baht (for two weeksuse approx) to save frtom having to cue for coins and tickets for the turnstiles Much easier and faster as the BTS stops can at times be very busy indeed This rail network should be the envy of the New Zealand Government and Auckland city council in particular It is a brilliant way to get people moving around the city Very well thought out and since last year goes all the way to Suvanabhumi (pronounced Suwanapoom) airport Easy to use and there is a map of the network at every BTS stop near the coin booths

title: Great ride from Bangkok to Chiang mai
review: This was an excellent option to get from Bangkok to Chiang mai We took the overnight train and bought a first class ticket Impressed with the cleanliness and attention to detail

title: Best way in and out
review: Forget the obvious price difference between cabs and the Airport express All the other reasons like traffic chaos speed reliability and safety make this the only sensible way to get to and from the airport

title: Easy
review: This is an easy way to get around n bangkokalthough it does get very crowded its easy to understand even in a different language We used this to get to the mall it was very easy

title: fun ride
review: There are five of us and we enjoyed the fun of travelling by sky train particularly to the river ferries However when you are a family of five it's still cheaper and easier to travel by taxi

title: Excellent and cheap way to travel from Airport to City!
review: Airport rail link is a medium speed train that runs between the Airport and the city with limited number of stops The train starts right under the Airport (you can take a lift down to reach here) and goes upto Phaya Thai station Considering the Suvarnabhumi Airport is far from the city centre this train is very useful for most tourists   I was staying at Royal Ivory Nana Resort near Nana Sky Train Station The taxi from our hotel to airport was costing around 700 Baht I took the Skytrain from Nana Station to Phaya Thai Station for 40 Baht and then easily changed to the Airport Rail Link The entire journey from Phaya Thai Station to Suvarnabhumi station costs 45 Baht and took 45 minutes Totally I spent 95 Baht from the hotel to airport which would have otherwise cost me 700 Baht in a taxi Having backpacks is much better when travelling in this train Though I had one roller bag and it was fine   The train is clean Runs at a decent speed The ticket machines are user friendly and very simple to use If you are confused there is a guard to help you out   If your hotel is close to any BTS station and if you believe in saving some money on travelling take this airport rail link If you are a big family the taxi and airport link cost would turn out to be similar

title: Easy and Convenient
review: Really easy and cheap to use Get to see great views and is comfortable and air conditioned Not great for seeing the main tourist attractions as no stops near by but good for seeing other parts of the city

title: Not so friendly with the elder
review: The BTS skytrain is clean and cozy but is not friendly for elder with a wheel chair since most of the sky train access is using stairs this make it a bit hard for older people

title: Boon in busy traffic
review: Bangkok traffic is just like a car travels @ 5kmhr when it's rush hourgetting to places is much more convenient using BST as in all Big cities  Don't expect a tourist pass like 3 day passXYZ amount and unlimited travel Infact if you enquire something of that sort they will propose a card which will be 100 Bht card + 50 Bht some charge and then 250 Bht reload for 10 or 12 one way journeys which comes out to be expensive Better is to take ticket from individual stationsthat too you will not get at counters They will handover you the exact change and then you need to go to vending machine to get the tickets   BST operates till midnight and therefore one of the most convenient way to travelalso it covers almost all major areas making it a favorite amongst touristsThough a little expensive compared to London tube or Singapore MRT or KL LRT but still a boon in Bangkok's busy traffic

title: So far so good
review: So far I have been on two types of long distance trains both were quite good You have to book a ticket in advance and you have to sit in your designated seat There is a personal wake up alert when you arrive at your station  The day train served refreshments for free and a small lunch   The night train will try and SCAM you into buying overpriced refreshments As soon as I got on the train a man handed me an orange juice (that tasted like medication) then came around to collect 60 baht for it I recommend buying your own food before boarding an overnighter Otherwise the bed was good  Timing  The day train left about an hour late The overnight train left exactly on time but I still arrived an hour after the predicted time  Overall the train is a cheap and impressive service in my eyes

title: The best transportation in Bankok
review: Good train that get you the fastest and the easiest way to central places in Bankok  Little crowded during rush hours and not so intuitive to understand how and where to swap but local people will guide you with a smile

title: Easy to get around
review: The Sky train and the MRT system are both great ways to get around Can get very crowded at times and if you are stuck at the opposite side of the train to the doors opening it can be a struggle to get off Cheap way to get around

title: SkyTrain
review: system couldn't be better  Buy an unlimited Ride pass much easier  I rode the train many times between the shopping center my hotel  Little bit crazy at rush hour but other than that awesome

title: Easy
review: While in Bangkok we decided to use the BTSeasy to use and very helpful staff  The trains are very clean and air conditioned

title: 1st ride
review: We wanted to ride the sky train in Bangkok on Holiday First impression Well organised clean and the ride relaxing Coming from another country the stations give good indications of where to go The train was fast and brought us to our destination safely  If you are in Bangkok give it a try it is not too expensive and you do not waist your time in traffic

title: Cool!
review: I haven't actually travelled by real train before (MRT doesn't count roght) so when I booked Chiang Mai I decided I'd travel by train Took the 2nd class night train (#13) and shared a compartment with an English mom traveling with her kids (a son and daughter) The travel was almost perfect except for the overpriced foods and drinks (a tiny cup of coffee at breakfast cost me 40 bahts and it wasn't even good) and the toilet which wasn't the cleanest I've seen (ladies be warned) My tips 1 Book early to get the lower bunk bed to see the view along the way  2 Bring a sweater as it gets really cold on the top bunk at night  3 Grab something to eat before the train leaves or just bring your own food in the train  4 I brought a book and managed to read a few pages before the swaying made my head hurt You may also use this time to chat with the other guys on the same compartment   If you'll be staying in Chiang Mai for 3 days or more use the train You'll still have plenty of time to explore the city and you'll be able to save on hotel costs for one night

title: A great day out
review: We had a great day at both markets and rode the train through the market and then watched the train pass when in the market the floating market was a great experience and we bought souvenirs from both markets

title: Great infrastructure, shame about the service
review: It's great to get around Bangkok without getting snarled up in traffic The BTS Skytrain would be even better if the network was more extensive  currently it only serves a small part of downtown Bangkok The main difficulty was in buying a ticket A long wait at the counter then an unhelpful official who did not explain that they do not issue you with a ticket they give you change so that you can use the ticket dispensing machines yourselfThe system is fine but it is not clear to foreigners how to use it Luckily the Thai people are usually very willing to help you out if you are in difficulties but this should be the job of the railway staff

title: Easy to use...
review: Bts is very useful especiall airport transfers In Bangkok huge trafic jam occurs So 1st option should be bts

title: Help the Infirm!
review: The best way to avoid the interminable traffic snarls the BTS has certainly not splashed out for elevators and escalators electing instead to tuck any rare specimens away from the more travelled areas   However once the ascension problems have been overcome this is certainly the best way to get around bar none

title: Bangkok's efficient SkyTrain
review: It's hard to imagine how Bangkokians managed without their Skytrain even though they did for many many years The elevated city train is a great way to get about the cityand certainly a very good alternative to negotiating the trafficclogged streets by taxi or tuktuk The multicar trains are clean and wellcooled (a must in this sweltering city) and fast And they come by often Authorities are expanding the various lines all the time meaning the sprawling metropolis will be even more accessible as time goes on Be aware that during the morning and evening rush hours the BTS stations are jammed with passengers and you may not be able to board the first train that comes along

title: Good way to travel
review: Fast and cheap not the best for things like handrails as they were all a bit greasy and sloppy to the touch

title: best economy way to get from and to the airport
review: This is the best economic way to get from and to the airport if travel light (not really good for big suitcases) The ticket costs around 150th and the trip takes around 20 min There are many signs so it is easy to use

title: beat the traffic
review: travel in peace criss cross the city at leisure except that english skills of the customer service needs to get a little better especially at comprehending  the sky train is a great way of traveling in BKK

title: Overground metro
review: Why this appears in the list of Bangkok experiences is a mystery it’s a crowded train that serves the parts of the city that tourists don’t really want to see

title: The sure way to get to Bangkok city (almost)
review: We arrived on the late evening on 29th April and by the time we exit immigration and gotten our luggage it was almost 9pm on a Friday evening in Bangkok All the taxi AOT (airport taxi) were sold out In the end we have to walk about 150m to the Airport Railink within the airport to take the train to Paya Thai Station in the city There were suppose to have an express train but it was unavailable In the end we took the normal train for 45 baths and it took us about 45 min to reach Paya Thai Station  Overalls it still beats taking taxi which will cost about 500 baths and there were a big jam in Bangkok that can easily take more than an hour compare to when we travel via BTS  Overall BTS is a sure bet to travel between airport and city if you do not have huge luggages If you do look for elevator to move between floors Be prepare to wait though as there are usually only one or two elevators available at the airport and at the station

title: Works well
review: Easy to access and affordable took the train out at 530am and arrived in record time to the station and beat the busy rush hour traffic highly recommend as your way to reach the city will save a lot of time

title: Great MRT services.
review: Travel by airport link train is by far the easiest and cheapest way to go if you are staying in Bangkok city and near to the train station it is fastest as there will be no traffic jam and they cost only 45 baht if you start from Phaya Thai and 35 bath from Makassan Makkasan station provides a taxi service counter free of charge at the ground floor of the building Trip takes around 30 minutes more or least from Phaya Thai

title: Fastest way to travel around Bangkok but not necessarily the cheapest
review: As long as you know the stations that you would like to go to BTS Skytrain is the most convenient and fastest way to avoid the heavy traffic in Bangkok (especially around Sukhumvit Pratunam Siam area)   Unless you intend to make extensive travel around the city we find the purchase as required ticket to be good enough   The daily pass cost Bht140 for unlimited ride Most travel from one station to another cost from Bht15 to Bht40 per trip Hence if your travel party is 4 person taxi ride could be cheaper For example a skytrain ride from Mo Chit (Chatujak) to City Centre (Siam or Chit Lom) cost Bht40 per person A taxi ride (with meter) from Chatujak To Central World would cost Bht100 to Bht120

title: The best Sarah
review: Sarah is the best Super funny Very recommended She is livello and the experience sad amazing super recommended

title: Best way to move
review: Fast cheap and with air conditioned And you can avoid the taxi cues If you're hotel is not near any station you can always get to the closer station and get a taxi  tuk tuk  bus from there

title: Avoid taxis.  Take the Skytrain.
review: I am the sort of traveller that automatically hails a taxi or tuktuk when in Thailand  The exception to that rule is when I am in Bangkok  I avoid taxis at all costs and take the BTS Skytrain  Very simple to get around clean easy to use  Highly recommend it as a primary source of transportation  Best way to avoid mid day heat and horrible gridlock

title: Cold air cond, but don't get Rabbit Card
review: Like Air cond strong enough despite the hot weather Don't have to wait for too long before the next train arrives  Dislike Quite a few stations don't have escalators so you would have to climb up the staircases which are few storey high The Rabbit card was not worth getting as you would need to pay 50 Baht (non refundable) + 50 Baht refundable deposit + the amounts of travel values you wish to put in By holding a rabbit card it gives you faster access to the gate as you don't have to queue to buy a new ticket for every single trip you take and it also deduct 1 Baht off each trip (which was so minimal though)

title: Great way to travel
review: Use this Skytrain to Chatuchak Market and stop at Mo Chit Station and then on the way home stop at Terminal 21 shopping center for more shopping

title: skytrain  great

title: Fast and efficient
