title: Use it... will save you time and its cool inside
review: I woild suggest anyone visiting BKK to use the Skytrain and Metro systems to get around Its quick easy and an efficient way to maximize your time

title: Easy efficient
review: We used this a couple of times the lady behind the thick glass was NOT helpful what so ever She made out she did not know where we were going she was just being awkward but the trip was good trains on time clean and safe

title: The best way to travel on Sukhumvit
review: If you ever need to get around somewhere on the Sukhumvit road like to a hotel or to almost all of BKKs most well known malls just take the BTS The traffic on the sukhumvit is on bad days like a massive parking   The cons to BTS are the following can get crowdy the air can be painfully cold at times quite loud considering that the tv is on all the time presenting ads that constantly repeat themselvesit can get a little annoying at one point

title: Wonderful
review: BTS in BKK is the very good choice for tourist But they should to expand route to another tourist attraction

title: A shame in public transport / Closing for Repairs
review: The rail link is falling apart and will be closing because things need to be fixed to run the rail link safe & someone forgot to order parts for train breaks etc  In addition poor planning when it was built because you can't link with the sky train BTS or MRT you arrive at a building that is not attached to other forms of public transportation

title: Interesting experience of Bangkok public transport
review: Walking away from the hotel to discover Bangkok street atmosphere then getting back fast using the skytrain once you are tired is a convenient arrangement Queueing for a ticket can be challenging when you don't know exactly at which station you will stop but the BTS staff will guide you and even exchange your bill into coins for the vendor machine

title: Great way to zip through BKK
review: We stayed at the Swissotel Concorde that was next to an MRT stop It was a great way to zip to the old city or out to the weekend market or to the Sumkumvit  area Cheap and easy with the one time purchase of the MRT smart card Just reload the card when you need to Very quiet rides very clean Rode it early mornings and late at night (*after 11pm when tuktuk by night tour ended) and no problems at stations or on the trains

title: Full
review: Stressfull travels always full and when you get out or in with a suitcase you get smashed because the sensor senses the suitcase first  Painful  But it was a quick solution to get to places and it went very often

title: Best way to get around quickly
review: Although only two lines exist it is still by far the fastest way to get around town Can be 10 times quicker tan taxi All trains are air conditioned so travel is always pleasant

title: Excellent way of seeing the most Bangkok has to offer in a short space of time
review: The trains were clean busy at times but enough seats or places to hold on cheap day ticket we visited around 10 stops between the two lines Excellently air conditioned which made the day easier would definitely recommend to travel using this method

title: COMFORTABLE TRAVEL
review: easy to follow instructions  comfortable travel in expensive  best in class to beat BANGKOK traffic

title: Wonderfully smooth
review: Great fast and reliable A very good and convenient way to get around to the different areas of the sprawling city

title: Very efficient
review: As tourists we try to use public transportation The BTS was easy to use good directions and very clean No issues

title: So easy to use.  and air con!!
review: Air conditioned carriages  and quick mode of transport very modern and efficient  Like all big cities it can get busy at peak times

title: Clean and fast (Air Con)
review: if you need to get somewhere fast use the MRT Its dirt cheap and easy to use Everyone station has English speakers

title: Easy travelking
review: Easy and cheap to use We travelled from the airport to the BTS and around to our hotel Attendants have enough English to help if you can’t decipher where to go but it really is a simple and safe transport system

title: Wonderful experience - outstanding guide
review: We had an really great experience on this tour  Our guide Tee was excellent with a lot of fascinating information to share along the way as well as valuable tips on what to do in order to make the most of our train and floating markets experience  We enjoyed the guide and your so much that we signed up for another tour offered by the same company the following day

title: Good way to avoid traffic jam
review: Taking the train is probably than taking taxi or tuk tuk on the road to avoid the traffic jam and negotiation of price If you have a rabbit card you could get around easily mainly using the light green and green line

title: A boon for the city with horrible traffic
review: the first thing you observe once you reach Bangkok roads is that the traffic everywhere is horrible at office times especially on Friday the roads are choked to an extend that a 25 km travel may take a good 15 hours to 2 hours of time Considering this the BTS skytrain is a boon to the city which keeps you out of traffic and helps you reach your destination in time at rush hours the trains are crowded so bringing in big luggage will not be a good idea The stations are good and mostly easy accessible

title: Reliable and quick transport to and from ther Suvarnabhumi
review: It can be somewhat crowded at times but it is an efficient cheap and reliable method of getting to and from the airport even with a  couple of smallish suitcasesLinks to BTS which is great

title: Worth the time and money
review: Value packed half day excursion to railway and floating markets The trip was beyond our expectations in a good way

title: Fast, clean and gets you to the main places
review: If you're staying near the areas with access to BTS Skytrain this is definitely a good travel option as it is cheap efficient and also comfortable and clean

title: best way to get around
review: By far the fastest way to get around bangkok and easy to figure out  The only bad thing is rush hour when you can be packed in a crowd and have to inch your way up as trains come and go

title: Cheap way to the city centre....
review: Nothing much to say other than its a fantastic cheap way to travel to the city centre The ticket price is 10 times cheaper than where i come from good frequency of service and connected to the BTS at Phaya Thai station

title: Fast and easy
review: Staying close to the BTS was great as it took you to all major shopping areas If it was peak hour and crowded you didn't have to wait long for the next one

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: I would highly recommend the skytrain The views are great and the train is airconditioned  The system is really easy to navigate and you can either get passes based on the number of trips you will take or a oneday unlimited pass for a great rate  During rush hour the train comes often and the wait was always manageable

title: Save cost for airport transfer
review: Fast and convenient save your taxi cost and time spent on traffic jam Easy access to main shopping area via exchange

title: Hightly recomment
review: Airport link is fast and convient… I recommend for everyone to take airport link  Becasue it is cheaper and faster Highly Recommend

title: Save money and your time to Airport
review: Train pass the city center so easy to take a train if you don't have any luggages and can pick up to station Only half an hour to Suvanabhum Airport from the center Maximum fare only 45 Baht

title: Good if you have long layover
review: We were having layover of About 13 hours we boarded and reached the destination very fast and convientely

title: Remember the need for connections in the city!
review: There are two different forms of service the express line from Phaya Thai in the city to Suvanaphoum Airport with two stops on the way for 90 baht one way and the commuter line with multiple stops for 45 baht The latter gets very crowded at peak travel times and can be unpleasant especially if you have significant luggage That said the trip is less than 30 minutes so it is tolerable Getting to and from the airport end is a breeze but at the city end you still need to get to your hotel one way or another The link with the BTS skyway is simple but you need another ticket and many stations require you to carry luggage up and down steps The BTS trains are often full and luggage can be a hassle And finally you need to get from the BTS to your hotel sometimes on sidewalks which are not all that suited to wheeled luggage So you need to consider where you are staying before choosing the link

title: Easy to use with friendly people if you get lost.
review: Very easy to use even if you are new to mass transit  A lot of Thai people speak English and will help if you look confused or lost  It is very safe  So travel without fear

title: Fantastic transport
review: Brilliant easy to use clean and cheap  Caught the skytrain down to the river then caught a free ferry to the Mandarin Oriental for lunch fab day

title: Cheap and Easy
review: The Skytrain is very cheap always remarkably clean efficient and above all very easy to use  Definitely an easier and cheaper way to get around Bangkok

title: Easy riding
review: When we going around in Bangkok we always use BTS Skytrain or MRT Metro which is a easy and fast way to traveling around the city

title: Perfect way to get into the city
review: The rail link from the airport is by far the best way to get into town Road traffic can be hectic at times so avoid it by taking the airport link It is cheap fast and airconditioned Tickets are easily purchased and there are clear maps in the carriages

title: Reliable
review: BTS is by far the most reliable public transit system I have ever used It is also very affordable and so easy to figure out even if you don't have any knowledge of the Thai language

title: Clean, Convenient, Cost effective, Regular Schedules
review: Connected to Airport Rail Link from RMT Found it to be Clean Convenient Cost effective and met my schedule needs Traveling Solo with one carry bag but there were ample space & luggage area for the larger luggage

title: Works well
review: Easy to understand how to get to where you need to Works well and efficient  I have nothing else to say nothing else to say nothing else to say

title: Comfort and easy travel to and from the airport....
review: This is the first time I have availed this train service and It was the very first visit of my teenage daughter to Bangkok She enjoyed it as her first ever experiencethe mapping and location directions are nicely places on each station its cheap for solo or couple travelers If you are travelling in a group I would advise to take prepaid taxi services it will be cheaper compare to train

title: Fastest way to city
review: This is the fastest and wisest way out of BKK apt to cityeasily connected with most of the downtown Metro lines and if u are not having heavy luggages then this is your best way to city rather than taxi in busy BKK trafficmost of the reputed hotels are near metro stations so it easily accessible though this A must try when u visit BKK

title: Good trip, booked with 12GO Asia
review: The train is great it was a good experience We had the train no 9 (Bangkok to Chiang Mai) This train was very new and very clean There are enough toilets on board The train has a few stops sometimes in the middle of the night This felt not always safe Also there was not much choice for food you could buy a lot of candy and that kind of stuff But not a decent (payable) meal were you could lift on for the night

title: Efficient way to travel in Bangkok
review: I only used the skytrain once on our last day in Bangkok but wish I had used it sooner  So much easier than taking a taxi as Bangkok traffic is very heavy  The trains are very clean

title: Uncomfortable and don’t do it hungover
review: We were picked up by our guide gang who was great throughout   From our pick up at the mbk mall and driven 90 minutes across Bangkok in the small bus which is quite uncomfortable (I’m 6 foot 2 and found it pretty cramped and very warm   We took the most uncomfortable and over crowded train to maeklong station and the view is rice fields and shanty villages   We had 10 minutes at maeklong station to see the train leave then take the bus to the floating market where u get left for half an hour to get something to eat then into the small boats which are a struggle for anyone of any sizeable stature for a quick 10 minutes around a square of water where locals are selling the usual stuff  I’m honestly glad I’ve done this as an experience after seeing it on tv etc but if you have mobility issues getting in and out the boat may be an issue   Then back 90 minutes on the bus to drop off personally I feel it’s not worth it but very glad I have for the experience   I feel it’s such a long day for such a small time on a boat and the maeklong market is very very very overcrowded and absolutely stinking   I would never go back but I’m glad I’ve experienced it

title: Easy and clean
review: Do yourself a favour  and experience Bangkok like a local The BTS is very easy to navigate and signage is also in English The trains are new and beautiful with air conditioning

title: good experience
review: We took the night train from Chiang Mai to Bangkok leaving at 5 PM and arriving around 6 AM the next day at Bangkok   We had a lower & upper beds and met a very funny thai guy whith whom I spoke hours & hours about all & nothing   The beds were more or less clean to be honest but the staff bring you covers and clean if necessary the bed so for me it was fine but for some people it may not  We arrive a little late (1H) at bangkok but it was not a drama  Then from the railway station you can take taxi tuk tuk subwayplenty of options   If you do the travel from Bangkok to Chiang mai you can reach the old city from the railway station for more or less BHT 100 with a tuk tuk

title: Leap of faith.
review: It's actually brilliant and very easy and so much cheaper that taxi or Tuc Tuc  Air conditioned with HD monitors showing ads TFL please note

title: It's a typical train ride easy to get places.
review: Pleasant enough gets you from a to b without too much hassle During busy periods and seasons expect to be a sardine Wasn't disappointed it's a public train afterall Reasonably priced

title: lovely n fast
review: tickets are nicely priced trains clean and very less wait time found it amazing to see the city from that height

title: Great transit in Bangkok
review: Easy to use good prices and efficient travel around Bangkok I get a Rabbit card so I don't have to buy a ticket each time I want o go somewhere

title: Convenient transport
review: BTS skytrain and MRT are two separate operators For new visitors to Bangkok to change from one to the other at interchange can be confusing because the stations are named differently and the route maps at stations do not show stations of the other system The stations of BTS skytrain are not equipped with lifts and escalators As these stations are above road level it is stressful for visitors without a pair of strong legs to climb up and down the staircases

title: Tourism breakdown
review: Always late and not enough trains Unbelievably poor service and staff has a low selfesteem Don't use it Also not connected with any of the other public transportation If you are a backpackers and want to save money and have time to waste I guess you'll be OK

title: Great Way To Get Around Bangkok.
review: This is just sooooooo simple I buy my Rabbit Card when I first arrive at the BTS SKY TRAIN station preload the card with around THB1500 & then travel all around Bangkok You put your pre paid card on the scanner on top of the metal barriers when you enter the station & you scan it again at the barriers when you leave the station at your destination It's really cheap & by preloading the card I don't have to put money in the machines & get a cardboard ticket to use the service nor do I have to have the right money for the stops I want When I leave Bangkok there is always some money remaining on the card & I always find someone to give it to A fantastic way to get around Bangkok Obviously there is a bit of a crush at peak times but generally its pretty easy to get a seat or standing place Please be aware of the seats reserved for monks I hate it when I see monks left standing on the BTS because some foreign tourist can' t be bothered to read the signs on the seats & give them up

title: Great Value
review: We used this transport heapsgot a day pass for 140THB each & got our monies worth as it gave us the opportunity to see the outer parts of Bangkokloved the Shopping Mall of Samrong as it was a lot quieter than central Bangkok

title: travel to the heart of Bangkok
review: Just take this train it takes you to the center of Bangkok where you can take the skytrain to the area of your hotel Much nicer than a "rip you off taxi"

title: Should Make Rabbit Card More Popular with Every Value Refundable in Full
review: BTS is a good transport but not that efficient in the stage of ticket purchase The queue for buying tickets (at counter or machine) is usually TERRIBLE I think they should promote more the use of Rabbit card (we have similar card in Hong Kong) But I learned that the B100 for purchasing the card is nonrefundable I think this is unreasonable I think so long as a person hasn't lost the card and returns it to the issuer heshe should have got a full refund For this reason I didn't buy the Rabbit card   If the use of Rabbit card is promoted well I think the queue can largely be reduced   The compartment inside the train is cozy particularly I like the good ventilation it's cool enough with fresh air People are like sadine fish sometimes as train inside fully packed

title: MRT service is efficient. However pack even on weekends. Locals lack courtesy to give away priority seats to senio
review: NET service is efficient with clean trains However still pack on weekends Locals still lack courtesy to give up seats to senior citizens

title: Boom... Airport to City in 30-45mins
review: When i first travelled to Bangkok The Skytrain was still under construction  Now i couldn't imagine travelling into the city any other way  first time travellers will find it super easy to purchase and understand tickets and destinations and the price @ either 45 or 90 baht (saves 15mins on the journey)  means its the most cost effective way and easiest way to land smack bang in the middle of town

title: Way To Go
review: The Skytrain is convenient and air conditioned You need 1 5 and 10 baht coins to buy tickets from the vendor machine A day pass costs THB 130 giving you unlimited trips

title: Beating the Jams
review: Excellent means to travel during peak hours to avoid the traffic jams Convenient comfortable and affordable way to reach most of the important landmarks of Bangkok

title: Easy to use, but not much better than just taking MRT
review: Ont our return to the airport we decided to just take the MRT to the airport It was cheaper and did not arrive much later than the 'Airport Express' I did not really see the advantage to taking a special Airport train Of course it's much better than playing games with Bangkok traffic

title: Excellent service
review: With options of fully express into KL central partial express stopping at a few stations or stopping all stations the rail out of KL airport is fantastic Efficient quick lots of trains and good amounts of room Getting to the airport can be quite crowded and busy

title: Airport to my hotel on Sukhumvit Road in 30 minutes for only a few dollars!
review: I boarded at the lowest level of the airport for a smooth ride going to the end of the line where I was able to then transfer to the BTS sky train and ride to the station near my hotel  The price can't be beat and you will save hour(s) over taking a taxi and dealing with Bangkok traffic  Airport link and BTS require separate fares

title: Simple to use
review: Sky train is simple and easy to use  Buy tickets on platform then off you go  Easy way to get around and keeps you away from the traffic below

title: Good Option to travel on budget
review: very good option to travel on budget to maximum places in bangkok only drawback is not direct connectivity to airport

title: The underground version of BTS
review: It's similar to BTS just that it's underground If only there is linked walkway from the BTS it will be much more convenient

title: Very small
review: Looked small and seats are not comfortable and safety wise in stations there are no barricades the stations are not comfortable for passengers

title: Convenient to access the shopping malls
review: Spends but fast  don't forget to bring a jacket on board air condition very powerful suggest buy day ticket

title: Only way to travel, quick direct and not expensive
review: This is brilliant and pity we have none in Australia They are people movers No drinking or eating permitted so clean and guess what no vandalism Seems they address vandalism and deter it  it works They have rules about standing and entering the train so it works well They have guards to ensure things are in order It is a seriously good way to travel there and certainly extends your comfort in being able to determine your own destiny

title: Easiest way to travel
review: Skytrain also known as BTS There are 2 main route now but there will be other route coming up soon The major lines are Sukhumvit line from Bearing to Mo Chit Another one is Silom line   To get ticket is easy change coin as per your stating that you wanna go I do recommend if you plan traveling by BTS lots get your daily ticket at every station It's valid til midnight without unlimited use   Make sure that you know the exit that you will use Escalator and elevator are provided

title: Fastest Mode
review: Airport rail link one of the fastest and convenient way to reach the airport and the service is also good

title: OK
review: It is nice to use the skytrain They are clean and very great when the traffic is busy It is not that cheap as we thought it would be but it was fine

title: The convenient way travelling in Bangkok
review: The traffic in Bangkok is terrible You will be caught by the traffic jam from 7am to 9pm in down town So BTS is my choice travelling in Bangkok city You can also connect to the Airport Express with BTS  BTS can also bring you to most of the tourist points  The only downside of BTS is they do not provide escalators in most of the stations So you will need a strong arm carrying your luggage up and down the platforms

title: Very good service
review: We used this from the airport to get to the train station and it is a very good swift and easy to use service along with being very clean we would use this again when in thailand

title: Safe
review: Efficient clean easy  frequent cheap air conditioning most of all feel comfortable and safe when using

title: Better than taking a taxi...
review: as long as the train goes near where you want to be   It's efficient and seems pretty reliable but it only covers a small fraction of the entire city  Fares are very cheap but best to ensure you have plenty of change for the ticket machines rather than queuing up to pay at a counter

title: Avoid the Traffic Jams
review: The airport rail link runs from the centre of Bangkok (Phaha Thai) to Survanabhumi Airport The trains run fairly frequently and it’s cheaper than a Taxi The greatest advantage is that you avoid the traffic jams which are a feature of the city   The disadvantage is that connections with other lines is fairly limited and unless your destination is near a station you’ll probably end up taking a taxi anyway

title: THE COOLEST QUICKEST CHEAPEST WAY TO TRAVEL !
review: I have been using this service BST for many years what is not to like On the trains   verbal directions are   in Thai and in English with  picture route maps above every exit door  they are very clean and very cool Trains which arrive approx every 35mins if there is a delay it will be announced on the platform you can obtain the change you need for your ticket at every station at a pay info desk if you do not wish to use a ticket vending machines no problem you can  use the change desk They are very busy and well used but they are a pleasure to travel on and so quick  Thais are very well behaved good mannered people tourists workers from all over the world  mingle in harmony amongst throngs of people

title: Avoid the traffic jams
review: Used the airport link for the first time yesterday to fly back to Chiang Mai  Cheap clean efficient and so much quicker and easier than struggling in the traffic

title: Don't hesitate - book this trip!
review: This is such a great trip and amazing value for money I did it on my own and it was fab  Jenny was a great guide very knowledgeable You see so much  the railway market was amazing and the floating markets were a bit touristy but still great fun I def reccomend the mango sticky rice from the second market  This trip was a highlight of my time in Bangkok would absolutely reccomend

title: Thoonthongjai Sainet
review: I'm mrthoon as a taxi driver The sevenseat family car at Bangkok type steers foreign customers Phan's trip to the River Kwai Death Railway Great excitement and stunning views of the surrounding people I hope to come again so beautiful to me

title: Reliable
review: Its safe informativeclean and cheap way to travel in BKK and the customer service is pleasant and helpful too  CONSNO LIFT at certain stationits difficult for tramsbuggy for the kiddos

title: fantastic example of public transportation
review: Reliable fas cheapconvenient From suitsties to elephant pajama pants people you'll find everyone on the BTS Only way to travel in BKK

title: Regular and fast
review: Easy to use really frequent with air conditioned but extremely over populated usage Prepare to stand in your neighbour's arm pit

title: Brilliant
review: The Skytrain is simply excellent Always on time Always clean Very good value for money Be prepared for busy platforms and trains at peak times but no more than the London Underground It is the best way to get around Bangkok

title: Convenient and fast way out of the airport.
review: It is pleasantly fast and convenient to travel out of the airport If you are travelling light with children that can handle their own luggage this is a good and fast alternative to taking taxi But most of the time we have more luggage when we leave Bangkok so we would still take taxi on our way to the airport

title: Very easy
review: It is very easy to ride the skytrain Perfect to get around town  Buy a rabbitcard or tickets for each jorney Can be a little crowded some times but no trouble even with kids

title: Easyt to get about
review: To get about the city is quite easy signs are also in English best to get a map although there are maps at the stations

title: I wish metro in London was the same
review: Great train spacious fast no delays air conditioning on I wish trains in Europe were as reliable and modern and were offering the same service as metro in Asia So far Tokyo Seul and Bangkok make a big competition for London and Paris tubes

title: Fast, Easy, and Convenient
review: Just like the title says This will take you all the way to the Sky Train and you can get any where you want from there

title: Easy Peasy to use
review: I find this so convenient to use and just simple to use  At each ticket machine is a map of the system and you find the station you plan to go to and it tells you what the cost will be   Then at the ticket machine you first select that amount on the machine and then insert your coins (no bills but you won't need any bills)  A ticket pops out and you take it to the entrance machine where you insert it  That same ticket then pops up where you need to take it and then and only then does the gate open allowing you to enter to the trains    They're usually very well used and as such are a bit crowded most of the day but a very convenient way to get around an otherwise traffic riddled Bangkok

title: Great way to get to the airport
review: If you have a minimal amount of luggage there is no better way to get to Suvarnabhumi airport cheaply and quickly You can connect to the Airport Rail Link from any BTS line just follow the maps posted everywhere in the stations The BTS has announcements at every stop in both Thai and English Get off when Airport Rail Link is announced and proceed to the train It is really cheap and easy and you avoid all the traffic in Bangkok My only reservation would be trying to get a lot of luggage on I am 63 and only do this with a carryon A younger person can probably manage more

title: Great trip
review: Amazing trip Railway market and floating market tour in the same day was perfect on schedule good guide and driver

title: Fantastic
review: This is by far the best transport system we have travelled on in any city in the world It is fast cleaninexpensive & extremely efficient 1000's of people use it all the time & it is rarely overcrowded as the next train is only minutes away The BTS System covers most of the City & also is an inexpensive & fast way to get to the Airport on time  particularly in peak traffic times which are a constant in Bangkok If only Melbourne had installed a similar service from The Airport & around the City instead of the inefficient & expensive Myki

title: Smooth traveling
review: Great way to get around if your destination is near the sky train station Good air condition so you can cool off from the heat on the street The trains are pretty crowded so it isn't  the best way to get a view over Bangkok from the train

title: quick, cheap little too cold
review: it is easy to travel but take a pullover with you bc it is really cold inside you can also reach connecting lines to airport via phata ya

title: Convenient link to airport
review: convenient link to the main shopping areas From the train stations along the route it is just a short walk to the hotel The fare is considered quite affordable

title: Super fun day at 2 very different markets!
review: This half day tour was so much fun The van picked us up at our hotel and we drove to the train market We paused halfway to get some fooddrinks and use the bathroom and they provided water bottles for all of us The train market itself was really cool but it felt like we weren't given enough time to explore it Our tour guide Jogi was very nice and shared some knowledge and tips about the market He also gave us some local fruit cakes to try from a market vendor Then we went to the floating market where we ate lunch and were given more time to explore We rode boats through the waterways and you can haggle with vendors on the water or on the banks All in all it was an awesome day I recommend to be prepared for the hot weather I'd say the trip in total took longer than expected 8 hours instead of 6 But we really enjoyed it The only thing I would change is the van was very shaky so if you suffer from motion sickness be prepared or bring medication

title: Always Kept Clean
review: We use the trains most of the time and from multiple visits over six years Its always kept clean Stations too are clean Now they have an improved variety of food offerings at most station entrance levels

title: clean friendly station
review: on arrival at the station the taxi drop off was organised as we entered the station there was a tourist information kiosk to guide visitor the lady was more than helpful extremely friendly and seemed genuinely interested in our stay in Thailand We arrived in time for the national anthem aroun 6pm i think and everyone stood to attention there was plenty of seating available as we had about an hours wait before we got the overnight sleeper train 13 to chiang mai We found the food very nice and within a short period of time found the train was ready to board it was easy to find the car number and our seats thoroughly loved the experience

title: Easy to find, quick clean travel
review: We used Skytrain for getting around Bangkok as much as we could because it was inexpensive easily accessible from our hotel and easy to figure out the route we needed  The trains are clean safe areas on time  what else can you want  The only possible negative for some people was the stairs to get to the Skytrain  perhaps they have elevators

title: No traffic transportation
review: Taking a BTS in bangkok is a must Traffic jam is very serious during the day and should be avoided Take a BTS

title: Just as easy and safe as the Skytrain!
review: After several trips to Bangkok I finally tried the MRT  I have been a big fan and user of the Skytrain over the years given the traffic issues  I was worried about a dark and unsafe subway adventure but true to Thailand's culture the MRT was very clean efficient and extremely safe  For first timers I suggest you google some videos that show you how to buy tickets  Overall it runs just like the Skytrain with regards to the transit maps and boarding process  I do suggest you bring some coins or the smallest bills to use in the auto ticket machine otherwise you'll get a lot of coins as change  Another tip is that unless you have a multiple use card you be issued a plastic "coin" to use on each paid trip as your ticket The ticket machine will give you this coin  You don't deposit the coin in the exit gate until after you trip concludes  When first entering you tap the coin on the machine reader and the gate opens  This wasn't explained well on the videos I saw  Happy Travels

title: Memories
review: It was so emotional for us to travel this railway knowing the lives that were lost But also proud of the achievements that many men made  My dear friend was captured in Singapore and worked on ten different camps from Bang Pong to just beyond Hell Fire Pas and survived What a great man

title: Easy to get around bangkok
review: Easy way to get around the city with a 140 Bhatt day pass even to get down to wharf to catch the tourist boat up the river

title: Give me my coins!
review: You will need your coins to board the train but do not fret if you only have bank notes You can exchange your bank notes to the teller and in return they will give you the coin equivalent  What you need to do is go to the machineteller and push the button of the desired amount For example if your destination has the number 20 written on it you put in 20 Baht worth of coins and it will give you a Singe Journey ticket to your destination  It is the easiest way to go around Bangkok and the train is very clean and very friendly to tourist Each station also has information counters where in you can get maps or ask someone who speaks English  No need to take the taxi or tuk tuk with the Skytrain connecting the major areas of which you can see Bangkok Operational hours from 6 am to 11pm

title: It’ the best transport manner from Suvanarbhumi airport to Phaya Thai
review: Quicker than taxi and low cost though it was a bit cramp on the train I would love to try it again

title: quick and efficient
review: Skytrain in Bangkok can easily take you to any location your need It is quick and efficient for travel The only bad thing there that it has very strong ear conditioning system that blows on you and you can get freeze after the hit staying outside

title: A reason to fly to BKK instead of DMK
review: Everyone who ever took the public transit bus from DMK airport to Bangkok for about 2 hours knows the hardship that entails   Solution   Fly to BKK and take the Airport Link into Bangkok   All it will cost you is 45 Baht & 30 minutes and you can get yourself & your suitcases comfortably into the center of Bangkok   NO need to take a taxi   I've even progressed to the point of booking hotels close to the terminus station of this line when staying in Bangkok

title: Efficient - Easy
review: If you want one way to get around some of the major areas of mid town bangkok then use the Skytrain Plenty of stations and very easy to use as a visitor And the ticet prices are way cheap once converted into US$ or GBP Its clean and quick but can be crowded  Good way to move around

title: Very fast, simple to understand
review: Its a great option to move around at Bancoc outside of the old town You can also use it to go to sur airport

title: Great connection to shopping malls
review: There were numerous malls between National Stadium to Asok and many are connected directly from the stations

title: BTS
review: Trains not frequent enough  Network still quite limited No agreement with underground metro makes it sometimes cumbersome for the few interconnecting stations available

title: Easy and clean
review: Must take with the high traffic of bangkok Easy to understand the map it is clean with air con It is a must take because of the non stop traffic of bangkok it will saves you hours

title: fun, fast and clean
review: Include this mode of transportation during your stay in Bangkok to avoid traffic and haggling with tuk tuk drivers Save your lungs and ride the BTS

title: Convenient, fast, low cost
review: This Airport Rail Link really did the trick for me when I traveled to Bangkok's main airport (BKK)  Fast very inexpensive comfortable  But allow plenty of time to find the station even if you're taking a cab to get there  My driver had to zig zag back and forth before we finally located the station entrance

title: Efficient and cool!
review: Well run and not too crowded the ticket machines were relatively easy to navigate for a beginner and non Thai speaker However the best thing was how cool they were to ride on after the heat and humidity of the streets

title: Exploration above Bangkok
review: This attraction has lost a star because of the hardness of finding the lifts & escalators Other than that it is a wonderful way of seeing a lot of Bangkok The stations clean & spacious The trains are regular & only 33 Baht from Nana to the start of the Airport Link Praya Thai  I was surprised & impressed by the safety on the platforms The attendants are very attentive & alert as well as  courteous Like all “Metros” the Skytrain can be extremely full at times

title: One of the best
review: This train system can rake you almost anywhere  If going to Khao San Road take train to harbor and boat to Pha Arir (N13) and then 399 meters to Khao San Road  Cheap eats and cheap hotels

title: Great way to get around
review: Fast cheap and a great way to get around Can be a little tricky to initially understand but once you get the hang of it it’s great Trains come every couple of minutes so you are never waiting long fully air conditioned and usually very crowded But as I said very cheap and probably the quickest way to get around

title: Poor signage, lack of escalators and infrequent trains
review: The Airport Link is a great idea but it is let down by poor signage (a lot of which still seems to be temporary) and hardly any lifts or escalators which is unforgivable when most of the passengers are expected to come from the airport loaded with luggage The City Line service which stops at several stations on the way to the airport comes every 15 minutes which is OK but nowhere near as frequent as the BTS Skytrain The Express service leaves every half hour which is very inconvenient plus it's overpriced at 100 Baht to go to the airport Overall if you live near a station along the line it's OK to use the City line to commute to other places along the line but I'd only use it to go to the airport if I was travelling alone with very light luggage or if I was travelling there with no bags eg to meet someone there

title: Another adequate form of transportation
review: Another adequate form of transportation between the MRT BTS and the boats you should be able to get to most anything

title: My favorite way to get around the City
review: The MRT service in Bangkok is simply amazing I think I would miss out on half the places I have visted in Bangkok if MRT didn't exist Although the payasyougo ticketing process is a bit more complicated than that of the BTS but one will eventually learn to do it in no time

title: Just a metro above ground
review: We were looking forward to riding the Skytrain but were left somewhat deflated The trains aren’t all that modern and don’t really facilitate any great views of the city It is literally just a metro system above ground which is fine as far as public transportation goes but we expected more of an experience If you need to take it to get from A to B then fine but I wouldn’t go out of my way to take a ride

title: crowded
review: I have used this service a couple of times and I find it a convenient service if you do not have much baggage The price is about 2 Euros and it is very orderly

title: Airport Rail Link
review: This is the 1st time that I had ever took a Airport Rail to the city center It was a nice experience the staff at the station were very helpful The journey was smooth and fast If you are two persons or alone and on leisure holiday  I would recommend this mode of travel to the city  is convenient  fast smooth and cheap Is only and $3545bth Is the cheapest that I have ever paid for a train service to the city in any country that I have been before  One can connect to the MRT ( Dark Blue Line ) at Makkasan to many places such as Patpong at  Sala Daeng Station  Huai Khwang station where the famous Sooboom Seafood are and the night market and further north you can find Chatuchak weekend market You can also connect at Phaya Thai to light green line and explore the shopping belt along Sukhumvit  such as MBK near Siam and Siam Paragon  Central World etc  Most important taking the Airport Rail line you are sure of the time reaching town center Traffic in Bangkok can be really terrible I was once caught up with traffic Jam for more than two hours from Airport to Town That two hours could have gone to a good foot massage and shopping or some cold beer somewhere Trust me traffic are really bad in Bangkok  always take the subway  Best of luck travelers

title: Clean and efficient public transportation
review: This is very convenient for solo or couple travelers I did not have to wait for more than 5 minutes to catch any train  I hope the government will extend this line to the Grand Palace area

title: So easy
review: It's just like taking the Metro in Los Angeles Everything is listed (maps) and the speaker announces which exit is coming next

title: Easy convenient travel
review: I wish Los Angeles had transportation like BTS Easy way to cruise around the city Very affordable Busy but functions smoothly Loved the option to be taken into the airport as well

title: Excellent, fast and cheap
review: This is a great way to get downtown without all of the traffic  It only cost 45 RMB to get down to where we swapped and got the BTS  Really efficient clean and well worth using  Would definitely use this again instead of the clogged traffic ways

title: Great day out
review: We really enjoyed this trip The guide was wonderful and really looked after us I highly recommend taking this excursion

title: Clean and Efficient
review: WE used the sky train frequently and found it to be a fast effective and relatively cheap method of travel especially to further places of interest from the immediate centre No eating or drinking is allowed and hence the trains are very clean The manners of the train users in waiting and giving up seats for disabled people was excellent

title: Fast, clean, safe, cheap and efficient
review: Excellent way to get around Bangkok Goes to areas not covered by the BTS You can get to Hua Lamphong (main Thai railway station connecting all of Thailand and beyond) via the MRT and the whole of the Thai railway is then at your disposal and very good it is too If you are over 65 get an 'elder' card you get a 50% reduction on the MRT available at all MRT stations Like the BTS trains are frequent clean and safe Good if you can avoid peak times as it gets very busy 18 stations in all running from Bang Sue to Hua Lamphong next to Chinatown Cost is cheap a seven station run cost me 15THB (£033GBP) double the cost if under 65 years old

title: Best mode of travel around town
review: From my favourite hotel in phaya thai it is a quick walk to the MRT stars and I can travel to all the malls  MBK the golf outlet station The trains are clean and prompt such a great way to get around

title: The longest 16 hours ever!
review: We took the 51 train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai We were in second class fan sleeper We tried to get better class on an earlier train but they were all sold out by the time our travel agent got back to us (If you are thinking about doing this make sure you really harass whoever you contact and get in really early to avoid this problem)  The first thing we noticed is that the train smelt like the inside of a butt I am 5"4' and even I found he bed a little small I imagine the top bed in a prison is more desirable than the top bed on this train The train is lousy and bumpy meaning that even if you do get to sleep it will be broken and unsatisfying  The real test of patience arrives in the morning You wake up early from your terrible sleep and the helpful attendant comes and turns your bed into a seat You then get to sit and look at some very plain countryside for the next 8 hours You have random very long stops at stations with no people there and at one point there was lots of smoke coming from under one of our carriages The delays are explained in thai (I presume) but we had no idea why we were stopped  There is no food cart where you can break your boredom by binge eating so you just have to sit in the hot butt stench until you finally arrive at Chiang mai at about 2 in the afternoon 16 hours after departure  Maybe take an earlier train but do not take the 51 train Fly catch a bus walk roll crawl but DO NOT take the 51 train (Unless you enjoy unpleasant smells and wasting most of a day of your holiday)

title: Convenient way to explore Bangkok.
review: Riding the BTS skytrain is an inexpensive fast and convenient way to explore Bangkok However the trains get overly crowded during the peak rush hour from 5 PM on wards so plan your trip accordingly to avoid the crowds Also be aware that most ticket dispensing machines will only accept coins so you have to look for the machine that will take bills

title: Chiang Mai to Bangkok - Train 9 or 10 Sleeper Train (NEWER TRAINS)
review: We got the Number 9 Sleeper train from Chiang Mai to Bangkok For people complaining they saw great travel vlogsblogs and then ended up on an old train you must get the number 9 OR 10 train  the others are very old and do not compare in qualitycomfort  For us as two adults it was actually the same price to buy a first class cabin with 2 beds as it was to get 2 beds in the standard class part of the train anyway Our cabin was comfy and we got our own sink space to change and a small table and plug socket   Toilets were fine but I would recommend being the opposite end to the toilets if you get to choose when you book We booked our tickets via 12goAsia as we found they sold the tickets cheaper online and it was all pretty easy You just pick the tickets up from a hotel opposite Chiang Mai station and they even let us leave our bags there for the day before we got the train   The staff do try and sell you food and drinks in the first class section as they make a commission on anything you buy We had some hot drinks which were fine  tea and hot chocolate but had already bought our own food with us   The sheets were clean and the beds pretty comfy and the staff come and make up your beds about an hour into the journey and put them away again in the morning just before you arrive Overall pretty easy journey and we enjoyed going to sleep and getting to wake up in a new place hours later

title: excellent mode of transport to get to the airport
review: This way to get to the airport is reliable and cheap  For me it is the best thing is that I can be sure what time I will arrive  very clean and efficient

title: Efficient and clean
review: This was a new addition since my last visit but it was very appreciated  It's a quick and efficient way to get around town at a very reasonable cost  It's also clean and tidy as you cannot eat or drink on it and most people seem to adhere to this rule  Buying tickets can take some time as it's generally very busy and they don't have too many ticket offices open  If you have plenty of change you could use the machines as they aren't too hard but you do need change

title: Quick !
review: Straight out of the airport Very fast Very clean and on time Always busy and safe too Watch the locals on their phones

title: Convenient and fast
review: Along with the BTS the MRT a fast cheap convenient way to get around Bangkok avoiding the city chaos standstill traffic and humidity

title: Easy and fast
review: Hands down the simplest form of transportation in Bangkok Traffic jams and protests made getting around on land quite difficult but the sky train saved us   Prices range from 15baht to about 47baht depending on length of journey Day pass for 130baht proved quite useful too

title: Clean and spacious
review: Fast and Efficient easy to book  The skytrain was cheap and it is a good way to see more of Bangkok from above

title: Well connected & helpful for tourists
review: we used the tourist pass for a day to visit places & this surely saved our money & time the BTS is very well connected & the day pass covers most of the stations a tourist will need to go

title: Cheap, fast and convenient
review: Cost and timeefficient way of getting to the city Not to forget it's also very comfortable and hasslefree

title: Quick, Clean and efficient
review: This service is very good Punctual clean but can be a little overcrowded  It is a preferable mode of travel to road as the traffic in and around Bangkok is manic

title: Efficient
review: Purchase the all day ticket only 140 bht Which other large city can you get this value Service also very good

title: Practical and efficient
review: Easy to use Information available also in English in the stations Trains also with infromation (written and spoken)

title: A must.

title: Closed from my hotel
review: This is the best way to travelling around Very good price for the traveler like us We are so happy with this type of transportation

title: Avoid peak Hour!
review: This is a great way to get around Bangkok though strongly advise you avoid peak hour or 10pm services (as all the malls shut and a secondary peak hour commences) The other big piece of advice is grab yourself a rabbit card it will help you stretch out your money as they journey caps after so many trips in a day

title: Quiet and cheap
review: Works well cheap and clean really good aircon to keep you Kool Easy to buy tickets at the airport and when we used it at nite was not packed so got a seat easily

title: Quick and safe
review: I took a trip on the airport link from the airport to downtown Bangkok You have to go to lower level of the airport terminal easy to find and very convenient The train itself is very clean and safe and you can get away from bad traffic You can also connect to BTS station and one BTS station is connected to the river boat deck Once you arrive in downtown you need to prepare small local currency from the airport and name of the hotel you want to go written in Thai on a piece of paper since most Taxi drivers do not know English Crazy enough You can even stay at the airport hotel for a few night and enjoy Bangkok by train

title: Beware of rush hours
review: For traveler who come from or go to Suvarnbhumi airport please avoid rush hours in the morning and evening The train is very crowdedyour luggage will be obstruct and really inconvenient

title: Great, easy to reach, cheap train service
review: Plus it's a scenic route on an elevated train thru 'slice of life' Bangkok neighborhoods Take the train to the airport and can even change to a bus to Pattaya from there

title: Cheap, clean and fast
review: BTS is such a great way to beat the traffic jams that frequent Bangkok  It is very reliable and runs frequently  Can change lines with greatest of ease and the best part is it's always super clean and airconditioned  One of the most reliable and cheapest forms of public transport anywhere in the world

title: Bangkok September 29th
review: Excellent small group tour to visit Damnoen Saduak Floating Market and travelling with Maeklong Train A lot and detailed information received from our guide Thay women SARA who conducted great this trip Very  happy

title: Very convenient and cheap
review: We used sky trains to go everywhere They are really convenient and fastest mean of transport Bangkok road are too busy and gets jammed sky train can save one a lot of time The only one drawback was that we had a little boy in a pram and taking him up and down from the station was sometimes very hard as there were no escalators or lifts So we had to carry his pram up and down the stairs With hot weather this would result in us getting sweaty Otherwise very convenient

title: clean and cheap
review: the skytrain is affordable and timely very clean and fast during certain times of the day it gets super packed but everyone is kind and plesant there are escalators to go up but uyou must walk down via stairs

title: Wow!!!! It's cheap, fast and very comfortable!
review: I wanted to experience as much as possible when travelling to Thailand so I decided to try most of its vehicles local bus subway train tuk tuk song theow boat motorbike and of course sky train in Bangkok  That was a little strange at first for me because everything is totally automatic from buying ticket at machines to checking and going on the train However Thai people are very friendly and helpful always willing to give out instructions for me so it was totally easy to choose destination get ticket and just go I was going from Victory Monument to Chatuchak Market  only 31 bath incredibe cheap On the train you can enjoy the lanscape of the city as well as enjoy the train itself It í very clean cool and fast Such a convenient way to transfer in Bangkok

title: train ride
review: awesome train to be in nice clean and spacious walkway well ventilated There's always an interesting place in every stop

title: THE CHEAPEST AND BEST WAY TO GET TO BANGKOK
review: We have used the train on a number of occasions and find it the cheapest and best way to get to Bangkok  We go to the end of the line and a cab from there takes us to the Vie Hotel for the cost of 100 baht

title: Airport Rail Link
review: Very convenient and cheap mode of transport for linking the airport and city just need to change once for BTS or MRT

title: second class sleeper
review: Second class sleeper to Surat Thani  The lower berth are much better and bigger The light is on all night be prepared (bring airplane night shades) It might be freezing cold  but nice slow way to travel

title: Easy access to most places
review: Bangkok's sky train is excellent Gets you to most sites we need at a very low cost and a lot faster than any other means of travel We usually use it to go to the weekend market at Mo Chit which is quick and easy and costs 42 Baht Cheap cheap cheap

title: Lovely holiday
review: There are many ways to travel around Bangkok and it is probably far cheaper and more simple  very recommended

title: excellent way to get around Bangkok
review: I always found this train system very good clean and efficient However the ticketing machines are not really designed for foreigners so they take a bit to understand although most Thais are very helpful I inserted small coins (fare was 32  hath) and the small coins kept getting rejected then the lady behind me gave me a 5 bhath coins and it workedIf you are in Bangkok for a longer time best to get their rabbit card and top it up as you go along Get the map most useful However if you are travelling in off peak times and in a small group it may be better to take a taxi Fares when compared to taxis are not exactly cheap (I am comparing to say Moscow or Delhi metro rates)

title: Could be better
review: Could be better if more English signs are there Cheap means of transport clean trains coming on time but sometimes it is over crowded (in office hours)

title: Busy at certain times
review: A good link to get from the airport to city centre Very busy from 79am and 58pm Outwith this you should manage without a lot of luggage

title: Sad and inspirational at the same time
review: Such an amazing site to visit the history here defies imagination What the POW’s went through was tough to say the very least Our tour took us to the Bridge over the River Kwai and a boat trip under it Later we caught the train on the ‘Death Railway’ across the wooden bridge the British POW’s built This is a must for everyone visiting Thailand

title: Fast to city
review: Best way to go into town when its trafficjam BUT they dont start before 6 or 7 in morning so if you arrive early flight take a taxi because there is no traffic then

title: Accessible to Pratunam area
review: The train is 3035 minutes to Pratunam area You can alight at the station before Phaya Thai Else you can take express direct train to Makassan station

title: Excellent
review: A great service once you know how to work the machines Never waited for more than a couple of visits and well signposted for all us tourists Loved the air conditioning too in the very hot weather

title: easy ,fast & cheap !
review: we got this in rush hour after a 6 am landing and it was still more pleasant than London in rush hour

title: Brilliant system!
review: This was my lifeline during my stay in Bangkok It is the fastest means of transport within the city If you want to avoid the deadly Bangkok traffic this is your best bet If your going to be travelling a lot take the day pass which is now 130 Bhat

title: Fast, efficient,on time
review: Can't go past BTS for moving around Bangkok If you plan on using it a few times during your stay or will be back to Bangkok again it pays to buy the card for 199 baht (minimum amount) then just swipe it to pass through But it at the ticket window at any BTS station The credit on the card does not run out  so just keep it ready for next visit and simply top up at the ticket booth  Note that you can see the balance each time you swipe the card as you pass through the electronic gate

title: No traffic jam
review: Best way to skip the traffic jam   During rush hour pretty full but still ok  They work well and they are clean Fastest way to get nearby a station od the sky train

title: So easy to use
review: We were staying at the Bayioke hotel and had to get to the airport for seven AM  The station is five minutes walk away and starts at 530so we got t o airport in plenty of time  The trains are clean bright and easy to use and announcements are given in English   Our stop was seven from the airport and took 35 minutes and delivered us into the heart of the airport

title: Transport around Bkk
review: Try to stay within walking distance of a Skytrain station as the ease of movement above the streets avoids traffic problems as well as giving easy access to MBK Siam Paragon Emporium Robinsons and the brand new EM Quartier

title: Skytrain magic
review: Don't hesitate to try this  it's fast cheap super clean and easy Crowded of course but much cleaner than other cities

title: Excellent way to get around Bangkok , easy as!
review: Easy to purchase tickets and find your way around Bangkok combined with the river ferries ( orange flag)

title: Clean and Efficient
review: People que up to enter the cars They are never eating or talking It's very modern and better than anything that exists in the United States

title: Transport links

title: absolutely world class
review: excellent train sysyem Bankok with heavy traffic  its gets choking with traffic The BTS train are well connected to malls etc so very convienient for shoppping

review: Quick way to get to and fro the airport Cheaper than the express line make sure you don't take that except you are in a hurry From the ending Point you can take a taxi anywhere to bangkok to get further around just make sure the taxi driver puts on the meter

title: A quick and easy way to travel
review: My wife and I sent a few days in Bangkok and had the opportunity to ride the sky train It was inexpensive quick and easy to use I would recommend that you research the stops you want in advance to make it easier and less pressured Be aware as well that at rush hour it will be crowded but it is an ideal way to get around the city

title: Easy & Fast !
review: Very easy to find it at the lower ground floor of Suvarnabhumi Airport and it can get to chatuchak market really fast

title: Great transportation!
review: This was an excellent way to avoid Bangkok traffic it was quick and very inexpensive  It was clean and easy to find your destination

title: Interesting place to visit
review: Visiting the Thai Burma Railway walking on the rails making journey in local train admiring wonderful landscapes

title: Bts
review: We use the Bts to get round bangkok At weekends it's quicker than using a car or taxi You get of at nearest station to where you are going We have a bts card that you can top up so you just swipe to enter sky train and exit Staff are friendly and helpful

title: So easy!!!
review: The travel system in Bangkok with these Sky Trains especially is great We had direct access from our hotel and straight to where ever you needed to go All of the station staff were also very helpful for tourists and also assisted my Mum who walks with a walking stick through side doors etc through the gates so she didnt have to walk through and get hit by the turnstyles Public transport is so much better here then in Sydney

title: Convenient & makes the city a lot smaller!
review: The BTS is clean air conditioned reasonably priced and allowed us to see different parts of Bangkok on a particularly rainy day  It's easy to navigate (especially for a newbie like me) and has very reliable service  My only complaint was how packed every car was  Keep an eye on your purse and pockets and avoid completely if you're claustrophobic because it gets packed  We used it between the hours of 9am12pm so a lot of it was likely rush hour commuters  However the crowds won't stop us from using the BTS again on the remainder of our visit to Bangkok

title: Convenient but not reliable in rush hours
review: Easy way to get into the downtown fast from the airport Not expensive and should take about 40 minutes to another downtown BTS Avoid the rush hours if possible A local I was talking to said sometimes it went down without the advanced warning

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: We loved using the Skytrain to get around Bangkok It's cheap efficient and the air conditioning is AMAZING on a hot day To pay your fare just go up to the window tell them where you want to go give them a bill and they'll give you the correct change to feed the machine for a ticket

title: Very efficient
review: The BTS is a very efficient and pleasant way to get around in Bangkok It is clean air conditioned and runs on time   You can also do a skywalk between several malls which is pleasant when it rains

title: EFFICIENT AND EASY
review: We always catch the Sky train to Phaya Thai and then change for the Sukumvit line to Nana or ChitLom depending on where we are staying   It is easy efficient and cheap and saves being caught up in traffic jams   The only issue is when exiting at some of the stations steps can be an issue if  you are carrying a heavy suitcase and not all stations have escalators  This is the only issue with catching the Rail Link and BTS

title: Great for tourists give it a chance
review: After you try it once and get the hang of it It's rly usefull and easy to handle Get a mapapp The airconditioning is pretty strong tho

title: Very convenient way to travel to the airport
review: Very convenient and inexpensive way to travel to the airport from the center of the city  Very similar to the Heathrow Express in London but 10 times cheaper

review: Use this and it will easy to reach the Suvarnabhumi Airport Hopefully there will be airport rail link to Don Mueang too

review: great form of transportation easy quick efficient and very clean I enjoyed taking the BTS skytrain to my hotel

title: so easy

title: Train market
