title: Recommended way to travel
review: I would recommend this way for travelling around Bangkok it made it easier for us to travel especially when the roads can be very congested Trains are quite frequent and easy to catch

title: Reliable and easy
review: Caught this every time I’ve visited Bangkok couldn’t be more easier and reliable to use simple get on at the airport look for  The closest station to your hotel then get a taxi plenty waiting outside don’t pay more than 100 thi bart into Mo chit from macason don’t be put off it’s easy just be prepared for the  247  Crazy Bangkok traffic

title: It was okay
review: My family just visited Singpore right before we went to Bangkok Thailand The direction of the Skytrain is not as clear as the one in Singpore and the place is not as clean as Singpore either it's not bad as public transportation though My husband always enjoys subway anywhere we visit

title: great for tourists
review: I used this from the airport to the city then changed to the BTS to get to my hotel  This is good value for money clean very clear on what stations it is passing and where you need to get off  would absolutely use this airport link again

title: BTS Skytrain and Rabbit Card
review: I love the Skytrain who doesn't Before the skytrain Bangkok was one huge gridlocked city But the Sukhumvit line makes shopping a fun adventure I recommend the Rabbit card  I keep a small balance on it and carry it in my wallet ID window so that I don't have to take it out of the wallet but just scan it over the reader  If you are staying only a short time in Bangkok  you might  consider purchasing a rabbit card with trips instead of adding cash to it Check online to read if this would be a better value for your specific needs    Of course the skytrain itself is a fun ride most of the time unless it is overcrowded After 9 am is best and also avoid the 57 rush home The air conditioning is always adequate and more often on the chilly side One thing I always enjoy are the different themes and advertisements decorating the outside of the entire train It creates the feeling that one is taking a ride in a theme park especially when exiting onto the entrances of the various shopping malls

title: Fast and cheap
review: Fastest and easiest way to get to the city centre For just 35 baht you are in the city centre within 20 minutes Trains are cool and clean but can get crowded during the route

title: Affordable and convenience
review: One of the easiest ways to explore Bangkok is via BTS Skytrain Like other big cities in the world the BTS Skytrain is one of the best mode of transportation with an affordable price for the ride We took the train from Chatuchak market and dropped at Siam Paragorn It costed about 42 baht They most important is its reliability and timeliness capability It is worth to have a ride and you can avoid dropping at the jewellery shops if you are taking tut tut It stops at major tourist spots especially shopping malls

title: Definitely recommended in bangkok's jammed packed roads
review: Arriving at the international airport once you exit lookout for signs to the MRT go to basement level It's easy ride is clean and for a very populated city the trains are not overly packed Our ride from airport to makkasan city centre was about an hour cost only thb70

title: Quick, Cheap, Convenient
review: Travelled on it today  and have used it many times in the past It is the quickest way to get downtown and avoids the possibility of unscrupulous taxi drivers ripping you off Comfortable  regular and  efficient Highly recommended

title: easy way to commute to Bangkok
review: the train is easy and fast way to travel to bangkok without a hassle of using taxi or bus  it is convenient during peak traffic hours as there is no congestion  Also it is affordable  you can choose to travel with a speed or just a local train (more stops and less expensive)

title: A wonderful service which takes the pain out of getting to Bangkok international airport
review: We used the Airport Rail Link as our primary means of getting to the airport before our international flight A positive experience indeed To get from Bangkok old town we first caught a speedboat orange flag ferry from jetty 10 to Central (Bt 15) Then a sky train to Phaya Thai (Bt 44) Then the Airport Rail Link to the airport (Bt 45) Talk about traveling economically and comfortably as a positive alternative to supporting the questionable taxis and being stuck in gridlocked traffic at a huge cost The ARL was clean efficient and problem free The officials we encountered along the way were helpful They spoke some English which was great for us Thank you ARL for making our journey comfortable and quite easy Highly recommended

title: Most Convenient
review: During day this is the best way to get around BangkokIn case there is no station close to where you want to go then the most intelligent thing would be to get a train to the closest station to your location and then take a taxiFrom the airport the service operates from 0600hrs to 0000hrsthough

title: Great!
review: Fantastic way to get to the airport it's cheap and fast  Beats the crazy traffic in Bangkok which is quite a big bummer when you have a plane to catch

title: Travelling
review: I would say its the best way to travel around Bangkok city to avoid unnecessary time caught i traffic jam

title: Quick and modern way to get to and from the airport
review: The train stops right outside the airport terminal and while it does have several stops it takes about a half hour to get from the terminal to downtown hotels running until 12 midnight

title: What a shame they canceled the express train!
review: What a shame they canceled the express line train from Airport to town a non stop line before took you in 25min downtown  Now we take the normal line with stop overs and it take 38 min above  Otherwise its a easy way transportation from Suvanabhumi International Bangkok Airport

title: Good way to cover ground on the cheap
review: It is what it is  A good easy way round Bangkok (one you figure out the routes) it isn't expensive and saves sitting in the ever present Bangkok traffic jams  Can get really crowded at rush hour times but it is a capital city

title: TRAVEL TIP FOR AIRPORT TO PRATUNAM AREA
review: 1  40 baht for 1 pax from airport to the nearest stop (Rajaparop) to pratunam area  2 100 baht for a tuk tuk from the exit to my hotel in the heart of pratunam area   Total cost for 2 pax = 180 baht Time = 40 minutes  By comparison via taxi   Total cost for 2 pax = 450 baht Time = 1 hr to 15 hrs (depending on traffic conditions)  If you find this helpful please like it to share it with other travellers )

title: BTS
review: A good transportation which a little crowded but it's verry convenience We also can look bangkoks traffic over the skytrain Using rabbit card is more comfortable than the single card We just spend 180bath for the card which 80 bath dor the deposit From Ratchatewi station to Siam station we Just need 15bath

title: Amazing!
review: The whole experience was great we had enough time at each stop & the driver & our tour guide Sara were amazing very attentive & friendly Sara gave lots of information & was very helpful throughout the trip she made it super relaxed Highly recommend this trip

title: Clean, efficient and affordable! UK could learn a thing or two!
review: This is what you want from public transport Clean efficient and affordable Recommend this if you want to go from one end of the city to the other Only thing is you kind of miss the buzz and atmosphere of being in a tuk tuk zipping around the city

title: great connection
review: in 30 minutes from airport to the middle of the centre of Bangkok for baht 45

title: To Airport from Sukhumvit
review: we travelled from Soi 13 sukhumvit using BTS and Rail link for airport and the travel time was less than 1 hour which was fully air conditioned travel without any hassle and was super experience as one can enjoy the aerial view of the bangkok  still think can reduce travel time by reducing the number of stops or increasing the speed for efficient use

title: Interesting to see the Railway market
review: Excellent Would tell my friends The Maeklong Railway Market is one of the more unusual markets in Thailand Selling vegetables fruit and other food items it looks like any other market on the streets of Thailand—until a passenger train goes roaring through the middle of it When the siren calls the stalls scatter and make way

title: Useful clean metro
review: Always crowded Buy a multi trip ticket if you can as they are not cheaper but are much easier to use

title: dont go on kings bike day
review: having used train on arrival in bangkok thought we travel from one side of town to other back to motel  im handicap person with limited walking abilityso when at 4 pm they stopped at line station and tell everyone to get off and no one knows why its a shockafter much fussing im tols its the kings bike ride day and trains  not running till late that nightok so how i get to where you were happy to sell me a ticket to gommmm no train no bus no taxi mmmmm you have to walk with the other 100000 people walking  across townooh and no directions either i know what your thinking he should have looked it up firstwell i did and all the notices said "the BTS skytrain will still be running" and in somw ways they were right 4 hrs and 6klm later they were running again but as the bike ride blocked the ones i needed on the main line

title: Smooth trip from city to airport and vice versa
review: More expensive than other ticket prices (about 90baht oneway) but its interior is different from the ordinary train around the city as its seats are facing each other and is more spacious It's really fast and comfortable and worldclass (August 2012)

title: Stay Above The Traffic Jams
review: The BTS was easy to use and a fast way to get around  Many of the stations are attached to the major shopping malls or shuttle busses are provided from the station to the mall  The machines are easy to use  just make sure the arrow on the card is facing the machine when you put it in the slot  When you are finished your journey  the machine will eat your card Great way to get around

title: Very nice trains
review: I love the fact that trains in the airport are made available Considering the traffic in Bangkok we opted to ride the train from the airport going to the hotel ad to the malls too

title: Best travel option to/from airport
review: My only complaint if any is the not all stationset have escalatorselevators which can be tricky if you have a lot of luggage Otherwise it beats Bangkok traffic any day

title: Time table
review: At least you know when you get there the traffic jams in BKK are horific Try to not get into them if you can Took a taxi once there and to do 50meters 20mn Sad

title: Nice, but not "wow"
review: I am not a railway buff but I did enjoy the ride from Kanchanaburi to Nam Tok and back The scenery is very beautiful I was waiting for the famous part close to the river and I had a good view of it but it did not overwhelm me  Have a seat in the very last wagon of the train  this is not crowded and you have a better view

title: 5 Star
review: London underground could learn a thing or two from this very clean runs on time best of all your not allowed to eat on the train EXCELLENT

title: Time saving good transport method
review: We took the rail link from Ratatchouri station and it cost 40 baht per  person to the airport It took 3040 minutes from the Ratatchouri station to airport If you do not have lot of luggage carrying with you this will be the most effective transport service to go to the airport

title: Accessd to stops
review: Good choice of transportation for newbies to the busy traffic that Bangkok is offering Affordable price of token as well Clean

title: Best access around the city of Bangkok
review: train station access was sign posted easy to use with a ticket card system and was clean cool cheap and smooth for ease of access around the areas of the city One suggestion would be for the trains to operate later into the evening

title: Convenient public transportation
review: Very convenient public transportation going around central Bangkok I like it that the cars’  are air conditioned A welcome respite from Bangkok’s warm temperatures

title: Easiest way to get around Bangkok
review: If you’re a tourist in Bangkok and looking for the cleanest & coolest means of travel to get from point A to B then use the Skytrain It’s easy and very safe I recommend a day pass if you are planning on multiple stops in a day which expires at midnight regardless of time of purchase

title: Airport Rail Link to get to my hotel "The Mandarin" on Rama IV
review: I used the Airport Rail Link to get to my hotel near Lumphini Park I didn't want to pay the taxi fare I found the system understandable and wellmapped They accept only Thai Bhat so get to an ATM in the airport before you attempt to buy a ticket I found people very helpful in giving directions to a firsttime user Having my luggage was a bit of a strain on a crowded railcar but seeing Thai people in their daily activities was worth the extra effort I did need to grab a cab after I exited at my station but it was a short ride (60 Bhat) (about $2 USD)

title: Well Organised Tour with Great Customer Support
review: Very well organised tour Exactly as indicated in itinerary Big Country Vacation has a very responsive customer support via Messenger chat 6am pick up time at my hotel was as confirmed the day before via email  Our tour guide had a very good command in English and was very enthusiastic in her explanations and tips throughout the day  There was a bruef stop for breakfast at a rest area where Mcdonald's and A&W were available  Train ride to train market was interesting There was time for everything and pace of tour was relaxing Floating market tour was very well organised as well  Overall good experience and value for money Suitable for families with young children

title: Excellent way to get around!
review: Used this every day during a recent visit to Bangkok Full Day hop onoff ticket was 140 baht The trains are spotlessly clean with air conditioning the announcements are in Thai and English two main lines that cross at Siam Station Excellent way to get around would highly recommend the Skytrain

title: Easy and cost effective, especially if you don't use the Express
review: If there are only one or two in your group this is great value and easy from the Airport Its much cheaper if you don't take the Express just fewer stops with Express but its cool and comfortable and not a lot of difference in time

title: Air con travel across Bangkok
review: Once I had learned the routes transfer points and payment system (a "Rabbit" card worked well) I found it easy to navigate this sweaty metropolis

title: Great way of getting around.
review: Great way of getting around the busy streets of Skytrain  Clean and easy to use highly recommend getting yourself acquainted with this form of transport when you're in Bangkok

title: Efficient transportation
review: The BTS was very easy to understand and use with the ticketing machines and all The trains were very clean as well

title: BTS SkyTrain
review: Very well organiized  punctual train service  Every station was announced in English as well so that the tourists were helped

title: Clean, efficient and fast
review: The Skytrain is certainly an excellent way to get around Bangkok  It is fast (better than being stuck in traffic) clean safe and efficient and the people are helpful  Once you get the hang of it there is no going back

title: Sobering but very well presented
review: Very well presented museum spent about 23 hours here We visited Hell Fire Pass the next day and we're glad we'd been to this museum first Coffee shop and toilets here

title: Airport city link for less than a quid!
review: 39 bahtabout 80p to get into the city at the first BTR interchange  Remarkable value  Fast Reliable Airconditioned  Definitely worth using

title: "The Best"
review: The sky train is the only way to travel quickly and comfortably in Bangkok  The fares are reasonable and the train stops at almost all the areas you'll want to visit on a short stay in the city  The sky train is the best innovation this bustling city has ever seen

title: So easy and so cheap!
review: I loved travelling by skytrain it's so easy and plus you can sightseeing Bangkok while on the train Absolutely loved airconditioning too))

title: Great and quick transport
review: The BTS is a great to travel from A to B It is quick and not that expensive Best is to avoid the rush hours

title: Excellent means to travel
review: I enjoy traveling by BTS and think it is one of the highlights of Bangkok Has made commune and going around the city much easier

title: Convenient, Cheap Transportation
review: The BTS is clean convenient & efficient  At some stations there are covered walk ways to major shopping centres hotels  Cheap way to beat the perpetual traffic jams & take in the sights  Bear in mind that during peak hours the trains can be crowded with the working crowd

title: efficient
review: very efficient timely and ordered service the best way to get around you will manage to bypass all the traffic under you very convenient and fast not too complicated to understand either people are helpful and courteous

title: Hassle free travel
review: Whenever you ride on a sky train you can almost enjoy every stop where point of interest exist Malls nearby at most stations cafe massage shopping around the station area or along the road If you got time explore more stations and dig out the hidden beauty and nature of Bangkok Moreover if you buy a day ticket you can safe a lot as well so get up early and embark the sky train in Bankkok for a round of hassle free travel

title: Extremely crowded
review: The train was very crowded so you were unable to get any good pictures of the market  The Floating Market was extremely crowded with boats getting banged around powered boats causing a lot of exhaust and fumes People yelling at other powered boat operators Not a pleasant experience  Overall very disappointed with descriptions and reality of experience

title: Take the train.
review: Although it only operates every half hour the train into town (Phaya Thai station) is cheap and fast  It helps you to avoid the horrible traffic at rush hour and connects easily to the BTS  Use the Makkasan station if you want to connect to the metro

title: easy, cheap and clean
review: It's a really good alternative to reach Svarnabhumi Really cheap only 35 baht from Makkasan And Makkasan is connected to MRT so its really convenient

title: great service
review: nice and clean comfy in hot weather easy to use even for foreignersignificantly pricier than buses though so when you would like to safe some money and have enough od tume try to catch a bus

title: Amazing for Bangkok!!
review: It have been to Bangkok many times But never miss to enjoy the BTS so colourful and vibrant BTS or Metro trains you would find in many more countries but the detailing to their looks of BTS its wow factor for me

title: The most convenient to travel within Bangkok city
review: BTS is usually above ground and it's aircon If you plan to stay more that a day do buy the Rabbit card which requires less top up The per pay counter at the BTS station is usually busy with queues so the Rabbit card will save you some time And you can return it at the end of the trip for refund less admin fee  BTS is well connected with MRT (underground) and various transportation in Bangkok So it's easy to travel around with BTS and MRT combination

title: Fast, clean, lots of people
review: The BTS sky train was a very efficient fast way to get around Bangkok Was easy to navigate People are helpful Not good for those who are claustrophobic elderly or handicapped While they can accommodate there are so many people stuffed on the trains it’s hard to move Did not bother us so much  Seems that is the norm for the BTS train in Bangkok

title: Perfect transport
review: Perfect transport to and from the airport We strongly recommend it Fast nice and clean Womderful aircondition

title: Good mode of transport to travel around Bangkok
review: Since bangkok is a very crowded city with a lot of traffic jams around it is good to move around the city and places with BTS instead Unless you got many friends together taking taxi is another option and of cos with a lot of big bags The signage is easy to read and available in English however the machine that issue the card only accept coins and you got to change coin at the counter recommended to replaced those machine that able to accept both cash and coin

title: Very good public transport
review: I rode the sky train whilst staying in Bangkok a number of times   It's very inexpensive per journey (I paid on a journey by journey basis as was only in Bangkok for 3 days) Each journey was between 3070 baht which is no more than a few quid   Very well air conditioned so a welcome break from all the heat

title: Necessary, but confusing and crowded
review: When in Bangkok you may have to use the BTS to get around  Know that you need to buy your tickets from a kiosk which will only accept coins so make sure you have enough  Also since the BTS is above ground there should be two escalatorstairs up to the station one on each side of the street  You want to find the stairs on your side of the street because crossing a street in Bangkok during traffic is hairraising  You will need to know which direction you'll be heading in so locate the station you are heading to on a map and then follow that BTS line to the end of the line noting the name of the last stop  That will tell you which direction you need to go to to find your correct train  Then you will need to queue behind others note the painted lines on the ground which will tell you where to queue  The trains themselves get very crowded especially during morning and afternoon rush hours so don't fret if you don't get on the first train  Riding the BTS is an experience not for the faint of heart

title: Efficient and cheap
review: Easy to navigate and in English Ticket dispensers mostly only take coins but each station have fast teller kiosks exchanging notes for coins You pick your destination by matching the code number of the mapIe From Asoke to Siam Square is coded 28 Push on button 28 the machine tells you the fare insert the coins and ticket and change comes out Make sure you retain your ticket to exit the station Very clean and ver air conditioned

title: fast cheap transit from airport to city
review: fast cheap transportation from airport to city  Board in the airport  inks with MTR for access to skytrain on Sukhumvit

title: BTS SKYTRAIN TRAVEL IN BANGKOK
review: I arrived 2 hrs late on my plane but only having carry on luggage made getting the train easy  Definitely get the train if you have only backpack luggage  I had travelled from Melbourne to Bangkok via Singapore and had been up for 27 hrs and it was still easy to figure out train trip  I had never been to Bangkok before and am a solo 67 yr old woman   I was staying at UBaan Hostel right near a train station and they send directions so its easy to follow  Check line directions above entranceexit door of train carriage you won't go wrong  I use my Rabbit card visa bank card from Bangkok Bank and that saved me time at the station  I just top up with another 100tht when card needs it Train is defiitely the way to get everywhere

title: I always catch the sky train it is wonderful
review: Sky train is the best way to travel in Bangkok you can catch it from the airport to your hotel especailly staying Sukhumvit area

title: Underground travel
review: Where BTS goes above from you head MTR goes from below your feet Nice connectivity overall in Bangkok

title: Easy way to get around Bangkok
review: BTS is easier than it looks to navigate   I used it for the first time to get back to my hotel area   Very cheap to get you around Much better than trying to take taxis

title: Sardine Cans!
review: Only four trains results in ridiculous overcrowding and thoroughly unpleasant journeys The station ticket machines and change outlets cannot cope with the numbers Someone needs to take charge and overhaul the system which was originally designed for 40% less passengers Wake up

title: GREAT SERVICE
review: Always prefer using the skytrain if possible Find the service always worth its price Never found it overcrowded and always on time and clean

title: Fascinating and the best way to travel through Bangkok
review: Catching the Skytrain and using  hhe river taxis is the best way to travel through Bangkok One must avoid the traffic for sure The city is not made for cars as there are just too many of them The skytrain stops throughout at all the major stops in the city and combines beautifully with the river taxis Its a worthwhile adventure

title: Convenient
review: The airport link is located at the lower level of the Suvarnabhumi airport There are clear instructions on how to get to the airport link We rode the train going to Phaya thai station to BTS station since our hotel is located near terminal 21 in Asok station The fare is approximately total of 90 baht per pax If you have a heavy luggage and is not using a trolley this mode of transportation from the airport to your hotel might not be suitable for you Also we rode the train at around 10am which is not rush hour in Bangkok The train gets packed during rush hours Some of the taxis in the airport will charge you 300500 baht from airport to Sukhumvit area   Overall this is the most convenient way to and from the airport since traffic in Bangkok is horrible esp during rush hour

title: This might save you from a heatstroke
review: Well ventilated and cooled transportation system It gets busier during the evening Easy way to cmmute between the airport to the city   Airport to city transfer might cost you 70 THB  This includes a transfer to BTS  You can also get a day pass for the BTS for 140 THB but it expires at midnight unlike other day passes that can be within used for 24 hours   This is a blessing in Bangkok’s grueling heat

title: Clean, on time and good air conditioning
review: Very good clean and great air conditional in train where is not very packed  Travelers will need to be aware of pick pockets event please keep your valuable item safe

title: Fast, clean and cheap
review: Very pleasant and airconditioned ride from the station saphan taksin to the national stadium From the station national museum there is an exit directly to the MBK mall We paid 37 baht one way

title: Cannot recommend this more as the best way to get around Bangkok
review: We were overwhelmed by the traffic which is terrible even from our standards coming from a busy US city We take public transportation whenever we can when we travel so we decided to use BTS as much as possible It was great Clean easy and efficient It was so much better than taking a taxi

title: Convenient
review: For those who prefer public transport rather than taxi and tuktuk this is the better way to go long distances in the city It is cheap and serves long hours Nevertheless it can get really crowded and there is not tourist pass or day pass that can be used in other transports such as underground or bus therefore it can get a little irritating to buy tickets all the time

title: Bangkok Subway - Air Conditioned, Inexpensive and Fast Way to Get Around the City
review: MRT is Bangkok’s subway system and is an air conditioned fast safe clean and inexpensive way to get around the city it has two lines to cover different ends of Bangkok blue line and purple line  Bangkok also has a skytrain system called the BTS (made up of two lines also the Sukhumvit and Silom lines) also air conditioned fast clean safe and inexpensive way to get around the city  Both systems have maps at the stations good signage (including English) and well marked stops  There are a couple of interchange stations (Silom and Sukhumvit MRT stations) where you can transfer from the MRT to the BTS (and vice versa) to fast track you to your destination   Bangkok is such a heavily traffic congested city so the MRT and BTS are excellent transportation alternatives to quickly get around the city and avoid sitting in traffic jams  Don’t shy away from using the MRT and the BTS to get around Bangkok just because you’re a visitor  Comparable to the well know similar type lines in Canada Europe and Japan   Traveller tip no open food or drink allowed on the train and be prepared to have your bag backpack or luggage quickly inspected at the turnstyle Be polite about it it’s for your own safety Bangkok takes security seriously and I’m happy that they do   For payment you can use a ticket machine or see the teller and for a prepaid card (you choose the amount to load onto card) With a ticket you slide it in the slot at the turnstyle and it pops in and back out (you’ll need it at the exit gate same process) With the prepaid card all you do is swipe at the turnstyle in and again when you exit This is how the line knows how much to charge Some trips just a stop or two are as inexpensive as 26 baht  My husband and I are both currently living in Bangkok and we both use the MRT and BTS daily as our primary form of transportation  I highly recommend using the MRT and BTS to get around Bangkok

title: Cool A/C on a hot day.
review: Great way to beat the heat and mad traffic Get around the major areas of the city quickly and on time There for over a few days get a 7 day or 30 day pass

title: Beautiful
review: The trip from Kanchanaburi Railway station to Nam Tok is beautiful Landscapes animals bridges FANTASTIC

title: Easy to use
review: It was easy to use when going out of the airport The transfer to Metro was easy to find The train was clean and fast enough We were lucky that it wasn't crowded early in the morning

title: good way to get around
review: the BTS sky train is a great way to get around is clean fast and very cheap links well with other trains and water taxis

title: Nice getaway from Bangkok
review: Good price very enthusiastic and nice tour guide Highly recommend if you're interested in seeing a different atmosphere and scenery outside Bangkok

title: Incredible mass transit system
review: All great cities have great mass transit and Bangkok is no exception BTS Skytrain is inexpensive and very easy to navigate add the great city views you get during your trip and it's 100% win  There is no better way to get around certainly nothing quicker at rush hour

title: A great get away from Bangkok :)
review: Professional and engaging tour A must if you are in Bangkok Ask for Sara she teaches Taiwanese on the trip There is AC on the minibus

title: Quick and easy
review: We were weary with not speaking Thia and all but was very easy and quick to use All carriages have AC and is a very quick way into the city

title: Lifesaver!
review: Air conditioned and efficient the Skytrain is the only way to get anywhere in Bangkok on time  Tip  you need plenty of loose change to buy a ticket  Also there are lots of stairs so not easy with heavy luggage or pushchairs

title: The same like by the BTS: Get a card, top it up, ride!
review: Here applies the same review I made for the BTS "Thai are practical persons That is why I do not understand why so many of them do not obtain a card for multiple rides instead of queuing up to change money then again queuing up to buy the ticket and that multiple times a day It can be a nightmare during the rush hours I presume that now you visitors know what you have to do Get a card top it up ride There is an additional benefit in buying a travel card you do not have to search for the price of your fare it is automatically detracted from the credit of your card Before you enter a train consult the plan with the route After you get off consult the signs where to exit the station in order to go to your destination Most times your destination is mentioned” Only here you have one more benefit Children and older persons get the same discount Ask for it at the counter You get it in both by buying a ticket or by obtaining a special multi ride card

title: good one
review: easy way to reach airport  economical and cool way  don't go in car there are 75% chances of struck in the traffic

title: Fastest way to get around.
review: When we visit Bangkok we always make sure the hotel is within walking distance of the railway We get a day pass for 140 Baht each and then we can hop on and off where we want Even if there is no station next to an attraction its quicker to get the train to as close as possible the get a metered taxi the rest of the way They are safe very clean and always on time and most important their airconditioners work very well

title: BTS - fast and easy
review: Where every you go you should take BTS and MRT in BKK It is cheap and fast and you can go to most places You can also take the boats on the Klongs to connect to BTS and MRT

title: Good and easy access to the airport.
review: This train gives you very easy access to main airport Journey takes approximately 45 minutes  The only advise I would give is to make sure that going to the airport you will board the train at the first station as it tends to be quite busy

title: Great way to get around
review: Great way to leave tht airport into the city and you can even connect to the sky train very cheap and easy to use

title: Such an exhilarating experience?
review: Definitely worth the visit The view was unforgettable Had such an amazing adventure Staff on the train were very pleasant and friendly

title: Fast and good price to access city
review: You can use Airport Rail Link to come to Bangkok city center area from Suvarnabhumi Airport This is the fastest and cheapest way Morning and Evening it is very crowded with local day to day office travelers

title: Way faster without getting stuck with traffic
review: The fares are reasonable and the stations and trains are clean tooBest mode of transport if u want to avoid traffic at busy hoursStaff at information counters do a good job giving all the needful instructions to the passengers

title: Worth it for the experience
review: We recently travelled as a family of 16 from Bangkok to Chiang Mai The overnight sleeper train was a wonderful experience for the kids We travelled in the 2nd class sleeper cabins Beds are bunks and are converted at roughly 8pm from the chairs Food on the train is simply microwaved frozen Thai food and not suitable for fussy kids Arrive prepared with your own food for kids Cabins remain open all night for people to walk through and lights remain on Privacy is achieved by closing your curtain next to your bunk bed Saftey of personal items made me nervous but security guards regularly walk through the carriages and we had no problems We woke in the morning to see the sun rising over beautiful Chiang Mai We booked online using 12go asia I was nervous as they only book tickets with the railway 2 months before the departure date so until then nothing is confirmed and we were travelling during their peak period  That said we didn't have any problems I would definitely recommend this as a wonderful experience

title: fun & easy
review: the skytrain is real easy to use & extremely cheapa must do for evryone who travels to BKK

title: The Most Helpful People Ever
review: New to Bangkok and the staff at Skytrain could not have been more helpful They even called my hotel for me to confirm location I can't even imagine this sort of service in the USAMAZING

title: a little bit old
review: good transfer but a little bit expensive than Singapore MRT and people inside it were so noisy There was no ticket's machine there

title: Only the tour guide is pleasant. Disappointed with the river and the boats. Also the railway is very crowded and very ho
review: Kudos to our tour guide Kobe Heshe is very concerned to her tourists The tour itself was not that specialit was so hot and crowded Nothing special The water is murky and the boats are not disciplined  The motorboats are not considerate enough with the noise and smoke they are causing

review: They used same German trains made by Siemens (ELECTRIC 350 PROTOTYPE) like in England (Trans Pennine Express) Interior was different seats was more comfortable than in some Tube (underground)

title: Fastest way to get around

title: best public transport in Bangkok
review: Cheap simple fast what else can i say about skytrain just perfect from our hotel to the entertainment area and massage places just 2 stations and to MBK shopping area just 37 bath must use

title: Looking forward to more lines!
review: Whilst it is nice to sit in a taxi it is not so nice to sit in traffic jams and these are often hard to avoid particularly at the weekend If you not feeling so patient the BTS is a great and quick way to go and also boasts great air con  A convenient way to travel around mixed with taxis and other modes of transport Recommended

title: I was so excited about this station
review: Like a living museum with active trains and you can roam around the place at your own risk of course I spent around 6 hours looking at trains If you are a die hard rail fan This has to be on your trip and bucket list

title: Great tour, but a little rushed
review: Overall this was a really good tour   We left pretty promptly in the morning and then there was an hour's drive to a quick stop for a toilet break and to grab some snacks After that it was a ~10 minute drive to the train station which was hilariously just a shed by the railway However the local stopping train was amazing and going through the market at the end was quite the experience Top tip  sit on the left hand side of the train for the best views When we got to the market this was a little rushed as we only had 15 minutes before the train left and unfortunately it was very difficult to get back into the market for this experience However it didn't dampen the mood too much   Shortly after this we were back on the bus for another short drive to the floating market which was a really amazing experience The tour through was a little short but you really get a feeling for place After a ~40 minute break to get dinner we were back on the road and back at the MBK centre after two hours   On reflection there's quite a lot of driving involved in the tour but it was definitely worth it

title: Easy access to the city
review: If heading to the city of Bangkok take the airport rail link to phaya Thai station (8 stops and end of the line) then get off and take the BTS to the city So cheap too45 baht for one person one way Air conditioned carriages too

title: always stay next to a sky train station
review: skytrain connects all the important places to visit in Bangkok  is quick efficient & has air con

title: Beyond horrible!
review: If you have the ability to fly instead of taking the train DO The only good thing I can say about taking the train is that we eventually got to our destination We had a "VIP Sleeper cabin" for two people The whole carriage was full of cockatoaches including in the beds We had to put our luggage on the lower berth bed and share the upper berth Needless to say we didn't sleep as we were terrified of being visited by them The so called AC system brought in all the diesel fumes from the train so in the morning we felt like we'd chain smoked all night The food is very poor quality and extremely expensive  we paid THB 1200for two people The train finally got to Chiang Mai 15 hours later and we were extremely pleased to get off I have no idea why anyone would rave about such an experience it was utter rubbish If you can afford the one hour flight I urge you to fly

title: Fast and relable
review: Excellent facility to get around bangkok Quick  and efficient A delight to use You never wait long

title: Bangkok's metro

title: bts bangkok
review: easy access and the staff is friendly fare is quite expensive the aircon is very good but we have to climb stairs

title: Some practical tips for using the BTS
review: Between them the BTS (Skytrain) MRT (Underground) and river transport cover most of the parts of Bangkok that tourists want to go to and using them saves you the hassle of the bity’s notorious traffic The BTS offers a fast clean cheap frequent service with the bonus of being an elevated railway so no tunnel noise and the chance to watch the city go by Here are some tips for those not familiar with using it •	You need plenty of change There are ticket machines at each station and they’re easy to use each station on the network map will have a figure at it that’s the fare cost from where you are so just put the money into the machine and hit the button for that fare (it gives change) But the machines don’t take notes and the staffed ticket booths don’t issue single journey tickets they’ll sell you the special tickets (eg unlimited day travel – which can be a good deal if you plan more than one journey) otherwise they’ll just give you change for a note •	Disability access isn’t always easy Most stations have an escalator up (only stairs down) or a lift but these aren’t well signed and may be on the opposite side from the one you arrive Be prepared to look •	When deciding the train you need to get remember lines are indicated by the name of the last station on the line in that direction so you’ll need to have checked that on the map Even if you’ve visited Bangkok before – the lines are being extended so the names on the signs change from time to time •	Move through the automatic barriers quickly once you’ve put your ticket through – you only get a brief time before the padded blocks slam back in place whether you’re there or not I’m not the only person to have got bruised that way •	If you don’t like crowds try to avoid the rush hour The trains aren’t as packed as in some Asian countries and no worse than eg London or New York then and they do increase the frequency (as little as three minutes between trains) but there is a crush then Don’t let this put you off using the Skytrain it’s still very useful and a lot more pleasant (or at least less unpleasant) than many masstransit systems I’ve been on

title: Cheap, fast and efficient transportation in Bangkok !
review: We found that the Bangkok BTS is the most reliable  fast  efficient and cheap transportation method  aside of taxi  buses motorcycle taxi  khlong boats etc There are 2 BTS lines  runs west towards Silom and the Sukhumvit Line runs east to Mo ChitThere's also interconnect station with the MRT on Asoke and Sala Daeng Train arrival are every 3  6 minutes operation hours from between 0630 until midnight The last train leaves between 2330 and 2350 Fares start at 15 baht for a station stop The trains can get pretty full during peak hours (0700  0900 and 1600  1900) on and off office hours

title: A great idea...poorly managed
review: The Airport Rail Link is an idea which has great potential  Sadly poor management and decisions surrounding its operations hamper its success  Currently there are no express trains between the airport and Phya Thai station the connecting station to the Sky Train  All express trains run only to Makkasan which is right in the middle of traffic central for Bangkok and which has much less passenger traffic than Phya Thai  Additionally links to the Sky Train and the Underground are a VERY long walk from Makkasan station  Very poor planning  Furthermore trains run only between 6am and midnight  Many international flights arrive between 11pm and 1am and depart before 7am leaving arriving passengers arriving late or departing early with no alternative except to deal with taxis in Bangkok  This is yet another example of poor planning  Express train service has been curtailed as the train operator has no budget to purchase spare parts for upkeep or maintenance of trains meaning that carriages designated for express service are being pushed into service as local trains as there are local trains out of service due to lack of spare parts  Still more poor planning  This is an excellent service and one which offers great potential  Sadly poor management is causing passengers to seek other alternatives

title: Cheap, Comfortable, Convenient
review: Traffic is so bad on the roads that sky trains are a must for travel in Bangkok especially if you want to get to places on time   Fortunately the trains are a great way to travel for the following reasons  1) cheap Only costs a dollar or less to travel places 2) Comfortable All sky trains are air conditioned which is a must in Bangkok  3) convenient Trains come frequently so you won't have to worry about missing a train  4) easy to use   maps are very simple to read and will tell you how much it costs to go to the stop you want You can only buy your tickets from the machines key selecting the price)  but they only accept coins  So if you need change go to the train tellers to get your change The ticket itself will have a map on the back  and the trains have monitors which will tell you which stop is next   As an Australian  I'm also appreciative of great rail systems as the ones in Australia are inefficient and have a lot to learn

title: Good and reliable transportation in Bangkok

title: Good facilities but poor service
review: We used night train #9 from Bangkok Hua Lamphong station to Chiang Mai  We booked thru 12Go office (just one day earlier) and paid around 1000 baht each for Class 2 sleepers Train left with 4 hours delay no compensation of any kind by the train company Food choices are limited in the train station as the foodcourt was not inviting but upstairs was very good coffee and drinks and snacks By the way this old train station is due to be replaced by a new one closer to Don Muang and maintenance is showing that Restrooms and main hall were clean The facilities in the train are very good and clean Temperature upper bunk is colder than lower bunk but linens and blankets are provided (much cleaner than in most airlines) Plenty of storage space under the seat  No WiFi on the train No evening meal supplied Breakfast was provided in the morning but it was the lowest quality food we experienced in Thailand unripe pineapple bland rice porridge processed meats (that I would not feed my dog) industrial type muffin and  slices of factory white bread No choice of rice no yogurt or other better foods Better bring your own cause it is expensive on the train too Ordering breakfast was done before sleeping and when we were asked to pay in the morning the total was higher than calculated but corrected upon insisting The serving lady than tried to shortchange us another 100 baht while smiling Be aware of this The attendant doing the bunk bed service was rude and grumpy and did not allow us to keep a pillow after folding the bunk in the morning Not quite the Thaiservice that we are used to maybe because the train is full of foreigners But we certainly would use the train again being better prepared in the food department a next time And we might bring ear plugs next time as our car had 4 little children in it that caused more noise than acceptable including crying at night

title: Efficient, Convenient and Popular Public Transportation
review: During my 6 day stay in Bangkok I used the BTS public transportation system several times a day to get to restaurants shopping attractions and meetings  Rather than purchasing a oneway ticket I bought a one day pass which costs 140 Bhat about $400 US which expired at midnight  When purchasing a ticket proceed to the ticket booth and ask for a oneday pass  The ticket agents understand some English and will quickly dispense the ticket  Remember after inserting the ticket at the entrance machine you must also take it out once the machine returns it to you  You'll use it to exit it at the end of your ride If you bought a oneday pass the machine will return it to you at the end of your ride otherwise it will keep it  I found it to be quick and an easy way to get around Bangkok  Stations with an "i" also have free maps of BTS  Study it before hopping on an train  Some helpful hints  take some 10 Bhat coins in case you purchase individual ride tickets as machines don't accept paper money line up at the arrows while entering the train and do so in an orderly fashion allow riders to exit before getting on give up your seat to an elderly or handicapped person don't speak loudly or shout on the train be mindful of the Thai customs practice personal hygiene before going out in public  While riding on the train I found some riders had body odor  The weather in Bangkok is hot and humid so be prepared to shower a couple of times a day The exits are clearly marked Exit 1 Exit 2 Exit 3 and so on  Do some research on your destination so you know which exit to use Exits are also marked in English and in Thai with names of attractions and hotels The Grand Hyatt Hotel and InterContinental are also clearly marked after getting off at the Chit Lom station All in all the BTS is a great alternative to taxis and private cars  Some BTS stations such as Chit Lom and Siam are connected to large shopping malls such as GaysonCentral World Siam Center and Siam Paragon which makes for easy access to shops and restaurantsI found that riding the BTS not only saved me $ but also saved me time and the frustration of sitting in traffic  While I thought LA traffic was bad Bangkok traffic could be challenging during the day as well As an LA native I can appreciate how the BTS makes getting around the city fast and easy  no traffic congestion delays  Use the BTS whenever possible
