review: Good way to travel due to the traffic jam in Thailand Taxi will cost a lot It cost THB42 per person from Siam Station to Mo Chit Station  Mo Chit station is where you will find Chatuchak weekend market

title: Nice trip. Highly recommended.
review: Everything was well organized Pick up directly from the hotel Good tour guide The group was manageable in terms of size and therefore not too big

title: good experience
review: We tried Aiport Rail Link to our hotel very cheap and comfortable i saw a lot of tourist use this one useful and clean

title: Very convenient
review: You can use it when you want to go to BK center or from Center to Airport with no worry about traffic jam The price is very cheap (35THB) They have many station for your consider to stop some where You can carry your big luggage with no problem no extra charge

title: So convenient
review: You can get to anywhere in Bangkok hasslefree easy and it is very convenient Do not have to worry about your transportation in Bangkok

title: Cool, comfortable and fast, but not cheap
review: The train was well airconditioned and fast During rush hours BTS was our best transportation means But the price was not cheap We had four people and in most cases taking a cab was cheaper than using the BTS  The Kiosk ticket machine could have been easier to use I could not find a button for setting the number of passengers so I had to buy ticket one at a time

title: Quick and easy
review: A fast and reliable way to get to and from the airport without relying on a taxi to get through the traffic It stops close enough to many tourist attractions to then have a short taxi ride to final destination

title: Faster than taxi
review: If you travel just with handcarry luggage it is the best way to get to BTS and MRT The 40THB are reasonable the schedule is good and the cars are excellent Unfortunately there is only a skytrain connection to Suvarnabhumi and not to Don Muang

title: Nice!
review: The skytrain was okeyawesome that you can walk to the next stasion too if its just one station i use bus from airport to sky train station and reach my desc to my hotel not so far and great walking area awesome budgets traveler choice

title: Train Market and Floating Market Tour
review: Sara was an amazing guide Very fun experience with great information about the history and culture

title: So convenient
review: And to my surprise the travellers were queuing up to get on the Skytrain  There were no pushing just civilised lines  Of and it is airconditioned so take your cardi otherwise it is very cold

title: Thai Underground Rail
review: A great way to travel across Bangkok Just pop up and connect to the Skytrain to get the most out of your city travel Quick clean convenient and cheap

title: Fast and convenient
review: A great fast and cheap means of transport to get around Bangkok After we got the hang of it and figured what the stations were it was a breeze Very convenient

title: Efficient
review: The Bangkok sky train is a pleasure to travel and good value  A one day ticket is 150bht  The maps are clear and air conditioned

title: Bangkok Skytrain ("BTS")
review: Moving around Bangkok using the Skytrain is infinitely preferable to ground transport It is reliable low priced rapid air conditioned and provides you with a unique elevated view of the city Many of the stations have elevated walkways that connect to hotels and shopping malls without the need to descend to street level and connects directly to a significant number of the upmarket shopping malls (eg Siam Paragon) and hotels (eg Sheraton Grande Sukhumvit)  It is also extremely popular with Bangkok commuters so be aware that there is a morning and evening rush hour (or in fact several hours) when the trains are relatively crowded However frequencies are high It is a vast improvement over the old days when taxis tuktuks and motorcycle taxis were the only means of moving around the city

title: Convenient! :)
review: BTS is quite convenient & fast compare of using grab car But if you're coming with a team friends & going to like 30min location just use grab cheap+ save time For those lover bird just use bts or have a long walkyou can see there's lots of cafe & pretty nice environment

title: Best way to see Bangkok
review: Thais have a lot of positive discipline You are simply very reasonable and and get off Unfortunately I don't know this from Germany

title: BTS is good
review: BTS is a good way to travel if your destination is near the Station Since it's an elevated rail system does require having to walk up to the platform Some escalators available and access direct from malls   During a 4 day trip used it once to travel 3 stops and ticket was THB28 per pax   May not be the cheapestquickest transport option depending on time of day Taxi can be cheaper for group travelling   Remains a safe option to travel around BKK Some ticket machines don't accept notes so you will need to get coins from the station staff counter   Was a staple mode of transport before but prefer app based vehicular conveyance modes now for Bangkok

title: Easy and Firendly to use
review: I used the BTS to see the outskirts of bangkok and I found it to be very easy and if you have question don't hesitate to go ask and you will be assited in an instant

title: easy to use and cheap
review: Cheap and fast way to go around Bangkok very easy to use however avoid pick hours it gets very crowded use the rabbit card much more easy

title: I love public transport!
review: Dude It works It's easy to use It shows up all the time There is nothing confusing about the Skytrain

title: Safe and efficient
review: Really useful for getting around the malls & very familiar to anyone living in London or NY as a pretty standard metro system  Gets busy at commuting hours It doesn't really make it out to the tourist sites but you can combine it with the river boats to good effect (just like the locals)

title: Simple to understand
review: Very straight forward and easy to use The air conditioning is a nice relief from the heat outside There is a map with all the train stations on the back of every ticket so it is very easy to figure out when you need to get off

title: Great train rides!
review: I have gone both north and south from Bangkok this summer both rides were very comfortable  The first running north from Ayyuthula to Chiang Mai was perhaps a little more comfortable than my trip to Surat Thani  Both very tolerable sleeping car experiences

title: Rabbit Card get away with long que
review: Please buy and use Rabbit card It a prepaid card which come handy when you need to use busy station The que can be long Most of station provide top up service  For those from doung muang air port taking bus to Mo Chit Station is the easiest and traffic free to town

title: Amazing connectivity
review: The train service is very commendable and the best thing is you can get out of a train and walk right into a mall also the frequency and cleanliness is awesome

title: Brilliant loved it
review: If you get the chance to go to Thailand then when in Bangkok have a day out and travel on the sky train Its a fraction of the price than the uk and better cleaner faster and more healthy than our uk trains  Give it a try you will love it

title: Easiest way to get around Bangkok
review: Loved the skytrainit was super easy airconditioned and very convenient    No complaintsI just wish they ran later than midnight

title: Fastest Way to Travel in Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is cheap fast and stations are easy to access  During my few days in Bangkok I used the service often and much appreciated the plentiful signposting which made getting on and off and finding the right exit so easy

title: fast and convenience
review: two lines cross bangkok cover most of the popular locations (or in fact the city is built alone the sky train) avoid the rush hour as it could be really packed

title: Quick, easy and cheap
review: The fastest and cheapest way to get into Bangkok city But the terminal is on the east side The humidity is usually high so even a 20minute walk will take its toll so get an official Taxi and avoid the Tuk Tuks and touts

title: You cant miss a ride on this.
review: Feels like a roller coaster at times Very good air conditioning and easily the best way to get around the city

title: BTS siam
review: Very organized and high standards for BTS stations in Bangkok Run on time  Best to travel during rush hours if you wiah to reach on time otherwise roads are heavily jammed

title: Easy commute
review: Felt like a local getting around the lines clearly labeled and the ease to purchase tickets (automated machine or sales booth) was good Trains were very clean safe comfortable and on time Even during rush hour the commuters were quite ordered no pushing to get on or off and very respectfullove the attitude here

title: Good price
review: Brilliant day out Left at 830 back to hotel at 4pm so more than half a day Had a wonderful time and our your guide Ora was wonderful Highly recommend

title: Fast access but too crowded
review: Revisiting Bangkok and an almost daily appointments the BTS is a reliable & fast transportation to get from A to B in a trafficcongested city However it is almost impossible to get a seat since it is sardinespacked with commuters The BTS is constructed high up that you have to climb up stairs from the ticketing booths where an escalator is not provided in some stations Not very pleasant when you have done a lot of shopping Reasonable price than spending more in a taxi in the traffic

title: Easy like Sunday morning
review: Easy way how to get to the airportyou can see from the carriage the traffic jams on the roads so you are happy you do need to face themThe travel took around 40 minutes from the first station to the last oneThe station is directly at the airport which is comfortable You need to purchase the chips

title: sardines
review: the orderly  and well run public transport is great though you are packed in like sardines

title: Definitely recommend when in bangkok
review: This whole tour flowed very well  through all parts of it The travel tour guide (Sarah) locations and time in each location were perfect

title: Great
review: Like the Tube in London but cheaper cleaner faster more modern easier to navigate better signage etc  OK better than the Tube in London 🤣

title: BTS Skytrain
review: The cleanest coolest fastest and most pleasant way to travel in BKK Just NOT with lots of luggage (So not the best for when you're leaving with lots of suitcases)

title: wonderful tour!
review: Sara is a very symphatic one Lots of useful and interesting details we loved it The trip not too short and not too long perfectly planned Thank you for the nice tour

title: comfort transportation
review: You can catch an air conditioning taxi a tuk  tuk  or even hop on the back of a motorbike But I found the only way to get around in Bangkok is to catch the sky train  Air conditioned  no traffic jams cheap and very easy to use

title: quick way in to the city
review: quick and easy way to land in the middle of siam and avoid bargaining about the price of a taxi took us right to the door step of our hotel in siam

title: Easy to use
review: if you´re ready and willing to explore the city at the lowest cost don´t hesitate and jump into the skytrain you´ll find ticket vending machines where you can select english as the language and then you just chose the station you´re going and pay the specific cost of it The machine will give a plastic card you´ll use to get in and get out

title: Easy fast and cheap
review: The cheapest form of transport to and from the airport especially if you are traveling light I would not reccomend if you have large suitcases etc One back pack is manageable otherwise take a taxi If you get in close to or after midnight take a taxi the train stops around midnight likewise for any connecting MRT or BTS in the city

title: WWII History
review: We paid for our tickets & our guide got us on one of the tourist carriages With the windows down the train took off & the breeze came in the window We watched as we went along the rail laid by POW & thought how hard it must have been Hearing the noise of the train on the track & standing at the open door watching the rail go past added to our trip It's good to see this still available to use I enjoyed the trip We even got a cold drink & a cuppa

title: Have to experience
review: You have to experience this Quick fast convenient and affordable From where we boarded in Pratunum to Airport it took us less than an hour to get to the airport Directions is good and you can ask any attendant for help they are very helpful on the station and at the airport

title: Life line of Bangkok
review: Its a great experience to travel with BTS in Bangkok its so well connection commercial building and Shopping mall sky wall of BTS connects the main shopping area without going back on to the street

title: Easy for travel
review: Best option to travel around Bangkok and avoid the traffic especially during peak hours Easy to understand quick and safe

title: Efficient transport.
review: I have travelled by BTS many times and find it a cheap clean and efficient mode of travel The ticket machines are easy to use and have an English translation Carry plenty of change with you

title: Convenience to travel in city of Bangkok
review: Very convenience to used in the town area definitely will come back to Bangkok Easy access to shopping mall and also got a lot of hotels along the train station

title: Hassle-free transportation from and to the airport
review: Since it was my first time to visit Thailand i was really glad to have found this airport rail link which was very easy to use The translations inside the stations were also very helpful Maps were everywhere except for the toilets But the stations were really safe and reliable clean and almost ontime   I think the train is usually packed not just by thousands of travelers but also of the locals so make sure that you can bear to stand for some time depending on where you're getting off I guess in some stations exits were confusing so make sure to find someone to ask to before you go anywhere There were stations that do not have air conditions also so be ready during summer time   Nonetheless it's a great help for tourist alikes I bet it is safe too as i did not encounter any bad or alarming issues during my almost couple of weeks stay in Bangkok where i only used trans and trains and trains   Happy travel)

title: It’s just a tourist trap
review: This is a tourist trap I didn’t do enough research before going (which is my fault) but it’s a 15 hour drive to get to the markets which just sold tourist knick knacks that you could buy anywhere in Bangkok These might have been a cool authentic experiences back in the day but now it’s just a gimmicky tourist trap that’s you can’t escaped since your so far from the city

title: Cheap and easy.
review: By far the quickest way to travel to Bangkok from the airport Traffic congestion has now become almost prohibitive to use the now over priced taxi services given the time it takes to drive to the city Word of caution however be prepared to connect to the MTR afterwards to get close to your selected location and then walk Tuk Tuks are fewer by the day not easy to find hence if you have big luggage still take a taxi for ease

title: Easily accessible and ideal for my needs
review: I love the BTS  It is so userfriendly almost frigid aircon after the heat of the city punctual smooth and wellconsidered destinations  Ticketing procedures are also easy and userfriendly Stations are large and safe Pity my home city of Manila could not copy and reproduce what a real metro rail system  should be like

title: Very handy way to get into town
review: For Baht 45 one way you are transported from airport to a station on the Sky train route and from there most places in town easily accessible The train has several stops but all required info is clearly ser out on train Just a pity you cannot use your Sky train stored vslue card on the airport train  you must buy a special token  all pretty easy

title: Hustlr and bustle trip
review: It's always fun for me to try this transportation in every city You just have to make sure of your route than open your map to know at what station you have to go Not every station have a non coin ticket vending mechine and if you don't have coin just go to the counter to buy I was on Friday afternoon trip which everybody is on their euphoria welcoming weekend Looooong Qeue small space to stand and very noisy situation but I enjoyed Don't worry to try it the local people (which could speak English) will openly help you to give any info Oh ya always becarefull of pickpocket It was funbelieve me

title: An efficient transport option
review: The MRT has been underused for years but with a new extension that changing The underground is a great option if its going your way the problem is that with only 1 line it probably doesn't Its good for connecting Hualamphon Station Sukhumvit and Chatuchak and a few other places

title: BTS - Better than suspected
review: This is the best transit system of any I have used Former NYC LA  Chicago SF and MEXDF resident Use it generously It has AC and it will get you around cheap

title: make it easy to arrive to airport suvarnapume and back
review: like to be connected easy and cheap only 45 bahton rush hourers very crauded3 statins in the city can be easly reach every place in city

title: Great transport, low costs
review: Always very clean punctual with security personnel on the platforms No fare dodging possible thanks to controlled chipping in and out  Very very cold though We caught a bad case of flu when you were cooled down from 35 degrees to a mere 5 degrees Cost for two people around 50 Bart for 45 stations

title: Smokers attention
review: We booked the 109 and left in the afternoon with window seats facing West which was hot because of the sun After a while we moved to the restauration and chilled out Food there is 100Baht warm and good but a bit expensive Smaller and cheaper meals you can get of the people who are walking up and down the train Although we had only a fan it was chilly at night because you're in the mountains and windows don't close that good so you'll feel a breeze passing by Sunset was awesome to watch Make sure you have some music a book game or really good company It's a bit noisy and the train stops a lot Other than that it's a fun experience especially when they come to make up your bed Smokers just go in between the wagons and stand near the door If you want to have a beer make sure to bring one and be sneaky because it's officially not allowed Some of the guys will sell you one but count on 160Baht for a can

title: BTS
review: Cheap and fast way to get from A to B Airconditioned comfort (if you can get a seat)

title: To notch
review: Prompt on time clean and very easy to use Loved it The system works well We were in Bangkok for the first time and even found the lack English being spoken no issue

title: Really quick & easy travel into the city centre
review: Easy cheap travel into the city centre no hassling with the taxi drivers and super quick especially if you are staying anywhere near Makkasan or Phaya Thai

title: Easy way to Travel to and from Sukhumvit
review: Fast easy way to travelto the Airport to or comming to a Sukhumvit Hotel getting to major shopping centres

title: Easy to get around.
review: Convenient  station just round the corner from our hostel Easy to use and get around on The BTS is very new and air conditioned  getting on the train was a relief from the humidity outside Very regular and very cheap

title: Very efficient
review: Great to get from one point to another in BKK Avoid taking it during rush hour (57pm) and you are bound to either go through a very tight squeeze since the train will be full or wait for a long time

title: Excellent public transport in Bangkok
review: Bangkok has great public transport crowded during rush hours that's for sure (well where isn't rush hour)  The downside is BTS sky train doesn't take you to all areas in Bangkok   Yet it's still covering a big part (for other parts take the river express boat or tuk tuk)     Start saving coins is my advice  Should you be longer in town buy a rabbit card that's more economical and saves you from standing in line at the ticket machines   The BTS is fast clean (freezing cold) and at every station it's  clearly announced in both Thai and English where you are  At every station good maps are available at no charge    I can highly recommend BTS when you're staying in Bangkok

title: Easiest way to get around Bangkok
review: The best option to avoid the crazy trafic in Bangkok  BTS is very easy and cheap way of getting around the city clean fast affordable and very easy to understand  Definitely better than cabs if you're staying close to one of the stations Very helpful customer service desk It can get very crowded weekends and after 2pm I highly recommend to get the BTS card even if you're staying for 2 or 3 days very helpful knowing the ticket machine won't give back change and must have the exact amount

title: Efficient and cheap transportation around BKK
review: The BTS Skytrain is a low cost and convenient way to travel around Bangkok It is efficient however sometimes can get crowded at peak times

title: Vacation
review: The rail system is clean fast & efficient Being a foreigner it was very easy to get around People were very helpful

title: Cool tour!
review: Kathy our guide was really nice and told us a lot about Thai people and their culture The trip to the market took a bit more time in the van because there were constructions  It’s really worth it to check the train market and the floating market  The only thing I would change it would be to have more time to check the train market You get there in the train and then you have time to see it leave but you don’t have Time to check the market itself  Either way great experience

title: Super convenient.
review: Early and very cheap way to get down town Bkk  Runs till 12am  Very convenient since it runs right under the airport Just buy your token from the vending machine and make sure you keep it  You will need it to get out of the station Easy connection to the sky train and metro

title: Beat the traffic and cheaper
review: Inexpensive often crowded but fiercely air conditioned (a blessed relief) Why sit sweltering in a cab for 50 mins when with a bit of effort up an escalator or a few steps) you can pay a fraction of the cost and be at your destination in a tenth of the time  problem is it's not city wide What is more  I was surprised to find that the wonderful Thai people (not all) still give up their seats for seniors  refreshingly polite

title: Cheap and convenient
review: Not much to say here If you like to get around cheap and fast this is for you Only negative is that it can be really crowded at times

title: Efficient and clean transportation
review: In view of Bangkok's mindboggling traffic the best way to commute is by Skytrain or BTS The service is relatively inexpensive well maintained and the passengers are disciplined Good that present lines are extended and new ones under construction

title: Definitely a Great Way to get to city!
review: Finally got to take a train into the city after hearing it for so long  And at a very affordable price too  We took the higher price ride  the Express Line from the Airport to Phaya Thai Station It is a nonstop journey The fare for single journey is 90 baht and two ways is 150 baht The journey was quite an eye opener as the train passes quite some areas not commonly seen by us Like rice fields and ponds Best of all the entire journey is only 17 minutes The other services includes nonstop to Makkasan Station and also the regular trains (45 baht  single journey) that call at all stops (but still only takes about 30 minutes) to reach Phaya Thai  So from now on we will not be hindered by the traffic jams in the city when we need to get to the airport on time  provided no breakdowns

title: Good transport
review: Really good way of getting around the City and to and from the airport Tickets are cheap and easy to get

title: Don’t take bts in rush hour time you will be late
review: Don’t take bts in rush hour time you will be late I faced it delays frequently at the rush hour time security staffs are not security truly when you face the emergency events for example from real past events  there was some passengers will beat you security staff just stand and looked  No elevator for disabled people some stations have elevators but can’t be used due to repairing  No tickets vending machine accept bank note due to this is developing country  You have to wait for long queues to exchange bank note to coins at the counter and using coins at vending machines again (2 steps)

title: Great !!!
review: The best and cheapest way from Makasan to Hua Lamphong I think After we bought the tickets the security staff run to follow us to ask us again about the place where we wanted to go When he knew that we were in front of the right gate he nodded and smile It's very kind of him He gave us good first impression about Thailand  (March 2018)

title: Quick way to travel around Bangkok
review: The BTS is the fastest and easiest way to travel around Bangkok Trains are clean and frequent The only down side is that the ticket machine only accepts coins

title: Quite expensive ride for short distance, but convenient
review: This is possibly the best way to get out of traffic jam in Bangkok especially Sukhumvit rd However the rate was rather expensive for short stop

title: Easy transport
review: I always stay near the BTS during trips t Bangkok It's cheap and it's easy Rush hour can be a little hectic but still manageablejust move with the flow  The highest charge is 59baht but depends on where you get off as to how much you pay  The trains and the stations are always clean with hefty fines if you drop litter This is one of the event transport systems I've experienced

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Very good way of getting around Bangkok easy to use and cheap  Trains clean and tidy and run often

title: Easy to get around
review: Good mode of transport with frequent trains Avoid rush hours trains could get quite congested  Don't buy the day pass unless you are planning at least 45 hop in hop offs

title: Highly Recommended Excursion
review: I booked this trip two days before departure with hotel pickup and received a message from the operator the day before what time they would be at my hotel  They arrived ten minutes early with a new 13 passenger Toyota van    We then drove to the train station with a short stop at a gas station to buy refreshments and use the restroom    The train ride was great and we stopped at the train market where we had about 45 minutes to look around  The van then picked us up again and took us to the pier and we boarded a motorized boat that took us to the Damneon Market  Awesome boat ride in narrow canals  We disembarked at the market and our guide gave us advice on the best places to eat lunch and what boats to take to do some shopping on the water  Everybody on the tour took his advice and we had lunch did some shopping and then took a nonmotorized boat around the market to do some more shopping    Finally the van took us back to the hotel  The entire tour was narrated in English by our guide and he was both knowledgeable and funny    I really enjoyed this tour and would highly recommend it  Best value to see Damnoen without question

title: Airport Rail Link
review: This is a convenient way to get into the city and connect with the BTS rail system At the airport there can be long delays waiting for a taxi so I recommend to get onto the airport link  Even if you don't go all the way to connect to the BTS network get off and catch a taxi away from the airport

title: Literally the best way to get around Bangkok
review: If you decide to take a taxi or took took in Bangkok any given afternoon you will soon realize that central Bangkok comes to a standstill  Scooting above all the chaos is the BTS Skytrain    Typically a train arrives at each station in both directions every 7 minutes and their air conditioners work extremely well  Because of their strict adherence to the no food and drink policy the Skytrain is always clean    There are two lines and the only junction point to cross over is Siam which can get crazy busy but it's worth it when you realize how much time you are saving

title: Bts
review: An excellent way to avoid the horrible traffic jam in Bangkok With the subway system mrt  that complements it you will get to visit most of the main attractions in Bangkok in a fraction of the time of using taxis toctocs or the horribly expensive tours that caters to the tourists do your homework online by checking bangkok Com\bts and Bangkokcom\mrt Before you get there and you will not regret it

title: Public transport as it should be
review: This system works I don't think much more really need be said However should mention there is enough info for English speakers to quickly work out how to get around Ticketing is simple trains are clean even boarding a packed train is relatively orderly Top marks

title: Awesome
review: The best and cheapest way of go around in BKK I hope they will expand it to other tourist areas there

title: Airport Rail Link experience
review: Why take a taxi from Airport when it is so much cheaper and more conv to take airport rail link to key places in Bangkok No fear of overcharging and all you need is a bit of planning Moreover they have annoucement in English too

title: Easy to find Your Way
review: We asked the Ticket Booth attendants to make sure we were going the correct direction  We used the Sky Train a few times with no trouble  It was nice and clean

title: mistery of bangkok
review: in all over the world the rail is the fast way to go in anyplace except in Bangkok If you  use this sistem to reach city you discover that a good runner take less time thasn train Nobody know why this train take a lot of time for few kilometers and only 7 stop It is destiny of all people that arrive in Bangok or leave that need a lot of time  if you go with taxi train or bus good idea with very slow realization

title: Best way to get around
review: Bangkok traffic tends to get horrible during rush hour To keep from wasting your day travelling by car take the BTS as it conveniently stops at many tourists attractions On top of it being convenient it is cheap )

title: Fast, Efficient and Clean
review: Coming from a metropolitan area I was highly impressed with the speed and cleanliness of this metro system NYC can learn a thing or two from them

title: Best way to travel from airport to city
review: Fast convenient value for money way to travel from city to airport and back You avoid traffic of bangkok and can reach in 40 min from Phaya Thai airport link to Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport Phaya Thai skytrain station is across the road and not well connected At airport the connections are fine

title: Great way to get around BKK
review: BTS is a great way to get around the city and avoid the traffic Obviously trains get packed during rush our But times in between are good if your on holiday Trains are clean safe and air conditioned

title: Faster then taxi. Easy to use. Above ground.
review: If you do not like to spend time in a taxi BTS is a great option to go from A to B whilst in Bangkok If you are more then twothree people and need to save money then do not use this option as taxi is awfully cheap in Bangkok I am not a frequent public transport user (too crowded smelly and busymaybe judgemental) but I do not mind BTS in Bangkok at all One stop cost 15bath (if they have not changed by late) It might be a good idea to save your 10B and 5B to use in the ticket machine otherwise some stations change notes You can also go to the cash boot and exchange notes to coins Modern and clean trains Easy peasy

title: Good Clean
review: Good Clean Fast On Time Safe Bright Helpful staff Good signage Never too busy Would use again

title: Great day trip
review: Great day out both at the railway and floating market Guide was great and definitely recommend   Wish we had abit more time to shop at both places

title: Very relaxed commute.
review: Excellent  Along Sukhumvit the BTS stations are mostly directly connected to large very modern malls thus are very convenient if you’re shopping for a new pair of running shoes and apparel The signage is clear and the staff can usually converse effectively if you need guidance    Fares aren’t exorbitant and the trains are air conditioned Platform standing areas are also clearly indicated with floor paint Stations and trains are elevated which makes phone reception very good    The turnstiles operate by single use or season smart cards  purchasable at machines or from station staff located in ticket booths Remember that consumption of food and drink is not permitted once through the barriers on the platforms or in the trains

title: Amazing train & floating market visit
review: We (my father my teenage daughter and I) have been visiting the train market & the floating market We have been booking the private tour and our guide T and the driver have been fantastic throughout the day from pickup in our hotel to dropoff The guide was very knowledgeable and we learnt a lot about Thailand The train market is simply amazing and absolutely worth a visit and the same is true for the floating market I highly recommend booking this tour with T

title: Terrorised for a day!
review: Battled through morning traffic to get on a dirty train well outside city and visit a market with junk souvenirs and stinking fish Then bundled back in van for trip to floating market for more of same Spent most of day in van in gridlock traffic Give this tour and this city a miss

title: Most convenient and reliable way to travel in Bangkok
review: The traffic in Bangkok is known widely for being so chaotic and slow when wanting to travel from AB So the solution is the BTS Unfortunately the travel direction and stations is limited but it is easier to travel to one of the more remote stations by car (or vice versa) then use the BTS to get to the area where you need to work or see items of interest It is airconditioned reliable frequent and is not delayed by traffic jams as seen on the streets below the tracks And of course it intersects with the MTR underground for access to another range of places

title: Efficient, air conditioned and cheap
review: I was arriving during peak hours so decided to take the ARL as I needed to get somewhere by a certain time and if I took a taxi could've been stuck in traffic The signage was quite good  to get to the stations On board is air conditioned which is a relief from the humid weather All in all a seamless and efficient trip and cheap too to get into Sukhumvit If you have lots of luggage though you're probably better off catching a taxi unless you don't mind lugging it around

title: Great way of getting around
review: Pretty easy form of transport  as long as you don't mind being up close with other people as it can get quite cramped

title: Bangkok rail link
review: Great way to get downtown from the airport  and inexpensive However if you have a few suitcases it can be a bit awkward

title: Efficient as always
review: The BTS is the most convenient way to travel around the city Just be careful during peak hours as the train is pack as a sardine

title: BTS is great, modern, air-conditioned, economical transportation.
review: Easy access the hotel drops you at the BTS Nana Station on request and will pick you up there also A day pass is 130 Baht good value Can get just about anywhere with the BTS and subway system

title: An excellent choice for transport
review: Cheap clean effiocient and convenient  the BTS Skytrain is an amazing way to get around  It can get a little crowded at the usual rushhour times but it gives more freedom and safety to the tuktuk and taxis  As it is up in the air you can appreciate parts of Bangkok from this vantage point

title: A good experience but more research might have paid dividends!
review: We took the First Class 1705 Sleeper Train from Bangkok to Trang booked through travelconecxion who were excellent and delivered the tickets to us on time at the Train Station First impressions were not great as a rather tired plastic covered bench seat greeted us in a slightly tired and grubby compartment Soon after departure a staff member appeared and offered us a choice of dinner to be served in the compartment We were then informed that another staff would appear to make up the bunks after dinner This all occurred as planned and we had a tasty dinner and then the bunks were made up with sheets covers and clean pillows no complaints from us and we had a good night on the train arriving close to the intended time of 0805 at Trang  Overall this was a good experience but I believe that there are better quality Sleeper Trains if one takes the time and trouble to find out ie much more modern rolling stock maybe not on this route

title: Works great, cannot imagine going by car
review: Yes the train WILL get crowded  But when you fly past the miles and miles of traffic you will be happier you carrier your luggage and squeezed on the train  Actually the train is not that bad leaving the airport station but as you move forwards Bangkok it will get MORE and MORE crowded  Still unless you are coming in LATE and night or very early in the morning USE THE TRAIN   The traffic in Bangkok is horrible  I spent 1 hour in a Tuk Tuk just to go 4 miles during rush hour  It is terrible  train is modern but crowded but you will be thankful you used it

title: Best way to get around
review: After dealing with the tuk tuks and taxis as a tourist this is the best way to travel airconno hassle and very fast Between 2252 thb each trip with no arguments pity it doesn't go to China town or near the royal palace

title: Easy to negotiate
review: Stayed in Bangkok for 4 days and used then BTS every day to go from A to B Very easy to travel all over the city   We stayed at the Eastin Grand which has a station on level 3 (Surasak)   For only a few dollars ($AUD) you can get an all day ticket  to midnight  and away you go the next station is always announced (in English as well) so is very easy to go shopping or sightseeing also is a great break from the heat of Bangkok

title: Best way to beat the monsoon weather.
review: I always use the airport link whenever possible On my most recent trip I left immigration just as heavy monsoon rains hit Bangkok City The roads outside were at an absolute standstill with huge traffic jams everywhere The rail link just chugs onn through to the city and thb 40 beats a stranded thb 400 taxi any day

title: Rapid transit in Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is must to move across Bangkok Well organized with clear signs for the visiting tourist The trains are clean and well kept We found it easy to use

title: Most convenient way to get from airport to Bangkok city!
review: Suvarnabhumi Airport can be some distance from Bangkok so to beat the always unpredictable traffic the airport rail is probably the best bet It is affordable and easy and can be found at the basement of the airport You will be in the city in under 1 hour and can either take a city at the terminal station or link up with the BTS service to get to the other locations in downtown Bangkok Clean affordable and hassle free in my opinion

title: What to expect
review: Try to avoid peak hours as usual and change for more coins as many stations do not have the coin changing machines notes which can be changed only at the counter with long queues

title: Easy to use.  Cheap, cheerful and efficient!
review: I used this a few times only  I mainly used the BTS  The MRT services more local areas and some tourist attractions  Appears to be busier than the BTS as more locals use it  Air conditioning is not as cold  Cheap to use and interchange should you also need to use the BTS  Staff are helpful and the self  service ticket machines are easy to use  Stations are clean and big  Follow the signs as there are many entrances  exits  The ticket mainly appears to be a token the size of a coin which is easy to loose so be careful  I just got single journey tickets  Not sure if you can get daily or multiple  You cannot purchase a combination ticket MRT  BTS  Totally separate  Average single journey is around THB 3000  Download an application from google play which will help you plan your journey and manage timings  Safe to use  You cannot eat or drink in stations or on trains  At the time of C19 masks must be worn  Taxis in Bangkok are awful  Expensive and drivers don't know the roads well  This is a cheap and cheerful way to commute around  Efficient and timely

title: Use the Sky Train
review: The Bangkok Sky Train (BTS) is quick punctual and super way of getting around BangkokCosts depend on how far you go you simply walk up the steps to the right platform (the sky train runs N  S E  W) find the ticket machine press the button of the station you want to go to and insert the coins If you haven't got the right money just go to the ticket booth and they'll give you change Once the train arrives let the people get off and then get onboard The station announcements are in Thai and English On some trains there are LED routemaps above the doors showing where you are on your journey It really is that simple have great trips guys

title: Very clean, a little confusing
review: The sky train is amazingly clean and I was not expecting that Buying tickets was also easy although the machine only accepts small notes and coins The train is air conditioned Our only problem was that we did not know the map of the stations so it was a little confusing to get to the right station

title: Quick, cheap and easy
review: It goes right into the airport  It is easy to figure out clean and fast no traffic to deal with  What more could you want

title: Bangkok Sky Train
review: The BTS ( the Bangkok Mass Transit System) or better known as the Skytrain is the quickest way to travel around Bangkok and is simple and easy to use  It is also one of the cheapest ways to travel around the city  You can buy a ticket for a single journey or if more journeys are planned a Standard Rabbit Card which allows multiple journeys You can add more money to your card at any of the BTS stations  The benefit of the card is that there is no need for queuing up for a ticket especially during busy times all you need to do is tap your card on one of the entry or exit turnstiles which only takes seconds and you are through  The BTS has two lines the Sukhumvit and the Silom lines which meet at the Siam Interchange Station this is the BTS busiest station A map of the BTS System can be downloaded from the internet  Other advantages of using the BTS is that is connects with the MRT (Metropolitan Rapid Transport) subway system at Sala Daeng and Asok stations  It also connects with the Express Boat River Taxies at the Saphan Taksin station beside the Sathorn Pier  The BTS system is very popular with the residents of Bangkok moving around 700000 people per day moving this number of people requires a train every five minutes of less to move all the people it can get a bit crowded at rush hour

title: Fast and convenient transport system
review: Pros Easy to access and convenient for travelers to travel around Bangkok Cons There are no elevators available and most of the stations don't have escalators going both ways (up and down) need to climb stairs up and down Will be inconvenient for travelers who are wheel bound or need to carry heavy stuff or luggage

title: Easy and quick
review: Very convenient way of moving around in Bangkok Quite a lot of people at most times but you can always wait for the next train and you are in a better position to enter Quick and efficient buy a card if plan to travel more than once or twice

title: Clean and efficient, but not extensive
review: Just like BTS Skytrain system I am surprised that MRT Bangkok's underground metro system counts as one of the "attractionsthings to do" in BangkokThough it does not rank as high as BTS (which is No 2) at No 19 (as of June 2017) it is still a surprise in a city with so many things to see and do Just like BTS I consider Bangkok MRT merely as a tool to get around to see the real "sights"  Yes it is clean and efficient and relatively new I think it is also more spacious than Skytrains However its network is not extensive enough Several areas of interest to tourists like Kao San Road Royal Palace and Wat Po cannot be accessed by skytrains or underground metro  Also you can not connect MRT directly to BTS Skytrain system Even they are next to each other in several locations (such as SilomSala Daeng) people using one cannot transfer to the other seamlessly You need to get out of the station use a new ticket and get into the other one This does cause some inconvenience

title: 2 days in BKK
review: Used the skytrain to get around in the city We found it clean reliable fast and cheap  Pick up some maps from your hotel or the airport and you will easily find a BTS near to the landmark you are trying to reach You can also combine the use of the BTS with the subway (MRT) which is good

title: Quick and easy to use, safe and fast way to travel
review: We used the train to travel whilst in Bangkok to get us to the big Malls the station was a 10 minute walk from our apartment and the stations and trains are very clean We felt safe travelling on them and had no problems navigating the stops price for a family was reasonable and we would use it if we ever returned to Bangkok

title: Very cold
review: The booking via 12goasia was very good We booked a VIP sleeper (cabin with upper and lower berth) The Train was always in time and we arrived nearly punctual in Chiang Mai Unfortunately it was very cold in the cabin because the ventilation openings couldn't be closed they were broken So it was very cold at the upper berth and there always was an air stream so at the end I got a cold

title: Great value day tickets
review: 140 baht gets an allday ticket and it is the quickest way around Bangkok apart from the river Avoid rush hour though

title: Do this. Easy way to get around Bangkok.
review: Easy to get around using this system Fast and comfortable but crowded as to be expected Figure this out and you have a great experience

title: So easy to get around
review: I'm a single mom traveling with my 9 year old daughter I was worried about taking transit in an unknown city where I don't speak the language but it turns out that I had nothing to fear The sky train is so easy to use once you figure out how to buy a ticket Don't worry there is always someone willing to guide you Just tell the person in the booth where you want to go how many people and ask her how much per person She'll give you the appropriate amount of coins Then you need to go back to the kiosk to purchase your tickets for the amount you were told Easy peasy The train is clean and air conditioned They even have TV's that tell you which stop is coming up next I found that very helpful because sometimes I couldn't understand when they named the next stop over the intercom Its a great way to get around such a large city

title: Great service
review: Fast cheapeasy to use public transport in a city where the roads are constantly clogged with traffic Signs are in Thai and Roman script so easy for English speaking tourists The only drawback is the lack of escalators going both up and down ( most only go up) and lifts for those with mobility problems

title: The best way to get around.
review: Cheap traffic free travel with great chilling aircon Goes to where you need and is good value especially with an all day pass if you want to go to several places

title: Great way to get around at low cost
review: BTS gets a bit crowded at peak times but great way to get around the city for minimal cost & no traffic jams (other than human)

title: Good but not completed infrastructure
review: The best idea to transfer to BTS system Didn't  like  A bit to tricky Better Than use the can or the bus BKK is not made for surface traffic

title: Easy way to get around Bangkok
review: Sometimes you can purchase your tickets at the booths other times the people there are for help and breaking change Once you know where you want to go you would then go purchase your tickets at the self serve ticket machine The routes are easy to understand and the people in the toll booths are friendly and speak English

title: Crowded All The Time
review: There seems to be insufficient cars every time because the train is perpetually packed I stayed 3 days in Bangkok & has never had a chance to get a seat Always have to push my way in & end up at the edge near the door

title: smooth journey
review: i would use this if i was alone or with my partner if more than two people than a taxi is the cheaper option to get to the airport if you like to be in control of your time be assured that the train is regular and punctual and you dont have to deal with the uncertainities of bangkok traffic

title: Saviour from traffic
review: I recommend the bts to all tourists saves you getting ripped off by taxi drivers who don't open the meter air conditioned and you don't get stuck in bangkoks rush hours However doesn't run after 12 midnight

title: Convenient
review: The BTS is very cnvenient to commute to the busy mall and market areas of Bangkok While we stayed close to the Sukhumvit Road with most of the malls and shopping areas nearby travelling by road was a frustration given the huge amount of traffic at any time of the day BTS then is a very convenient alternative

title: Fast
review: This train is good to get to the platform go to gate number 3 and follow your nose signs are up takes you to Bangkok ok you might have to change to go to different parts but it's easy enough They speak English in the ticket office

title: Easy to use and cheap
review: Easily the cleanest and possibly the safest way go get around Bangkok  It doesn't yet go everywhere but when it does it will be very good It's cheap easy and foreigner friendly

title: It gets you there...get a mrt card to save time
review: MRT is the underground subway system for metro bangkok  Here is a few things you need to know   great for single travelers or even small groups to beat traffic especially when the destination is very close by to the station  During peak traffic times it is sometimes faster to take MRT to nearby destination and then take taxituktuk or local bus from there   air condition is strong inside train like the SRT  You can take a light jacket but it is only for a short time  Good way to beat the daytime heat though   Unfortunately the rabbit card is not compatible with MRT so you will need a separate card for MRT  Like BTS the MRT ticket queue can get quite large and it could mean waiting 1520 minutes just to get a token  So MRT reloadable pass or multiday passes might be more convenient   connects with lots of popular destinations especially Hua Lamphong which is the SRT main station (ground level interprovince trains)

title: Great
review: The tour guides were amazing and I really enjoyed the floating market Ask your guide to take you to quick snap with tigers if you want )

title: Why is this on tripadviser?
review: This is a great way to get from A to B  Every time I've caught a taxi in bkk we've had a 10 minute (minimum) traffic pause So I suppose if you are going somewhere that is enroute take the skytrain   but that's all I can say

title: Polite Thailand..
review: BTS in Thailand is very clean yet expensive The people of Thai are very polite and care to othet person They are willing to give their seat to little children old person and also a woman  No fine like Singapore but they always keep the train clean and comfortable I thing Thailand has a high standard of ethics

title: Fastest way to get from one part of Bkk to another!
review: When I'm in Bangkok use  the BTS very often because it is easiest and fastest way to get from one part of Bangkok to another For long distance is much cheaper than taxi Easy way to buy tickets Have a good connection to almost all huge shopping malls in Sukhumvit and Silom areas Very clean and modern style of carriage with aircon During rush hours sometime not easy to get inside of BTS train but people stay in the line to get in and quiet fast my turn comes Will recommend to my friends

title: Easy to navigate
review: The train is very easy to navigate It is conveniently connected to the airport and made getting into the city easy and cheap It was very clean

title: Cheap and quick
review: Best way to get into Bangkok Better than using private car or taxi as traffic can be quite bad Be good if they could also build one to pattaya

title: Cheap but useless
review: Getting a taxi to or from the airport and most places in the city centre is less hassle and takes a similar time and only costs a little bit more I think they desperately need to sort the station at Makkasan out at the moment it lacks onward connectivity

title: Very helpful
review: One must stay close to the BTS system if you want a hustle free transport in Bangkok you'll be able to move around with precise timing

title: great subway !
review: easy to use  they do not print tickets  you get tokens everything very economic  never a new  friendly people  just choose your destination

title: Too expensive compared to taxis
review: Let me say it isn't expensive by comparison to USD or other currencies but if you have more than one person it is often only minimally more expensive to taxi a bargained or metered air conditioned taxi I think the lines aren't organised like other cities Maybe I am biased because shanghai's public transport system is phenomenal

title: BTS Skytrain
review: easy to navigate  information available in English  clear map  helpful staff  not crowded (didn't use it during the rush hours though)

title: Best way to see Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is a wonderful way to get all over Bangkok  It is extremely safe and efficient  Once you figure out the fare machines it is also extremely easy to use  You select your destination and look up the fare in advance and simply put in exact change for your ticket  The trains come often and usually are not crowded  Not like NYC  The views are spectacular  We thought about just riding the train all over the city to look at the skyline

title: Easy to use
review: The Airport Rail Link is so convenient to use from the airport into the centre of Bangkok   Easy to locate within the airport  Fast to buy the tokens from the self service kiosk   We didn't wait long for a train and the train was clean Nice and cheap way to travel into Bangkok

title: Quick and comfortable though bit crowded
review: As there is always traffic jam in Bangkok especially during busy hoursBTS is the best choice to travelIt is quick and comfortable though will be rather crowded sometimesOne important thing is the BTS train is air conditioned

title: The only way to travel
review: A brilliant and efficient service which delivers you from the city right into the international terminal (and return) for less than $AUD2 per person

title: just went one way to Suvarnabhumi- super easy
review: i think it was 40 baht from Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi  and in the next couple years the bus will expand to Don Muang airport as well so you can skip all the downtown traffic

title: Travel Cheap!
review: Good connections convenient and cheap Connects most shopping areas eg Siam Paragon Terminal 21 etc and tourist spots

title: Convenient and cheap travel option.
review: We took this train to Chatatuck market in BangkokIt wasn't far from the Indra Regent Hotelin fact we walked to the station It is very clean and safe Much better option that a tuk tuk or taxi  You have a short walk once you get off but even that is fun as you'll be walking with many people who are also on the way to Chatatuck market Very convenient way to get around

title: Very well organised trip, Railway Market Unforgettable experience
review: I was doubting to take a trip to Railway Market I wanted to do it by myself but choosing this trip was a very good idea The guide knew everything about timing and places in order to take fotos from the train while entering to market also before she gave us complete informations about the trip schedule The floating market Damnoen was as I read before very very touristic nothing authentic but trip deserve all the money only for Railway Market twiking into consideration is difficult to arrive there alone (3h)

title: Quiet clean ride to the airport
review: Nice transit We easily found our way with luggage from the skytrain and swirched to the airport link It is elevated like the skytrain so you can still look around and across the skyline Some of the stations are large and very modern Arrival at the airport was simple and easy to use

title: Great rail link
review: One of my favourite rail links to and from an airport   I'll start by saying the ticket machines are easy to navigate it's done in a nice simplistic way and also in a few different languages Chinese and English being two that I saw  Clean trains fairly frequent and a cheap nice ride into town

title: The best means of transport in Bangkok
review: There is no indication that the notorious traffic jam in Bangkok will be solved in the near future If one is getting from one city destination to the other and they are covered by the BTS network please take the BTS as it will save you travelling time by multiples Another beauty of the BTS is the very efficient air con inside their carriage In the generally very hot Bangkok the aircon transforms the carriage into a haven from the heat Fare is reasonably priced and for visitor who relies on BTS the Rabbit card (which is a stored value card that has a 5year validity period) is recommended as you do not have to queue for getting change and then to queue again to get the tickets from the vending machines BTS is in my opinion the best ways to travel within Bangkok

title: BTS is super
review: the traffic in bangkok is terrible  starts early and goes late  traveling by taxi takes forever  by yourself doing a motorcycle is probably pretty good as they can weave between cars you better have good medical insurance tho  but the BTS is superb  i just glides along over the top of all the hustle  i think it is mostly elevated two levels so nice views too  so try to stay somewhere near one of the lines and it will be your transportation favorite  it is also airconditioned a very important feature

title: Good day out
review: Had a good day The transport in the mpv was comfortable The train market was really interesting but found the floating market a little soulless But good to see different things Enjoyed the train ride very much and nice to see areas outside of Bangkok Our guide Jenny was great informative and fun Overall great value

title: Convenient
review: I stayed in Silom during my trip to Bangkok so I had to either ride a tuktuk a cab or the BTS SkytrainI opted for the latter I was lost during my initial try to find the train station but it was an exciting kind of getting lost because I had to see a lot of beautiful things along the way The train wasn't as packed as the MRT back home so it's more comfortable

title: Great underground service
review: Again the first time we have been to Bangkok and the underground service was very efficient clean and affordable

title: Fast! Doesnt feel safe...
review: The train is very fast and you have a nice view Unfortunately there were two complete power outages on the way and unfortunately we did not feel safe anymore

title: Great tour, get so much included for your money!
review: Sara was our tour guide and she was so knowledgeable even giving us mini Thai language lessons on the bus which was great  We spent a good amount of time in both markets and Sara tells you the kind of prices you should be expecting to pay so you don’t get ripped off   She also told us the best restaurant at the food court and we can confirm it was so nice Good prices too   We got to go on the train into the market which I didn’t know was included so this was fab And then of course got to see it leave which was so interesting to see how the stall owners prepare for the train going through   Overall great day Sara was great and the driver was too

title: Cheap and convenient
review: Quick and clean way to get across the city And cheap

title: Airport Rail to Sky Train
review: This is an easy way to connectd with the Sky Train or Metro avoiding taxis on the very crowded freeways It's not fancy but has ample room for bags

title: Efficient and effective system.
review: Airport Rail link provides a very easy and efficient service from the main airport in Bangkok to the city The service is clean efficient and gets you into Bangkok in about 30 minutes Trains run frequently there is a local service which is cheaper and used by locals this can become crowded there is also an express service which is more expensive but faster and only stops at the Makasan station which you can use to connect to the subway system or you can obtain taxis at this station  Security is employed at the stations and baggage maybe "checked"

title: Fast way to travel
review: I'm a fan of both the Skytrain and the Skywalk Definitely beats fighting traffic at the street level I wish we had public transport this well designed back home

title: Better than Australian Trains
review: First thing first THE AIR CONDITIONING IN THE TRAIN WAS AMAZING  So very easy to work out train stops etc ticket prices are very cheap trains are very neat and tidy

title: Wish we had made more use of the Sky Train
review: We only used the Sky Train once to get to Ekamai bus station (which has its own stop) but were left wishing we had used it more The trains are clean fast and are a great way to save money as opposed to taking tuk tuks everywhere

title: efficient....
review: air conthis app wants me to add more characters to this reviewit's a modern train and does what it's supposed to

title: No problems
review: We found the BTS to be good value efficient and easy enough to negotiate We used it numerous times during our stay particularly when going to shopping centres

title: Great way to get around when near the BTS lines
review: The skytrain is an easy and well priced way to move between certain Bangkok highlights like the river pat pong night markets Siam (central shopping area) Sukamavit victory monument and Chatuchak weekend markets Avoids the chaos of rush hour in clean comfortable transport BTS staff and guards are always happy to help Keep in mind that the trains can get quite busy at certain times of day

title: Easy Transport
review: Not much to say about the Skytrain You can easy go from one point to another if you don’t want to rest in a taxi in Bangkok’s horrible traffic

title: Unique market experience :) well priced!
review: Lovely guide that taught us a lot about Thai culture along the way Really interesting and unique markets well worth the money

title: You would be surprised
review: The BTS is one of the most modern mass transit systems I've used much cleaner faster and cheaper than the London underground by far

title: A lifesaver in this overcrowded city.
review: Three things to know about the BTS  It's refreshingly airconditioned () it costs 140 THB for a day pass and frankly it's the only method of moving around in this horriblyovercrowded city  The one day when I did try to take a taxi I ended up getting out after 1 hour (and just 3km)  and walking instead it was faster  Next time I come to Bangkok I'll be making sure my hotel is near a BTS station

title: What a day!
review: We had a fabulous time out guide brought us to the best sites knew exactly where was a great spot to see train and best area for food It was a wonderful day

title: Fun 1/2 day excursion for great price!
review: So excursion is just as advertised We thought the train was a mustdo experience  The floating market was fun but a bit too touristy Best thing I bought was a ice cold beer and the fried shrimp it’ll cost you but it was worth it The shopping stalls sold their regular stuf like bags paintings and small souvenirs  All and all great experience and you back with half day to spend on other activities

title: Highly recommendable transit
review: This super efficient way to get around Bangkok is a model of efficiency that many places ought to copy Quickair conditioned and inexpensive Gets you around town promptly and away from auto traffic

title: Clean and Air Conditiioned
review: We took the Skytrain from Sukhumvit to a few stations down The train itself was very clean and information was easy to understand The air condition was a welcome luxury

title: Take a taxi instead!
review: So iof you want to leave BKK and you are NOT directly next to the train stain you have to take a taxi to get there already Arrived at the train station you are facing to carry up your traveling luggage upstairs manually as escalators are not existing or not working temporarily Train cost around 100 THB per person plus the taxi to the train station will cost you another 6080 THB approx If you take a taxi from downtown to airport by taxi it costs you 240 THB plus 75 THB highway fee So if you are traveling not alone to safe money by taking a taxi and if you are traveling alone you still safe nerves time and energy (carrying luggage the stairs)… Your call

title: Don't use at PEAK HOUR...
review: Morning from 6am9am Evening 5PM8PM  avoid avoid avoid as possible train randomly broke down and unpredictable schedule

title: excellent transport system
review: bangkok bts or sky train is excellent passenger transport system you can travel though the city by less money in it love it

title: Quick and cheap
review: If you are going to the airport I would recommend taking the rail link It is so cheap compared to a taxi and stops right inside the terminals so you don't have to walk far to check in The train is quick and reliable Very easy to use

title: On my way!
review: It's crowded The staffs there was very nice If you are in hurry I won't recommend you going by this way You have to spare the time so you wouldn't be late I would warn you that the doors of the trains are very noisy when they closes

title: BTS skytrain
review: Expecting a lot more as it seems to be pushed as a major attraction  It is basically a train on a high level track but with very limited range Worth a ride but do not get too excited

title: Best way to get aroun in BKK
review: BTS will get you to most places in a quick and comfortable way Best is to buy a "Rabbit card" that you can load with money

title: It's not that daunting!
review: Taxis are usually easy and not that expensive to go most places in Bangkok but if you like public transportation like I do the Airport Rail Link is a good inexpensive way to get to places that are near to the BTS andor MRT  Just know which station you need to get to and follow the signs leading down to the bottom level and the Rail Link  You can only buy tickets here for stops along the Rail Link then if you transfer to the BTS at Phaya Thai or the MRT at Makkasan then purchase those tickets there  There is an express train from the airport to Makkasan but I could never see the value in that  Enjoy getting immersed into the fantastic Thai life if not too tired and it's not too late and you don't have too much luggage They do stop running late at night be sure to check

title: Give it a try
review: Best way to travel into bangkokIt is so easy to follow the signs buy the ticket and get to bangkok central in 20 minNo need to bargain with the taxi drivers

title: Quick, Easy Trip to the City.
review: Quick Easy Trip to the City without having to worry about the Bangkok traffic you never wait long for a train they are always clean and have Air Con and cheap )

title: London tubes could take a leaf out of the skytrain
review: Excellent way of getting around runs on time fully air conditioned and easy to Navigate  If only we had in London

title: Fast and Great within 4 minutes i was on the BTS this is my favorite way to travel around BANGKOK it has air condition
review: Fast and Great within 4 minutes i was on the BTS this is my favorite way to travel around BANGKOK it has air condition  Easy to get around

title: Very bright!
review: I took the journey from Chiang Mai to Bangkok we left at 6pm and arrived for 830am the next morning The beds aren't too bad and the curtains are very helpful with privacy but it's a shame that they don't dim the lights at night time because they do make for a restless nights sleep

title: cheap way to get around
review: really cheap way to get around bangkok and to beat the traffic as well can get really busy during peak hours so be patient

title: Way to go
review: Best value for money Fast and very efficient Easy to use and navigate Announcements in Thai and English Screens the same Staff very helpful Made getting around easy Saved a lot of headaches in traffic congestion

title: Easy and cheap. Best way to get to central Bangkok to avoid traffic
review: Used this on my recent visit and found it really easy to get to Sukhumvit area (via one change) Cost about £2 in total Found it got pretty busy during commuting times Clean easy cheap avoids rip off taxis that charge a fortune and most importantly gets there quicker as no traffic

title: Efficient way of getting to airport
review: The Skytrain and Airport Rail Link is the most cost efficient way of getting to the airport from Bangkok Make sure you do leave earlier though as peak times can affect the time you arrive at the airport (between 4pm and 7pm are the peak times Comfortable and cost efficient

title: Probably the best way to get to BKK city!
review: Beat the BKK traffic  take the Airport Rail Link  Sad to see the Express service go however still very good and predictable way to reach BKK city centre  TIP Stay near the main stations Makkassan (or Sukhumvit MRT station where you are 1 stop from Makkassan) or Phaya Thai

title: Strangers can navigate the boggling Bangkok
review: It's crowded but offers helpful staff accurate maps and guides and easy to use I found it helpful in a strange place where there is loads of traffic

title: Super easy and clean
review: if you can avoid taxis and tug tuks I do and BTS is great It is amazing how well it runs in a city of chaos and 20 million people I highly recommend it if it is convenient for you

title: Best Way to avoid Traffic
review: This is the best way to travel to save time in otherwise congested Bangkok traffic They are punctual cheap and very clean

title: Easy way to go around bangkok.
review: If you want to avoid bangkok bad traffic jam this is how you should do to go around bangkok city Use BTS ☺

title: Underground Bangkok
review: Clean and efficient as long as you skip rush hourThe trains are short but with limited correrage of the city this isn't a problem As a tourist MRT can useful to get to between the main areas in combination with the Skytrain

title: Cheapest and best form of transport.
review: We found the Train system the best way to commute around the city as the tuk tuk drivers ripped you off and took you to gem stores tailors etc and the taxi drivers overcharged tourists If you travel by taxi ask the driver to put the meter on if he refuses go to another taxi   There are many stations however the BTS doesn't travel the full length of the city This is why we have given it 4 stars The tourist attractions such as the Grand Palace and Reclining Buddha are not serviceable via the BTS

title: Airport rail  link  under repair
review: In Bangkok yesterday and Airport  Rail  link  under  repair  city line still running but not sure how slow it might be (we ended up getting an airport transfer minivan 900 bhat  each way for 5 )  Not sure how long it will be out for

title: Fast method to get into city
review: Easy to locate at the airport (Basement)  Fastest way to get into Bangkok city avoiding crazy hour traffic jams and cheap too

title: Quick Way Around Bangkok
review: An easy efficient and fast way to get around town Took the SkyTrain to the Jim Thompson Outlet shop  It was about a four block walk from the nearest station  We also visited several shopping malls with stops adjacent to them  Also took the SkyTrain to several small restaurants The rechargeable “rabbit” card is easily refilled and easily used  Great way to avoid street level traffic It can get crowded though at peak times

title: First visit to Bangkok
review: Great service from the Airport Busy in rush hour but we still got a seat Very reasonably priced at 45THB each Staff very helpful opening barriers for us making it easier for us to get through with our cases Great way to avoid the Bangkok traffic

title: Expensive for short travel
review: We took the train couple of times to go around but found it to be expensive for short travel However it was still much cheaper than tuktuks

title: Convenient and pretty
review: I personally enjoy BTS every single time I'm in Bangkok Extremely convenient not very pricey and incredibly enjoyable way to move around You can explore the city even when you're in a train because of amazing views  As for me there is only one obveous disadvantage there are not enough stations so sometimes it's simply not possible to get where you need using BTS

title: Easy way to enjoy Bangkok in a cheap  budget
review: BTS is always very helpful and easy way to go any places in Bangkok You can get many trains in a few minutes Each train come between 24minitues gap One can cover many tourists spot with BTS Shukumvit line Silom lineit's a really good journey Many important tourist places and super mall well connected through the bts station  Example SIAM Paragon mall Wax museum BAAC MBK etc

title: A very convenient facility
review: We've been using the Bangkok BTS for years now during our visits In fact we always try to stay at a hotel in close proximity to one of the stations

title: Excellent Bangkok airport connection, but not to Don Muang.
review: The Rail link connects Suvarnabhumi Airport to the center of Bangkok with transfers to several other city rail lines (BTS MRT) It is clean and easy to access The rail station is located in the bottom floor of the airport with elevators and trolleyfriendly escalators going there Bangkok has serious traffic congestion particularly at morning  and evening rush hours and this rail link can be much faster and cheaper than a taxi particularly if you are solo It is only 45 baht to the center of town connecting to the BTS line (and the Siam and MBK shopping area) 35 baht to the Makasan exit which connects to the MRT going to Sukhumvit (and the BTS line at Asok) and 40 baht to the Ratchaprarop exit which is a few minutes walk to Baiyoke Sky Hotel and the Pratunam shopping area including Pantip Plaza The rail link is an excellent addition to the transport system The center of Bangkok is very transportfriendly with buses taxis rail and motorcycletaxis for the brave Unfortunately rail does not link to the other airport Don Muang although it has been planned for many years

title: Quick and easy way of getting round the city.
review: Excellent service Quickest way to cross the city Clean and efficient We took it to see The Jim Thompson House which was an excellent place to visit

title: Save time and headache
review: If you are thinking of using a taxi in Bangkok this is an adventure that you don't want especially for travel that is more than a few blocks in the central areas They have no idea where to go and the traffic is the worst I have seen anywhere in my travels  Take the BTS it is very traveller friendly fast and only 20 baht for short trips I highly recommend

title: Good choice
review: Not too many people in rush hout compare with BTSMRT which is good The train not coming late always be on time

title: The cheapest and most reliable link from BKK to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: This German made tidy and reliable train takes you from Makassan to Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Int'l airport in no time Avoiding all traffic jam and congestion of Bangkok's roads and motor ways this train keeps your stress level down as you can be sure to reach your airplane on time And for only 35THB per trip it is also very cheap

title: The fastest way into the city
review: The rail link is 45 baht one way and runs frequently  It's on the lower level of the airport  take escalators all the way down and get what looks like a poker chip token from the ticket window  The train cars have plenty of room for luggage  Taking the train all the way to Phaya Thai takes about 30 min  If connecting to the BTS having large suitcases or multiple suitcases may be more challenging to navigate since some of the BTS stops do not have escalators  The rail link will avoid the traffic of Bangkok and get you into the city faster even if you need a taxi from the rail link or BTS station

title: Victory Monument to the airport... Airport link for sure!
review: For all those moving between the airport and Victory Monument you will not be disappointed taking the Airport Rail Link Clean inexpensive and regular the easiest way travel between the airport and the city And once in the city it connects directly with the Bangkok Sky train

title: Fast and efficient.
review: There's no point getting a taxi if you're heading to central Bangkok  However it closes from 12am  6am  The Airport Rail Link is fast efficient and cheap  Around 10% if the cost of a taxi into the city centre  It's going to feature in an upcoming Youtube video on my channel called 'The Hand That Bites'

title: Sky Train - so easy and convenient
review: We used the Sky Train for getting around in Bangkok It's really easy and fast It interconnects with the airport train the Metro and also piers on the river  Definitely get a Rabbit card to avoid lines for entrance 200 Bhat minimum

title: Better way to avoid traffic jams !!
review: Good for travelling in Bangkok to the main attractions then take taxi if it's too long too walk  In weekday morning and evening too many people take BTS skytrain to their offices Please avoid during the rush hour If you don't want to waste your time in queue for the tickets please prepare the coins for the ticket machine There's also One Day pass you can contact directly at the ticketinformation office on the station

title: easy way into the city
review: much quicker than a taxi  easy to use staff always around to assist if needed if going to central Bangkok get of at Makkasan then walk down to MRT

title: Easy and cheap

title: Great way to get around Bangkok

title: Great Experience

title: Not bad for a single traveller getting out to airport
review: I sued this rail link and it was pretty good  only point of note is that they DONT have exppress link wiht no stops  this stopped sometime last year so the rail link into town has arond 6 stops eventually stopping at Phay Thai BTS and then easy too link to Sukhumvit Link  etc    only takes around 2530 minutes to get into town from airport for a cost of 45baht  pretty good value provided you dont have lots of lugggage

title: Very convenient

title: Great alternative

title: Clean and convenient
