title: Fastest access to Suvarnabhumi airport
review: Excellent mode of transportation in going in and out of airport The airport rail link is located right inside the airport terminal (at lower level) Very easy to find Just follow the clearly posted signs inside the airport

title: Surprisingly modern, clean, and orderly
review: Our hotel was in  Sukhumvit by the BTS Nana station so naturally we used the sky train The BTS day pass and a separate tourist boat pass allowed us to cover most of the major sight in Bangkok To purchase the BTS tickets we opted for the ticket sale counter instead of the vending machine to be safe The window staff very courteous and efficient speaks English  Labelled instructions and directions are intuitive We are impressed by the cleanliness (Ie no used paper tickets or cigarette butts etc on the grounds) the lines the riding comfort and above all the sightseeing bonus  Escalators seem to be at every station at least for the way up

title: easy movement in Bangkok
review: The skytrain is easy to use and takes you near many of the most popular locations in Bankok  Especially easy to the weekend market

title: Every city needs one

title: Sky Train.
review: Okay not as good as I thought it would be  its just a train Not sure what I was expecting Good mode of transport though even if to get you in an air conditioned space for 10 mins

title: Good

title: No traffic jams to the airport

title: best way to travel the city

title: Easy and efficient
review: BTS Skytrain is clean and safe  It is easy to purchase tickets at machines or window agents very affordable  I did not notice graffiti inside the cars always a good sign  I do recommend if it serves your destination much better than sitting in Bangkok traffic

title: Essential transport

title: Very convenient and easy transport route from Airport to city
review: This is such an easy and cheap way of getting from the airport to the centre of Bangkok It's so user friendly station clearly marked in the airport route maps everywhere simple ticket purchasing system (ticket machine or ticket office) and air conditioned trains We got the train to Makkasan and connected with the underground system from there to get to Sukhumvit The walk between the two stations at Makkasan is short and a covered walkway so not onerous at all Can't remember exact price but the ticket from airport to Makkasan was approx 40 baht

title: Well organized tourist trip
review: The trip was very well organized we heard a lot about Thailand and our tour guide was great The two markets were great to look at but a total tourist attraction  We were advised not to go shopping and I felt very sorry for the animals for photos (snakes and small monkeys)

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: The BTR offers 2 lines that transverse the major areas of interest in Bangkok Quick easy cheap comfortable and reliable

title: it beats driving

title: super fast and cheap
review: Great choice for Bangkok but closes at 12am It is cold inside but very very clean Better then most trains I know from Europe

title: Very convenient
review: Best way to get around sukhomvit area Has a station at all the major shipping centers Ad well it can be taken to the weekend market (chatuchak) Very clean and English signs are also provided at the station and on trains

title: Convenient public transport

title: Convenient

Bts train in bangkok is always clean and frequent Crowded but yet they are very frequent love their excellent service👍🏻👍🏻

title: BETTER THAN MOST EUROPEAN SYSTEMS
review: The MRT Skytrain and BTS offer the easiest and most comfortable ways of getting around Bangkok and avoiding the trafficThe system is modern with aircon and wifi on the trains and a good information and station announcement system We found local Bangkok people very helpful and whenever we were looking a little lost they would stop and ask if they could hep The link to Survanabhumi airport is open and the one to don Muang will open within the next 6 months

title: Easy to Use
review: The BTS Skytrain is easy to use all you need is to know where you want to go Look on the map find the exit you need The Skytrain will take you from one point to another the only problem you will have is getting to where you will board the train from your hotel Many hotels offer complimentary shuttle service by boat or land The hotel boat's runs automatic every fifteen to thirty minutes Look for the sign that say "hotel shuttle" area  there are other taxi shuttles that will cost You need first to look at the map in order to see which train you need to take then find your exit   You ask the ticket agent for help heshe will tell you the amount you need to pay and give you change   Once you know  the amount you need to pay to your exit you go to the machine and pay that amount The agent does not sell the ticket When you have your ticket look to the sign where you train runs go through the machine by inserting the ticket on the slot and save your ticket in order to get out in your final destination If you think you get off at the wrong exit ask the guard inside before leaving This way you can still board the train without having to pay again Once you put the ticket through the exit it will not comeback out This is real easy for those used to the rail system

title: An Excellent Private Tour
review: Our tour guide and driver picked us up from our Bangkok accommodation at 7am as planned and off we went through the early morning traffic heading north to the River Kwai There was a useful coffee and toilet stop after 90 minutes of travel We reached Kanchangaburi after a further 60 minutes drive and our first historical stop was the Commonwelth War Graves Cemetry an emotional experience so beautifully presented and laid out There were so many graves and so many young lives lost  very sad Next we stopped at a small bamboo hut a replica of the prisoners of war living accommodation  very basic and a number of historical black and white photographs telling the story of the Death Railway The Bridge over the River Kwai was next just a kilometre away We had time to walk over the bridge view its structure and the River Kwai The train arrived within 40 minutes We had reserved seats and travelled for 90 minutes having opportunities to see the River and various cuttings and elevated sections of the railway Our driver met us at the end of the line and we were taken to a pleasant local restaurant for a buffet lunch and drinks After lunch we again travelled by car to the Hellfire Pass Memorial Centre This is a modern building tastefully designed and laid out to commemorate those prisoners of war who lost their lives on this particularly difficult section of the Death Railway It was funded by the Australian Government as a large majority of the workforce and deaths were Australians The Centre provide free audio guides which allowed us to walk through the massive rock cutting following the route of the original railway line and stop at numbered markings to listen to stories from prisoner of war survivors The Death Railway was a significant feet of human courage and endurance On the way back to Bangkok we stopped to view a pretty waterfall We arrived back in Bangkok around 7pm having thoroughly enjoyed our tour

title: Do not take this train!
review: I thoroughly agree with the last reviewer Exactly the same experience We were on coach 11 cabin 1920 in first class The air conditioning only starts when the train is about to move It then smells of fumes I asked the attendant how to stop them (she assumed we were too cold didn't want to confuse her with the real reason) You couldn't stop them and we were too warm anyway There is enough fumes in Chiang Mai without having them in your sleep while you get there   I didn't sleep a wink with the constant unexplained stops the jolting from side to side putting my shirt up to stop the fumes and worry about derailing as it has in the past It hit something at one point and come to an abrupt stop The driver couldn't pull away without jolting the train I can't believe anyone slept We were in first class might as well have had second where I hear they had the light on all night to contend with as well either way you couldn't sleep The toilets smelt and had a wet floor so I tried to go as little as possible The food was luke warm at best The attendant seemed desperate for us to have a beer then I realised why when it come to more than the food We arrived an hour later than scheduled maybe the driver was avoiding derailing   I'm going to make a similar plea as the last reviewer Please please please don't use this train for this journey and go by plane instead

title: SkYTrain quick and reach destination more than cars
review: Skytrain is quick and reach destination to different stop Siam Paragon Sathorn Road etc it's a best way and comfortable for people Thailand people are going to work  it's very clean have air conditioner TV news it's  have most tourist spot for other traveler it's also have a temple for Thai people to pray And it's a more advantages than cars because it' avoiding traffic and get away from hot weather in Bangkok if you come at 4 or 5 o clock  have many people in cars and it's have Elevator for people who have wheel chairs in different stations I think it's a most comfortable for tourist to travel in a sky train because it's more cheaper than taxi  which plies Silom and Sathorn Roads the Central Business District of Bangkok terminating at the National Stadium and Bang WA The lines interchange at Siam Station and have a combined route length of 3645 kilometers (2265 mi Besides the BTS Bangkok's metro system also comprises the underground railway line MRT and the elevated Suvarnabhumi Airport Link (SARL) serving several stations in the city before reaching the airportThe first elevated level of the stations contains the ticket booths some small kiosklike shops and access control gates The second level (and third at Siam station) is again accessed with stairs and escalators and contains the platforms and rails With the exception of Siam Station the stations follow a side platform layout Siam Station utilizes island platforms to facilitate crossplatform interchange between the two lines Additionally many stations have ramps and elevators to allow passengers who use wheelchairs to access the ticketing hall and platforms from the street The distances between doors are equal throughout the train regardless of whether they are in the same or different cars and the locations where the doors will be after the train has stopped are marked on the platform The platforms are built to accommodate trains of six cars but trains of only three or four cars are in operation Security personnel are stationed at every platform and ticketing hall To give hasty passengers some leeway there are often signs at the escalators "Walk Left Stand Right"  Three Skytrain stations Sala Daeng Asok and Mo Chit are interchanges with the underground MRT system Saphan Taksin station is connected to the adjacent Sathon pier where the Chao Phraya Express Boat services call Many stations are linked by 'Skybridges' (overhead pedestrian walkways) to neighbouring buildings and public amenities  Consumption of food or drinks is forbidden past the ticketing gate or on the Skytrain  Platform screen doors (half size) have been installed at On Nut Phrom Phong Asok Chit Lom Siam Phaya Thai Victory Monument Sala Daeng and Chong Nonsi stations in 2014[8] These will eventually be installed at all stations The installation at Phrom Phrong station caused a software problem and a 6 hour shutdown of all BTS services on 24 December 2013 leading to gridlock in the cityFor singletrip and storedvalue ticket holders fares are calculated according to distance but adult  student  senior passes for limited  unlimited train rides are also available Next to the magnetic fare cards which require replacement once every two years the Skytrain has adopted nearfield contactless technology in its ticketing system with the intent of becoming compatible with the system presently used in the MRT  In May 2012 the new storedvalue ticket called Rabbit Card was launched instead of the old one Rabbit Card is a brand new electronic payment card system that allows holders to pay for the fee of BTS and BRT with only one card[10] Rabbit Cards can also be used to pay for other services and restaurants that are associated with BTS for example McDonald's Burger King Starbucks  At its opening the BTS had twentythree stations on its two lines seventeen on the Sukhumvit Line and six on the Silom Line with both lines interchanging at Siam Since then six additional stations have opened on the Silom Line and five additional stations have opened on the Sukhumvit Line respectively

title: Fast, affordable and modern
review: The skytrains are fantastic There are a number of options you can choose from to get around bangkok but nothing is quite like the skytrains   They remind me of New York trains but with are a little more modern They are also pretty frequent so you will always have a train coming   The automated ticket vending machines are in Thai or English and advise exactly how much you need to pay per trip I used it to travel from National Stadium (Starting of Silom line) to Surasak (5th stop) and it cost me 34thb or in NZD $150odd  If you plan on using the skytrain alot I would recommend getting a Rabbit pass card The have several options which you can choose from that would suit yout travel frequency  The trains also advise which station is coming up in Thai and English so you know when to get off  It also has a direct line to the Airport at Suvarnabhumi which costs up to a maximum of 46thb per journey The end of line is in the city at Phaya Thai  Overall a great modern cheap public transport system

review: We took the train from the airport to the train station in the city centre It's 45 baht for a single journey

title: Cheap and accessible
review: Use it often when we are in Bangkok and bypass the traffic on the roads below Use the stations map to work out the fare Generally crowded during peak hours but that is fine Nice if the frequency of the trains is increased

title: Very efficient public transportation.
review: To travel around in Bangkok is consider very easy there are lots of great building and places situated near to the Skytrain station and you can travel cheap Consider buying the rabbit Card if you are going to travel a lot by sky train in Bangkok as it is cheaper then paying cash Require 100 baht for the card and you may top up another 100 more to go around

title: Reliable and fast
review: Fast and efficient bts train service at affordable price Strategiclly located and clean station Nice and easy to take

title: Best way to get to/from the airport
review: Easy and cheap way to the airport 40 minutes and 8 stops Arrivesdeparts in lower level of airport If you arrive in Bangkok on a late flight remember that the BTS (to which the Rail Link connects) stops at midnight MonFriday so you will need to get a taxi if your hotel is not within walking distance of the Phaya Thai BTS

title: BTS is great.
review: Bangkok is a very big city but the BTS makes it easy to come from one place to another  It is a cheap way to go explore the city It just do what it's supposed to do

title: no escalator!!
review: most BTS train station dont have escalator need to climb stairs otherwise it is clean and quite frequent

title: Sara Floating Market trip
review: Love Sara service all the way for our train and floating market experience Well explained on Thailand history  how to speak simple in Thai Always provide advise to us for the shopping tips 🥰

title: Great if you're heading into the Phaya Thai area of the city
review: The Rail Link is quiet underutilised but I've used it on several occasions and it's been reliable relatively quiet and cheaper than taking a taxi   If you have more than 1 person in your party splitting a cab would work out about the same cost but if you need to go somewhere near the sky train station in Phaya Thai it might be worth checking out

title: Easy to Navigate
review: The skytrain is pretty easy to navigate It is a great way to get around the city cheaply I used it frequently while in Bangkok I felt safe and it got me where I needed to go quickly

title: A great way to get around Bangkok
review: We stayed near the Asoke station and used the BTS as our main mode of transport  It was great we usually rely on taxis when in Bangkok the BTS was easy to use and reasonably priced much cheaper than using taxis not to mention a good experience

title: Well organized and good service
review: Bangkok's MRT is such a great way to get around the city Although obviously some peak times are best avoided due to the crowds most other times there's plenty of room

title: Convenient
review: If you are shopping in malls or markets near BTS or skytrain it is more convenient and easy to use the BTS to go to places like Siam Paragon Siam Centre Siam Discovery Centre (Siam Station) MBK (National Stadium station) Central World Big C or Pratunam market (Chidlom station)   Many said if more than two persons it is better to take the taxi which is not true As during mall closing time many taxi refuse to use the meter and charge a high fixed fare Some bring you to diamond factory or take a longer route   Buy the one day pass (THB13000 for adult) which is cheaper than per trip ticketif intend to go to a few places in a day Use the skywalk to reach your destination following the easy to read directional signs to your desired shopping mall after getting off the train  Always stay in a hotel near the BTS station to enjoy this accessibility and convenience

title: Fast, easy and we'll run.
review: If the Taxi life gets to you and the rush that is Bangkok might  Use the Skytrain  But plan ahead because there is not a lot of English help however if is very safe and very well run

title: Fast & convenient
review: The airport link is the most convenient way to get to the airport It's very fast but it is VERY CROWDED when you first get on and thins out as you approach the airport Not suitable if you have very large bags and luggage with you Perfect if you just have a backpack or a small carryon

title: Best way to get to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport.
review: This train goes right into the airport and runs toward central Bangkok and terminates at Phaya Thai BTS train  It also intersects with the MRT train at Makkasan  You can get almost anywhere in BKK  The train runs frequently is inexpensive clean quiet great air conditioning The full length of this line is about a half hour At each end security (soldiers I think) carefully inspect the entire train with dogs It only takes a few minutes but adds a level of safety

title: Economical and convinient to and from Airport
review: Recommend this only who has one check in bag and small hand carry bag If you have more than two bag then better to take taxi

title: Fast and inconvenient.
review: I am a bit torn about this review The Airport Rail Link express lines are super fast clean and comfortable never crowded 17 minutes to the airport from Phaya Thai BTS 15 from the Makkasan station  BUT  Makkasan  getting to Makkasan station is a horror You can walk from Asoke BTS (far) or Phetchburi MRT (not so far) if you don't have much to carry and don't care about getting hot But Makkasan is located in a morass of oneway streets Bangkok taxi drivers are so far expressing unwillingness to go there if they even know where it is And while it is getting easier to get proper licensed taxis when leaving it is by no means a sure thing which means it is fairly useless if you have luggage  Phaya Thai Is just fine but again difficult if you have a lot of stuff   I find myself on ARL thinking "This is great if only 'they' had thought things through"

title: Modern Urban Rail Transportation
review: I was so shocked when I first ride on the Skytrain   It was punctual clean and fast Skytrain really made living in Bangkok convenient as it helps people to travel around without being stuck in Bangkok's notorious traffic jam

title: Way to expensive for a city like BKK
review: If you are a family of 4 and above or a group of 68 then this option to travel is pathetic  Its way to expensive You might have to walk also too much to react the train  Taxi or tukk tuk will be much cheaper and comfortable  If there is too much traffic then tuk tuk Or else always take taxi so much better Use grab to book

title: very fast connection from Airport to City of Bangkok
review: its very quick and will take less than 30 minutes if you are planning to gocome from the Airport which usually can take 2 hours  only problem you face is during the rush hour

title: Clean, reliable ...but not very practical
review: Just make sure to carry a lot of change (in coins) and do not discard your ticket before exiting the network as you will need it to clear the last exit gate

title: The best way to travel!
review: It’s certainly the best way to travel in Bangkok  It’s Cost effective but most of all it’s quick so much quicker than travelling by car the roads are so busy and slow  The sky train is reliable and easy to use It’s clean and safe and there are multiple stations across Bangkok  The stations are manned by very helpful staff who will help you to work out your journeys and provide change for the appropriate fare   Can’t recommend this service enough

title: Super Fantastic Tour
review: We loved this tour Sara was our tour guide and our driver was Eddy They are an amazing duo and had a wealth of knowledge We would absolutely recommend this tour The Railway Market and Floating Market was an experience and fun

title: Best mode for to and fro from airport
review: it took just 45 baht and 30 mins to reach siam from airport had i taken taxi i would have paid atleast 700 baht and 90  mins

title: Great way to beat the traffic!
review: I LOVE the BTS skytrain It gets you close to wherever you want to go quickly and most importantly it is air conditioned Hate traffic Take the BTS Don’t want to be bothered by street vendors Take the BTS  Don’t like haggling with taxis or tuktuks or sitting in the aforementioned traffic TAKE THE BTS Oh yeah it is MUCH cheaper than all of those other options and there  are people to help you buy tickets It’s easy Enjoy

title: Easy but crowded
review: This is the easiest way to get around Bangkok Air Condition makes it a relief to escape from the heat Bangkok seem always to have huge traffic So even if taxi is very cheap the train goes faster

title: The best transport in Bangkok
review: Forget taxis or tuk tuks Skytrain is by far the best way to travel around Bangkok No traffic guaranteed Comfortable trains and nicely air conditioned And you get to see Bangkok from a different perspective

title: Excellent transportation
review: We took this system to and from the chatujak market It was clean easy to use (plenty of help at the counter if needed) and a good means of getting across a busy city

title: Smooth, Easy To Use, Convenient
review: Staff were friendly and helpful   Ticketing system is easy to use Just need to know where you're heading to   Ride was smooth   Just not enough space for the luggages

title: Easy to use Clean
review: We should have the rules in the states  No eating or drink or yakking or your phone  Very easy to use and it gets you to most places easily   Much faster then cabs and most rides are 1 to 2 bucks

title: Quick,cheap and easy to use
review: My wife and I found this a very cheap method of travelling around the city Tickets were easy to buy from the ticket offices which are clearly signed at each station One day tickets can be bought or individual tickets for each outward journey which we did as it then iallowed us the flexibility to travel back by Sky Train taxi or Tut Tut ( whichever suited us best at the time ) The only downside we found is that it runs around the centre of the city rather than direct to the centre so on some occasions we had to use other transport methods as well to access the sights we wanted to see  Also if you do use the train make sure you study the route first as on occasions you might have to change trains We found it useful that an automated voice announced the stations the train was next due to stop at in Thai and then in English

title: Efficient
review: super reliable and easy to understand if you don't speak Thai The scenery when using the Sky train is awesome all the skyscrapers of Bangkok are just so beautiful

title: Cheap transport
review: The skytrain is a very cheap way of transport in Bangkok It serves sightseeing although often busy can cause you want to leave quickly

title: Easy to use
review: Very easy to use helpful staff cheap option to get around Tickets can be bought at machines or from the ticket counter The trains are clean most of the time very busy

title: excellent
review: This is a great way to get around the city fast efficient and  very easy to use Would recommend  anyone wanting to explore Bankok to use this it is very easy to use and cheap

title: Smooth but crowded
review: Though its a airport rail its still a normal train used for public transport  Thus do not expect extra space for luggage Very pack so expect to squeeze a bit The ticket look like a token v interesting Pait 35bat to travel from S international airport to Makkasan stn

title: Easy
review: Easy to go evary where My hotel is near by the skytrain Very convenience A lot of people used Perfect

title: Worth every satang
review: The BTS (Skytrain system) really is the most effective and efficient way to get around Bangkok Whilst it does not yet cover ALL parts the network is still expanding and you can reach most places you'll want to visit Or at least get close enough to then walk or take a motorcyle taxi or tuktuk or taxi for the last stretch The system is simple and getting tickets easy Use a Rabbit Card (like Hong Kong's Octopus Card) if you're a regular visitor or stating for a prolonged period and it's even easier using it Avoid peak work hours if possible though as it's really busy and packed at those times All round it's worth every satangcent

title: a perfect choice during the peak hour
review: a good service with frequent time departure good price if you have many belongings bags is not so comfortable cause in the city station is few lift and not so international organization need to improve to serve the customer

title: Savior
review: BTS saves everyone who boards it from the traffic of bangkokespecially during the evening BTS is on timeclean and fast and you won't even realise there's chaos on the roads below your BTS tower A must for city like bangkok

title: Best train system in BKK
review: This BTS skytrain system is extending every year and now cover more than 40 stations in downtown area

title: No views, but equally as good as BTS
review: The MRT train doesn't stop at all (or most I guess) of the major shopping complexes like the BTS skytrain but does stops at places where the BTS doesn't  eg QSNCC Obviously you shouldn't expect any views though Ironically the windows seem bigger than of BTS trains

title: Efficient service
review: the easiest way to to suvarnabhumi airport i took from ratchaprapop station to airport and cost me 40thb clean and spacious this airport train will connect to BTS train at phaya thai station

title: Very nice, but not very big
review: Very clean very simple and easy to use It's more expensive than taking public buses and doesn't go everywhere in the city I'd give it 5 stars if the lines went farther

title: Visit to MBK & Downtown
review: Cheaper than a taxi to get around and its fairly easy to manoeuvre around Busy and tight at times but very good and reliable and train comes regularly too

title: Easy to get to/from the airport
review: If one lives near the main station it is a great value  I have taken it a couple of times but I was travelling light  The point is that afterwards you have to take a cab and depending on the time of arrival it would be better to take a cab from the airport

title: cheap and fast, provided you are close to sukhumvit street
review: you never have to wait more than 3 minutes it's nicely air conditioned but very crowded during rush hours Several stations connect to the underground It's cheap (depending on the distance between 15 and 50 THB for a single ride) fast (sukhumvit has traffic jams almost 247) Only drawback is that it shuts down too early at night (think the last ride is around 11pm)

title: Very impressed
review: The skytrain system is awesome  You can get everywhere so quickly and easily (and in airconditioning)  very cheap way to get around  I wish Australia had a system like this

title: Superb transportation
review: Have a nice experience using this sky train in bangkok save a lot of time to go from one place to another and fast  there's information everywhere so you will not get lost here

title: Fastest and cheapest way to travel from Bangkok Airport!!
review: This is undoubtedly the fastest cheapest and most convenient way to travel from the Suvarnabhoomi Airport into Bangkok or other way around The trains are really fast spotlessly clean and very punctual At 90 Baht per person oneway they are dirt cheap and a fraction of the 1200 to 2000 or more Baht that any kind of Taxi will charge you There is enough space to keep all your luggage and mostly the train is half empty It's even got a clean toilet inside it

title: Aircon, cheap, and timely
review: Best transit I've been on in my opinion You can pretty much get anywhere with the BTS it is fast the Aircon is very nice since it is always hot in Bangkok Faster and more reliable than LA's poor excuse for a subway system it's also easier to navigate than Londons Underground and I find the Tube very easy to use

title: Excellent air-con
review: I stayed at Okura Prestiage Hotel which has a direct connection to BTS station The BTS is very helpful for visiting Bangkok given that the traffic there is awful (however it gives you extra time to write commnets in either Facebook or TripAdvisor while waiting in the traffic jam) The aircon is marvelous that makes you pleasant even in the hot weather and huge crowds You have to move faster with some pushing and slippery while getting into the train since there are too many passengers Oneday ticket is very useful一日多次票是非常有幫助的 BTS的空調非常好 夠冷因此不會讓你在擁擠又高溫的曼谷感到不適 非常建議搭乘 可惜的是目前只有兩條線 曼谷的行車擁擠度太嚴重隨便塞車一小時以上是家常便飯推搭乘BTS

title: The way to go in Bangkok.
review: It is clean it is safe it is easy to understand and with the ridiculous traffic of Bangkok it is a fast and less stressful way to get around  We found it to be the best way to get around in Bangkok

title: Very good option
review: Bts is a good option to travel through certain parts in bangkok Its air conditioned however remember u might have a long walk from the station back to your hotel Not what u would want after buzzing along in 36 degree weather  But definately a cheap mode of transport Worth a try

title: Easy, cheap and clean
review: Fantastic service allowing easy access from the airport into the city Fortunately for us our hostel was right off the MRT which again was easy to transfer to from the Airport Rail Link Very cheap considering the prices of many cities airport rail links and a very quick transit into the centre of bangkok

title: A MUST for travellers
review: Almost the only way to get around town  Taxi  traffic Scooter  dangerous Tuk Tuk  shady WhiteGlove  the best but pricey

title: Efficient way to get to Bangkok city
review: For my recent trip to Bangkok in early April I’d decided to try the airport rail link instead of the taxi  From Suvarnabhumi Airport to my Hotel at Sukhumvit Soi 15 I took the Airport Rail to Makassan Station (tickets which are in the form of a token can be bought from the vending machines)  From Makassan I had to exit the train station walked across a overhead bridge to Phetchaburi MRT station (underground) and transfer to Sukhumvit Station  Please be aware that the tickets between the MRT system and the Bangkok BTS are not integrated This means you have to purchase separate tickets which was annoying as I had experienced on my return journey from Sukhumvit to Phetchaburi There were long queues at the ticket counters and the vending machines  This mode of transport is not recommended if you have heavy and bulky luggage bags  there are lots of stairs and the weather is hot if you arrive during the day  It is otherwise a very pleasant and efficient mode of transport

title: Fast and efficient
review: Train is fast and clean Perfect if you want to avoid the traffic jams Some stations are linked via the skywalk which is sheltered all the way

title: Best way to travel in bkk!
review: With all the crazy amounts of traffic bangkok has this is definitely the best way to travel Its cheap its easy to navigate and its all over downtown bangkok Only downfall is that it does get awfully crowded during peak hours

title: Quick an inexpensive
review: No better way to get to and from the airport Would always choose ARL over a taxi or Uber or Grab Nothing more to say

title: The best transport in Bangkok , convenient, fast, many lines to everywhere !!
review: It’s definitely one of the best transportation in bangkok since   1 The price is very reasonable  consider quite cheap 2 They got pass for tourists  so can travel unlimited for 17days (if i’m not mistaken) 3 Can go to many directions very convenient 4 Avoid bangkok traffic

title: Fast way to get about
review: Very efficient service but can be packed but there is only short distance between stations As the roads are manic this is the way to travel by choice

title: Fast
review: Bts train should be an inspiration to many public service providers The trains are clean  on time & every stop is clearly indicated in english

title: Easy access to every part of the city!
review: clean and organised train services around the city but was surprised that they don't have cards available for tourists for us to have unlimited access during short stay so we need to buy every time we need to use BTS Anyway easy and hassle free transaction all the time )

title: Precision, cleanliness and comfort travel
review: In a city like Bangkok traffic can be a pain (even though it is much better today) The BTS links you to most places and is a very efficient clean and confortable way to move around Bangkok city

title: One of the fastest option to use to travel from airport to town
review: Train comes almost every 15 minutes for the nonexpress line and the train is always congest with people from airport and people in the residential area near by If you looking for traveling without pleasure or comfort but fast here it is

title: Best
review: Bangkok is one of the most popular place Lots of people travel everyday Last month I visited Bangkok and find sky train is the best way to get any popular place of the city It is cheap rather than taxi tuk tuk or even bike as well as faster than taxi service It takes only 30 minutes to reach sukhamvit from suvarnabhumi int airport and cost around 50 bath

title: Quick and easy
review: Skytrain is a quick and accessible route for transporting The system is simple to use  Price is ok cheapUseful

title: Links to Skytrain etc
review: Use the Rail link from BKK main airport (not the old one) and it connects into the Skytrain service  Easy cheap and fast

title: Good transport system
review: Cheapclean and efficient Easy to navigate after a few trips Like anywhere can get crowded during morning rush hours Extensions being built but no links to the Grand Palace tourist area  you'll probably need to get a taxi Last train is before midnight

title: Is being extended and improved.
review: a good way to get around parts of the city as its coverage is patchy Clean and modern train and the air conditioning is a godsend Does tend to become rather crowded especially at peak times has not yet reached the major attractions

title: A great way to get around
review: The BTS or as everyone knows it is a fantastically quick and easy way to get around Bangkok  the stations have booths were you can get change if you don't have any at the time or you can buy a period pass Trains are often and run from early morning (about 6 am to late in the evening) the last one i caught was just before midnight Clean tidy and efficient  transport

title: Great way to move in Bangkok
review: With connections to the Metro and the train it's easy to get around Bangkok However sometimes it's easier faster and cheaper to take a taxi depending of course how many persons you are

title: Excellent transport link
review: Another fantastic service Simple quick and cheap to use  The staff are helpful and the train has air con  It can be busy at times

title: The express service no longer operates!
review: We've used the airport express rail link regularly if not very frequently since it opened  The service was good and it was sensibly priced  This month  May 2015  the express link had been cancelled and no date was given for its reintroduction  It is perfectly possible to use the stoppingcommuter service but the trains are often full  which is easy to understand  and the journey takes almost thirty minutes instead of about 15 on the express  The service to the airport is still convenient but it is to be hoped that the express service comes back in some form and fairly soon

title: Best Solution to see Bangkok City
review: The BTS system is quite small in comparison with other major cities around the world however gets you to a majority of sites around the city The system is expanding within the next couple of years and will be interesting to see it connecting with other major attractions For simplicity the BTS system gets a 45 but for ease of access and buying tickets a 15 why because the system is clogged during rush hour just like most other cities however the BTS system could see some drastic improvements especially to buying tickets the system has a circular column where you see ticket machines vending tickets however if you dont have the right coins then you have to go to the infoticket office and change money Another long queue to wait to receive change for the machine then instead of giving you a ticket for the journey they give you change to wait in another long queue for the ticket machineincredibly stupid and a waste of time very frustrating Recommendation Use the BTS it is much better than the metro buy a tourist card for the time your in bangkok to save you the time and frustrations of waiting and enjoy the journey The system does get clogged during peak times so try and time your journey wisely

title: Great service
review: Gets you to where you wantneed to go no worries The staff are friendly and only to willing to help Bonus

title: Fast and efficient
review: Used the service to get back to the airport from the main central railway station  Good service clean with no grafitti

title: Best Airport Rail ever
review: I always take Airport Rail from BKK airport to city It's super convenient and worth taking only 40 Baht and won't take you too much time You don't have to bargain with the taxi driver just drop on the train

title: best and fast
review: Very Highly  recommend Cabbies here have a standard rate of 100 Bhat for any short trip and trains in that case are best for long distance and with kids cabs are fine

title: The best public transportation means between the airport and city
review: Whenever we travel to Bangkok we would use ARL fromto the city and Suvarnabhumi airport since it was opened more than 8 years ago which is the most convenient and low cost way to reach both destinations and at Phaya Thai station where can be semi interchanged with BTS skytrain system literally bring you to down town area and many parts of the city Can't imagine without it even though sometimes it could be overcrowding in the train carriage during the weekends and holidays

title: Convenient.
review: Very Convenient and easy to use to and from The Intl Airport Clean and cool About 30 minutes ride to city center Budget

title: Nostalgic
review: I'm writing this 10 weeks into my 12 week holiday This trip is the highlight of my holiday so far full of nostalgia  Listening to the old fashioned whistle "toot" on the jerky shaky hot and sweaty train journey then walking across " The bridge over the river kwai " in part it was like stepping back in time We had many stops for food and drink we also had a great time at the adventure park just before the bridge a clean safe well organised area nice picnic area and of course wall to wall sunshine with a back drop of rolling countryside down to the river Kwai Unforgettable day great memories

title: Don't take a taxi from the airport, take this instead
review: Fast and easy  Especially around evening BKK traffic is HORRIFIC entering the city and you will be in a taxi for hours if you decide to take one This is a much more reliable fast and cheap option to get to and from public transport to the airport

title: Great shuttle
review: Good transportation to the airport The skytrain is cheap and very fast Not as anoying as taking a cab

title: rapid link
review: Rapid link for airport to Bangkok 2 modes are available  the quickest only stops once and the 2nd has various stops  so depending on where you go limits your choice Most stations have no lifts or escalators so bear that in mind if you have lots of luggage Taxis also have limited boot space due to lpg tank stored in boot so again space is limited

title: Beat the ridicules Bangkok traffic take the BTS or Subway
review: Clean and like new  people travelling behave themselves unlike the trains and subways  in the USA

title: Very well organized but freezing
review: You need to pack extra clothes just for the ride but it does provide swift and punctual service to get around quickly

title: Fast and cheap
review: I've taken this several times especially when there was high traffic  It's fast and cheap and gets you where you need to go

title: Clean, efficient and regular
review: We used the BTS every day we were in Bangkok The ticket machines only accept coins so you usually have to change money each time which is a bit inconvenient But the service is really clean fast and obviously wellused by locals and tourists alike

title: Punctual and comfortable to travel
review: Not all station are strollerhandicap friendly but the ticketing counter staff are definately friendly and helpful Fees are relatively cheap and most important punctual People are nice there where they won't hesitate to offer seats for you Purchasing tickets at the machine are easy and fast too

title: Very nice BTS and new
review: BTS in Thailand was new and clean Easy to buy ticket and using For me they not have big traffic like in Japan It's fine to use BTS in Bangkok I was convenience more than bus or taxi

title: Best transportation in town
review: you need to hop on in early morning (under 7am) to avoid Bangkok rush hour Stand in middle of statition to hop on to the train because the train carriage is not long enough

title: Expensive but worth it
review: By Thai standards this is an expensive way to travel but once you try it you will enjoy the cleanliness efficiency and views from this great service

title: To just about anywhere and back
review: We walk about 30 minutes to get to Bang Wa BTS station at the terminus of the Silom line The BTS takes less time to get to National Stadium (the other teminus station) than our walk to the station It is quiet has ac and (at least for us) plenty of seats Stations are announced in English and Thai as you approach and queues are orderly but it does get crowded as you approach the city At Siam you can change for Phaya Thai (on the Sukhumvit line) and then to the airport It's quick and cheap but needs two changes of trains Siam is very busy as it is an intersection with another line but if you go with the flow of people you'll get where you need to be to leave the station for the numerous shopping centres and BACC or to change trains Trains start at 0630 end at midnight and arrive every 5 or 6 minutes during these times Most stations are near major parts of the city or at least join another of the transport systemswalking areas allowing easy movement throughout the city The BTS Rabbit Card does not work with the MRT transportation system so you need an separate cards but that's an administrative problem rather than a travel problem You need to work out what you want  (a)Slightly squashed in an ac carriage that gets you there quickly or (b)stuck in a Bangkok traffic jam (and pay more for the privilege) I usually go by train

title: Avoid traffic jams with taking the skytrain
review: Get to the shopping centre and even to the weekend market But be prepared to freeze (air condition)

title: Nice experience
review: I never "flied" with a train before but in Bangkok i did It was very nice to travel in Bangkok with this transport mean Quick clean and with pleasant people Sometimes of course depending of the hour it was crawled I traveled in 2011

title: Great access to Bangkok
review: wonderful cool (airconditioned) transport to most main attractions  Value for Money although expensive for natives unless city workers

title: Efficient!
review: One of the most efficient ways to get around Bangkok Coupled with the BTS this makes traversing Bangkok a breeze on time clean air conditioned and cheap Of course it can be crowded entering the stations and on the train in peak hours

title: Ready trip
review: Best and easiest also cheapest and fastest way to get to Airport depending where you are train clean and fast  good service

title: One line running
review: Of the two rail links (Express and City Lines) only the City Line was operational And the line has limited hours of operation with the last train at midnight  a real shortcoming for the many tourists who arrive on international flights at the dead of night That said I've found the staff helpful and the line to be of real use during operating hours

title: Sky Train is very easy to use to get around Bangkok
review: While the Sky Train is very easy to use if you have a 4 or more people a taxi may be cheaper but also could take longer in traffic

title: Quick trip to the river
review: Skytrain again It's easy to use if you know where you need to go The transfers are easy too Clean but crowded during rush A good ride and above it all

title: Overcrowded
review: I used to live in Bangkok in 2012 and back then the BTS was great Now its always overcrowded as hell Sometimes you need to wait 3 Trains to get on Also it has increased in price by about 4050% Network extensions are going super slow for example they are building an interconnect to Don Mueang for like three years already

title: Easy access to getting around Bangkok!
review: When I first started visiting Bangkok I always used a taxi then I discovered how userfriendly and so much cheaper and quicker to use the Airport Rail Link There are staff security people who are friendly and helpful the trains are clean the various stops are clearly marked and the announcer repeats the stops in both Thai and English

title: Great value if you're fit and don't have luggage
review: Cheap efficient clean air conditioned However you have to get guard to radio to someone to unlock the lift and after waiting for someone to arrive with key were told it was out of service so if you have luggage or physical handicap not suitable

title: Very cpnvenitent
review: Roughly 45 mins all up from Phaya Thai allow a little extra during peak periods Easy connections from BTS

title: The best choice for Airport!
