title: Getting around Bangkok
review: This is essential for transportation in Bkk Airconditioned and shaved your legat and feet Before Anyway and subway It really was a project that took long time to go from one part to another Even during rushours its nice and convenient much dur to the helpful people ❤️

title: Outstanding
review: Western standards at eastern prices offering a pleasant stressfree and spacious environment with the airconditioning an added bonus in the Bangkok heat

title: Convenient way to travel in Bangkok
review: Make sure to optimize the use this transport facility in Bangkok Its convenient cheap quicker and safe

title: Efficient to get around
review: Use the skytrain It is better than sitting in the traffic jam spending hours in a taxi outside rush hours it is fine taking a taxi and cheaper

title: Great experience!
review: Dada our guide made the experience all the more wonderful  He greeted us at the hotel with such professionalism and warmth that it set the tone for the rest of the tour  Our driver was also very good  a smooth and safe ride throughout The tour itself was enjoyable and we had a great time experiencing both the railway market and the floating market  and of course the wonderful food  Would definitely recommend others to jloin this tour

title: This Is The Smart Way To Get Around In Bangkok
review: Anyone traveling in Bangkok I recommend doing it by public transportation such as the BTS (elevated) or by MRT (subway) you may choose the TukTuk if you are keen on treating your lungs to proper pollution You may choose the taxis if you want to be rejected as a customer (big problem in Bangkok Taxidrivers unwilling to drive customers to their desired destination) Or you may take a motorcycle taxi to get to the end of a Soi quickly or if you are in pressed for time during rush hour A rental car in Bangkok would be a sign that you are completely unprepared for this city

title: Whistle Stop Market Tour
review: A whistle stop trip to the railway and floating markets Good value and fast paced It might have been nice if our guide had given us some background of the history and background behind both markets  but that might have been due to some of our fellow guests talking when he was trying to give us the basics It was a bit rushed in places but we booked it so as not to spend 9 hours doing the same trip so that was to be expected We were back in Bangkok for 330pm time for a shower swim and out for the evening Thanks to Vincent (our guide) and driver who worked wonders through the traffic

title: Interesting, but lack of information
review: It could be better the guide could be more interested in informing tourists about the places he uses an overcrowded train and misses the market movement

title: cheap transportation
review: I think the price is higher than MRT so most citizen will use MRTBTS is more comfortable than MRTMy hostel is near to Siam BTS so can take BTS go to Mo Chit station to go chaktuchak marketIn a hightemperature country BTS got air condition

title: Real good option
review: Like the skytrain Yes great to travel with The stations are not of many so to say But a good way to prevent from traffic jams And a good cheap alternative to tuk tuk and taxis Connects with the skytrain worth using

title: Super clean!
review: This like the BTS is very clean safe and reasonably priced  My only complaint is that I wish that the trains were more frequent

title: superb.............
review: very good service at very good cost we have used this for full stay of 4 days in Bangkok very convenient and very safe better than waiting for hours in traffic jam

title: Yay
review: I love the mass transport of Bangkok and this is a great part of it  easy to use and well integrated to the sky train

title: A Great Time and Money Saver!
review: There was a long queue at both taxi stands And I need to get home fast I went inside again and proceeded to the Airport Rail Link Half an hour later I was in the place where I was supposed to be And grinning

title: The only way to get around Bangkok
review: So easy to use and so cheap Clean and comfortable The BTS will only get better as it is expanding with new stations

title: Easy transfer to the City at affordable rates, bypassing the heavy traffic!
review: 40bht per person including children provided a quick & very affordable transfer from Airport to our hotel and vice versa Trains come every 10min and takes about 2030min transfer to airport  Probably cheaper for small travel groups The biggest advantage is that one can avoid peak hour traffic as the train is relatively uncrowded

title: Best option in Bangkok
review: During peak hours it is very difficult to move in BangkokWalking to the nearest BTS and go anywhere is the cheapest and best option

title: Easy, Easy, Easy
review: The easiness of the train system the cleanliness of the trains

title: Bts sky train
review: Bangkok is popular with all the traffic jam taxy scam and in holiday mood like this BTS sky train is an option to travel with air con easy to use and clean people in thailand very nice to show u the way

title: Memorable Trip
review: I travelled solo in OctoberI was on an organised tour and the tour operator picked and dropped off at my hotelIt took 2 hours to arrive at the point of where our tour commencedPart of the tour started by a visit to one of the war cemetaries and a museum which provides a very graphic pictorial history of the building of the railway by allied POW's and local people Then onto a boat trip up the Kwai river to the bridge where you can walk across the bridge The railway station is next to the bridge where a train will arrive to take you on about a 1 hour trip through to countryside with stops along the wayThe train has wooden seats and no aircon (open windows supply air)It is very enjoyable and vendors continually walk through the train carriages selling fooddrinks and various souvenirsOur group (12) then stopped for lunch at a lovely outdoor garden resort which served mainly asian food but westernised for the tourists tastes(not spicy)This was set in a gardenforest setting and was very tranquilLunch was included in the price but if you require extra such as soft drinks or alcohol it is not included in the package and was an extra costSpent about 1 hour or so before heading back to my bangkok hotel which took about 3 hours by our tourist vanAs a guide the day trip takes nearly 11 hours (730am to 600pm)

title: Way cooooool
review: You need to be "on the ball" to work out which train to take the language barrier sometimes is frustrating but ASK and you will be helped by very friendly locals Cool train ride  did this a few times and worth travelling each time

title: Quick, cheap and lovely views of the city
review: Very cheap way to get around the city like a local Clean and air conditioned and easy to buy tickets for

title: convenient
review: conveniently to town centre avoid road traffic jam with taxi comfortable and spacious cabin best transportation from airport

title: Very good choice to travel to the air port
review: it's really convenient for the tourists and people who want to go to the airport because it's safe your time and taxi scammer It's taking you from the airport to the city centre If I have to go to the airport during the service time I usually prefer to take the train to the airport rather than taxi

title: Awesome
review: The local train is fantastic  Windows open clickety clack as you work your way thru the Thai countryside  It's important to reflect that as you travel enjoying the moment that all along the route people's father's sons husbands brothers and friends died after a horrendous "life" as Pows  It is hard to reconcile the enjoyment of the now with the recent history Highly recommended

title: A very convenient way to get around in central Bangkok
review: Had always relied on BTS when I travel to Bangkok Efficient and clean It can crowded during rush hours but other than that not much to complain about It is also a great way to see the locals at their routine

title: Took just under 30 minutes from Phaya Thai Station
review: We found it so comfortable that we took a taxi to the Phaya Thai Station and traveled by Airport Link train with our luggage You may also take the BTS to reach to Phaya Thai station if you are traveling light It takes 45 bahtperson and fixed half an hour to reach airport station

title: BTS, nothing else
review: Simply the best way to move around in BKK  MRT a Second Choice  Also the city has evolved into a place where you either live nearby BTS & MRT being fortunate or not

title: Best way to get round
review: This might be the best way to get round Bangkok but it is crowded and pushy for most of the day If you are going out you need to know that trains do not run after midnight

title: Awesome way to get around, especially to airport.
review: Way to goeasy to read info and affordable to  Easy and quick way to get to airportclean and airconditioned too  Amazing platform safety features If only all cities could utilise such technology

title: The only way to go
review: Bangkok traffic is crazy  the BTS is the only way to traverse the city cheaply and quickly  get a BTS card and off you go

title: The Best path
review: Since they built it We always used it Without a doubt it is the best way to get the Center of Bangkok in less time At the begining there was two sky train lines Non stop and the other one now there is just the one wich has diffrent stops But it is ok In 30 minutes You will be there In a taxi coulb be two hours  You must check wich is the Best stop to take another line or the subway  I always enjoy the trip looking through the window looking how different is this country I love it

title: Excellent
review: Although I've been to Bangkok many times I've always used the skytrain and never needed to venture underground On my most recent trip the closest public transport station to a market we were going to was "Thailand cultural center" and that's how my first journey on the mrt came about Because the skytrain is newer I expected the underground mrt to be a bit rough around the edges and dingy so I was pleasantly surprised It was modern clean and efficient and I wouldn't hesitate to use again or recommend

title: Fast and cheap
review: Unless you got a bunch of luggage andor are far from where the stations are this is a great way to get to the city from the airport  It's only 45 Baht to take it from the airport to the end of the line and it takes only 30 minutes to do it in a nice air conditioned train with no traffic anywhere  Taxi from airport to the Patpong area is about 350 Baht give or take depending on traffic and how long you sit around in it  The rail link and the BTS cost me like 65 Baht and it was a nice ride  Had to walk to my hotel instead of getting dropped off at the front door but still worth saving about 23 beers worth of Baht  If you get off at Makkasan Station it's a bit of a walk to the metro station but one you get there it's 45 stops to Silom  Take it to the end at PhayaThainear MBK and it's only four stops on the BTS to Sala Daeng station(Silom) near where I was staying

title: Very easy to use
review: The Skytrain is very clean and easy to use and a great way to get around  Coming from the US where public transit (where it exists) is often a nightmare experience the courtesy cleanliness and good service of the Skytrain was a real novelty (Tellers will make change for you no problem) This may be less impressive for folks coming from places with good transit systems of course )  In general cabs and tuktuks are very inexpensive in Bangkok so the Skytrain may not always be a better value (especially for groups) but you can skip the traffic jams and eliminate the stress of negotiating fees with each driver

title: Train and boat market
review: This tour was one of the highlights of our Thailand trip Kiwi our tour guide was great The train market was fun to be a part of and the floating market is a must to experience

title: Super simple
review: Very convenient connection from bats and very simple and inexpensive to use Very clean and convenient drop off

title: Old but not obselete
review: My 2 friends and I took Class 2 aircon sleepers (Lower Berth) from Bangkok and Chiang Mai over a night and it was amazing The sofas are made into beds by the train service staff and it was super comfortable You can also look out of the window and bask in the warmth of the sun and the beautiful scenery There is an openconcept restaurant within the train and I recommend having a meal there Pretty cool dining on an rickety old train Highly recommend this experience to those looking for something a little less orthodox methods of traveling within Thailand for tourists

title: Slow
review: i will rather traveller to get a cab or some other transport to the city or any place you wanna go  However during a traffic jam  The rail link is the most useful transport

title: very punctual
review: The BTS service is excellent to know BKK Tip find a hotel close to the BTS station so you can go around the city very cheap

title: Recommended form of transportation
review: A lot cheaper and faster than a taxi or tuktuk You miss all the traffic and  get a good view of the city Frequent air conditioned clean  convenient cheap friendly staff  The machines to buy your tickets are really straight forward if not the ticket office staff are helpful and speak English

title: Great system
review: We took the BTS Sky train from Nana To Taksin to pick up the river boat Our friend who know Bangkok was with us you have to have change or go to the counter to get it as the machines give out coins but not notes Look at a map where you are going from and to Ours was 45bht Buy your ticket and keep it to the end of your journey when the machine takes it off you

title: Excellent - cool and on time
review: Cool modern and on time Crowded all the time but easy to queue to get on Try to buy a multi trip card as these are easier to use but offer no dsicount

title: "Refrigerator on wheels"
review: Got the sky train on Monday from Siam station to Taksin station after a gruelling walk in searing heat what a relief fantastic efficient way to get around Bangkok

title: fast clean very cheap
review: Easy to use even on first day in bangkok it is clean fast and very cheap

title: Best to get around
review: We got around Bangkok by using BTS mostly best way to travel to get to all the shopping centres just make sure that you are on the right platform going towards the right directions Really uncomplicated Hv lots of coins cause the ticketing machines do not accept notes But you can always buy a ticket or exchange notes for coins at the control station If you plan to take a few trips on the skytrains on the same day you may want to buy A Day Ticket I think it is Baht140 per pax

title: Great transportation
review: Efficient cheap safe orderly user friendly  Keep ticket on hand to exit  First time I have seen people line up in rows to enter train Very civilized

title: Quick and useful
review: The skytrain is cheap (at least for tourists) and very useful in getting from place to place at least if you are close to it

title: Bangkok's best place to keep beer cold
review: All destination which can be reached by BTS should be approached by BTS There is no better way to commute in this city with a horrible traffic in the streets The AirCon would keep dead pigs suitable for use as food

title: BTS Service Bangkok
review: This is excellent service for moving around Bangkok  low cost and much quicker than sitting in Taxis

title: Far superior to London under ground tains
review: Easy to use cheap and clean very efficient service Great for visiting other parts of the city and for shopping at MBK store or Siam Centre

title: Only way to travel in Bangkok
review: Skytrain and MRT are only way to travel in Bangkok Sometimes you have to take a Tuk Tuk or Cab but most of the time the public trans system will do So clean and easy to use as well as being cheap Plus you don't have to hassle with cab drivers  If you are brave of heart and want a experience you will never forget take a motorcycle taxi (short distance) It will blow your mind These guys dart in and out of travel take short cuts and go way to fast Very exciting Cost you like 2040 baht (12 USD) Do it

title: Easy to navigate
review: Easy to navigate and the cashiers are helpful  Fast and cheap with air conditioning Also used the train As an over head crosswalk Crossing big roads is scary

title: Fast transport
review: Fastes and cheapest transport around the city Especially when its rush hour Only minus is that its open til midnight

title: Great way to get around Bangkok.
review: Do not rent a car while in Bangkok Traffic congestion is terrible BTS and MRT are fantastic They are easy to navigate completely safe and always spotlessly clean

title: Comprehensive Experience!
review: The timing of this excursion was perfect The time spent in both locations felt like just enough and allowed us to experience the sites on our own time in a comfortable way Our tour guide was great and knowledgeable and explained local customs and stories very well The floating market tour was a great experience however you could tell it was geared towards trying to get tourist to buy things (which I understand) but it was a little draining Other than that I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting the area Plenty of places to buy food and both tour guide and transportation were very reliable

title: Vacacuines en Bangkok
review: MRT is the subway underground of Bangkok I usually stay overnight near Asok so it is the most practical on weekends you can go to Chatuchack Wekend Market which is one of the largest in Bangkok and the world

title: Fast and convenient, better have exact change
review: In my opinion the best way to get around Bangkok Modern and fast (and more important air conditioned) The process of buying tickets can be a little confusing at first You need to get tickets from the machine and you need the right coins for that It is not trivial to get the attention of the attendant in the booth but when you do you will be told which station is your destination and the attendant can also break bills into the coins the machine needs

title: Sara was an excellent guide
review: The trip was an early start but worth it Sara kept us well informed and was very knowledgable about the areas we traveled through  She ensured we were fed and watered with local foods throughout the day  The places we visited were amazing to see

title: Easy and cheap
review: We used this around the Sathon area  great for getting to the MBK area and to the Skybar our hotel (eastin grand) has a stop at it Much cheaper than using taxistuk tuks so definitely worth a trip on

title: The best form of travel in BKK
review: The best form of travel in Bangkok where traffic is horrendous Have coins at hand to purchase tickets if you don't have your own Rabbit card

title: Easy way to reach Airport
review: Its probably the best way to reach Airport if one has to travel in busy traffic hours The only problem I see is that it is not connected to all major parts of the city From Sukhumvit 22 to reach airport train  one has to use  BTS first & walk 5 mins then take MRT subway walk again for 5 mins to reach the Makasan station bit difficult for anyone with loads of baggage

title: Clean and quick
review: The sky train is a really useful and inexpensive way to get around Bangkok It’s clean and quick and you don’t have to put up with the busy roads of Bangkok

title: Fast and easy
review: We took the train for shopping  It is fast and easy and plenty of space for everyone Will certainly be using it again next time we visit

title: Mass Transit
review: Use of the BTS(above ground rail system) is best to circumvent BKK's surface traffic on BKK's busy roads The Skytrain does link with the MRT underground system) at various interchanges

title: Cheap and easy way to get around
review: We took the BTS a few times and had no problems reading the map or asking for directions for the workers If on a budget I would highly recommend

title: Great train system
review: Great train system No Myke just buy your ticket at the ticket machine at the station Fast and reliable

title: Be Aware
review: Our tour guide did a phenomenal job and I give her credit for getting us there explaining what was going to happen and how crazy it can get She got us to the boats before the masses showed up so we could do the floating market The problem was not with the tour organizers or guide Some of the boats are powered and race past the boats that are not We got pushed into some trees by one of them which snagged our umbrellas and they crashed down on my wife and my heads It was almost out of control  The railway market was packed also and difficult to get through Lots of uneven ground to negotiate It was worth doing but be prepared for masses of people

title: Great idea
review: We used both the BTS Skytrain and the MRT yesterday getting around for the first time in Bangkok The MRT is a multi level subway colocated at some stops near the Skytrain so getting around is relatively easy however they do not use the same system of payment Skytrain is by tap onoff cards and the MRT is by black tokens the staff at each are very friendly and assisted us confused tourist with which level and platform to use no problems travelling around Bangkok we look forward to using the MRT again today

title: Better than a taxi in every way
review: If you're going to our from the airport this should be your only option It's faster than a taxi into or from anywhere in BKK and really cheap   No more half hour traffic jams You can thank me later

title: Best way to get around Bangkok!
review: The sky train is fabulous  Very safe no clean and efficient  Also inexpensive and fast way to avoid all the traffic  I highly recommend

title: Out & About
review: Excellent service easy to use  Professional and helpful staff  Stations and trains are clean and you feel safe Staff available if you need assistance The Aircon is such a relief

title: transport in Bangkok
review: The BTS skytrain is a convenient way to get around to the major shopping malls and districts in Bangkok Fast and easy to use Instructions in english and thai

title: Best of transportation between airport to down town
review: Easy and fast from airport to down town plus cheap if they can operate little late after midnight may good for everybody cause many tourists come after midnight some of them may have communication between taxi drivers good for Thai tourist business

title: Very cheap and reliable
review: I advice people to use the skytrain since it's cheap and fast It is super easy to get tickets in each station as well as knowing your next stop The only thing I hate about stations is that there is no elevators in case needed Maybe I missed it But I've been to Bangkok more than three times and never seen elevators in skytrain stations

title: convenience
review: MRT is way more cheaper than BTS (the sky train) very convenience  avoid rush hours as it will be very crowded

title: Well organized and readily in English (best A/C in the world)
review: We took the train out of curiosity but it was the easiest thing we did in Bangkok  And the air conditioning is pure luxury

title: Always use my rabbit card
review: Can be busy but trains are very regular so chill and get on the next one if too crowded Directions at each station to where you want it go are very easy to ding and follow

title: The most simple way arround Bangkok
review: Wow this is such an easy and inexpensive way to get arround the center of Bangkokclean and comfortable even for new tourists

title: Really not that great
review: The system is not connected directly to BTS the systems aren't integrated it's more of a mass transit than an airport line so it gets very crowded which sucks for carrying bags  If you're staying at the more popular Sukhumvit locations you get to transfer twice between two unconnected systems through areas that are super crowded and not baggage friendly

title: Only way to get around Bangkok - forget taxi or tuk tuk
review: Easy easy easy only way to get around Bangkok  Set price no argueing over charges with tuk tuk driver or taxis who won't use meter

title: Cheaper way to and fro bangkok city
review: From Silom i took uber to phaya thai it just cost me almost 55 baht and the airport link at phaya thai to suvarnabhumi just cost me 40baht Huge save from taking taxi

title: shopping and eating
review: From suvatbhumi airport to centara watergate pavillion hotel we use the airport rail link  The train is clean comfortable and fast

title: Great option to get downtown
review: The rail link was clean inexpensive and quick Announcements are made in Thai and English  We rode it just prior to rush hour so it wasn't too crowded As we were riding to Phaya Thai station we could see the infamous Bangkok traffic and knew we made the right choice Changing to the BTS is easy but if you have a ton of luggage be warned there are a lot of steps to climb  The BTS is also very crowded and the locals will not appreciate the room that your bags take up

title: Easy
review: Very cheap and easy to use Sometimes crowded at the times people travel for work The network is reasonably extensive and is extending I believe

title: most efficient transportation
review: it's best way to travel from airport to downtown esp on peak hour It only takes you less than 30min for 45B Schedule is quite frequent running every 15min The termination station phaya thai is directly connected to BTS station

title: Convenient and fast
review: It is a perfect mode of transport to the airport and staff are always there to assist if needed Clean easy to navigate affordable and fast

title: Great service, great price.
review: Use this to get around Bangkok it's excellent  Very frequent service good price goes to most of the places you'd want to visit If you're staying for a few days buy yourself a Rabbit ticket and skip the queues

title: From ratchethewi to mo chit
review: Its about 15mins ride Ride to mo chit is not so crowded and having strollers on board is fine But from mo chit and back is very crowded and hardly can have a strollers on board Mo chit station is very very crowded and recommend that you have coins for your ride if not the queues to buy tickets over the counter can spend you half an hour Overall experience is fine

title: Perfect means of travel!
review: If you're staying close to a BTS station don't think twice abt using the BTS Remember you don't have to buy a daily pass if you're a tourist  check where you want to go and decide whether it's worth buying a pass or just taking a ticket everytime It's the fastest means of travel and a perfect way to get into most of the major malls in bangkok

title: Really good trip, saves a lot of hassle
review: Got to see the sites and had a very knowledgeable tour guide Would have been very expensive and confusing without them

title: Quick, easy, affordable
review: If you can use the BTS rather than a taxi  fast cheap and they're everywhere  only pain in the bum is the climb up the stairs

title: Best transport to/from airport,
review: It's the most convenient mean of transportation to and from Suwannaphum Airport to the center of Bangkok There are numbers of transfer station to both MRT and BTS to take you to different places in Bangkok It brings you above all local traffic conditions into the city Just make sure you study the route to your final destination carefully on where is your connection station It's the most comfortable transport if your destination is on it's route

title: The only way to get around
review: The Skytrain is the elevated version of the metro  tube Its not particularly large and doesn't go into the west  NW of the city but it goes to places like Siam Square The airport (via a special service) and most commercial areas   It's spotlessly clean and they even have little posters explaining etiquette they definitely need some of those in London   It's best to queue up and buy a travel pass from the teller That way you're not amassing a pocket full of shrapnel If you make a mistake and underpay your fare they're nice about it and help you out rather than fine you (extortion) like they do on some mass transit systems (Prague)

title: Excellent service
review: You can save time as well as money using airport rail link very excellent service joining all important places

title: Modern, fast, direct, regular & airconditioned comfort !
review: The BTS (Skytrain) system is a fast and efficient way to travel around Bangkok  The 2 BTS lines are shown in dark green and light green on the free maps available at every BTS station  Also when you buy your ticket there will be a map of the BTS train system on the back    Make sue you are on the correct platform going in the direction you intend  There are many signs people to ask (staff who speak English) diagrams and monitors to help you  If you're staying for a while a RABBIT CARD will give you even cheaper fares  enquire at the train window  This is great as the card stores your credit  Saves time just tap going into the gates at the station and when coming out  The machine will show your credit balance  Fares are cheapfrom 15 baht for one station and several stations only around 31 baht  Tip  the trains wont waittight schedules so if you hear the train arriving at the platform be quick to get there and get in as see many a time when people a bit slow getting on and the doors close right in front of themlike the movie 'Sliding Doors' hehe    No eating or drinking allowed on trains Highly recommend this clean modern fast efficient and cheap way of travelling around popular Bangkok tourist areas

title: Great way to get around
review: With only two lines the Bangkok BTS has a limited network The trains are nice and cool  more so than the underground MRT trains During peak hour it can be difficult to get on the first train that arrives so they can be crowded but are relatively frequent A great way to get around quickly avoiding the congested roads

title: Clean and ssfe
review: I traveled solo while in Bangkok and getting around on the sky train is easy and cheap the sky train its self is really clean and the aircon keep your nice and cool there is also a police officer at every stop so you feel very safe while traveling

title: Cheap and conveninent
review: If you are travelling to a destination nearby a station then my advise would be to take a train It's cheap it's fast and you will not be stuck in traffic Be aware that not all stations have working elevators

title: BTS has come of age
review: Now that suburbia has been reached by the successive extensions plus the interconnection with the MRT the BTS has come of age  I am still not used to how full the trains are on the Sukhumvit Line

title: Up in the air you can actually see the city!
review: Hey the skytrain is the best way to avoid the cloying and noisy streets of Bangkok Reasonably priced and move SC swiftly Try to find accommodation near s BTS stop if you canyou will have a better tie in this city if you do

title: fast, efficient and economical
review: Best way to get to the city from the Airport when not carrying heavy luggages Better than taking taxi as it is faster efficient safe and economical and the plus point is that they have friendly staff to guide you at the station

title: Great
review: Fantastic service easy to navigate and dropped us right where we wanted to be in Bangkok Very cheap too

title: Hua Lamphong to Chiang Mai Train #9
review: Very professional very clean and modern overnight train Having only gotten a few hours sleep the night before due to drunken farang in my hostel I was glad that the bed was comfortable and went out like a light  At my great surprise probably as I’m used to the shockingly bad trains in the UK the overnight train arrived in Chiang Mai about 3 seconds later than it should have (0715) I put this down to my watch being slightly out  The only thing that was bad was the food lady gave me some ripped out sheets of the main menu which had all the most expensive food on it I asked for the full menu and it was given to me  Coffee in the morning at 6am was welcome

title: Easy to use
review: Simple to use clean airconditioned trains Good and easy to understand announcements single fare was 40 Bhat Great way to get around the city

title: Came back to see .
review: Ran out of time on previous visit worth seeing 100Bt entrance just walk around but more temples to see around plus seeing monks interesting Very hot and humid Best to split up day with grand Palace maybe

title: Great Service
review: Clean efficient and easy to use a great way to get around the Bangkok madness it works well with the subway and train aswell

title: A fast way to get around and avoid the huge traffic congestion
review: Very easy to navigate and get about on here Will cut you journey time in half at peak times and probably half the cost of a taxi  tuc tuc

title: Very convenient and easy to us
review: Very cheap and convenient way to get around the city The staff at the ticket counter will assist if you are unsure of which lineroute totake  Can get very crowded though

title: Good way to avoid traffic
review: Very reliable clean and efficient Bit limited with the routes but continues to expand Cheap to use and you can purchase unlimited day tickets which cost only 140 Bhat

title: Good transport
review: Catch this train to and from the airport it's quick safe and you avoid the traffic If you have an early morning flight then be careful as this transport only starts at 0600 Takes about 45 mins to reach the airport

title: Great and fast way to get to the Airport
review: Great and fast way to get to the Airport Great services always on time runs regularly and air conditioned

title: cheap and quick.
review: we used it on our way back from city center of bangkok to subkumvit airport and it was really good you got to see also the poorer part of thailand on the way on our second trip to bangkok we would use the train again instead of taxi cost with taxi was 650 and with rail link 90

title: a bit tight on rushhours but a great alternative to taxis!
review: a bit tight on rushhour but a great alternative to taxis Great value for its price  Always good to stay near a Skytrainstation

title: Flying visit to Bangkok, avoid crawling to the airport.
review: The airport link is located near to the main hotels on Sukhumvit It's not an easy walk from the main hotels on Sukhumvit Road hot and on very busy roads However at peak traffic times this could be a godsend if your hotel is pretty close It avoids horrendous traffic on all the main roads and will get you there in a predictably short time The main short coming is that it will require at least a taxi ride to get there from nearly all hotels On clear roads it would be tempting to just ride the tax all the way to the airport Sunday am and Saturday before 10 am would be good times to avoid the skytrain as traffic is quiet then

title: Best way ever around Bangkok...
review: Theres no easier or cheaper way around Bangkok Anyone who knows Bangkok traffic should be delighted about this new state of the art transport system It is still growing as we speak with new areas of Bangkok opening up to the BTS every year

title: BEST WAY to get to the city center
review: This is a clean fast efficient and inexpensive way to travel between the airport and city center When you connect to BTS Railway it will take you close to most of the places a tourist would want to go

title: Great Just Great. No traffic jams. SHORT TIME And center of Bangkok.
review: was at the end of October Connection in Bkk 7 hours Had 23 full hours in Bangkok Great value Just fast train is one in  30 minutes

title: Great service. Better and quicker than taxi
review: Fast and efficient Tickets available at basement level of airport About a quarter the cost of a taxi

title: Good
review: No doubt the fastest way to travel in Bangkok  But it can get crowed during rush hours the only way to beat the terrible traffic jams

title: Very efficient
review: The sky train hooks up with the subway the mrt but you need to have a different card or pay separately if you transfer from subway to sky train Clean and efficient a great way to get around

title: Fast transport
review: Fast and convenient means of transport Not many stations though on this line Fares are cheap as well

title: Public transport
review: Always on time Clean ThaiEnglish language Good air con

title: Fast and cheap way to get around
review: I've often used the Skytrain on my many visits to Thailand and also marvel at the ease of moving from one point to the other The friendly voice that announced in both Thai and English the next station is  a definite pleasure to foreigners

title: Super easy to get around
review: The sky train is very clean efficient and super easy way to get around Bangkok Not to mention cheap

title: Convenience
review: Very efficient public transportation You can purchase tickets via machine or ticket booth  Train is clean and fast with easy to understand map  Each station has many exits so it is best to know which exit to take so you don’t end up on opposite side of street

title: Fast mode of transport within BKK
review: The BTS is a fast mode of transportation with BKK It has two main lines and you may need to change the track depending on where you are off to Good to experience but if you have a metro back home this is nothing out of the ordinary

title: Great way to travel
review: Easy to read map as there are only two lines Next to each ticket machine is a map with numbered stations and then how many Baht the journey costs Keep all your change to buy tickets orgo to kiosk with noted Air conditioned trains clean and regular service makes for a great sightseeing tool

title: Easy to navigate
review: I traveled on the sky train from the Terminal 21 shopping complex to MBK shopping complex by myself I was rather nervous about it initially however soon found the whole system to be  very user friendly and I quickly became confidant to explore other stops along the line very regular service and inexpensive

title: inexpensive and reliable
review: great to get around and the trains are very modern it only takes 10 minutes to get to siam paragon which is a huge mall in bangkok The queues at Nana station were terrible and its always too busy

title: Avoid Traffic Jams
review: Highly recommended means of transport to get around Bangkok  Select hotel based on proximity to BTS station to avoid being stuck in traffic

title: Convenient and Reliavble
review: Easy to navigate around the city The website provides a lot of information eg fare schedule travel duration  Very good for planning

title: Fab out of the heat
review: Love the skytrain It must be one of the best inventions ever and since my last trip was two years ago its good to see they have expanded it  Travel is so easy and cost is good  A one day card costs 120 baht and saves a lot of hassle as most single trips are around 2030 baht so considering you might need to return for same price a one day ticket is good value if you use it a few times that day  Some places have a lot of queues so as Siam and Victory Monument but don't worry if too packed as another will be along in no more than 10 mins

title: convieniant
review: A cheap and easy way to get to the airport and to avoid the Bangkok traffic The train is air conditioned but can sometimes be very crowded but the trip is short and you will be in the airport in before you know it

title: Perfect solution
review: This is perfect solution to get transferred from or to the airport it cost you only 44bath until the town

title: Easy, Convienent, Cheap
review: The BTS is so easy to catch Stations are well sign posted and easy to find Tickets machines were easy to use and had instructions in English We just purchased tokens for our trip So cheap The station and trains are so clean Guards on the stations (as well as everywhere else) Would highly recommend using the BTS

title: Fast convenient service
review: It's easy to get from the Suvarnabhumi airport to the city with this fast and regular train service but it doesn't go to the other airport Don Mueang When the Skytrain is extended you'll be able to get to Don Mueang that way If you need to travel between the two airports use the free shuttle bus

title: Impressive!
review: The Bangkok tourist map should be updated to reflect the new MRT stations We needed to go visit the Golden Palace Wat Pho and Wat Arun Our map indicated Hua Lamphong as the last stop There is a wonderful new MRT station at Sanam Chai that seamlessly connects the three landmarks mentioned above plus Museum of Siam

title: Top tour
review: A “must do” tour if you are in Bangkok for a couple of days If you’re lucky you will get Sara as a guide  she knows all the short cuts tips & tricks to make this a most enjoyable day Highly recommended

title: Once in a lifetime experience
review: Lucky was a fantastic tour guide It was a once in a lifetime experience Highly recommended We were picked up from hotel early before 8am and got back at 330pm so be aware that it is longer than half a day Well worth the money

title: Excellent Transportation in a Congested City
review: All visitors to Bangkok should try using the Skytrain This is an excellent way to get around a congested city and the system is not difficult to learn

title: Most convenient transport to City
review: The cheapest and fastest mode of transport from Suvarnabhumi airport to downtown Bangkok by alighting at Makkasan Station for only 35 baht and connect the Metro MRT to go to Terminal 21 Shopping Mall and from there you can take BTS to Nana or Asoke

title: Quick and easy!
review: Knowing what Bangkok traffic is like we tried the Airport rail link and found it really easy to use and very quick to get into the city centre From airport to  the city it took 30 mins with 8 stops We then caught a cab from the last station to our hotel which they have a taxi rank there We were at or hotel in under an hour

title: Fast and Economical way to reach Swarnabhumi Airport
review: The highest ticket price is 50 THB from Phaya Thai to Swarnabhumi Airport Its fast and efficient  Note  It does not go to Don Muaeng Airport

title: Let the train take the strain
review: We took this a couple of times in the evening as the traffic was so heavy and not moving Easy to use and very cheap

title: Good way to get around Bangkok
review: Buying a ticket was easy and getting around the station was easy to navigate with a short waiting between services

title: Good in Parts
review: There are 2 services The City Line which stops everywhere takes about 30mins from end to end (Airport to Phaya Thai) and is about every 1520 mins for 45 baht They can get crowded and not a lot of luggage room but they get the job done air conditioned and no traffic jams  The Express line is a weird mess Trains 1 an hour between the Airport and either Makkasan or Phaya Thai BUT NOT BOTH Why not just have a single service stopping at Makkasan and then on to Phaya Thai keeping everyone happy The timings between them are odd as well  They are comfortable uncrowded trains though and are worth the 90 baht if you get your timings right  BUT WATCH OUT The Phaya Thai to Airport line is now out of service (or at least within the next few days) for 1 year to renovate the trains Really Quite laughable really

title: Easy to get around
review: Bts sky train is the easiest way to get around bangkok As well the fastest way It connects with underground metro as well

title: Convenient Travel
review: Skip the jam and hop on the Airport Rail Link It takes only 3045 minutes from the Airport into City Centre An affordable and reliant means of transport for those travelling on a budget

title: Sara - Big country company
review: Sara is awesome She speaks good English and took care of us really well We will definitely look for her to bring us around the next time we are here

title: Very useful!
review: Given the famous bangkok traffic BTS Skytrain is a godsend to tourists like me One good thing is that the attractions are stated on the sign board beside the name of the stations so you will not get lost   If BTS allows us to buy multiple single trip tickets it will be a big improvement

title: Excellent and reliable
review: I found the skytrain to be excellent  it runs frequently is clean reliable and cheap It can be slightly busy at peak times which is to be expected however I found it to be quieter than any subways or trains in other countries   It's a pity there aren't more routes throughout bangkok and that the ticket machines seem to only take coins so I constantly needed to exchange notes at the ticket office

title: Best transport
review: This is by far the easiest and fastest way to move in Bangkok Tickets can easily be purchased from machines

title: is an underground
review: is an underground not an attraction by the way is clean frequent and fast if you to take you take otherwise not is not an attraction

title: A life-saver in Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is a lifesaver in Bangkok  Case in point we were chauffeured from MBK mall area to JW Marriotts for dinner one night and got caught in Bangkok's notorious rush hour traffic (after a tropical rain storm)  Traffic was at a standstill for 45 minutes  You think LA rush hour traffic was bad its nothing compared to Bangkok  We went literally 10 feet in 45 minutes  The chauffeur (to his credit was absolute spoton)  recommended to our Thai friends that we take the subwayBTS skytrain in order to reach our destination ontime for dinner  We did it  It was clean (but crowded given the rush hour traffic and I'm sure everyone in Bangkok decided to do the same) efficient and got us there just 30 minutes late (even though we took a circular loop)  Our chauffeur arrived just as we are finishing dinner in time to take us back to our hotel   Word of advice be familiar with the BTS Skytrain as it may be a lifesaver in Bangkok  If you stay anywhere along Sukhumvit Rd Rama I Rd Ploenchit Siam Square etc area get a day's pass as this is the most efficient way to navigate all the shopping malls along the way  Rush hour can be crowded but it is still the best way to get from point A to point B in this area

title: Ok
review: Good stations Crowded trains I think I was charged a ‘tourist tax’  Easy to navigate Clean Fast

title: Great way to get round Bangkok
review: Used the service to move around as the roads were manic  very cheap as well Spoke with a member of staff to buy tickets as we were not sure where we were going  very helpful and spoke perfect English as well

title: SO So convinient
review: Straight from the airport to downtown Bangkok  wish all cities were this well organized  As first timers we were a bit lost but the staff made it easier  I guess we weren't the first clueless travelers )

title: Chit lom to airport for $3 (80 baht)
review: Train was packed on a Friday night and it's not as easy as getting a taxi for $6 but the traffic is so horrible and unpredictable that it was worth it  The trains were clean on time and safe  Just need to be prepared to haul bags around a bit  Workers speak enough English to get you where you need to go I recommend it to get one more car off of the incredibly congested roads

title: Great way to beat Bangkok traffic
review: I use rail link often It is pretty efficient and the price is right I have to connect to the Sky Train which is fairly simple You do have to do a lot of walking so if you have mobility issues small children or a lot of bulky luggage this may not be your best option It also has to be said that my flight into Bangkok is only 2 hours Not so sure I would use the rail link if I was coming from far away

title: Express link out of service!
review: The express link is out of service the regular one with several stops takes approx 30 mins It is clean & efficient but very crowded & no seats available Thank goodness for the airconditioning

title: Nice
review: The locals are nice polite and friendly  They  are very helpful and selfdisciplined  Easy to get to anywhere in town  Cheap

title: I love the BTS
review: A bastion of air conditioned sanity above the sweaty mass of taxis tuk tuks & buses on the streets below the BTS is a fantastic way to get around Bangkok However you can't access some of the more famous parts of Bangkok directly on a BTS line so check your route carefully before setting off

title: Great tour
review: Other than the early start because the market closes this really is a great day to spend the day  The experience of riding the train going to the market and enjoying some street food and then riding to to the floating market by boat made the trip complete Our guide Kiwi had us sit in the rear of the train so we could see the process of moving moving the stalls to accommodate the train A great trip all around

title: Convenient
review: Cheap fast and very convenient although the network is not very wide It can get very crowded at times

title: Particular !
review: Super kind and good He speaks English very well It's not easy to find a person like that Unfortunately little time to see things between one excursion and another

title: All you need is BTS
review: Whatever it is the BTS is the way to travel in Bangkok Don't have to worry about the traffic jam in Bangkok Stops are well within major malls and attractions Get the Rabbit card for ease of travel and you don't have to line up to get tickets

title: Worst train experience!!
review: Rude kitchen staff Open toilets that dump onto the tracks are revolting dirty train and painfully old No water offered  and as soon as you wake up and open your curtain the couches gets shared which was payed for by you as customer Left a fowl taste in my mouth We booked second class and would much rather take a plane next time

title: Hassle free and convenient
review: The best option to cut the bangkok traffic is the sky train  almost all the occasion on time Can obtain a day pass best option for tourist a bit crowdy though but a nice option to have

title: Definitely the most convenient way of traveling in Bangkok
review: The best and safest way to avoid all day traffic jams in Bangkok Frequency is quite low compared to other capital cities though Air con quite strong

title: Not Sure It Exists
review: I am only being partly facetious when I say I am not sure it exists  On both our arrival and subsequently on our departure four days later we tried to use the Airport Rail Link  Both times we were directed away from that transportation means and told we had to use the BTS link (which also runs to the airport  Red Line I think) instead  On both times the BTS was uncomfortably packed (we stood the entire way  jammed into a corner with our backpacks)  It seems that it exists  there were closed ticket booths  and I see many maps that show it  just not sure it actually runs  Maybe we were just very unlucky

title: Hot bussey and expensive.
review: Some times you have to take it But on some routes you can take the Metro to and is way cheaper and more comphy

title: Get around cheaply and quickly avoiding traffic.
review: Bangkok subway is clean modern and efficient The only thing I can dat against IT is that with a suitcase the gate shuts top quickly so you may get stuck with a beep

title: Hasle Free Movement
review: It was really an amazing experience Beat the traffic jam of Bangkok No hassle cheap for small numbers( 23)

title: Great way to get around and avoid the traffic
review: Cheap reliable and clean transport Easy to understand network and connections with great views over the city as you travel

title: Efficent
review: Trains are regular clean and cool It is easy to buy a ticket and there is good signage to help you know where you are going

title: Skip traffic and take the rail to the heart of Bangkok
review: Super cheap and stressfree way to get from BKK to central Bangkok  While you may still need a taxi or tuk tuk to connect to your final destination you can avoid the horrendous Bangkok gridlock and inflated taxi rates  It's easy to find at the airport exit arrivals and take the escalator ramps to the basement  Suggestion If you won't have a data plan look up your stop in advance

title: Our first trip
review: We just came home from our first 8 night trip to Bangkok and we picked 2 hotels in Silom and Sukhumvit which were both very close the BTS I do recommend hotels 1 block away from BTS as the raised concrete rail really amplifies the noise of the traffic underneath and also traps the exhaust gasses as well The BTS skyteain and MRT subway will get you almost anywhere you want to visit in Bangkok Each station will have a change attendant as the ticket machine only accepts 1 5 and 10 bhat coins unless you buy a tap card but just carry some change as you will need it for street food anyway

title: Easy, cheap, don't get stuck at Makkasan.
review: It's easy to get on from the airport and super cheap to get in the city And it saves you trying to negotiate with taxi drivers (though the app Grab is pretty great in Bangkok) But don't like me get off at Makkasan and try to find a taxi Since you won't be able to It's a dead zone there Not sure if the other stations are better but they should be On the other hand getting a Grab to drop me OFF at Makkasan was just fine and I think it saved me time and money to get to the airport

title: Easiest way around bangkok
review: Clean cheap and fast This is the way to go to avoid the horrendous Bangkok traffic  Skip the taxis Head for the trains

title: A new asset for Bangkok
review: Spare a thought for the taxi drivers of Bangkok But seriously this new extension to the Skytrain network (although it is essentially a completely separate line) was the least of their worries Successive coups seriously damaged the tourist industry putting many of them out of business If you want a cheaper but less convenient ride into town then go for it but for me I'll stick with a taxi It's clean and has never been too crowded but by its nature everyone has several huge bags with them so prepare for some discomfort

title: Fast and Clean
review: I could compare with Singapore's MRT and it's very easy to ride to understand and station is really clean with people you can talk to

title: Airport Rail Link - a difficult choise
review: Using the airport Rail Link is ok the problem comes at the end of your trip especially when you are carrying a lot of luggage Most of the stations have only 1 elevator (waiting) and the real hassle is the Taxi at the end of your trip Many times they don't want to take you especially when they have to go to the Prathu  Nam Area where we live So it is one of these things whether you take a taxi right away from the airport or not Without luggage it is fantastic

title: Used it for the fist time, will do so in the future also!
review: The link is very easily accessible from the airport Travel was fast and hassle free (might get full during peak hours)  Biggest problem was getting off at Phaya Thai and getting a cab ( get a Thai SIM or check you data plan and install uber or grab  you will not get skewed with bogus taxi quotes )

title: Convenient and Clean way to travel in Bangkok
review: Would recommend you use the MRT & BTS especially as you can avoid the traffic below Compared to other metro such as Dubai Singapore Malaysia I found the Bangkok MRT & BTS very clean and a great way to commute

title: Fastest way to airport
review: If you are almost run out of time for your flight Airport Rail Link is your savior  However if you have plenty of time I would like to recommend you to take public buses to airport Experience the hectic and busy Bangkok City while ontheway to airport Sanambin is mean "airport" in Thai language

title: Fast and cheap!
review: It is a very convenient way to travel from Bangkok to the airport however when you try to carry your heavy luggages upstairs it would be a nightmare to do that

title: Best method of transport in Bangkok
review: The BTS system in Bangkok is absolutely fantastic It takes you above the traffic jammed streets and flies you over to your destination in a comfortable air conditioned environment There are trains every 5 minutes (if not sooner) so you aren't waiting a long time for the next one Really is the best way to avoid the long travel times on Bangkok roads

title: Best method to travel in Bangkok
review: If visiting for more than a day in Bangkok try to find a hotel that's close to the Skytrain  you'll really appreciate it especially if here for business and need to get to office everyday  It's VERY clean runs frequently and everyone is respectful

title: I love the BTS Skytrain!
review: I love the BTS Skytrain It is very convenient and connects you to major locations throughout Bangkok It is cheap and efficient to get around the city

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: Air conditioned and if you are lucky you may even get a seat No traffic jams and you travel point to point in comfort

title: Great way to escape the traffic!
review: Why spend time in a cap taking 4 times as long to get where you need to go when the BTS is well connected runs very frequently and is inexpensive

title: Excellent Tour and Guide
review: Excellent tour  Sara was an amazing tour guide very friendly super informative We had a great time thank you so much

title: Very convinient but with families/Bags ets better to take Taxi
review: Good with No heavy baggage and without childrenbetter families to take Taxi from HotelAs some changes are reqd to change lines to the Apt

title: sky train bangkok
review: This is an efficient Service(generally)'but it always very busy Travelling on it for a Visitor I s not difficult but just plan your journey andUSE A MAP' You will experience  little courtesy from you fellow travellersso be decisive when boardingleaving the train It is dog eat dogbut at least you do see the apsights of this teeming city

title: Fast & easy with air-condition
review: Fast & easy with aircondition No problems with using skytrain easy to use and fast to get to everywhere In the middle of day some traffic but nothing too bad  We would recommend to use skytrain to access sightseeing and make shopping

title: An essential part of Bangkok transportation but gets very crowded
review: If you are not using BTS Skytrain to get around in Bangkok you are doing it wrong It lets you to zip over the traffic jams and saves a lot of time It does not go everywhere though If several people are traveling together it is actually it as equally fast and cheaper to take a taxi IF you know that you are unlikely to get stuck in a traffic jam (Bangkok thankfully does not have a 247 rush hour) Even a shorttime visitor should get the BTS SmartPass The minimum added value is 100 baht which you can easily spend even during a single day if you are sightseeing in the city It is really tedious to queue up to the coinoperated ticket vending machines especially if you first have to stand in queue to get change My experience is that the service is reliable but the trains can get really crowded and you just sometimes just cannot get inside  Food and drinks are not allowed even inside the stations  you will be hassled by a security guard if you walk in with a water bottle in your hand

title: Cheap connection if you travel alone
review: I travel always only with handcarry bags so Airport Rail Link is cheap and relative fast choice between Suvarnabhumi airport and Bangkok city Unfortunately it has may passengers and direct Makkasan Suvarnabhumi express rail has stopped to operate

title: A good alternative to taxis for accessing the Suvanapumi Airport
review: The rail link connects Savanaphumi Airport (BKK) the main international airport for Bangkok with the sky train public transport service at Phayathai station and the MRT subway system at the MRT Petchaburi station (a short walk from the Makkasan stop on the air rail link) Note that the 'express' train system has been suspended partly because there were too few passengers willing to pay the premium price (the majority of travelers on the line are workers at the airport or locals using the line for transport between stations) and partly because of problems with rolling stock The fare from the airport to the BTS is 45 Baht (about $125 these days) and takes 2030 minutes The major disadvantage is to transfer from the air link to the BTS requires going down a long set of stairs and with bags that is a problem Going up from the BTS is on an escalator so that is not so bad though having more than carryon bags still is a hassle It is not crowded and usually a seat is available plus there is space for bags on the train A good choice for getting into the city if you are not laden with luggage

title: Very easy to use
review: Prices were very reasonable and a good way to travel during rush hour Staff very helpful but you need to pay attention as the station names are not always what you expect to se

title: It was too congested and wait time was killing
review: Its not the dedicated metro to the Airport It passes through the city and carries most of the city population  After the last city station the passenger going to Airport to just 10 It is cheap but not very comfortable

title: It works well
review: We thought we'd give it a go instead of catching a cab from the airport as was told it's efficient  Our hotel was near Victory Monument which meant taking the airport link to the end of the line (Phaya Thai) & then jumping on the connecting BTS  It worked for us but it just depends where your hotel is located  Also your hotel may provide a (complimentary) shuttle bus to an airport link station & if so suggest you consider this option as it may be a quicker & cheaper option than a taxi

title: Clean. Cheap. Easy to use.
review: Clean Cheap Easy to use This really makes traveling around the city a lot easier Very much cheaper than trying to use an overpriced tuktuk that charges you twice what a taxi does and the taxi charges you more than twice what the Skyline does Highly recommended

title: Clean and quick
review: If only Australia had a rail network as prompt and clean

title: Economical and fast
review: There are two services City and Express The Express service seems impractical unless you have a lot of luggage because it is less frequent than the City line more expensive and a longer walk to reach the entrance than the City line (at least at the Makkasan station) On the City line there is no overhead space or special storage areas for luggage

title: Good transport.  But mind the air-conditioning
review: A very convenient way to travel around the city is via the skytrain   Traffic in Bangkok during the day is rather congested so this is a reliable means of transportation  Most major department stores have a skytrain station nearby  One note is that the airconditioning in the skytrains is freezing cold so please bring a thin layer of clothing to keep yourself warm

title: excellent
review: BTS have an excellent service Good maps good informations and you can get fast wherever you go The prices are good too You can buy a day pass which is cheaper

title: Excellent, easy and cheap way to get around
review: Very clean and safe Not too hard to work out Nothing like rush hour in London people have manners here

title: Gets you there quickly
review: The skytrain is easy to take and gets you where you want to go quickly  You can avoid the Bangkok rush hour traffic

title: Easy and affordable
review: Best way to travel around Bangkok Cheap easy and very convenient I always take the BTS when I am in the area

title: Surprisingly good
review: It was actually really good comfortable leather recliner seats plenty of leg room and storage overhead for your luggage Toilets are very basic a floor indian one not the best  But were clean at the beginning of the journey  Food is available but not worth it Take your own from 711 or something   It was 13 hours in total but so reasonably priced at just over £10 so a big tick from us 2 female traveler's   Me Nicola Kelly from UK  And Michele from Canada

title: so clean and much easier than the London tube
review: Love the fact it is very clear to work out where you are going and the staff at counters speak English and will give you change for the ticket machines Also it is very clean

title: To the heart of Bangkok
review: This is the fastest and easiest way to go around in the york of Bangkok Ticket price starting from 2050 Baht Please avoid peak time from 79 AM and 58PM at weekday because it will be crowded for sure

title: Good and reasonable priced.
review: Best option to avoid Bangkok traffic We enjoyed BTS whenever possible to reach our destination on time

title: Best way to get around
review: BTS is clearly the best way to get around BKK while getting a good view of this marvelous city and it’s quite affordable We opted to get the Rabbit card with stored value as we are here for a week You can get those cards at any BTS station from the staff in the glas booth 100 THB deposit and the rest of what you decide to put in goes on the card balance A trip is 1550 THB and we’ve consumed about 100 THB per day We will probably keep these cards (as they’re valid for 5 years and the balance stays on it for 2 years) but you can ge the deposit back from the BTS booth at any station once you’ve finished your stay Easy to navigate the BTS lines with the maps on the trains with an offline MetroBTS map and with google map Perhaps the only tricky part is to figure out which exit to take on the way down to avoid ending up on the wrong side of a noncrossable road Just check signs or google map and you’ll figure it out Rush hour 79 AM and 57 PM is not too bad for those who are reasonably used to busy metros in other metropolises Have fun

title: Too many steps
review: The sky train is nice to do but if you have the possibility to take the MRT metro is better We are a couple over 60+ and there are to many steps and no rotator only elevator but the doors are closed and you must always looking  for some one to let you use this The Mrt has always rollators up en down and for 60+ is half price when you asked for it

title: Bring a jacket
review: Service is easily understood and the trains are modern  But brung a jacket or scarf as the cars are chilled to freezing temperatures compared to the air outside

title: Great
review: Very nice experience but to many people and many choice of street food and restaurant Luckily on that time the weather is not that hot

title: Fast and cheap
review: This is a great way to get into town Does not go to main backpacking area of Khao San Road though Easy to useLook at BTS maps before you go cos you may need to connect if you are going to different area or just get a taxi  I would nt use it if I had a big suitcase Easier to get a taxi from airport and avoid lugging luggage

title: Holiday
review: Very good n time saving from traffic very easyit is cheapest to use in thailand compared to taxi n tuk tukcan save lot of money n is very comfortable n organised

title: Wow I was impressed
review: Great service Airconned easy to use & the best way to get around fast We only had 2 days in Bangkok & used the sky train all the time Buy a day ticket which will last until midnight good value

title: skytrain
review: very confusing at first but the people at the counter are helpful easy way to get around bangkok can get busy usually just standing room left on the train

title: A real life a Thai experience
review: The journey was long but totally worth it We had never seen markets with so much life and character  both very different from the street market  It’s more of an experience than a shopping trip The train market is simply unreal

title: Great way to get around
review: We spent several hours buzzing around the city on this train It pretty easy to figure out and a lot of fun It does get quite busy when everyone heads to work or home at the end of the working day

title: The Thai know how to travel
review: This is one of the cleanest modern  safest and inexpensive Skytrains that I have ever taken Everything is well written in Thai and in English Easy to understand the system The trains have AC and free wifi

title: Public transport
review: Recommended mode of transportation while roaming in Bangkok as it is cheap and saves a lot of time If u intent to travel multiple times please take daily pass which will cost 140 baby

title: Easy to use, clean and cheap
review: The train system is so easy to use that you can cut out all the crazy Bangkok traffic and get around using the system   Everything is immaculately clean and very cheap

title: Easy to use!
review: Take the Airport Rail Link because it's a nobrainer and saves you some cash Just be sure you're in shape to schlep your luggage up and down some steps

title: Buy a “card” - have 1/2 price senior rate card
review: This is a well run clean modern transportation subway system  It complements the sky train system but they are owned by different companies so you need different access cards  BUY one  It will save you from the long lines that occur on a regular basis to buy tokens  Very inexpensive and so easy to use  Highly recommended and thankful for it while traveling in Bangkok

title: fast, efficient, safe and cheap
review: avoid the BKK traffic use the skytrain fast and cheap air conditioned easy to use  a must for all travellers

title: The easiest and the best
review: It is the easiest and quick way to move from one place to another in the city and it is a good way to save time and money and is somewhat comfortable and easy to save between the lines and stations and linked to shops and most hotels and you can buy cards in its forms daily weekly and annual in all simplicity and my favorite in the city

title: Easy to get in city center of Bangkok
review: Train is air conditioned clean and so on and a lot cheaper than a Taxi ) Last train at midnight is not so bad you've got plenty of time to see whatever to see in Bangkok either by day or by night

title: Quick and easy
review: Regular service clean and tidy trains and very cheap fare This is the quickest way to travel to Bangkok airport Hassle free

title: Good during off peak times
review: Great for getting into the city from Suvarnabhumi however beware in the other direction during peak timing Be prepared to queue for the train at Makasan It is really really crowded during peak hour and you may have to wait for a couple of trains before you are able to be squashed onboard Still beats being stuck in traffic so you'll just need to allow for some extra travel waiting time

title: EASY to use if you are a foriener
review: The BTS was CHEAP FAST on TIME and CLEAN It was a bit crowded and not easy if you have a lot of luggage and Runs until midnight

title: Easy, cheap and comfortable way to travel
review: Great way to travel throughout Bangkok comfortably with air conditioned carriages The staff are always friendly and helpful at the stations also

title: Fast, safe, easy and cheap way to go round in Bangkok
review: If it comes to public transportation Bangkok is challenging The BTS is one of the fastest way to reach some of the major areas and in addition also the Suvarnabhumi airport If you ever stuck in a taxi in Bangkok for an hour or even longer you will certainly learn to appreciate the obstacle free way of transportation by BTS It is crowded in peak hours but still with normal behavior of the crowd not aggressive like in many other towns If you stay longer in Bangkok a Rabbit card with 50 trips is the best value for money option Otherwise a day pass will do You should by the tickets out of the rush hours if possible to avoid long queues Overall very clean and nice to travel Be aware of pickpockets  they are active in Bangkok as well as in all other big towns

title: So useful
review: The BTS sky train is incredibly useful to get around parts of Bangkok It is cheap and efficient but best of all because it is a sky train it provides some great views of the city

title: Take it - it is so easy
review: The rail link is 45 Baht  It takes you right into the eastern part of the city in 20 minutes  It drops you at Praya Thai where you pick up the MRT  You can go north or south from there for a few pence and the Sky train is so easy to use  The ticket machines are in English as well as Thai  You look on the map press the station you want and a price comes up  put in the fare and a plastic credit card type ticket emerges  On the Airport Rail link you can slide in notes  On the MRT it is only coins  If you don't have enough the ticket office will not issue a ticket but will change notes for coins  It could not be simple and most of the main connections are just a short walk across platforms  Everything is brilliantly signed

title: Please Restart the Express Line!
review: When the Airport Link was first introduced they ran an express line and a regular line which stops at 7 or 8 stations along the way and is the train that still runs now They stopped the express line a few years ago I thought this was due to a fall in tourist numbers when they had a bit of unrest in the city But now that the tourists have returned in full force  Suvarnabhumi Airport is handling way more passengers than its capacity  shouldn’t it be time to reinstate the express line The express line costs twice as much as the regular line stops only at Phaya Thai Makkasan and the airport had plusher seats and space dedicated to luggage and was very popular with tourists Bring it back The regular trains gets ridiculously crowded especially at peak hours and is almost impossible to manage with luggage etc So AOT please bring back the express Airport Link

title: Interesting train to ride and very cheap tickets too (flat rate of 100Baht!!
review: I highly recommend taking this train especially for the stretch of the "Death Railway" (its other name due to the history of lives loss during WWII by POWs who built it) from Kanchanaburi to Namtok The stretch of the rail called the Wangpo Viaduct is particularly scenic as the train runs alongside the river and it is possible to walk on it by getting off at the station called Thamkase (this is mostly for those who are on a guided tour as on your own it may be a long time to hang around for the next train either back to Kanchanaburi or further on to Namtok station) as there are only two trains in each direction per day)  My suggestion would be to take the train all the way to Namtok station (the last station of the line) and catch either a taxi (from Namtok station directly) or public bus number 8203 (walk a little out to the main road bus runs hourly) to visit Hellfire Pass which is nearby The bus costs just 20 Baht and brings you right to the entrance of Hellfire Pass Return back to Kanchanaburi by bus (60Baht) after Hellfire Pass

title: Economic way to get into Bangkok from the Airport, (when not too loaded with luggage!)
review: This is not really an attraction as such as essentially it's a public transportation system but maybe a decent ride 'out of town' if looking to fill an hour or two on a quiet day     Travel in Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi (BKK) airport on the City Line (or return) is fairly straightforward but is not without its pitfalls for the unwary   The Train Station is located on the lower level of the main terminal building  Whilst inherently simple once familiar with it I strongly suggest that people do some research online before taking it on  This link might be of help httpwwwtransitbangkokcomlinesSuvarnabhumi%20International%20AirportAirport%20Link%20City%20Line    There are ticket machines plus manned ticket kiosks I personally find that the ticket kiosk is often easier and quicker as queues can build up whilst people come to grips with a new and unfamiliar ticket dispensing machine  A ticket comes in the form of a small coloured disk that can be tapped onto the barrier mechanism to open the gate and likewise deposited into a slot at the end of the journey again to open the gate to let you out There are also wider manually operated gates with station staff to help those people with large suitcases etc   Please be sure to know which station you want to leave the train There are 8 stations end to end but if going into central Bangkok you will most likely want  'Makkasan' if connecting onto the linked MRT(Subway)Station at 'Petchaburi' and the Subway network OR quite likely going through to the final stop at   'Phaya Thai' if then connecting onto the BTS (Skytrain) network  Regretfully I've heard people asking the ticket clerks 'which stop is closest to  Hotel' and this is usually quite beyond the average language understanding or similarly the hotel location expectation of knowledge of the rail clerks I think its helpful to understand that the fully elevated line runs to the North of the main city area rather than through the middle of the city   So know which station you want beforehand If you are at all unsure I would strongly suggest that you take a public taxi instead  The train journey takes 30 minutes end to end The trains themselves are purpose designed for the job they do and each carriage has an empty if nonracked area for cases and luggage The consensus is that you stay with you baggage rather than walk away to find a seat elsewhere  At the airport end there are elevators (lifts) and escalators to assist in the easy movement of heavy baggage but be warned that at many other stations there are precious few elevators with only stairways as an alternative so consider how much baggage you have and how heavy it all is before taking the City Line train option  My final thought is that many Thai people now also use this rail service for their daily commute into the city so early morning and early evening trains can be very busy indeed   Please note too that the consumption of foods and drinks are not allowed whilst travelling on the trains Similarly it is considered good manners to allow people off the trains first through the centre of the doors and then enter the trains via either side of the doors and not 'jump the queue' by walking through the centre area  NB centre = center depending on country    Quick clean costeffective and efficient but please do consider the amountweight of baggage that you have with you before deciding to buy a ticket Enjoy
