title: Amazing tour, especially if you're Australian! Request guide Ken.
review: Where to start This was simply an amazing tour with one of the best guides we've ever had  Ken If you request anyone request Ken He is full of knowledge about Thailand and the war When he is explaining the history you can tell his is ardent to the subject and wants to ensure you understand everything accordingly  The tour is private to your group and includes hotel pickup and comfortable transfers to see multiple points of interest including the JEATH museum war memorial the bridge over River Kwai a train ride along the original route and of course the Hellfire Pass and associated information centre  Ken and his driver (his name escapes me  sorry) ensured our day was comfortable with plenty of water and soft drinks and wouldn't hesitate to make a stop here and there for toilet breaks and coffee A lunch at a local restaurant after the train ride is also included simply delicious  I highly recommend this tour It is moving emotional and fun all at once Ken made our day and didn't hesitate to assist us with photos and securing an amazing seat on the train  Top Tip Wear comfortable clothing sunscreen a hat and walking shoes

title: Easy to get around in town
review: But it gets realllllyyyy crowded during peak hours Nonetheless it is a great way to avoid traffic jams and the terrible taxi drivers who refused to charge by meter and overcharges tourists

title: very good option
review: a excellent alternative to taxi It is very easy to use and the connection with the metro BTS is easy too Very clean and safe for a ridiculous price

title: Fast and efficient!
review: Used the MRT a lotIt was clean and and fast with good connectionsWas never too crowded like the Sky train

title: Great servive
review: A must to get around Buy a multiple trip ticket will save ques at peak times Clean efficient and airconditioned

title: Quickly to your hotel
review: Airport rail link is a very easy cheap and quick way to get from the Suvarnabhumi airport to the center of Bangkok and vv

title: Cool
review: Very efficient in bangkok which the traffic can really bad at the time  Have powerful ac running too But if there is no traffic i would recommand uber taxi which is really cheap

title: Too crowed
review: Train are too crowed  Specially in working hrs You need to que up for changing coins they need to improve on this part but yes it's best way to travel around Bangkok

title: So easy to use.
review: Travelled all over Bangkok using the Skytrain Super easy to navigate clean and air conditioned Day ticket was 180 baht

title: Best way to commute to Bangkok
review: Given Bangkok's traffic is notoriously bad the best way to commute into town from the main airport  Suvarnabhumi Airport  is the Airport Rail Link For 45 baths you can get to Phaya Thai station where you can then get on the BTS  the skytrain that serves most of central Bangkok The airport rail link is highly recommended as it only takes 30 mins from the airport to the city

title: Ok but
review: Its a good way into the city but then it gets a bit tough as the in town airport terminal could be a lot more user friendly You will probably have to catch a cab from the in town terminal so maybe catch a metered taxi from the airport Do not under any circumstances take an AOT limousine from the airport they are heavily touted and are an absolute rip off

title: Clean & Easy
review: BTS is one of the best ways to beat the crazy traffic of Bangkok BTS stations are located with key areas of Bangkok city Trains are clean easy and air conditioned

title: Very convenient
review: My hotel was located very close to BTS Asok station and we used the sky train to travel around in Bangkok as much as possible It is better to travel this way as the roads can get pretty crowded especially in the evenings The sky train is really good very clean and is quite reasonable

title: A very unique experience!
review: A must see very unique “Oui” was a great guide She took great care of us which made the train ride and market tour awesome

title: Best way to commute
review: Sky train is well connected all around bangkok and It is very cheap and safe way to travel anywhere around the city Very clean and also Its easy to find information from any where

title: Fun and easy to ride!
review: Clean cold AC (which was a huge plus on those hot Bangkok days) easy to navigate and offered great views of the city

title: Air conditioned and easy to use
review: Was surprisingly easy to use but make sure you have change for the automatic machines  They were air conditioned and not too busy when we used them at around 1011 am on a weekend

title: So Much Fun
review: Loved it I do wish we had more time at the Railway Market though We waited 15 mins for the train to depart and pass through so we can witness the vendors immediately cover the tracks After that we only had 15 mins to meet our guide and it took about that much time to walk through the market to get to the meeting point We were only able to stop at two places to shop The floating market was so much fun I wish we had more time here too It appears we took a shorter route around the river My friends and I were a little anxious about negotiating prices for merchandise but once we got started it was really fun The vendors made it a great time Our tour guide Natty was awesome as well She was very helpful and informative At the end of tour she even took the time to write out instructions on how we could return to our hotel via public transportation

title: Just great
review: Very convenient and efficient transportation system it goes pretty much to everywhere we wanted to go Friendly and easy to use

title: Easy to use
review: The system is very easy to use and on time But tends to get very packed I mean very and most people just focus on phone screen

title: Highly convenient and necessary to avoid jams
review: he BTS doesn't take you everywhere in Bangkok there are still a few interesting spots that have to be reached by boattaxituktukwalking but it takes to most of the central areas near several malls touristic spots and places to hangout dine drink party  Given how horrible traffic jams can get in Bangkok take BTS as much as you can

title: Great to get around
review: Goes to most areas of Bangkok and cheap and fast (very unlike any form of road transport) Most staff speak at least basic english and like everywhere in Thailand they are very helpful

title: Quickest and most convenient means of transportation to reach Bangkok
review: Quickest and most convenient means of transportation to reach Bangkok although it gets very crowded at rush hour like all public transportation systems in Bangkok Airport rail Link easily connects with the Sky Train or the Metro (all separate tickets  from different companies) Frequency is every 30 minutes

title: Better than London Underground
review: Amazing and clean As Thailand is very hot the air conditioning is a big relief for tourists The skytrain is sooo highly developed A must go in Bangkok

title: Easy, fast, cheap
review: Don't be intimidated  This sky train is super  Fast cheap easy  There are plenty of people to answer your questions  I rode it at rush hour to a gym (crossfit) I wanted to find  So many people were willing to help me  In English  Take it  In fact my hotel had hailed a taxi to take me to the gym at rush hour  The taxi driver said I could get there so much faster and cheaper by BTS that he took me to the BTS stop instead of taking me to the gym  he was right

title: Great tour
review: This trip is well worth doing Our guide Sara was very knowledgable and took great care of us The timings were perfect just right to experience all the markets had to offer Highly recomend

title: Great, Stylish, Effecient
review: A great cheap way to navigate ur way thru the massive urban sprawl The trains come often and are stylish and modern The super high vantage point from the train platforms give u an amazing view of your surroundings  one of my favorites (not that I saw them all) was Mo Chit where I discovering a beautiful park and a gigantic weekend market that resembled a small town

title: Professional Safe Transport Superb Sky Train
review: After driving to Bangkok Airport to pick up Australian friends visiting Thailand we went by Skytrain from the airport to Australian embassy returning to airport before driving to my residence in Bangsaray Thailand Superb trip for all three of my party scenery views and service had to be scene to believe Incredibile experience best public transport

title: Great
review: Fast way to travel to the airport very efficient and better than a taxi I liked the system a lot and recommend it

title: Easy to get around
review: Clean well maintained public transportation system The individual cars are wrapped with advertising helping the cars to appear new and clean on the exterior

title: Good way to go to the city.
review: Very convenience to go to the city but should avoid rush hour that many local will go to work and the train would be very crowded

title: Easy way to go around tourist and shopping areas
review: The BTS has only 2 lines but it is sufficient for tourists We got the Rabbit card and just loaded the card as needed This heloed us go in and out of the stations faster Most of the time we took the Silom line which passed through the shipping centers as well as to the Saphan Taksin station whete you can go down to take the boats at Chao Phraya River for sightseeing The trains had good airconditioning wide and in time

title: journey to past
review: this railway track is build by japnese precision and hard work of more the lakhs of people and war prisoners and tainted by death of more then 20000 people

title: Great way to go
review: After dragging around in tuk Tuks and taxis I took the train I have a new found appreciation for Bangkok Looks much better from up top and it's the best air conditioning in the city

title: How to get to the City centre easily
review: Ac quick and easy to use mode of transport into the City centre and above all helps avoid the Traffic congestion if using a Taxi or the Bus Very cheap when you consider the distance to the Airport from the City centre

title: Best transportation
review: Take care it is sometimes very chilly in trainTrains might be quite growded but it always better to take train but taxi

title: love the raillink
review: I love the raillink It is a nice way to get to the city without having to hassle with a taxi  In my opinion the ARL is the quickest cheapest option to go to town So if you EITHER want to go fast OR cheaply the Raillink is the way to go  From Phaya Tahi you can go by BTW to other places or by bus to the old town

title: Cheap and quick
review: The best way to go from the airport to the city cheap and quick It has many departure hours so you won't have to wait long Also it is inside the airport just walking distance from the terminal

title: fast, efficient, reasonable price
review: For those who are in a hurry or in tight budget and do not want to stuck in traffic airport link is the best choice It's very efficient and the ground staffs are also helpful Like it

title: Nice experience
review: It's really nice experience for those who travel Thai to travel BTD sky train Really easy access for tourists and also it's time save from traffic

title: Best and cheapest mode of transport from Airport
review: I always take the airport link from Suvarnabhumi airport Taking a cab is costly and takes time due to the never ending Bangkok traffic You can reach the city centre Phaya Thai in 45 baht which is about 15 dollars very comfortably

title: Crowded, but quick
review: Buy the Rabbit card rather than line up to pay for each individual ride The train is clean just not comfortable That's because it is always crowded People do not easily give up their fseats to the informed or elderly and there is little seating while waiting for the train

title: Just great fast and cheap
review: Just great fast and cheap and very easy to get around  Air conditioned clean and fast service to the city

title: Good day out
review: This trip was very good  Picked up on time and the host was brilliant  Had a great day with the team   All went well   Many thanks

title: clean and on time
review: the train is clean and local will also ride this line to travel so be sure to avoid peak hours train arrival timings are being displayed on the board

title: For wheelchair need more stations with elevators
review: Anyone upright should take advantage of this quick and inexpensive transport  We did make it from Mo Chit station (near the weekend market) to Siam station in a wheelchair with no problem once at the BTS stations   But the walk to and then from each of those stations took quite a bit of time to navigate with a wheelchair through the crowds and the bumpy and narrow sidewalks   BTS is 2 years behind schedule to meet a court order to upgrade all of the stations with elevators   A shame since we also saw  mothers struggling with strollers up the stairs  Access is really for everyone since at anytime anyone could sprain a limb or break a leg and need an elevator while healing  And for the elderly climbing all of these stairs is also a problem   So average score since part of the system is accessible but really needs more attention to be a public asset

title: Transport
review: Easy access Rail from airport connect with BTS so much faster and comfortable  BTS counter staff are very friendly and helpful

title: Very efficient & effective & clean
review: MRT subway is very efficient & effective & clean  Easy to learn your way around  Moves much quicker than the cars on the road

title: great way into the city.
review: taking the airport rail link into bangkok is the perfect and fast way to get from the airport into the city center right now the trip 45 baht to phaya thai the interchange with the bts a little ardorous are the steps when there are no escalators but lifts are available too

title: very punctual and comfortable
review: very cheapcomfortable and punctualbut a little crowdedthe only thing that i liked about skytrain was that they are very fastwe dont have to waste our time in looking for taxi or tuk tukwe cannot get cheated as the usual taxi drivers try to do

title: Better experience than BTS
review: The vending machine accept 100 Baht note and it's more convenient for travellers Meanwhile the airport rail link vending machine provides with multitickets function The stations in between takes approximately 35 minutues for one stop

title: Preferred travel in bangkok
review: Clean and super easy to travel with Especially as travel time and temerature are an issue in bangkok the train is reliable and comfortable

title: Fast and cheap!
review: Great way to get closer to the city 45baht for single clean quiet train Got off at phaya Thai then taxi to khao San road 70baht Much cheaper than paying 200300+ direct

title: Excellent
review: Sara is the best tour guide in Thailand The tour is a lot of fun and Sara is super funny I don't understand why Tripadvisor makes me write more if I do not wish to do so although my experience has been really nice Thank you

title: Smooth tour of railway and floating market.
review: It was a smooth tour We got on the train which we didn’t expected We went to the rail market by train and watch it leaving the market So experienced seeing the market from both ways Our tour guide was lovely

title: Good option for avoiding traffic
review: If you don't have much luggage andor wish to avoid the traffic this is a good option If only Jakarta and other cities had a link like this Not overpriced like Sydney

title: Great and fast link into town
review: Once you exit immigration follow the signs for the train heading downstairs There you will find lots of kiosks and a teller there to help you Pay about 45 bht and you get a token to enter like a metro Keep this token as you will need it to exit at the end Train is clean and fast and the best option for getting downtown from the airport

title: The best way to travel into Bangkok !
review: The Airport Rail link is cheap very clean  modern and quick And  you are sure to avoid the traffic

title: Clean and cooling
review: The BTS is clean and the air con is good Not so crowded but maybe it's because the timing i took was not peak period Price is cheap Save money and time as it is always heavy traffic on the road in Bangkok

title: The Bangkok BTS is a classic!
review: I love taking the BTS when I'm in Bangkok The BTS staff are all willing to assist if you have questions or any problems Taking the BTS is a great way to learn the layout of the city  The BTS experience allows you to see some interesting people from all over the world Very international

title: Ok
review: Just like Delhi metro nothing special Does not have complete bangkok coverage but covers only main points like Chatuchak victory tower siam plaza etc

title: Does the job
review: Go all the way to Phaya Thai to link up with the BTSavoid Makkassan as no BTS and even taxis are hard to come by

title: Easy & Efficient
review: Cheap and easy transport no need for taxis and spending time in crazy traffic AC so great for a cool down Run regular your never waiting more than 10 minutes Announcements also in English so great for foreign travellers Always spotless clean

title: Easy and efficient traveling around Bangkok
review: Super easy to travel and navigate through the city of Bangkok The greatest relief was the powerful air conditioning within the trains The train services were frequent and much faster to get to a destination compared to tuktuk or taxi services within the city

title: Should have A/C at waiting areas.
review: Good train  Clean  New  Easy to use  It will be excellent if the waiting areas are close and cold and increase the trains to decrease the waiting time

title: Use the Skytrain !
review: During my stay in Bangkok I was using as much as possible the Skytrain Keep in mind that during rush hour the train is very very full  Trains are clean and well maintained Fixed price for everyone Taxi in Bangkok is always the Problem that most drivers don’t like to drive on the counter and asking for fantasy high prices That’s why I only took Skytrain Metro or GRAB App With Grab I never had any problems

title: Efficient, cheap, chearful
review: Stayed at Sathorn A little tricky initially with 2 different lines and sometimes having to change depending on your destination Definitely the most efficient and fastest method of travelling in Bangkok Cool clean quiet and cheap

title: JAMES BOND was HERE.. haha
review: A must do for your BANGKOK trip buy a small ticket through the automatic vending machines and explore the town through this lovely clean public transport

title: Easy Access
review: An easy access within the city and liked An always a time saver in the traffic high Bangkok and could plan to be on time with the MRT usage than Taxis

title: Easy to get around quickly!
review: It gets you around town quickly and cheaply And if it doesn't get you exactly to your destination you grab a taxi for the last stretch

title: Efficient and fast service from and to Airport
review: Used the Airport Rail Link during my last trip to travel from and back to the Airport Very efficient and clean service Currently due to the Covid19 outbreak the train will be cleaned every time before departing from the airport Hand sanitizers  are available everywhere around the station  Save and fast Loved it

title: Easy travel
review: Before buying a ticket be sure to have enough coin change in your pocket There are ticket machines you will find your destination on the map and find its number  thats the price in THB from your current destination Then click on the button with your number and pay in coins They will not sell you tickets at the office they will only change your money to coins for you to do the transaction at the machine At bigger stations they have one machine working with bills but its rare and there is always a big line waiting

title: Running or not
review: The Bangkok Airport Raillink is a very good project It was planed excellent and save time and money for the travellers The Cars are clean  and save the trin is mostly on time  but only when it is in operation Most of the foreign travellers arriving at the Bangkok Airport have no informations about this special train Also it is not every day sure that the train is in operation Here the Traincompany needs to do a better Information and PR specialy in the planes arriving Bangkok Also it would be nice when the traveller can buy the ticket in the plan on the way to Bangkok or in the departure country The othe bad thing on this project is the Makassan Station  very clean save  and no people Some points in the concept must be wrong The Taxidriver are not happy to go the station and when you arrice and you will use a taxi it needs long time ti find one This two points bad or no information and the organisation at Makassan Station are very bad and need to be checked

title: Easy
review: Well signposted and easy to purchase tickets as I had researched on map where we needed to get off and change trains Only cost 35bht each fast and efficient

title: Eco-friendly & wallet-friendly!
review: The skytrain is a very efficient costfriendly and Ecofriendly way of traveling As you may know traffic in Bangkok can get very bad especially around 5pm Taxi fares although cheap by American standards are much more expensive than a simple BTS ride that costs about 1 dollar and takes a fraction of the time Since it is above ground you also get a pretty good view of Bangkok and can take some pictures from inside the BTS Sometimes it gets crowded so if you are left without a seat make sure you hold onto a railing because stops and turns can make you lose your balance All in all the BTS is definitely worth the small price

title: A reasonable option but not frequent enough
review: This is one way to avoid Bangkok road congestion when travelling to or from the airport  Unfortunately the services are just not frequent enough to make it compelling  and then there is the problem of no excellent interchanges to the BTS system

title: Relaxing, inexpensive, convenient
review: If you have lived or traveled anywhere with a metro system you will find this easy to use Try to remember to bring coins as some stations don't have Money changers ( but can always go to counter just sometimes has a line) And it's air conditioned With the heavy traffic in Bangkok it can also be quicker

title: Helping a lot to reach more places
review: The Skytrain definitely helping you to explore more about Bangkok places On time and clean station Sometimes we confused how to mention the station name The rest are perfect

title: Easy to ride, beat the traffic
review: This train is definitely a good way to get to the central business district It's a shame they don't have a well0organized taxi rank since you will most likely need to use one to reach your destination But there is no shortage of cabs on the street to flag down

title: Clean, fast, and reliable
review: Fantastic way to beat the traffic jams in Bangkok and get to the the airport efficiently and ontime

title: No maintenance
review: Scary they are 2 years behind maintenance yes you read it well behind In a country where everything breaks because of the tropical climate that is scary   If u have a lot of luggage there are no elevators and sometime it is hard to get taxis at certain stations

title: Handy
review: Gets you from the airport to the city quickly Always taxis waiting at the other side to pick you up

title: Ahhhh air conditioning
review: Easy to navigate and cool you can ride skytrain to lots of Bangkok's attractions such as the Chatuchak weekend market Jim Thompson house Siam Paragon and more Peak hours can be very busy but when the roads are jammed sky train is a great choice Be aware that many times you can take a taxi for about the same price or a bit less than sky train

title: Boring train trip
review: We had the 1045 train very old carriages no ac The views were not very interesting and the whole trip was quite boring Toilets were very primitive We had to stop for an accident and this caused quite a delay in a hot train so we left the train at an earlier station Not recommended

title: Really Delighted
review: It is the time for me for the skytrain It was amazing I will come back again for someday because I love it "Bangkok"

title: Great travel..........
review: Enjoyed our trip on the MRT Very clean stations and train Service excellent Would strongly recommend tourists to  atleast take a rideWith the sort of traffic in Bangkok would be a smart move to travel via MRT

title: Always clean, always prompt
review: For short trips within the city this is perfect  It avoids having to negotiate with taxi drivers and it helps avoid the ubiquitous traffic

title: Excellent reliable service and a very reasonable price
review: Although you can take a metred taxi and a very low price to and from the airport the Sky Train link takes you right into the terminal building and avoids all the traffic So it's highly recommended

title: Comfortable and Fast
review: I decided to take Airport Rail Link to the airport just to experience the efficiency I took the BTS from Phloen Chit Station to Phaya Thai BTS Station where I changed to the Airport Rail Link One drawback it could be challenging if you have more than 2 pieces of luggage with you and trying to go up the staircases

title: BTS...Clean Cool Easy and Efficient!!!
review: Recently visited Bangkok where we used the BTS during most of our stay and I must give kudos to Thailand for having a great transit system👍🏾 they announced the stops in English and the signs where printed in English as well The transit employees at the information booths were very pleasant and helpful The trains were very clean and they ran quite frequently so if you missed one another came minutes later You could take the BTS to most of the tourists attraction and you could also get to the ferry with ease I would recommend the BTS if you don't want to be bothered with the traffic or the heat

title: Cheap clean and relatively reliable
review: It's only 45baht (around 85p$13) for a single trip takes around 2530 mins but you get to see lovely views of the city and literally save hundreds of baht compared to taxis

title: Christmas visit
review: Get tickets from the machine not the kiosk Very clean and quick service  Air conditioning was great

title: Fast and convenient
review: If you want to get around Bangkok fast and easily I would highly recommend using the sky train  The prices are very inexpensive as well

title: Brilliant mode of transport
review: We used the sky train on various occasions during our visit to Bangkok  A day ticket is £150bht which needs to be Brought from the ticket desk IT can be used all day at various stops   When purchasing tickets from one location to another you need to buy the ticket at the machine using coins The ticket desk will prove coins if needed The price is the number on the machine and you will need to look at the map to work out how much you need to pay The ticket desk also give advice on this   If I return to Bangkok I will defiantly use the sky train again

title: Fast but more pricy
review: Airport rail to downtown is fast an efficient but more expensive than the bus service Some bus for a little extra drup you at your Hotel

title: Clean and Efficient
review: The sky train is probably the most affordable way of travel and a really cool way to view the city There ate only two lines as of now it would be more convenient if there was more Despite that this train is my goto transportation method in Bangkok For the price the view and the airconditioning you can't beat it

title: Quick, air conditioned, safe
review: The Sky Train is clean air conditioned safe and comes frequently during the day This is specially important in a city with terrible traffic

title: Fast Clean and covers most areas
review: The sky train was fast clean and punctual  The station diagrams are well laid out and easy to follow  A great way to get around

title: fast and inexpensive way to get around BKK
review: there could be more efficiency  you need to get the change (coins) at one booth then go to the machine  They could also sell the tickets at the booth

title: Fast and affordable train
review: If you need to get along form airport to the city this is the best and cheapest option fast and reliable frequent trips daily from about 6am to midnight clean and good

title: Quick way to get around. And wonderfully cold
review: A metro running high above ground An efficient and convenient way to get around the parts of Bangkok it covers   The drawback is that there seems to be no way to get a "all public transport"card in town Still the Skytrain was better than the Metro for us

title: This Skytrain gets you just about everywhere in Bangkok
review: Stations are close to all tourist sites in Bangkok as well as shopping outlets and night markets Best to get 24h unlimited journeys ticket

title: Useless For Tourists During Rush Hour
review: In the past there was a lovely intown checkin facility that apparently no one used It was air conditioned and spacious It led to the airport express line (same as normal line) and was only 90 Baht per trip The frequency kept dropping until one day it was "suspended" That was that's ago and it's never run again  Now left with only the (nonairconditioned portion of the station) commuter line that has only 4 cars most times and runs far too infrequently it has become useless for tourists going to or from the airport during anything other than off hours Yes it runs from before 6 to midnight but if you need to get on during the morning rush into town or the afternoon out of town you will wait to watch multiple trains pass without space Especially with large luggage  It's a great idea and a failed concept that's mostly gone to waste Still if you use it off peak it's an incredibly cheap trip into town

title: Airport rail link Suvarnabhumi
review: This long awaited connection to the BTS skytrain network is proving invaluable for both travellers arriving and departing from the main airport  It takes approx 30 minutes to connect to the main BTS network and is accessed from the ground level at Suvarnabhumi  Trolleys are not allowed all the way so must be carried on the final stage

title: Easy and cheap
review: Very easy to buy tickets Just over 1$ CAD to get downtown Very clean The service starts at 6 am and it was fast and clean  Easy to transfer

title: A Fast Way into Bangkok
review: Faster way to get into Bangkok if you are not carrying too much luggage and want to get into Siam in 35 minutes

title: Well managed rail link service
review: No wonder why Thailand is a preferred tourist destination for people around the world The services for tourists are so good that one is naturally drawn to this country Airport rail link is your best alternative to high priced taxis No matter where you are staying you will find your way into the city with airport rail link And the officials present at the stations go out of their way to help you A big thumbs up to Thai government for maintaining this so well

title: Fantastic and Cheap
review: Easy to access and a 20 minute ride to Airport Ticket from Ratchaprarop Station ( Pratunam Area ) is 40 Baht No traffic hassles and comfortable ride Anthony

title: Pleasant journey
review: Tried the sky train today Very convenient seamless to MBK  staff is friendly and no hassles Should try

title: Fast, reliable, safe....but a bit too cool
review: BTS is an overground train service that connects among others most of central Bangkok and the Sukhumvit areas  The service is good and reliable while the extra vigilant eyes of the security personnel in each station should ease the worries of most travelers However it is packed during peak hours and the airconditioning system of the BTS is slightly too strong making it advisable for some1 to carry a long sleeve jacket or shirt on top of the usual sleveless shirttshirt

title: Old Fassion Trains
review: Still not completed rapid train in Thailand as good chance to take slow speed & old fassined trains as good for tourist Train ticket is super cheap if you doubt you can go & check it

title: Efficient Transport Option
review: A very efficient option to get to the airport The air conditioned cars provide a nice relief from the Bangkok heat Just be sure to give yourself sufficient time to get to the airport and be aware that this train does not run 24 hours

title: Quick & easy transport
review: Excellent & fast way of  getting into town Cheaper than taxi THB45 from the airport to the city around AUD200 per person Definitely worth it

title: No Taxi needed
review: You don't need a taxi in Bangkok They are to slow due to the traffic jam in Bangkok Use instead the train Fast an cheap   Before you begin your travel go and make a screen shot or download the map with all lines available Helps you to plan your travel Identify before your travel begins which line you have to take after leaving the Airport Rail Link after leaving it at its final station in Bangkok Doing so will help you to spare money

title: Really Great Tour with Jill
review: This tour was really fun and I definitely recommend it We had time at a really nice highway stop for breakfast and then went on a train to Railway Market We saw many beautiful sites on the way The railway market and floating market were both really nice with plenty of time for pictures  My guide Jill was so helpful and also having some great laughs with everyone She really made the trip so much more fun

title: Another nice transport by over head
review: This skytrain is nice for short distance travelling specially for shopping and entertaining view on the cities around Bangkok stations are very pretty

title: Best thing ever!
review: Very Convenient and  inexpensive Max is 42 bahts for one way depending what station you're traveling too It even goes as far as to the Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: City tour using MRT and BTS
review: it was fun experience using MRT for the city tour and also for the airport transfer  Safe and reliable transport service

title: Fast and efficient....crowded
review: Excellent transportation system Clean airconditioning quick and efficient Cheap Can get very crowded

title: Time managment in most jam city.
review: Sufficient time management in heavily traffic jam of Bangkok This journey choice can throw your trouble away from traffic jam when return to Suvannabhumi International Airport

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok
review: I love the experience of traveling using BTS whenever I visit Bangkok It's overcrowded during peak hours but the crowd is well managed Stations are connected to mall and important buildings on the route through skyways Tourists can buy a full day pass to take advantage of avoiding queues for tickets and save time Most stations have free wifi by major telecom providers if you are using their sim

title: Good Alternative to a Taxi
review: This is a quick and easy alternative to get into Bangkok smoothly The terminal is inside the Airport and well signposted It is cheaper than travelling in a Taxi if you are solo or a couple If you have tons of luggage it can be difficult but if you can walk wheeling your luggage it is good In the Airport train terminal buy a ticket from a machine there are normally English speaking staff to help you standing by the machines BEWARE to make sure that you board the direct train as it is faster and not so crowded as the one that stops at all stations Once you are at the end stop there are Taxis waiting to take you to your final destination This method of getting into Bangkok can avoid frustrating traffic jams on the Toll way

title: Good to escape traffic - can be very crowded
review: Probably the only way to avoid the traffic but it can get very crowded at times Does not serve all Bangkok areas An expansion would be great

title: Clean, safe, and frequent.
review: Easy to use The attendants are really helpful It would be perfect if it had indication of how much time for the next train

title: Easy travel
review: This is the way to go Easy to use affordable and frequent train service Once you sort out how to work it much quicker than road transport

title: Easy n convient
review: Just took us less than 30 minutes to reach Pratunam from Airport  Escaping from all the traffic jams

title: Clean safe cheap transport.
review: Use the BTS extensively during trips to Bangkok Great public transport Get a rabbit card if you are there for awhile

title: Efficient, cheap, safe!
review: 1 Very clean saw no garbage 2 Cheap at most 42 bhat but as cheap as 1520 Only annoying thing is you need change to get a ticket 3 Fast with a train every 25 minutes 4 feels very safe for anyone good lighting but can get crowded

title: Convenient to get you into the city, can get crowded
review: For about 45 baht (~125 USD) you can get from the airport all the way into the city Easy to locate at the airport follow the slanted moving walk ways all the way to the bottom then find the kiosks to purchase blue line tickets (the express is not working and not worth it) It will link you up in Phaya Thai with the Skytrain (BTS) if your stop is not on the link itself It also links with the subway (MRT) Very cost effective especially if you don't have a ton of luggage We had backpacks Note it can get pretty crowded at peak commute times (morningevening) It is airconditioned

title: Nice but overpriced

title: The SkyTrain is PART of Bangkok's mass-transit scheme
review: I chortle when I read reviews by others complaining that they cannot figure out how to take buses when they decamp from SkyTrain stations There are buses in Bangkok and they are extremely cheap but unless you speak Thai or have some kind of guide (which I have never seen after eight years living in the Kingdom) you are better off staying off of them and using other forms of transport   You see you should use the SkyTrain (or the Underground for that matter) as a means to get yourself into the VICINITY of your ultimate destination Once you are nearby go down to street level and either hail a taxicab or better get onto the back of a mototaxi Taxicabs are metered and they are airconditioned so they are fairly stressfree to use You just need to be able to clearly explain to the driver where you want to go   Keep in mind that you are in Thailand The onus is on you to speak enough Thai to explain your desired destination to the driver Failing that have a map that explains in Thai where you want to go Failing that have a Thai friend available on the phone who can speak to the driver and translate for you Do not get angry if you cannot explain yourself to the driver It is not his fault It is yours   That said if you get into a taxi (for example near Patpong or near Wat Po or near any of a number of other "touristy" destinations) and the driver slyly quotes you a price rather than agreeing to use the meter be advised that his behavior is illegal and you should and you can hold him responsible Here is what you do You take a photograph of the taxi placard This will be on the inside door in the rear of the taxi and is generally a combination of numerals and letters Ideally you get a photograph of the driver You attempt to get a photograph of the taxi license which will be in a case in front of the front passenger seat If the driver is not chasing you around the taxi by now walk away   Go to your nearest police station Politely request "Tourist Police please" Repeat your request politely An English speaker will be found for you File a formal complaint against the taxi driver It will just take a few minutes Then ask the police to assist you in getting a driver who will not waste your time with these shenanigans   There are a couple of reasons why this needs to be done One taxi drivers need to stop trying to profiteer off tourists Two the police officers who compel them to do it need to suffer as much interference with their criminal racketeering as possible Yes the cops are almost always behind it The force drivers who pick up fares in specific neighborhoods to try to quote rates rather than use the meter in order to get a kickback This sort of thing is rife in the Silom area You will also encounter it if you try to get a taxi at the mouth of Soi Cowboy for example at closing time at the Asok end   One more comment about taking taxis It is increasingly protocol in Bangkok to tell the driver where you wish to go before you pile into the cab He may not wish to go in your direction or to your destination you see Technically this is also illegal But the driver may be approaching the end of his shift or he may need to visit a gas station soon so just tell him through the open window or through the open door where you wish to go If he will take you he will nod Then get it If he does not wish to take you he will shake his head Let him go and take the next taxi If the driver slyly looks at you under his eyelashes and says "song loi baht" photograph him and his taxi placard and jack him up with the cops This has to happen or the misconduct will spread even more   Finally let's talk about mototaxis or as they are called here "motos" There are motostands near all SkyTrain platforms Just look down from the platform level onto the street and you should see the drivers congregated in their orange vests Make your way down tell them where you wish to go Again you must be able to communicate with them If they nod do not omit to ask "tao alai" This means "how much" They will quote you a price You will need a local to tell you what the appropriate price is for the trip but generally speaking mototaxi drivers do not attempt to rip off tourists Most of the time You do need to pay attention You will never have to pay 100 baht for a moto ride for example If the driver quotes you that price you are asking him to take you too far or he is trying to steal from you Most quotes will range from 2050 baht and they will be worth it as there is no faster or better way to get through Bangkok gridlock Just hang on hard You should have trip insurance as well Accidents are rare but they can happen   Hope this helps

title: Excellent. Fast and efficient. Aircon. Easy ticket system. All signage in Thai and English. Cheap
review: We used the Skytrain for 3 days to get round Bangkok and it is brilliant   You quickly find yourself planning everything around the Skytrain or MRT (underground) The Skytrain  underground and on ground railway systems connect at lots of stations and the links are easy and well sign posted   Use a Taxi not a  Tuk Tuk Get to the nearest station and then walk or use a meter taxi only Politely insist they use the meter and be prepared to smile and walk away (there is no shortage of taxis) Don't on any account take a tuk tuk You will always pay more than a taxi in Bangkok and they'll take you to a gem dealer and a tailor and and  They get a kickback for every passenger they bring to each of these places and you may struggle to get to where you want to go  Integrated Railway System Pick up a railway map and read the Railway36 site for a great description of how this integrated system works and which ticket machines take coins and which take notes The ticket machines are a great way of getting rid of small change   Using the Ticket Machines Most of the ticket machines are touch screens Touch it to activate then touch the English button at top right select the station you want to go to some will allow you to select tickets for multiple travellers and some you'll have to go through the process for each person put in your coins or notes and your plastic ticket or token will drop down into the dispenser at the bottom of the machine likewise your change Wait for the change to all drop down before retrieving otherwise coins will bounce out onto the ground😉 Once you've got your ticket or token proceed to the ticket barrier You either insert the ticket in the slot on the vertical face and it shoots out on the top or you touch the plastic token on the icon picture Proceed to the correct platform To do this you need to look at a map of the line (plenty in the train stations) and work out the station at the end of the line in the direction you're going Finally if you want to use notes (2050100 baht) have crisp clean notes otherwise they are often rejected  Sitting and Standing Even at non rush hour times you'll often be standing We travelled with luggage and it wasn't a problem Take a seat when one is available but be polite and give your seat to anyone older than you or pregnant This is an important unwritten rule You'll also create plenty of goodwill and elicit lots of smiles  Yellow Lines and Arrows At the stations watch out for the yellow lines and arrows on the platform The train door will open at precisely the right place Exiting passengers get off first and you need to leave space for them to do this and so  passengers  wanting to get on wait on either side Look for the yellow arrows and it will all make sense  Rush Hour Rush hour on the Skytrain is from about 1600 to 2000 so you might want to avoid these times Unsure about the morning
